title: GOOG Stock Price, Forecast & Analysis | ALPHABET INC-CL C (NASDAQ:GOOG)
summary: This article provides an in-depth analysis of Alphabet Inc.-Class C (NASDAQ: GOOG) stock, covering its current price, performance, technical and fundamental ratings, financial highlights, and analyst forecasts. The stock closed at $306.02, with analysts expecting a 10.68% price increase over the next year. GOOG shows strong fundamental health and profitability, alongside decent technical indicators.

title: Teamsters Lawsuit Puts UPS Driver Buyouts And Cost Cuts In Focus
summary: The Teamsters Union has filed a lawsuit and emergency motions against UPS over its Driver Choice Program, alleging it violates the national labor contract and could eliminate up to 30,000 union jobs. This legal challenge impacts UPS's plans to cut costs and reshape its workforce, with potential implications for operational flexibility and investor sentiment. The outcome will determine if UPS can proceed with planned buyouts and cost savings, affecting its long-term strategy amidst competition from FedEx and Amazon.

title: iRobot Acquisition News: New Owner Discontinues 3i Robot Vacuum Brand
summary: Following its acquisition by Shenzhen-based Picea Robotics, iRobot will discontinue Picea's 3i robot vacuum brand. This strategic move consolidates manufacturing, development, and marketing resources under the iRobot Roomba brand, aiming to strengthen its competitive position in the global market. iRobot, which filed for Chapter 11 bankruptcy in late 2025, will maintain its U.S. headquarters and continues operations during the transition.

title: Rivian Automotive, Inc. / DE SEC 10-K Report
summary: Rivian Automotive, Inc. released its 2025 Form 10-K report, highlighting significant financial improvements including increased revenues and reduced net losses, driven by growth in Software and Services and cost efficiencies. Despite a decrease in production and delivery volumes from the previous year, the company detailed plans for new product launches like the R2 SUV and the construction of a new manufacturing facility in Georgia. The report also outlined strategic initiatives, such as a joint venture with Volkswagen Group, and identified challenges including intense competition, supply chain risks, and the need for significant capital investment.

title: LiveOne Inc (LVO) Q3 2026 Earnings Call Highlights: Strong Revenue Growth and Strategic Partnerships Amidst Competitive Challenges
summary: LiveOne Inc (LVO) reported robust Q3 2026 financial results with over $20 million in revenue and significant operating expense reductions. The company highlighted its strong B2B pipeline, including over 100 active enterprise opportunities and expanding partnerships with major tech companies. Despite a net loss of $4.1 million and market skepticism, LiveOne is confident in its customized white-label solutions and sustainable cost structure to drive future growth.

title: Eversource Energy earnings missed, revenue topped estimates
summary: Eversource Energy (NYSE: ES) reported its Q4 earnings, with an EPS of $1.12, missing analyst estimates of $1.13. However, the company's revenue for the quarter reached $3.37 billion, surpassing the consensus estimate of $2.94 billion. Despite the earnings miss, Eversource Energy provided a positive outlook, forecasting FY 2026 EPS to be between $4.80 and $4.95.

title: AENTW SEC Filings - Alliance Entertainment Holding Corporation 10-K, 10-Q, 8-K Forms
summary: This page provides a comprehensive resource for investors to access Alliance Entertainment Holding Corporation's (AENTW) SEC filings, including annual, quarterly, and current reports. It features AI-generated summaries, sentiment and impact scores, and historical stock performance data for each filing. One key recent filing highlighted is from February 12, 2026, detailing Alliance Entertainment's increased profitability and a new five-year distribution agreement with Amazon Studios.

title: Why Vontier (VNT) Stock Is Trading Up Today
summary: Vontier (NYSE:VNT) shares rose over 12% after the electronic equipment provider significantly beat revenue expectations for the fourth quarter of 2025, reporting $808.5 million against estimates of $764.7 million. Although the company provided a mixed outlook for Q1 2026 with revenue guidance below consensus, investors focused on the strong quarterly performance. Vontier's stock is up 18.7% year-to-date and reached a new 52-week high, indicating a strong market response despite varying forecasts.

title: Astronics at TD Cowen Conference: Strategic Growth and Challenges
summary: Astronics Corporation presented at the TD Cowen 47th Annual Aerospace & Defense Conference, highlighting its strong recovery post-pandemic with revenue projected to near $1 billion in 2026 and an anticipated growth rate of 10-15%. The company emphasized its strategic focus on in-flight entertainment, connectivity solutions, and the FLRAA military program, while also exploring M&A opportunities and managing debt effectively. CEO Peter Gundermann and CFO Nancy Hedges discussed record backlogs, improved supply chains, the transition to LEO satellite technologies, and the potential for wireless charging in aircraft cabins.

title: Infosys, Wipro ADRs slide amid AI fears; US tech wobbles
summary: Infosys and Wipro's American Depository Receipts (ADRs) experienced a decline, with Infosys falling over 4% and Wipro about 3.35%, due to increasing concerns over AI's potential to disrupt traditional outsourcing models. This downturn reflects a broader weakness in the global technology sector as investors question the future demand for legacy software services. While some US tech giants like Apple, Amazon, and Cisco also saw drops, Siemens AG bucked the trend with a 7.1% surge after raising its fiscal 2026 earnings per share outlook, attributing the positive forecast to AI-driven gains in industrial manufacturing.

title: Hasbro Stock Still Has Room to Run
summary: Hasbro is experiencing significant growth driven by its popular games like "Dungeons & Dragons" and "Magic: The Gathering." This success has positioned Hasbro favorably, contrasting with Mattel which owns competing iconic brands like Barbie and Hot Wheels. The article suggests that Hasbro's stock has further potential for appreciation due to this strong performance in the gaming sector.

title: PHINIA shares dip slightly after Q4 earnings miss despite revenue beat
summary: PHINIA Inc. (NYSE:PHIN) experienced a slight dip in share price after its Q4 earnings of $1.18 per share missed analyst estimates of $1.22, despite revenue exceeding expectations at $889 million against a forecast of $838 million. The company reported a 6.7% increase in Q4 revenue year-over-year and provided fiscal 2026 revenue guidance of $3.52-$3.72 billion, aligning with analyst expectations. PHINIA also continued its shareholder return program, repurchasing shares and paying dividends.

title: Alphabet Drops 7% Post Q4 Earnings: Buy, Sell or Hold the Stock?
summary: Alphabet (GOOGL) shares dropped 7% after its Q4 2025 earnings report, primarily due to investor concerns over the high capital expenditure guidance for 2026, aimed at building AI and cloud infrastructure. Despite strong cash flow and continued dominance in search and cloud with significant AI integration, the stock is considered overvalued with a "Hold" rating from Zacks. The company's AI advancements are boosting user engagement and enterprise client adoption, but increased spending, capacity constraints, and valuation concerns temper short-term enthusiasm.

title: Health Catalyst and F5 Stocks Trade Down, What You Need To Know
summary: Health Catalyst (HCAT) and F5 (FFIV) stocks fell significantly, 6.8% and 6.7% respectively, during an afternoon session as investors grew more selective in the AI boom and reevaluated interest rate cut expectations. A stronger-than-expected U.S. jobs report pushed back anticipated Federal Reserve rate cuts to July, creating headwinds for growth-oriented sectors like software. Health Catalyst shares have been highly volatile, experiencing a significant decline since the start of the year and trading well below its 52-week high.

title: Form FWP BANK OF NOVA SCOTIA Filed by: BANK OF NOVA SCOTIA
summary: The Bank of Nova Scotia has filed a Form FWP for a Senior Note Program, Series A, offering Equity Linked Securities – Market Linked Securities – Auto-Callable with Contingent Coupon with Memory Feature and Contingent Downside Principal at Risk Securities due February 23, 2029. These securities are linked to the performance of Amazon.com, Inc., Microsoft Corporation, and Netflix, Inc. The filing details the terms, including contingent coupon payments, automatic call features, maturity payment amounts, and various risks associated with the investment, such as the potential for loss of principal and credit risk of the Bank.

title: Cognex (CGNX) Shares Skyrocket, What You Need To Know
summary: Cognex (CGNX) shares surged 33.5% after the company reported strong fourth-quarter 2025 results that exceeded analyst expectations. Revenue grew 9.9% year-over-year to $252.3 million, and adjusted EPS rose 35% to $0.27. The company also provided an optimistic first-quarter 2026 revenue forecast, indicating accelerating demand for its machine vision systems.

The firm notably reduced its stake in NVIDIA Corp by 84.52% and Alphabet Inc by 88.63%, while making substantial new additions to Amazon.com Inc, ServiceNow Inc, and Eli Lilly and Co. These moves highlight the quantitatively driven hedge fund's strategic shifts in its investment holdings.

title: Marcus & Millichap stock hits 52-week low at $24.93
summary: Marcus & Millichap's (MMI) stock recently hit a 52-week low of $24.93, marking a 32.65% decline over the past year due to challenging market conditions. Investors are awaiting upcoming earnings on February 13, and the company's IPA Capital Markets division recently arranged a significant refinancing deal for a luxury multifamily property.

title: GOOG stock rebounds as Alphabet clears $32 billion Wiz hurdle and sells rare 100-year bond
summary: Alphabet's Class C shares rebounded after EU regulators approved its $32 billion acquisition of cybersecurity firm Wiz, lifting a significant antitrust hurdle. The company also raised £1 billion through a rare 100-year sterling bond within a larger $31.51 billion global bond raise, signaling the increasing capital demands of the AI race. Despite this, the European Publishers Council filed an antitrust complaint regarding Google's AI Overviews, accusing it of using content without consent or fair compensation.

title: The Great Distortion: 1,500 Stocks Vs. The Magnificent 7 In Norway's Massive U.S. Equity Portfolio
summary: Norway's Government Pension Fund Global, the world's largest sovereign wealth fund, holds 1,577 U.S. stocks, yet nearly one-third of its $935 billion U.S. equity portfolio is concentrated in just seven "Magnificent 7" companies. This massive concentration, led by Nvidia, Apple, and Microsoft, highlights a growing market distortion where institutional capital heavily favors a few mega-cap tech giants. The analysis suggests that while diversification may appear broad, market performance increasingly depends on these powerful few stocks.

title: Popular Cable Channel Facing Potential Bankruptcy: Report
summary: The popular home-shopping cable network QVC is reportedly facing significant financial difficulties and potential bankruptcy. The company, along with its parent QVC Group Inc. (formerly Ourate Retail), has seen declining revenues and customer engagement due to changing customer habits and increased online competition from platforms like Amazon and TikTok Shop. This has led to debt restructuring discussions, a tumbling stock price, and recent layoffs.

title: Big-Name Hedges Fund Bought This ETF Last Quarter. It’s Crushing the SPY in 2026
summary: Davis Advisors, a hedge fund managing over $22 billion, acquired shares of the iShares S&P 500 Value ETF (IVE) in Q4 2025. This value-focused ETF has returned almost 5% year-to-date in 2026, significantly outperforming the S&P 500's 1% gain. The article suggests that investing in IVE could be a wise move for investors looking to counter a potentially overvalued broader market and benefit from its exposure to value stocks and specific tech giants like Apple and Amazon.

title: Nixxy, Inc. Announces Strategic Partnership with PayToMe.co to Accelerate Telco + Fintech Convergence

The partnership seeks to create high-value revenue streams, enhance customer experience, and automate compliance for cross-border transactions and mobile commerce.

title: InvenTrust Properties Corp. (NYSE:IVT) Q4 2025 Earnings Call Transcript

title: AEP expands spending plan, beats profit estimates as electricity demand surges

The utility company is a major beneficiary of this surge, with hyperscalers like Google and Amazon driving 80% of its growth. AEP emphasized its commitment to affordability for residential customers while investing in necessary infrastructure to meet the increased load, which has doubled since October.

title: eBay Stock Is Quietly Going Off: Is This Old-School Giant Your Next Power Play?

IBM's emphasis on "sovereign AI" and Infrastructure as Code positions it favorably amidst evolving market trends and regulatory shifts, despite some remaining risks in its consulting segment and legacy contracts.

title: JD.com Expands In Europe With JoyExpress To Support Joybuy Growth

This move signifies JD.com's strategy to integrate its strong logistics capabilities directly into the European market, aiming for same-day and next-day delivery through a local network of warehouses in the UK, Germany, Netherlands, and France. The expansion positions JD.com to compete more directly with established European e-commerce players and manage future EU import regulations.

title: FMR LLC Increases Stake in Coherent Corp with Significant Share Acquisition
summary: FMR LLC, also known as Fidelity, has significantly increased its stake in Coherent Corp (COHR) by acquiring an additional 6,430,255 shares, bringing its total holdings to 23,572,803 shares. This transaction, executed at $184.57 per share, reflects FMR LLC's confidence in Coherent Corp's growth potential despite the stock being identified as significantly overvalued. Coherent Corp, a leader in materials, networking, and lasers, demonstrates strong growth metrics and outperformance potential, attracting interest from other major investors like Dodge & Cox and Ken Fisher.

title: Earnings call transcript: McGraw Hill Q3 2026 sees digital growth, stock dips
summary: McGraw Hill reported Q3 2026 earnings, showcasing a 4.2% year-over-year increase in total revenue to $434 million, driven by 11% digital revenue growth and 14.8% recurring revenue growth. Despite these positive financial results, the company's stock experienced a 5.23% decline in aftermarket trading and a 4.15% drop in premarket trading. The company raised its fiscal year 2026 guidance and anticipates a return to growth in fiscal year 2027, focusing on AI integration and market expansion.

title: AWS Momentum Supports Amazon.com's (AMZN) Expanding AI and Cloud Strategy
summary: Amazon's AWS unit is seen as a key growth driver, with UBS projecting a significant increase in AWS revenue by 2028 and strong growth in 2026. This comes as Amazon committed to higher capital expenditure in FY 2026 and AWS secured a multi-year cloud and AI agreement with Prosus NV to expand its technology footprint globally. Despite recent stock performance, analysts maintain a highly positive outlook on AMZN with a significant upside potential.

title: NiSource Inc (NI) Q4 2025 Earnings Call Highlights: Strong EPS Growth and Ambitious Investment Plans By GuruFocus
summary: NiSource Inc (NI) reported strong financial results for Q4 and full-year 2025, with adjusted EPS surpassing guidance and an ambitious $21 billion capital investment plan over the next five years, including an additional $6-7 billion for the Amazon project. The company plans for dividend growth, controlled O&M costs, and average annual customer bill increases of less than 5%. Despite challenges like increased operating expenses and weather impacts, NiSource is optimistic about future growth, particularly in data center opportunities and regulatory solutions.

title: AI hyperscalers help boost Cisco’s revenue, but its stock sinks on soft guidance
summary: Cisco Systems Inc. reported Q2 financial results that exceeded Wall Street expectations, with revenue up 10% to $15.35 billion and adjusted earnings of $1.04 per share. Despite securing $2.1 billion in AI infrastructure orders from hyperscalers like AWS, Microsoft, and Google, the company's stock fell over 7% due to perceived soft guidance for the current quarter. While Cisco increased its full-year forecast, investors were concerned about the modest growth in North America's networking sector and the impact of memory chip shortages.

title: SmartRent to Report Fourth Quarter and Full-Year 2025 Financial Results on March 4, 2026
summary: SmartRent, Inc. will release its fourth quarter and full-year 2025 financial results before market open on Wednesday, March 4, 2026. Following the release, President and CEO Frank Martell and CFO Daryl Stemm will host a conference call and webcast at 11:30 a.m. ET to discuss the company's performance. Details for the call and webcast will be available on SmartRent's investor relations website.

title: A Gold-Rated World Stock ETF
summary: The iShares MSCI World Index ETF (XWD) is a Gold-rated ETF that captures large- and mid-cap stocks in developed markets globally, following a market-cap-weighted approach. While its US equity allocation has grown significantly, reflecting the strong performance of US large-cap companies, the fund also benefits when non-US markets outperform, as seen in 2025. The ETF has a strong long-term track record, outperforming its category average, thanks to its emphasis on large-cap and US stocks.

title: Amazon reveals new stake in this electric aircraft maker, stock jumps
summary: Amazon has disclosed a new 5.3% stake in Beta Technologies, an electric aircraft maker, purchased in the fourth quarter, which caused Beta's stock to jump. The investment is noted in a recent SEC filing and comes as Beta Technologies' stock has been under pressure, although technical indicators still show bearish trends. Investors are now looking forward to Beta’s upcoming earnings report on February 23, 2026, to see if the company can build on this momentum.

title: My 3 favorite small caps for 2026
summary: In this podcast, Frank Curzio and Daniel Creech discuss their favorite small-cap stocks for 2026, focusing on opportunities in AI infrastructure, rare earths, and tokenization. They delve into the risks of deflation and the unparalleled scalability of AI, highlighting companies like Streamex (STEX), DG Power X (DGXX), and Wrap Technologies (WRAP) as undervalued picks with significant upside potential. The hosts also touch upon the impact of politics on investing decisions, particularly under a potential Trump administration.

title: LendingTree's new leader aims to build 'Amazon of financial services' in two years
summary: LendingTree's new CEO, Scott Peyree, has taken over after the death of founder Doug Lebda and plans to transform the fintech company into the "Amazon of financial services" within two years. This strategic shift comes as Peyree navigates a challenging lending market. The article highlights his ambition to sharpen the company's direction.

title: Walmart Inc. (WMT) Price Target Increased at Oppenheimer as Firm Eyes Solid Q4
summary: Oppenheimer analyst Rupesh Parikh increased the price target for Walmart Inc. (WMT) from $125 to $140, maintaining an Outperform rating, based on expectations for a strong Q4 and solid top-line momentum. The firm anticipates management to guide sales and operating income growth in line with its long-term framework, possibly falling short of current Street expectations, which could create a buying opportunity. Walmart recently achieved a $1 trillion market valuation, driven by its ability to attract diverse customer bases, expand its online presence, and invest in AI and supply chain automation.

title: Microsoft Corporation (MSFT) Forecasts 37%-38% Azure Growth as Investors Question Heavy Outlays
summary: Microsoft (MSFT) is forecasting 37%-38% growth for Azure in the upcoming quarter despite investor concerns about heavy capital expenditures that exceeded projections. The company reported a 38% climb in Azure revenue for the last quarter, meeting forecasts, and total revenue grew 17% to $81.3 billion. Investors are questioning the significant outflows, as spending outpaced Azure's growth, with capital expenditures rising 66% year-over-year to $37.5 billion.

title: Strengthening Fundamentals in Mechanical and Electrical Contracting Industry Drive Analyst Sentiment on EMCOR Group (EME)
summary: Stifel analyst Brian Brophy recently raised the price target for EMCOR Group (NYSE: EME) from $713 to $754 and reiterated a 'Buy' rating, citing strengthening fundamentals in the mechanical and electrical contracting industry. The firm's survey indicates rising activity levels that could lead EMCOR to surpass Q4 consensus estimates. Despite a 27% year-to-date increase in shares, the article notes that the consensus 1-year median price target suggests a limited upside of 3-4%.

title: Noble Corporation (NE) Price Target Raised by $7
summary: Noble Corporation plc (NE) saw its stock price increase by 16.28% between February 2 and February 9, 2026, after BTIG raised its price target from $35 to $42. This upgrade, coupled with Barclays also increasing its target to $36, follows the company's announcement of new contract awards totaling $1.3 billion. CEO Robert W. Eifler emphasized how these backlog additions indicate strong demand for deepwater drilling and will improve fleet utilization and future earnings.

title: Is B2Gold Corp. (BTG) One of the Most Undervalued Gold Stocks to Buy According to Analysts?
summary: B2Gold Corp. (BTG) is considered one of the most undervalued gold stocks by analysts, with CIBC increasing its price target to $6.50 based on revised gold price forecasts. Despite short-term production hurdles at its Goose mine, the company projects significant ramp-up and is advancing strategic expansions like the Antelope underground deposit. B2Gold is a Canadian gold producer with operations across Mali, the Philippines, and Namibia, and is also involved in a project in Colombia.

title: Europe spending on sovereign cloud infrastructure to triple from 2025-2027 - Gartner
summary: European spending on sovereign cloud Infrastructure as a Service (IaaS) is projected to triple between 2025 and 2027, with spending rising to $12.6 billion in 2026 and $23.1 billion in 2027. This increase is driven by a growing concern for digital and technological independence amid geopolitical tensions and reliance on US or Chinese hyperscalers. Globally, sovereign cloud spending is expected to reach $80 billion in 2026, with 20 percent of new spending shifting existing workloads to local providers and 80 percent supporting new digital solutions or modernizing legacy workloads.

title: Final Trades: Palo Alto Networks, Millrose Properties, Visa and Apple
summary: The article features the "Halftime Report Final Trades" segment, where the Investment Committee provides their top stock picks for the second half of the trading day. The specific stocks highlighted in the title are Palo Alto Networks, Millrose Properties, Visa, and Apple. The content includes a video segment, but the main text is a brief introduction to the committee's recommendations.

title: Amazon Bets Big on AI With $200B Capex: Buy, Sell or Hold the Stock?
summary: Amazon.com, Inc. delivered mixed fourth-quarter 2025 results with revenue beating expectations but EPS narrowly missing. The company announced a substantial $200 billion capital expenditure plan for 2026, primarily driven by AI investments, which has raised investor concerns about free cash flow and near-term returns. Despite strong AWS growth and strategic AI initiatives, the stock's premium valuation and competitive landscape suggest a "Hold" rating for now, with patience advised for new investors.

title: Under Armour tops the list of most shorted S&P 500 consumer discretionary (XLY:NYSEARCA)
summary: Under Armour (UAA) held its position as the most shorted stock among S&P 500 consumer discretionary companies in January. Conversely, Polibeli Group (PLBL) was identified as the least shorted stock within the same sector. These findings reflect a modest change in average short interest across the S&P 500 consumer discretionary stocks over the month.

title: Pershing Square Sells Stake in Canadian Pacific Kansas City (CP)
summary: Pershing Square has sold its holdings in Canadian Pacific Kansas City (CP), along with stakes in Chipotle, Nike, and Hilton, as part of adjustments to its investment portfolio. The firm has simultaneously invested in Hertz, Amazon, and Meta Platforms, expressing optimism about their future potential despite noting financial stress indicators and insider selling at CP. Canadian Pacific Kansas City, a Class I railroad with a market capitalization of $74.68 billion, shows strong revenue growth and profitability but faces liquidity concerns and a declining gross margin.

title: Edison international stock hits 52-week high at 66.73 USD
summary: Edison International (EIX) stock recently hit a 52-week high of $66.73, reflecting a 36.93% increase in value over the past year. The utility company boasts a compelling P/E ratio of 8.71, a 5.36% dividend yield, and a 23-year history of consistent dividend payments. Recent developments include a 6% increase in its quarterly dividend and UBS reiterating a Buy rating with a raised price target of $70, citing undervaluation and improving financial metrics.

title: I Have “Total Faith” In Amazon.com (AMZN) CEO, Says Jim Cramer
summary: Jim Cramer expresses "total faith" in Amazon.com CEO Andy Jassy despite recent stock downturns and analyst downgrades, particularly concerning the Amazon Web Services (AWS) division. While acknowledging AWS faces stiff competition and growth challenges compared to rivals, Cramer believes Jassy knows how to navigate these issues. He also suggested Amazon might need to undertake further layoffs.

title: Philip Morris stock hits all-time high at 186.7 USD
summary: Philip Morris International Inc. (PM) stock has reached an all-time high of $186.70 USD, marking a 27.82% appreciation over the past year. This achievement is attributed to strong earnings, strategic initiatives, and robust financial health, including substantial gross profit margins and 18 consecutive years of dividend increases. Analyst ratings from Stifel, UBS, and Bernstein SocGen Group reflect varied price targets but acknowledge the company's strong performance, supported by sector trends and its market expansion efforts.

title: Costco Wholesale stock price today: COST edges higher after Evercore target raise
summary: Costco Wholesale (COST) shares rose 0.4% following Evercore ISI's price target increase to $1,050, maintaining an Outperform rating. Bernstein also raised its target to $1,155 as analysts remain confident in the stock's performance amid shifting market conditions and consumer sentiment. Investors are now looking at the upcoming CPI release and Costco's Q2 earnings call for further indicators.

title: Astera Labs Plunges Below Key Support Levels. Should You Buy the Dip in ALAB Stock?
summary: Astera Labs (ALAB) shares dropped over 20% despite strong Q4 results and optimistic guidance, primarily due to dilution concerns after the company issued new warrants to Amazon (AMZN). However, the agreement with Amazon also represents a significant revenue opportunity contingent on product purchases. Wall Street analysts maintain a "Moderate Buy" rating for ALAB, seeing a 45% potential upside, driven by the company's critical role in the growing AI infrastructure market and impressive revenue growth.

title: Saks is Discontinuing its E-commerce Partnership with Amazon.com, Inc. (AMZN)
summary: Saks Global, a bankrupt retailer, is ending its "Saks on Amazon" e-commerce deal with Amazon.com, Inc. The decision follows Saks invoking its right to reject the deal due to its Chapter 11 filing and aims to concentrate on driving traffic to Saks.com and other expansion areas. The partnership, which began in 2024 with a significant investment from Amazon, reportedly soured after Saks' bankruptcy filing and faced opposition from luxury brands citing brand dilution concerns.

title: The Top 5 Analyst Questions From Flex's Q4 Earnings Call
summary: Flex's Q4 earnings call highlighted strong demand in data center and industrial segments, offsetting weakness in consumer businesses, leading to revenue and EPS beats. Management discussed continued investments in AI-driven data centers, growth in embedded power, and the financial impact of the Amazon warrant deal, while analysts queried market dynamics and margin improvements. Future catalysts include AI deployments, portfolio shifts, and managing consumer market softness.

title: NVIDIA (NVDA) Must Comply with Strict U.S. Licensing Terms for Its H200 AI Chips China Exports
summary: NVIDIA (NVDA) is required to adhere to strict U.S. licensing terms for exporting its H200 AI chips to China, as reported by Reuters and confirmed by the Commerce Secretary. This comes despite limited export permissions and aims to address geopolitical constraints on China-facing AI revenue. Additionally, NVIDIA is reportedly nearing an acquisition of a $20 billion stake in OpenAI, signaling its commitment to maintaining leadership in high-performance AI chips amidst growing competition.

title: Wealthfront Advisers LLC Purchases 8,940 Shares of American Electric Power Company, Inc. $AEP
summary: Wealthfront Advisers LLC increased its stake in American Electric Power Company, Inc. (NASDAQ:AEP) by 8.4% in the third quarter, acquiring an additional 8,940 shares. Several other institutional investors also adjusted their holdings in AEP. The article also provides recent analyst ratings, stock performance data, dividend information, and details on an insider stock sale by Director Benjamin G. S. Fowke III.

title: How Marvell Stock Benefits From The Amazon-Anthropic Connection
summary: Marvell Technology is positioned to benefit significantly from major AI-related capital expenditures by Amazon and the enterprise scaling of Anthropic's AI models. Despite its stock underperformance, Marvell's revenue mix is now 73% data center-centric, making it a key player in custom silicon, networking, and optical interconnects for hyperscalers like Amazon. The deepening partnership between Amazon AWS and Anthropic, with its commitment to Amazon's Trainium and Inferentia hardware, suggests sustained demand for Marvell's silicon as autonomous AI workloads grow.

title: DA Davidson Raises Modine (MOD) PT to $265 Following FQ3 Beat, Exceptional AI Data Center Momentum
summary: DA Davidson analyst Matt Summerville increased Modine Manufacturing Company's price target to $265 from $255, maintaining a Buy rating, after the company's FQ3 2026 earnings beat, citing exceptional data center momentum. B. Riley also raised its price target for Modine to $250 from $190, noting the company's transformation into a high-volume, pure-play climate solutions manufacturer with higher-margin products through data center capacity expansion and the spin-off of its Performance Technologies segment. The article highlights Modine as an under-the-radar AI stock to buy, with analysts emphasizing its strong position in providing thermal solutions for AI data centers.

title: Spotify Technology S.A. (NYSE:SPOT) Q4 2025 Earnings Call Transcript
summary: Spotify Technology S.A. (NYSE:SPOT) reported strong Q4 2025 earnings, beating expectations with a reported EPS of $5.2 against an expected $3.21. The earnings call highlighted robust MAU growth, record Wrapped engagement, and substantial payouts to music rights holders, totaling nearly $70 billion since the company's founding. Discussions heavily featured Spotify's strategic embrace of AI to enhance personalization, drive user engagement, and transform internal processes, positioning the company as a leading intelligent media platform.

title: Amazon Buys 5.3% Stake in BETA Technologies
summary: Amazon has acquired a 5.3% stake in BETA Technologies, an electric aviation company specializing in vertical takeoff and landing planes. This investment, made through its NV Holdings subsidiary, signals Amazon's continued commitment to green initiatives and a long-term interest in cleaner, faster transportation for its logistics network. Following the announcement, BETA's stock surged by 17% in after-hours trading.

title: Freedom Holding Corp. reports $1.7 billion in revenue for 9 months of FY2026
summary: Freedom Holding Corp. announced robust financial results for Q3 FY2026, ending December 31, 2025, with total net revenue reaching $628.6 million for the quarter and $1.7 billion for the nine-month period. The company expanded its customer base to 7.2 million across brokerage, banking, and insurance services, driven by its SuperApp ecosystem. A significant development was a strategic agreement with the Government of Kazakhstan and OpenAI to provide ChatGPT Edu access to 165,000 teachers.

title: Advancing enterprise cloud storage across AWS, Microsoft Azure, and Google Cloud
summary: NetApp has introduced significant updates for its enterprise cloud storage solutions across AWS, Microsoft Azure, and Google Cloud. Key advancements include S3 Access Points for Amazon FSx for NetApp ONTAP, enterprise-grade virtualization support for Azure NetApp Files, iSCSI block storage for Google Cloud NetApp Volumes, and AI-driven enhancements in NetApp Workload Factory. These updates aim to improve performance, flexibility, security, and operational efficiency for hybrid cloud environments.

title: 5 Insightful Analyst Questions From Boot Barn's Q4 Earnings Call
summary: Boot Barn Holdings Inc. (BOOT) reported strong Q4 results, surpassing analyst estimates for revenue and adjusted EBITDA, driven by broad-based sales strength and expanding merchandise margins. The article highlights key analyst questions from the earnings call, focusing on sales acceleration, margin sustainability, new store growth, and the performance of exclusive brands. Moving forward, analysts will watch new store openings, exclusive brand growth, merchandise margin improvements, and customer acquisition strategies.

title: KeyBanc Cut its Target Price on Procore Technologies (PCOR) to $80
summary: KeyBanc has reduced its target price for Procore Technologies (PCOR) to $80 from $91, citing recent valuation multiple pullbacks in the software industry due to generative AI concerns. Despite this, KeyBanc maintains an Overweight rating and anticipates Procore will beat Q4 2025 revenue and cRPO estimates. The acquisition of Datagrid is also highlighted as a positive development, integrating advanced AI capabilities into Procore's construction management software.

title: Oracle: Strong Generative AI Demand Supports Data Center Buildout
summary: Oracle's stock recently saw a significant jump, driven by positive reception to OpenAI's GPT-5.3-Codex and increased capital expenditure plans from other tech giants. Despite this rally, the stock is still down year-to-date. Morningstar maintains a $277 fair value estimate for Oracle, acknowledging the strong demand for generative AI supports the company's data center buildout, but highlights high risks associated with debt management and GPU sourcing.

title: NiSource Announces Full-Year 2025 Results
summary: NiSource Inc. (NYSE: NI) announced its full-year 2025 financial results, reporting GAAP net income of $929.5 million ($1.95 per diluted share) and non-GAAP adjusted net income of $905.2 million ($1.90 adjusted EPS). The company reaffirmed its 2026 non-GAAP consolidated adjusted EPS guidance of $2.02–$2.07 and expects to invest approximately $28.0 billion from 2026–2030, including nearly $7.0 billion for strategic data center infrastructure. NiSource anticipates an 8%-9% compound annual growth rate for non-GAAP consolidated adjusted EPS and 9%-11% for consolidated rate base growth from 2026 through 2033.

title: The most unexpected winner of the AI boom? Caterpillar
summary: Caterpillar, traditionally known for construction vehicles, has emerged as a surprising beneficiary of the AI boom, with its stock doubling in the past year to an all-time high. The company's growing exposure to data centers, energy infrastructure, and AI-related demand, supplying critical equipment rather than developing AI itself, has driven its market capitalization to $347 billion. Its record full-year sales of $67.6 billion and a $51 billion order backlog underscore strong demand and a shift towards energy and power solutions, outperforming tech giants like Apple and Microsoft in stock growth.

title: RFG Advisory LLC Has $2.21 Million Stock Position in Marvell Technology, Inc. $MRVL
summary: RFG Advisory LLC recently reduced its stake in Marvell Technology, Inc. (NASDAQ:MRVL) by 45.4%, now holding 26,275 shares valued at $2.21 million. Despite this, other institutional investors have increased their positions in the semiconductor company. Wall Street analysts maintain a "Moderate Buy" consensus rating for Marvell Technology, with an average target price of $115.16.

title: DXC Completes Enterprise-Wide Amazon Quick Deployment and Launches New Practice to Help Accelerate AI Adoption
summary: DXC Technology has announced the completion of an enterprise-wide deployment of Amazon Quick across its global workforce of 115,000 employees in 70 countries. Following this successful internal implementation, DXC launched the DXC Amazon Quick Practice, a new business unit designed to help customers operationalize AI at scale within complex, multivendor enterprise ecosystems. This initiative highlights DXC's "Customer Zero" approach, where new technologies are validated internally before being offered to clients, aiming to accelerate AI adoption and improve productivity.

title: Microsoft Corporation $MSFT Shares Bought by Oak Ridge Investments LLC
summary: Oak Ridge Investments LLC increased its stake in Microsoft Corporation by 2.2% during the third quarter, making MSFT its second-largest holding. Institutional ownership for Microsoft stands at 71.13%, while insiders own a small 0.03%. Analysts maintain a "Moderate Buy" rating with a target price of $591.95, and the company recently beat Q4 earnings estimates and declared a $0.91 quarterly dividend.

title: Morgan Stanley Raises Franklin Resources (BEN) Target to $22, Keeps Underweight Rating
summary: Morgan Stanley has increased its price target for Franklin Resources (NYSE: BEN) to $22 from $21, while maintaining an Underweight rating on the stock. The firm adjusted its Q4 adjusted EPS estimate down due to higher operating costs but raised its 2026 and 2027 forecasts based on expected stronger fee income and better non-operating investment returns. Franklin Resources reported a preliminary month-end assets under management of $1.71 trillion as of January 31, 2026, reflecting favorable market conditions and net inflows.

title: Costco Tests European Same Day Delivery To Deepen Member Engagement
summary: Costco Wholesale has launched its first European same-day delivery service in France and Spain through an expanded partnership with Instacart. This move aims to deepen member engagement and test online fulfillment demand in these markets, aligning Costco with existing European consumer expectations for convenience. The strategy allows Costco to extend its value proposition online without building a costly last-mile network from scratch, though potential risks include operational complexity and competitive responses.

title: SenesTech to manage Amazon sales of Evolve rodent products directly By Investing.com
summary: SenesTech, Inc. (NASDAQ:SNES) announced it will directly manage Amazon sales of its Evolve Rat and Evolve Mouse products, effective immediately. This strategic change aims to enhance e-commerce operations, which represented over 50% of the company's 2025 revenue. By taking control of product presentation and customer communication, SenesTech expects to retain a larger portion of e-commerce revenue, with financial benefits anticipated to grow significantly in Q2 2026.

title: NiSource Inc stock hits all-time high at 44.97 USD By Investing.com
summary: NiSource Inc. stock reached an all-time high of $44.97, surpassing its previous 52-week high. The utility company's stock has surged by 19.85% over the past year, reflecting strong performance and investor confidence. This milestone follows recent positive developments, including a declared quarterly dividend, a raised price target from Mizuho due to a large data center project, and an extension for its NIPSCO generating station.

title: Power Integrations VP Gupta sells $123,717 in shares
summary: Sunil Gupta, VP of Operations at Power Integrations Inc (NASDAQ:POWI), sold 2,673 shares totaling $123,717 on February 9th and 10th. These transactions followed his acquisition of 3,840 shares on February 6th due to a Performance Stock Unit vesting. Despite the sales and an earnings beat in Q4 2025, the company's stock experienced a slight dip, indicating mixed investor sentiment.

title: Microsoft (MSFT) stock: Vulcan Value Partners cuts 43,824 shares
summary: Vulcan Value Partners, a Birmingham-based investment firm, has reportedly cut its position in Microsoft (MSFT) by 43,824 shares. Despite this reduction, Microsoft remains the firm's largest holding, indicating a tactical reallocation rather than a loss of conviction, likely due to increased AI capital expenditures and high valuations across the "Magnificent 7" stocks. The move suggests a broader defensive tilt by Vulcan amid market volatility and concerns over AI investment returns, even as analysts maintain bullish long-term outlooks for Microsoft.

title: Non-lethal rat control maker brings Amazon sales in-house to lift margins
summary: SenesTech (Nasdaq: SNES) is taking direct control of its Evolve Rat and Evolve Mouse product sales on Amazon, moving from third-party sellers to in-house e-commerce management. This strategic shift, effective immediately, aims to increase revenue retention, improve margins, and enhance customer communication and data utilization. E-commerce already accounted for over 50% of the company's 2025 revenue, and financial benefits from this transition are expected to begin in Q1 and become more significant by Q2 2026.

title: STMicroelectronics N.V. $STM Shares Bought by ABC Arbitrage SA
summary: ABC Arbitrage SA increased its stake in STMicroelectronics N.V. (NYSE:STM) by 378.6% in the third quarter, making it their 17th largest holding. Despite this, STMicroelectronics faces challenges including a recent EPS miss, thin margins, and a high P/E ratio, leading to a mixed "Hold" rating from analysts. The company has positive catalysts like expanded engagement with Amazon Web Services and new automotive technology with AI acceleration.

title: Has Alibaba Group Holding (NYSE:BABA) Run Too Far After Its 50% One Year Rally?
summary: Alibaba Group Holding has seen a 50.1% rally over the last year, leading to questions about its current valuation. A Discounted Cash Flow (DCF) analysis suggests the stock is undervalued by 37.4% with an estimated intrinsic value of US$266.07 per share. While its P/E ratio is in line with the industry, investor "Narratives" on Simply Wall St offer vastly different fair value estimates, ranging from a bullish US$197.66 to a bearish US$107.09, reflecting varying assumptions on growth, regulation, and risks.

title: DXC deploys Amazon Quick across entire workforce
summary: DXC Technology has completed an enterprise-wide deployment of Amazon Quick across its global workforce of 115,000 employees. The company also launched a dedicated Amazon Quick Practice, aiming to help other enterprises rapidly deploy AI solutions. This initiative is designed to improve employee collaboration, information access, and overall work delivery across its distributed enterprise, while also offering consulting services for external clients.

title: The Truth About JBG SMITH Properties: Hidden Tech-Real-Estate Play Everyone’s Sleeping On
summary: JBG SMITH Properties (JBGS) is presented as a hidden opportunity in tech-real estate, particularly due to its strategic position around Amazon HQ2 and the Pentagon in the DC area. The article highlights its potential as a physical layer for AI and data infrastructure, appealing to long-term investors interested in this tech-government corridor despite current market disinterest due to high interest rates and office market weakness. It contrasts JBGS with meme stocks, portraying it as a "slow-burn bet" with leverage from its specific location for tech and government tenants.

title: Rapid Micro Biosystems COO Wilson sells $17k in stock
summary: Rapid Micro Biosystems COO Wilson sold 4,610 shares of Class A Common Stock worth approximately $17,438 to cover tax obligations from vested restricted stock units. Following the sale, Wilson directly owns 257,768 shares. The company reports strong Q4 2025 revenue growth and anticipates a 20% increase for the full year, despite an InvestingPro analysis suggesting overvaluation and rapid cash burn.

title: Stmicroelectronics stock hits 52-week high at 33.47 USD
summary: STMicroelectronics (STM) stock recently hit a 52-week high at $33.47, reflecting a robust performance with significant gains over the past year. The company boasts strong financials, maintaining dividend payments for 28 consecutive years and holding more cash than debt. Despite a recent earnings per share miss, strategic partnerships like the one with Amazon Web Services and subsequent analyst price target increases suggest continued growth potential for the semiconductor company.

title: Fisher Asset Management Boosts Amazon.com Stake by 489,924 Shares
summary: Fisher Asset Management, managed by Ken Fisher, recently increased its stake in Amazon.Com, Inc. by 489,924 shares. Despite recent volatile stock moves and a significant capital expenditure plan for AWS, AI, and logistics, Wall Street analysts maintain a "Strong Buy" rating for Amazon due to expected accelerating AWS growth and long-term earnings power. TipRanks’ AI Analyst, Spark, rates AMZN as Neutral, citing strong financial performance and a positive earnings outlook alongside tempered free cash flow conversion and a weak technical picture.

title: The Truth About JD.com Inc: Why Everyone Is Suddenly Paying Attention
summary: JD.com Inc is garnering significant attention as a potential comeback story in the Chinese tech sector, with discussions around its valuation, logistics-focused business model, and ecosystem expansion. While some investors view it as a contrarian "must-have" due to its current low trading price compared to historical highs, others remain cautious about potential growth, regulatory issues, and overall sentiment towards China. The article advises investors to conduct thorough research, understand the risks, and decide if JD.com aligns with their investment strategy, highlighting it as an interesting risk-reward story rather than a simple momentum play.

title: Green Brick Partners stock hits 52-week high at 77.97 USD
summary: Green Brick Partners (GRBK) stock has reached a new 52-week high of $77.97, reflecting strong market confidence and a 29.52% increase over the past year. The company boasts an impressive "GREAT" financial health score and its stock is considered slightly undervalued according to InvestingPro. Recent developments include amendments to its credit facility and a new $150 million share repurchase program, alongside analyst coverage highlighting its land-long strategy.

title: Teradata tops expectations on public cloud momentum and its stock soars
summary: Teradata Corp. greatly exceeded analyst expectations in its fourth-quarter earnings and revenue, driven by strong public cloud growth, which sent its stock soaring in after-hours trading. The company reported earnings of 74 cents per share and revenue of $421 million, along with a 15% rise in public cloud annual recurring revenue. Teradata is also strategically pivoting towards Artificial Intelligence with its new Autonomous AI and Knowledge Platform, which is expected to support future growth.

title: JPMorgan Chase & Co. Reduces Stake in SoFi Technologies Inc
summary: JPMorgan Chase & Co. has significantly reduced its stake in SoFi Technologies Inc by selling over 17 million shares on January 30, 2026. This strategic move, impacting JPMorgan's portfolio by -0.01%, occurred when SoFi shares traded at $22.81, which is higher than the current price of $21.18. The decision likely stems from concerns about SoFi's valuation and mixed financial performance, despite its growth in the financial services sector.

title: Five9 (FIVN) Experiences Weak Share Price Momentum Amid Broader SaaS Sector Headwinds
summary: Five9, Inc. (NASDAQ: FIVN) is facing weak share price momentum, with its stock declining over 60% in the past year, hitting a 52-week low of $16.10 on February 3, 2026, due to broader SaaS sector headwinds. Despite an expanded partnership with Google Cloud for an Enterprise CX AI solution, Morgan Stanley reduced Five9's price target, advising selectivity in the SaaS sector. The article includes promotional content for other investment opportunities.

title: Bank of America Says AWS Capex Returns Will Drive Amazon.com (AMZN) Shares
summary: Bank of America has reiterated a "Buy" rating for Amazon.com (AMZN) shares, predicting that returns on AWS capital expenditure will be the primary driver for the stock

title: Earnings call transcript: MasterBrand Misses Q4 2025 Expectations, Stock Steady
summary: MasterBrand reported Q4 2025 financial results, with a net loss of $42 million and revenue of $644.6 million, both missing analyst expectations. Despite missing EPS forecasts by a significant margin, the company's stock experienced a slight increase in aftermarket trading. MasterBrand anticipates continued market softness in 2026, driven by affordability pressures and evolving trade landscapes, but expects stabilization and modest improvement in 2027.

title: Rapid7 shares plunge on weak outlook despite fourth-quarter beat
summary: Rapid7 Inc. saw its shares drop over 18% following a weak fiscal 2026 outlook, despite exceeding earnings and revenue expectations for its fiscal 2025 fourth quarter. The cybersecurity provider's forecast of only 2% to 3% growth spooked investors, as it significantly lagged behind the growth rates of other tech and cybersecurity companies. For the fourth quarter, the company reported adjusted earnings of 44 cents per share on revenue of $217 million, both above analyst estimates, and highlighted key business developments like new AWS Network Firewall features and a partnership with HITRUST.

title: Amazon to acquire up to 3.26M shares of Astera Labs common stock
summary: Amazon.com (AMZN) has entered into an agreement to acquire up to 3,262,299 shares of Astera Labs (ALAB) common stock at an exercise price of $142.82 per share. This transaction stems from a warrant agreement established in October 2022 and amended in October 2023, where Amazon is a customer of Astera Labs. The warrant vests based on Amazon's purchases of Astera Labs' smart fabric switch, signal conditioning, and optical engine products, potentially totaling up to $6.5 billion.

title: Astera Labs Grants Amazon Strategic Performance-Based Warrant Investment
summary: Astera Labs (ALAB) has granted Amazon a warrant to acquire up to 3.26 million shares at $142.82 per share, vesting through February 2033. The warrant's vesting is directly tied to Amazon's purchases of Astera Labs' products, potentially reaching $6.5 billion, thereby strengthening their strategic commercial relationship. This agreement provides Astera Labs with significant future revenue potential and Amazon with exposure to Astera's growth in the data center and cloud connectivity markets.

title: Amazon One Medical Introduces Health Insights to Help Patients Better Understand Their Lab Results
summary: Amazon One Medical has launched Health Insights, a new beta feature that helps members understand their routine lab results. This feature, developed with Lifeforce, analyzes over 50 biomarkers from bloodwork and translates them into actionable insights and personalized lifestyle recommendations. It aims to complement clinical care by empowering members with information for more meaningful discussions with their care teams.

title: Amazon Reports Share Stake In Beta Technologies; Dissolves In Owlet, Smartrent and Vital Farms
summary: Amazon has reported acquiring a share stake in Beta Technologies, an aerospace company. Concurrently, Amazon has dissolved its shareholdings in several other companies: Owlet, Smartrent, and Vital Farms. This indicates a shift in Amazon's investment portfolio.

title: Astera Labs revenue jumps 115% to $852.5M on AI connectivity
summary: Astera Labs reported record Q4 revenue of $270.6 million, an 17% sequential increase, and full-year 2025 revenue of $852.5 million, marking a 115% year-over-year jump, driven by strong demand for its AI connectivity solutions. Despite the positive financial results, the company's stock, ALAB, experienced a 7.83% decline, with market analysts noting a pattern where strong operational results do not always lead to short-term price appreciation. Astera Labs also announced a CFO transition and strategic expansions including the production ramp of Scorpio X-Series and the opening of an Israel Design Center to accelerate AI fabric R&D.

title: Saia (SAIA) Stock Trades Down, Here Is Why
summary: Saia (NASDAQ:SAIA) shares fell 5.9% after the company reported fourth-quarter 2025 results with a significant drop in profitability, despite revenue narrowly beating expectations. Earnings per share missed Wall Street estimates, driven by a lower operating margin and decreased sales volumes. The stock has been volatile, and this move indicates the market views the news as meaningful, although the stock is still up 14.3% year-to-date.

title: Elizabeth Warren 'Pushing For Answers' After Google Turns Gemini Into An AI Shopping Assistant: Senator Says It Could Lead To Consumer Manipulation
summary: Senator Elizabeth Warren has raised concerns about Google's integration of its Gemini AI chatbot into shopping services, warning it could lead to consumer manipulation and privacy violations. Google has partnered with major retailers like Walmart, Shopify, and Wayfair to allow Gemini users to search for products, receive recommendations, and complete purchases directly within the chatbot. This move is part of an escalating AI shopping race, with competitors like OpenAI and Amazon also developing similar tools.

title: Why This Amazon ETF Plunged Last Friday
summary: Shares of Amazon (NASDAQ: AMZN) recently tumbled after the company announced plans to spend $200 billion this year, primarily on its Amazon Web Services (AWS) unit to boost artificial intelligence (AI) efforts. This news caused a significant drop in the Direxion Daily AMZN Bull 2x Shares ETF (NASDAQ: AMZU), a leveraged ETF designed to deliver 200% of Amazon's daily performance, resulting in a 14% decline. The article highlights that leveraged ETFs perform as expected on a daily basis but are not suitable for long-term holding due to their design.

title: Blackstone boosts stake in AI startup Anthropic to about $1 billion, source says
summary: Blackstone has increased its investment in AI startup Anthropic to approximately $1 billion, participating in the company's ongoing funding round. This additional $200 million investment values Anthropic at around $350 billion, reflecting strong investor confidence in generative AI companies. Anthropic recently launched its new flagship AI model, Opus 4.6, which offers advanced capabilities amidst growing concerns about AI's potential to disrupt traditional software industries.

title: Duke Energy's data center pipeline hits 4.5 gigawatts as demand soars
summary: Duke Energy has seen its data center pipeline grow to 4.5 gigawatts, signing 1.5 gigawatts in new deals since November. This surge in demand includes major tech companies like Amazon and Microsoft. The utility's expanding infrastructure highlights the increasing energy needs of the data center industry.

title: Estee Lauder sues Walmart alleging 'despicable' sale of counterfeit beauty products
summary: Estee Lauder has filed a lawsuit against Walmart, accusing the retail giant of knowingly facilitating the sale of counterfeit luxury beauty products from brands like La Mer, Le Labo, and Clinique on its online marketplace. The suit claims Walmart played an active role in promoting and profiting from these sales, despite its stated commitment to vetting sellers. This action follows a CNBC investigation into counterfeit goods on Walmart.com, highlighting the risks associated with the rapid growth of the platform's third-party marketplace.

title: New Kroger CEO expected to stress the fundamentals
summary: Greg Foran, the new CEO of Kroger, is anticipated to shift the company's focus back to fundamental operations, customer experience, and employee relations, moving away from the previous CEO's emphasis on acquisitions. Industry experts believe Foran, known for his people- and operations-centric approach at Walmart, will prioritize clean stores, fast service, and competitive pricing. This strategic change aims to better compete with major players like Amazon and Walmart, potentially involving new executive talent and a refined digital strategy.

title: Why WESCO (WCC) Shares Are Trading Lower Today
summary: WESCO (NYSE:WCC) shares fell significantly after the company reported fourth-quarter 2025 earnings that missed Wall Street's profit expectations. Despite revenue meeting forecasts and growing year-over-year, adjusted earnings per share and EBITDA were below estimates, and the free cash flow margin declined sharply. This profitability miss overshadowed the revenue performance, leading to a negative investor reaction.

title: Alphabet boosts debt sale again as total raise exceeds $30 billion, sources say
summary: Alphabet is increasing its global debt sale to over $30 billion due to strong investor demand, surpassing an initial expectation of $20 billion. The company plans to spend up to $185 billion this year on capital expenditures to fund its AI initiatives. This move follows other tech giants like Oracle seeking debt financing to support their significant investments in AI infrastructure.

title: Benchmark lowers Criteo stock price target to $30 on client exit impact
summary: Benchmark has reduced its price target for Criteo S.A. (NASDAQ:CRTO) to $30 from $38, while maintaining a Buy rating, citing concerns over the impact of a major client exit. This move precedes Criteo's Q4 results and highlights an estimated $70 million shortfall in 2026 retail media revenue and significant margin compression. Despite these challenges, Criteo is planning to relocate its legal domicile to Luxembourg and replace ADRs with direct Nasdaq listings, while Stifel maintains a $42 price target, seeing potential in agentic commerce solutions.

title: What's Going On With Hasbro Stock?
summary: Hasbro's stock surged after reporting strong Q4 earnings, significantly beating analyst expectations with adjusted EPS of $1.51 and revenue of $1.45 billion. The company also announced a new multi-year licensing partnership with Warner Bros. Discovery Global Consumer Products for the Harry Potter universe, starting in 2027. Hasbro provided optimistic fiscal-year 2026 revenue guidance and a $1 billion share repurchase program, leading to a 6.59% increase in HAS shares.

title: Taiwan Semiconductor’s January Sales Show the AI Tsunami Is Still Growing
summary: Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing (TSM) reported record-breaking January revenue of $12.7 billion, a 37% year-over-year increase, significantly surpassing analyst expectations. This performance underscores the relentless demand for AI chips and the continued boom in high-performance computing. The company is aggressively increasing its capital expenditure guidance to fund new advanced chip capacity, indicating strong future commitments from its largest customers, including major hyperscalers like Amazon, Meta, Alphabet, and Microsoft.

title: NiSource Inc stock hits all-time high at 44.97 USD
summary: NiSource Inc (NI) stock has reached an all-time high of $44.97, surpassing its previous 52-week high, driven by a 19.85% increase over the past year and strong investor sentiment. The utility company, with a beta of 0.65, has maintained dividend payments for 40 consecutive years and recently announced a quarterly dividend of $0.30 per share. Analyst price targets have been adjusted, with Mizuho raising its target to $50 following news of a $15 billion Amazon data center campus, while Jefferies reaffirmed a Buy rating with a slightly adjusted target of $49.

title: How 3M AI Tools Accelerate How Ideas Become Products
summary: 3M has introduced new AI-powered digital tools, Ask 3M and the expanded 3M Digital Materials Hub, to accelerate product development for engineers, particularly those in small and medium-sized businesses. These innovations leverage generative AI, advanced modeling, and simulation-ready data to help customers quickly identify suitable materials, digitally validate designs, and even explore generative solutions before creating physical prototypes. The goal is to reduce iteration cycles, lower prototyping costs, and bring better products to market faster, especially in fast-moving industries like electronics and automotive.

title: Cybersecurity firm Intrusion hires veterans to chase U.S. government deals
summary: Intrusion Inc. (NASDAQ:INTZ) has strategically expanded its business development team by hiring Valencia Reaves as Public Sector VP of Sales and Patrick Duggan as Director of Channel Sales & Partnerships. These additions are aimed at strengthening the company's presence and accelerating growth within the U.S. government sector and broadening its channel and partner networks. The company anticipates these hires will deepen its coverage across federal, enterprise, and channel markets, leveraging their extensive experience to drive new contracts and partnerships.

title: Albany County IDA slashes Plug Power's job requirements for incentives
summary: The Albany County Industrial Development Agency (IDA) has significantly reduced the job creation requirements for Plug Power, a fuel cell and hydrogen manufacturer, to maintain its eligibility for approximately $9 million in incentives. Plug Power had not met the original employment targets at its Slingerlands headquarters, leading the IDA to lower the required number of jobs by 60%, citing a desire to support the company amid financial challenges and a reduced initial investment from the county. Plug Power expressed gratitude for the continued support, stating the amendment provides a sustainable framework for its operations.

title: Dynatrace, Inc. (NYSE:DT) Q3 2026 Earnings Call Transcript
summary: Dynatrace, Inc. (NYSE: DT) reported strong Q3 Fiscal 2026 results, exceeding guidance across all metrics with an annualized recurring revenue (ARR) growth stabilizing at 16% and net new ARR growth at double digits for three consecutive quarters. The company highlighted its AI-powered observability platform, incorporating Grail, SmartScape, and the new Dynatrace Intelligence, as critical for managing complex cloud and AI-native environments. Dynatrace also announced a new $1 billion share repurchase program, underscoring confidence in its long-term growth and market position.

title: Amazon, Transocean, Interactive Brokers And More On CNBC's 'Final Trades'
summary: On CNBC's "Halftime Report Final Trades," four experts shared their top stock picks. Bryn Talkington chose Horizon Kinetics Inflation Beneficiaries ETF, Stephen Weiss selected Amazon.com, Jim Lebenthal picked Transocean Ltd., and Joe Terranova suggested Interactive Brokers Group, Inc. The article also provides recent financial performance details for Amazon, Transocean, and Interactive Brokers.

title: Gartner: European spending on sovereign cloud IaaS to nearly double in 2026
summary: European organizations are projected to nearly double their spending on sovereign cloud Infrastructure as a Service (IaaS) in 2026, reaching $12.6 billion, due to geopolitical tensions and a desire to reduce reliance on US hyperscalers. This trend, termed "geopatriation," will see businesses moving existing workloads to local cloud providers, posing a challenge for hyperscalers who must adapt to avoid losing market share. While US-owned "sovereign" cloud services exist, their true sovereignty is questioned, suggesting partnerships with local providers might be a better approach for hyperscalers.

title: Why Incyte (INCY) Stock Is Nosediving
summary: Shares of Incyte Corporation fell 8.8% after the biopharmaceutical company reported mixed fourth-quarter 2025 results. While revenue of $1.51 billion surpassed expectations, adjusted earnings per share of $1.80 missed Wall Street's consensus estimate of $1.92, which was the primary concern for investors. The company also saw its operating margin contract to 22.3% from 25.6% year-over-year, indicating higher expenses relative to revenue growth.

title: Earnings Flash (HAS) Hasbro, Inc. Reports Q4 Revenue $1.45B, vs. FactSet Est of $1.26B
summary: Hasbro, Inc. (HAS) announced its Q4 revenue reached $1.45 billion, surpassing FactSet's estimate of $1.26 billion. This earnings flash was reported by MT Newswires, indicating a positive beat on revenue expectations for the toy and game company.

title: ProShare Advisors LLC Has $85.21 Million Stake in Marvell Technology, Inc. $MRVL
summary: ProShare Advisors LLC reduced its stake in Marvell Technology by 20.6% in Q3, now holding 1,013,545 shares valued at $85.21 million. Marvell Technology reported strong Q3 earnings, beating analyst estimates with $0.76 EPS and $2.07 billion in revenue, and analysts maintain a "Moderate Buy" rating with a $115.31 target price. The company also recently paid a quarterly dividend of $0.06 per share and saw an EVP sell 5,000 shares.

title: Bank of America says AWS capex returns will drive Amazon.com (AMZN) shares
summary: Bank of America analysts believe that Amazon's stock will be driven by the returns on its AWS capital expenditures. This signals a positive outlook for AMZN shares due to the anticipated value generation from its cloud computing investments.

title: DA Davidson Thinks Amazon.com (AMZN) is "Losing the Lead" - Here's Why
summary: DA Davidson downgraded Amazon.com (AMZN) from Buy to Neutral and lowered its price target to $175, citing concerns that the company is losing its lead in cloud computing and lagging in the AI-driven retail landscape. The firm noted AWS's slower growth compared to competitors like Azure and Google Cloud, and suggested Amazon might need significant investment in AI to remain competitive. Despite a separate price target revision from Bank of America maintaining a Buy rating, DA Davidson believes Amazon faces strategic disadvantages without direct AI integrations.

title: Advanced Micro Devices (AMD)'s Datacenter Momentum Builds as Goldman Flags Operating Expense Pressure
summary: Advanced Micro Devices (AMD) reported strong fourth-quarter revenue and guidance, primarily driven by its Datacenter segment, yet Goldman Sachs maintained a Neutral rating due to higher-than-expected operating expenses. The firm highlights AMD's robust momentum in its Datacenter business for 2026, supported by market share gains and new product ramps, but notes limited near-term operating leverage due to significant AI infrastructure investments. Goldman Sachs's rating reflects concerns over immediate operating leverage and customer concentration, though a more positive outlook is possible with improved revenue and execution.

title: Freedom Holding Corp. Reports Financial Results for the Nine Months and Quarter Ended December 31, 2025
summary: Freedom Holding Corp. announced strong financial results for the three and nine months ended December 31, 2025, showing significant growth in total assets to $12.38 billion and shareholders' equity to $1.40 billion. The company reported a net income of $76.2 million for the quarter and diluted EPS of $1.25, driven by a diversified revenue mix and substantial growth in both banking and brokerage customer bases. Its CEO, Timur Turlov, highlighted the success of their digital ecosystem strategy, which now serves over 7 million customers.

title: Jim Cramer on Amazon.com (AMZN): “You Need a Certain Level of Faith if You’re Planning to Own This One”
summary: Jim Cramer discussed Amazon.com (AMZN) after the company's recent earnings, highlighting its surprisingly high $200 billion CapEx forecast for the year, significantly exceeding analyst expectations. He noted that this massive investment, aimed at AI infrastructure, retail operations, and satellites, overshadowed positive quarterly results like strong AWS growth. Cramer acknowledges the stock's recent sell-off due to the CapEx and weaker operating income guidance but expresses faith in CEO Andy Jassy's ability to execute these investments for future returns, although he admits it requires a "leap of faith" for investors.

title: The Backbone of AI: A Comprehensive Research Feature on Credo Technology Group (CRDO)
summary: Credo Technology Group (CRDO) has transitioned from an IP provider to a key architect of AI data centers, specializing in high-speed, low-power connectivity solutions like Active Electrical Cables (AECs) and optical DSPs. The company has seen significant financial growth, with revenue surging over 126% in FY2025 and projections of exceeding $1.2 billion in FY2026, driven by the demand for 800G and 1.6T networking in AI infrastructure. Despite risks like customer concentration, Credo's innovations and strong market position make it a crucial infrastructure play in the ongoing AI revolution.

title: The Walt Disney Company $DIS Stock Holdings Increased by Profund Advisors LLC
summary: Profund Advisors LLC increased its stake in The Walt Disney Company by 21.9% during the third quarter, bringing their total holdings to $3.187 million. Several other institutional investors also adjusted their positions in Disney. Analysts currently rate Disney as a "Moderate Buy" with a consensus target price of $135.80, following recent positive earnings and strategic announcements.

title: Genius Sports partners with WPP Media on new sports ROI tool
summary: Genius Sports Limited formed a strategic partnership with WPP Media to launch a new intelligence tool called the WPP Brand Sports Momentum Score. This tool aims to help brands optimize sports marketing investments by identifying optimal sports, audiences, and moments for engagement, powered by Genius Sports’ Fan Graph. The collaboration gives WPP Media clients enhanced planning, activation, and continuous measurement capabilities, and comes as Genius Sports expands its offerings through acquisitions and new platforms like BetVision.

title: SenesTech Strengthens Direct-to-Consumer Commercial Strategy by Directly Managing Amazon Sales of Evolve™ Rat and Evolve™ Mouse
summary: SenesTech, Inc. announced it will directly manage the sales of its Evolve™ Rat and Evolve™ Mouse products on Amazon, shifting from third-party management. This change is effective immediately and aims to increase revenue and enhance profit margins on their e-commerce channel. The company expects greater control over product presentation and customer engagement, leveraging internal resources to optimize sales and marketing efforts.

title: Ecommerce earnings recap: What you missed from e.l.f. Beauty, Tapestry and more
summary: This article provides a recap of recent ecommerce earnings reports from several major retailers. It highlights the strong performance of e.l.f. Beauty and Tapestry, both of which saw significant net sales growth, largely driven by their ecommerce channels. The report also includes financial updates from Amazon, Estée Lauder, Ralph Lauren, Under Armour, Alibaba, Costco, Home Depot, Target, and Walmart, detailing their latest quarterly sales figures and online growth trends.

title: Melius Downgrades Microsoft (MSFT) to Hold, Flags AI Capex and Cash Flow Risks
summary: Melius analyst Ben Reitzes downgraded Microsoft (MSFT) from Buy to Hold with a $430 price target, citing concerns about AI-related capital expenditure and cash flow risks. The analyst believes Microsoft's 365 business faces threats from AI, requiring increased spending to compete with Amazon and Google, which could further impact free cash flow. Additionally, Melius noted the slow progress of Microsoft's AI assistant, Copilot, suggesting it may struggle against competitors and affect growth and margins in the Productivity segment, despite valuation concerns related to revised free cash flow estimates.

title: Hagerty Channel Debuts on Prime Video
summary: Hagerty, Inc. (NYSE: HGTY) has launched a free ad-supported (FAST) channel on Prime Video, making its award-winning automotive enthusiast content available 24/7. The channel will feature popular shows like "ICONS," "Revelations," and "Barn Find Hunter," expanding Hagerty's reach for car lovers. This initiative aims to enhance the driving enthusiast experience by providing easy access to hundreds of hours of high-quality, original programming.

title: Amazon.com Inc. (AMZN) Citigroup Cuts Price Target to $265
summary: Citigroup analyst Ronald Josey has lowered the 12-month price target for Amazon (AMZN) stock from $320 to $265, while maintaining a "Buy" rating. This adjustment reflects a more conservative near-term outlook due to a volatile macroeconomic environment, tempered expectations for margin expansion and revenue growth, and increased scrutiny on large-cap technology valuations. Concerns include normalizing consumer demand in e-commerce, cost pressures in logistics, and more measured growth in Amazon Web Services as enterprise customers optimize cloud spending.

title: Oracle Soars 10% as Analyst Calls Cloud "Pure Upside" – Is It a Massive Buy Signal?
summary: Oracle (ORCL) shares jumped 10% following an analyst upgrade, despite previous drops due to concerns over high spending and debt for AI cloud infrastructure. The company plans to raise $45B-$50B to fund its Oracle Cloud Infrastructure (OCI) expansion, backed by a massive $523 billion in remaining performance obligations. D.A. Davidson analyst Gil Luria upgraded Oracle to Buy, citing the core software business covering the enterprise value and OCI as pure upside, supported by strong demand from partners and its stake in the U.S. TikTok joint venture.

title: Salesforce cuts fewer than 1,000 jobs, Business Insider reports
summary: Salesforce reportedly cut fewer than 1,000 roles at the beginning of February 2026, impacting areas like marketing, product management, and AI product teams. This comes as U.S. companies streamline operations and adopt AI tools, following earlier comments from Salesforce CEO Marc Benioff about reducing customer support roles due to AI's impact. Despite these cuts, the company had previously raised its fiscal 2026 revenue and profit forecasts, anticipating growth from its AI agent platform.

title: Narrow Drawdown?
summary: Equity volatility is increasing, but this is largely due to a decline in mega-cap technology stocks which are driving down the S&P 500. A market rotation is underway, with value and cyclical stocks gaining as investors broaden their portfolios beyond tech. This trend is expected to continue given the resilience of the U.S. economy, highlighting the importance of diversification.

title: FTAI Infrastructure Stock Jumps 11.5% Amid Market Rally Past Dow 50k | 2026 - News and Statistics
summary: FTAI Infrastructure (FIP) stock surged 11.5% on February 6, 2026, closing at $6.02, as markets rebounded from a tech-driven sell-off and the Dow Jones Industrial Average crossed 50,000. This rally was fueled by recoveries in technology stocks, Bitcoin, and improved U.S. consumer sentiment, with investors also focused on AI-related capital expenditure benefiting chipmakers. Despite the recent jump, FIP shares remain 16.2% below their 52-week high from August 2025, although early investors have seen significant returns since its 2022 IPO.

title: GPIQ ETF Price Forecast: Can a 10% Yield at $52 Survive the Next Nasdaq Selloff?
summary: The Goldman Sachs Nasdaq-100 Premium Income ETF (NASDAQ: GPIQ) offers a 10%+ monthly cash yield, trading around $52. Its strategy involves an option overlay that monetizes Nasdaq-100 volatility, allowing it to provide substantial income while tempering capital appreciation compared to growth-focused ETFs. While attractive for income-seeking investors, the article warns that a prolonged Nasdaq-100 downturn, coupled with its return-of-capital heavy distributions, could pressure the fund's NAV and lead to potential yield compression.

title: Provident Dumps 490,000 MapleBear Shares Worth $18 Million
summary: Provident Investment Management, Inc. has fully divested its 489,560 shares in Maplebear (Instacart's parent company), a transaction valued at approximately $18 million. This complete exit reflects the increasing competition in the grocery delivery sector from giants like Amazon, Kroger, and Uber, which has dampened Instacart's appeal and slowed its revenue growth. Despite some positive metrics like 18% net income growth and a low P/E ratio, Provident's concurrent holdings in Instacart's competitors suggest a strategic shift towards more favorable options within the delivery industry.

title: STMicroelectronics stock price target raised to $32 from $29 at Mizuho
summary: Mizuho has increased its price target for STMicroelectronics (NYSE:STM) to $32 from $29, while maintaining a Neutral rating. This adjustment follows a significant commercial agreement between STMicroelectronics and Amazon Web Services (AWS) for AI data center deployments, which Mizuho expects to generate "multi-billion" incremental revenue by 2030. Despite the positive outlook from this partnership, the Neutral rating was kept due to near-term analog headwinds, though various growth drivers were acknowledged.

title: Qwen Coupon Surge Puts Alibaba AI Ambitions And Stock Valuation In Focus
summary: Alibaba's Qwen AI chatbot experienced a surge in demand for its Spring Festival promotional coupons, leading to a temporary suspension. This event highlights significant user interest in Alibaba's AI tools for commerce and raises questions about the company's AI infrastructure capacity during peak times. Investors are now watching how Alibaba manages such traffic spikes and integrates AI to enhance user engagement across its platforms.

title: Freedom Holding Corp. Eyes U.S. Debt Market to Fund Telecom and Data Center Expansion
