summary: Freedom Holding Corp., led by Kazakhstani billionaire Timur Turlov, is considering entering the U.S. debt market to raise $300-500 million for expanding its telecom infrastructure and building data centers. This move aims to fund large-scale investment in digital infrastructure to provide cloud services to major tech companies, government institutions, and private businesses, shifting the group's strategy towards a more capital-intensive, infrastructure-based business model. Turlov emphasizes the importance of building long-term relationships with U.S. investors and the strategic integration into the global capital market, while also exploring international expansion for its Superapp.

title: Gartner Says Worldwide Sovereign Cloud IaaS Spending Will Total $80B in 2026
summary: Gartner forecasts that worldwide sovereign cloud Infrastructure as a Service (IaaS) spending will reach $80 billion in 2026, marking a 35.6% increase from 2025. This surge is driven by countries outside the U.S. and China seeking digital and technological independence, with governments and regulated industries being the primary purchasers. The increasing demand for "geopatriation" projects is expected to shift 20% of current workloads from global to local cloud providers, pressuring hyperscalers to address national sovereignty concerns.

title: Why ServiceNow (NOW) Stock Is Up Today
summary: ServiceNow (NOW) stock jumped 3.3% in afternoon trading after analysts suggested that the recent "SaaSpocalypse" sell-off had pushed valuations into deeply oversold territory, sparking opportunistic buying. This rebound comes after a previous 6.3% drop due to fears that new autonomous AI agents from Anthropic and OpenAI could threaten traditional software licensing models. Despite the recent positive movement, ServiceNow is still down 29.8% year-to-date and 50.4% below its 52-week high, with early 2026 seeing significant concern over AI's impact on recurring revenue software giants.

title: Brandywine Realty Trust plans to sell up to another $300M of its office portfolio
summary: Brandywine Realty Trust plans to sell an additional $300 million in office assets, according to CEO Jerry Sweeney. The firm has already divested $1 billion from recent sales, and its Philadelphia portfolio currently boasts a 97% lease rate. This move signifies a continued strategy to optimize its real estate holdings.

title: The man who fixed Walmart's grocer is Kroger's new CEO
summary: Kroger has appointed Greg Foran, former CEO of Walmart U.S. and Air New Zealand, as its new chief executive. Foran is known for revitalizing Walmart's grocery business with his hands-on style and focus on customer experience. His appointment comes at a critical time for Kroger, which has faced leadership changes, inflation challenges, and a blocked merger with Albertsons, and is expected to bring much-needed leadership to the supermarket conglomerate.

title: Shopify (SHOP) Valuation Check As Swanson Health Expands Onto Its Commerce And Subscription Platform
summary: Swanson Health's expansion onto Shopify's commerce and subscription platform highlights Shopify's relevance for larger brands. Despite a recent share price decline, an analyst narrative suggests Shopify is 40% undervalued, projecting a fair value of $186.64. However, its high P/E ratio compared to industry averages indicates significant optimism already priced into the stock.

title: What's driving Procter & Gamble's monster start to 2026 — and how it can continue
summary: Procter & Gamble has seen a strong start to 2026, with shares up 10% following a challenging 2025. This surge is attributed to a broader rotation of investors from high-growth tech stocks, concerned about AI's impact and capital expenditures, into defensive consumer staples like P&G. The company's performance is further bolstered by improving fundamentals, including strength in emerging markets, a weaker U.S. dollar, and lower oil prices, all contributing to better margins and sales.

title: GM hires new head of strategy from Lucid Motors
summary: General Motors has appointed Claudia Gast, formerly of Lucid Motors, as its deputy CFO and VP of strategy, corporate development, and technology partnerships. She will begin on March 1 and will focus on scouting partnerships with technology companies, reporting to CEO Mary Barra and CFO Paul Jacobson. Gast replaces former Tesla executive Zach Kirkman, who is leaving GM for other opportunities.

title: MercadoLibre stock pops back over $2,000 as MELI eyes Feb. 24 results
summary: MercadoLibre (MELI) stock recovered to over $2,000, climbing 1.8% ahead of its provisional quarterly results on February 24. Investors are closely watching the Latin American e-commerce and payments giant for updates on commerce volumes, payment trends, and margins, especially gross merchandise volume (GMV). The company's performance often reflects shifts in consumer appetite and logistics efficiency in the region.

title: Oracle Shares Surge as Big Tech Spending Eases Software Worries
summary: Oracle Corp. shares rallied significantly due to increased capital expenditure by major US tech companies like Amazon.com Inc., which eased concerns about AI's potential threat. The stock surged by as much as 12% intraday, marking its largest rise since September 10, despite still being down about 50% from its September highs. This rebound was directly linked to Amazon's commitment to spend $200 billion on data centers and other equipment this year.

title: Schwab Trading Activity Index™: STAX Score Sees Highest Reading Since February 2025
summary: The Schwab Trading Activity Index™ (STAX) rose to 49.96 in January, marking its highest reading since February 2025, driven by net equity buying by Schwab clients, particularly in the Information Technology sector. This increase occurred even as the S&P 500 showed minimal gains. Generation X investors were the most aggressive buyers, while Generation Z showed less confidence.

title: STMicroelectronics' Golden Cross Meets Amazon Backstop - And The Chart Lights Up
summary: STMicroelectronics NV (STM) has achieved a Golden Cross technical signal, indicating a potential new uptrend, supported by a significant deal with Amazon.com Inc (AMZN). Amazon's equity-linked deal, including warrants, establishes a financial backstop for STM at $28.38 per share, giving the technical signal strong fundamental support. Analysts project 11.5% revenue growth for STM in 2026, with resistance levels at $33.47 and potential for further upside.

title: 4 Stocks to Buy Before Their Big Discounts Disappear
summary: This article identifies four stocks that Morningstar analysts believe are currently undervalued and represent buying opportunities. It summarizes discussions from "The Morning Filter" podcast, covering topics like recent software stock performance, the AI trade, upcoming CPI numbers, and earnings reports for companies like Zimmer Biomet and Applied Materials. The co-hosts also assess whether specific stocks like Alphabet, Amazon, Advanced Micro Devices, and Palantir are buys after their earnings.
authors: David Sekera, CFA and Susan Dziubinski

title: Form FWP BARCLAYS BANK PLC Filed by: BARCLAYS BANK PLC
summary: Barclays Bank PLC has filed Form FWP for Phoenix AutoCallable Notes, maturing in approximately 5 years, with the U.S. SEC. These notes are linked to the performance of the Russell 2000 Index, Nasdaq-100 Index, and Dow Jones Industrial Average, offering contingent coupons and potential for automatic redemption. The filing details the terms, risks including credit risk of the issuer, potential for significant loss, and lack of liquidity, and advises potential investors to carefully review associated pricing supplements and prospectuses.

title: 34 New 4-Star Stocks This Week
summary: Morningstar has identified 34 new 4-star stocks this week, indicating that their prices have fallen into undervalued territory. Among the prominent companies added to this list are Amazon (AMZN), Advanced Micro Devices (AMD), Novo Nordisk (NVO), Thermo Fisher Scientific (TMO), and Walt Disney (DIS). The Morningstar Rating system evaluates stocks based on their price, fair value estimate, and Uncertainty Rating to help investors identify undervalued or overvalued opportunities.

title: STMicroelectronics shares soar after AWS AI cloud agreement
summary: STMicroelectronics' shares surged 6% after an expanded, multi-year, multi-billion-dollar commercial agreement with Amazon Web Services (AWS). This collaboration positions STMicroelectronics as a key supplier of advanced semiconductor technologies for AWS's high-performance compute infrastructure, vital for cloud and AI data centers. The partnership also involves STMicroelectronics providing specialized capabilities, including power solutions for energy efficiency, and options for AWS to acquire up to 24.8 million ordinary shares.

title: STMicroelectronics Shares Climb 8% Over Strategic Collaboration With Amazon Web Services
summary: STMicroelectronics N.V. (STM) shares surged by 8% on Monday following the announcement of an expanded strategic collaboration with Amazon Web Services (AWS). This multi-year, multi-billion dollar commercial agreement encompasses several product categories and includes STMicroelectronics issuing warrants to AWS for the purchase of up to 24.8 million ordinary shares.

title: Hyperscalers Will Spend At Least $625 Billion on AI Infrastructure This Year. How to Invest.
summary: Four major hyperscaler companies—Alphabet, Amazon, Meta Platforms, and Microsoft—are projected to invest a combined $625 billion or more in AI infrastructure and data centers in 2026. While these companies compete for AI market dominance, the immediate investment opportunity may lie with data center and AI infrastructure providers rather than the hyperscalers themselves, as profitability for the latter remains uncertain. The Global X Data Center and Digital Infrastructure ETF (DTCR) is highlighted as a potential way for investors to benefit from this massive buildout, given its focus on the underlying infrastructure.

title: Roivant Sciences stock hits all-time high at 26.35 USD
summary: Roivant Sciences (ROIV) stock has reached an all-time high of $26.35, marking a 137.1% increase over the past year, despite recent Q3 2026 earnings reporting a larger-than-expected loss and revenue shortfall. The surge, which places the stock almost 3x above its 52-week low, reflects strong investor confidence in the company's strategic initiatives and robust cash position, despite analysts expecting a sales decline this year. Roivant's market capitalization stands at approximately $18.5 billion, and it holds more cash than debt.

title: Bank of New York Mellon stock hits all-time high at 125.89 USD
summary: Bank of New York Mellon's stock reached an all-time high of $125.89, showcasing a 47.63% increase over the past year. The company's strong financial performance, with $20.11 billion in revenue and 8.43% growth, alongside an undervalued stock according to InvestingPro, has driven investor confidence. Recent strategic moves include issuing $1.55 billion in senior notes and executive leadership changes, while analysts from RBC Capital and Keefe, Bruyette & Woods have raised price targets.

title: 3D Systems Corporation (DDD) Strengthens Growth Outlook With Expanded Production Capabilities
summary: 3D Systems Corp (NYSE:DDD) is expanding its Littleton, Colorado facility by 80,000 square feet to enhance its Aerospace and Defense Application Center of Excellence, aiming for over 20% growth in its industrial segment in 2026. This expansion and favorable regulatory changes, such as the National Defense Authorization Act, are expected to boost revenue from production printing systems and custom metal parts beyond $35 million in 2026. The company is actively involved in a multi-phase, $18.5 million US Air Force-sponsored program to develop next-generation laser powder bed fusion technologies, further cementing its position in the additive manufacturing market.

title: Assessing Instacart’s (CART) Valuation After New Costco And Allegiance Partnerships
summary: This article assesses Instacart's (Maplebear, CART) valuation following new partnerships with Costco and Allegiance retailers, which expand its enterprise platform internationally and domestically. Despite recent share price declines, a valuation model suggests the stock is 31% undervalued, with a fair value of $50.22 compared to its current price of $34.64, driven by increasing recurring, higher-margin revenue streams from its growing omnichannel integrations. The analysis highlights targeted growth, rising profitability, and a premium earnings multiple, while also acknowledging risks like labor costs, competition, and ad spend pressure.

title: APA stock hits 52-week high at 27.72 USD
summary: APA Corporation's stock has reached a 52-week high of $27.72, reflecting strong investor confidence and market sentiment. The company has seen a 33.27% increase in stock value over the past year and maintains a healthy dividend yield for 56 consecutive years. Analyst ratings are mixed but generally positive, and the company is involved in a strategic divestment of its Allgas stake.

title: Walmart’s decade of change with Doug McMillon
summary: Doug McMillon's tenure as Walmart CEO brought significant transformation, especially in technology and e-commerce, resulting in substantial increases in net sales and income. His strategic decisions, including major investments in digital capabilities and international acquisitions like Flipkart, propelled Walmart into a new era of retail. McMillon has now passed the leadership baton to John Furner, leaving behind a legacy of innovation and a culture of adaptability for the retail giant's future, particularly with the rise of AI.

title: Concentrated ETF Bests S&P 500 With Active Stock Picks
summary: The Alger Concentrated Equity ETF (CNEQ) outperformed the S&P 500 in 2025 by over 14 percentage points, returning more than 32% due to its focused portfolio and strategic stock picks centered around artificial intelligence infrastructure. The ETF, managed by Dr. Ankur Crawford, invests in 30 or fewer predominantly large-cap companies identified through fundamental research as demonstrating promising growth potential and "Positive Dynamic Change." This active management approach allows CNEQ to pick companies like NVIDIA, Microsoft, Amazon, and Nebius Group, which are positioned to benefit from the anticipated surge in demand for compute capacity driven by "agentic AI."

title: 3 Safety-First ETFs to Retire in Comfort
summary: This article identifies three safety-first ETFs designed for comfortable retirement: Fidelity Low Volatility Factor ETF (FDLO), iShares MSCI USA Min Vol Factor ETF (USMV), and State Street Consumer Staples Select Sector SPDR ETF (XLP). These ETFs emphasize diversification, low volatility, and stable dividend yields, focusing on high-quality or essential consumer companies to reduce risk. They offer an alternative to individual stock picking for retirees prioritizing wealth preservation.

title: King Soopers parent company names former Walmart executive as new CEO
summary: Kroger, parent company of King Soopers, has appointed former Walmart executive Greg Foran as its new CEO. Foran, known for his tech-savvy and detail-oriented leadership at Walmart's U.S. division and Air New Zealand, is expected to help Kroger compete with rivals like Walmart and Amazon. His appointment follows the abrupt resignation of the previous CEO and comes as Kroger navigates challenges in e-commerce and faces scrutiny over new technologies.

title: American Financial Group Reports 4Q25 Revenue of $2.06 Billion Ahead of Consensus Estimate
summary: American Financial Group, Inc. (NYSE: AFG) reported strong fourth-quarter 2025 results, with revenue of $2.06 billion, surpassing the consensus estimate. The company also saw a significant increase in underwriting profit, rising 41% year over year. Wells Fargo initiated coverage with an "Overweight" rating, citing favorable growth prospects and low exposure to property insurance.

title: Wall Street's Hidden Value Play? Amazon's Chinese Rival Ranks Top 10% On Key Score After Recent Pullback
summary: PDD Holdings, the parent company of Pinduoduo and Temu, has achieved an impressive value score of 89.66, placing it in the top 10% globally, despite a 9.09% year-to-date stock price decline. This high score indicates that the market price is low relative to its strong underlying financial fundamentals, including robust revenue and earnings growth. The company faces regulatory challenges like a Texas ban on Temu and a fine from Chinese tax authorities, yet it continues to be a major competitor to Amazon, expanding its social commerce model globally.

title: Kroger names former Walmart executive as its new CEO
summary: Kroger has appointed former Walmart executive Greg Foran as its new chief executive officer. Foran previously led Walmart's U.S. division, where he enhanced online ordering and digital capabilities. This move comes as Kroger faces increasing competition from Walmart, and after its proposed merger with Albertsons was blocked, with Foran succeeding the interim leader Ron Sargent.

title: STMicroelectronics Expands AWS Deal, Issues 24.8M Warrants
summary: STMicroelectronics has secured a new multi-year, multi-billion dollar deal with Amazon Web Services, positioning ST as a key provider of semiconductor technology for AWS infrastructure. The agreement includes a warrant allowing AWS to purchase up to 24.8 million ST shares, vesting based on AWS's purchase of ST goods and services, with an exercise price of $28.38 per share over seven years. This partnership aims to enhance AWS's infrastructure performance, reduce costs, and accelerate product rollouts, leading to a 3% increase in STMicroelectronics' stock price to $29.85 following the announcement.

title: DeFi Technologies launches index tracking regulated crypto capital flows By Investing.com
summary: DeFi Technologies, through its subsidiary Valour, has launched the DEFT Valour Investment Opportunity (DVIO) Index to track regulated investor capital flows in digital assets. This index aims to provide better "signal quality" by monitoring real capital through Valour's ETP platform, covering the top 50 crypto assets. Despite the company's stock facing headwinds, InvestingPro rates its financial health as "GREAT," and DeFi Technologies plans to expand offerings based on this new index.

title: Did Non‑Recourse Refinancing at Amazon‑Leased 7 West 34th Street Just Shift Vornado’s (VNO) Investment Narrative?
summary: Vornado Realty Trust recently refinanced its 53%-owned 7 West 34th Street property with a US$250,000,000 non-recourse loan, extending the debt maturity to 2031 at a fixed 5.79% rate. This move, for a building entirely leased by Amazon, shifts the loan from fully recourse to Vornado to a non-recourse structure, buying the REIT more time but at a higher interest cost. While it may ease some near-term concerns about leverage and refinancing, it doesn't resolve core issues like pressured earnings, interest coverage, and an unstable dividend record for Vornado.

title: AMD Rally Raises 2026 Expectations as Chip Demand Strengthens
summary: Advanced Micro Devices (AMD) is at a critical "inflection point" following a significant stock surge, driven by factors like limited server CPU supply, China sales approval, and demand for its MI325X AI accelerators. The company's 2026 outlook is highly dependent on its MI400 Series & Helios AI accelerators, which are expected to compete with Nvidia, with some experts suggesting AMD could achieve a trillion-dollar valuation if it executes well on AI and data center growth. Investors are currently focused on the sustainability of AI demand and AMD's ability to capitalize on the AI chip market.

title: Morgan Stanley Highlights Viking Holdings (VIK) for Resilience in Wealthier Demographic Segments
summary: Morgan Stanley and Bank of America have both raised their price targets for Viking Holdings (VIK), citing the company's resilience in catering to wealthier demographics. Morgan Stanley noted that while the broader leisure sector faced challenges in 2025, companies like Viking saw acceleration, a trend expected to continue. Bank of America's analysis showed a significant year-over-year increase in cruise spending, highlighting its unique strength compared to other travel sectors.

title: STMicroelectronics expands strategic engagement with AWS, enabling high-performance compute infrastructure for cloud and AI data
summary: STMicroelectronics has significantly expanded its strategic collaboration with Amazon Web Services (AWS) through a multi-year, multi-billion USD commercial engagement. This partnership establishes ST as a key supplier of advanced semiconductor technologies to AWS, enhancing high-performance compute infrastructure for cloud and AI data. STMicroelectronics will supply specialised solutions including high-bandwidth connectivity, advanced microcontrollers, and energy-efficient analogue and power ICs, while AWS will utilize ST's technologies to optimize electronic design automation (EDA) workloads and accelerate product development.

title: STMicroelectronics shares jump 6% on expanded AWS partnership
summary: Shares of STMicroelectronics NV jumped over 6% after the European chipmaker announced an expanded strategic partnership with Amazon Web Services. This collaboration positions STMicroelectronics as a key supplier for AWS's next-generation compute infrastructure, covering data center connectivity, cloud-based EDA workloads, and custom silicon. Analysts at Morgan Stanley view this as a positive development, strengthening STMicroelectronics' presence in the high-growth data center silicon market and providing better revenue visibility.

title: How Investors Are Reacting To V2X (VVX) Expanding Secure AI Partnerships And Reviving A US$4.30 Billion Contract
summary: V2X, Inc. has recently formed partnerships with Google Public Sector and Amazon to implement secure AI, cloud, and smart warehousing solutions for U.S. defense and intelligence, while also resuming its US$4.30 billion T-6 COMBS aircraft supply contract. These developments enhance V2X's position in advanced AI and government support, potentially influencing its market perception and future profitability. The company's ongoing contract backlog and technology ambitions present both opportunities and execution risks for investors.

title: Barrick Earnings: Very Strong, Driven by the Gold Bull Market
summary: Barrick Mining reported a very strong fourth quarter with adjusted net profit after tax more than doubling year-on-year, driven by high gold prices despite rising unit cash costs. While the company's stock is considered significantly overvalued by Morningstar, Barrick plans to increase its quarterly base dividend and pursue an IPO of its North American gold assets.

title: STMicroelectronics Stock Surges on AWS Partnership
summary: STMicroelectronics (STM) stock surged over 9% following the announcement of a multi-year, multi-billion dollar deal with Amazon Web Services (AWS) to supply advanced chips. As part of the agreement, AWS may purchase up to 24.8 million STM shares over the next seven years. The news has led to significant options trading activity, with call options being particularly popular, and the stock is experiencing its largest daily percentage gain in months, trading at its highest level since June.

title: RBC Maintains Outperform on Amazon.com, Inc. (AMZN) Feb 2026
summary: RBC Capital has reaffirmed its Outperform rating for Amazon.com, Inc. (AMZN) on February 6, 2026, citing strong AWS performance and resilient retail trends, without changing its price target. This decision comes amidst varied analyst opinions, with Wells Fargo setting a $305 target and DA Davidson lowering its target to $175 on the same date. Investors are advised to use analyst ratings as one input, balancing them with fundamentals like AWS growth metrics and capex guidance, especially given Amazon's substantial market capitalization.

title: Marvell Technology, Inc. $MRVL Shares Sold by Oppenheimer & Co. Inc.
summary: Oppenheimer & Co. Inc. significantly reduced its stake in Marvell Technology ($MRVL) by 4.8% in Q3, selling 16,958 shares, though the investment firm still holds a substantial position. This comes as Marvell Technology reported strong financial results, beating revenue and EPS expectations, and provided positive Q4 guidance. Despite some insider selling and mixed analyst price-target revisions, the company maintains a "Moderate Buy" consensus rating with an average target price of $115.31.

title: Amazon’s $200 Billion AI “Shock and Awe” Campaign Overshadows Record Sales
summary: Amazon recently announced an unprecedented $200 billion capital expenditure for 2026, primarily aimed at dominating generative AI and satellite infrastructure. This massive investment, the largest ever by a private corporation in a single year, overshadowed record sales in Q4 2025, causing Amazon's stock to drop by 11% due to investor concerns about near-term profit margins. The spending is focused on expanding AWS infrastructure, custom AI chips, and the Project Kuiper satellite network, indicating a strategic shift towards becoming an infrastructure and intelligence behemoth.

title: STMicroelectronics Shares Climb After Multibillion-Dollar Chip Deal With Amazon
summary: STMicroelectronics' shares climbed after the company secured a multiyear, multibillion-dollar agreement with Amazon Web Services. This deal positions the European chip maker as a key supplier for AI-infrastructure chips and includes an option for AWS to acquire a stake of up to 2.7% in STMicroelectronics. The news led to a 5.5% increase in STMicroelectronics' Milan-listed shares.

title: Oppenheimer & Co. Inc. Acquires 11,777 Shares of Walmart Inc. $WMT
summary: Oppenheimer & Co. Inc. increased its stake in Walmart Inc. by 2.5% in the third quarter, acquiring 11,777 additional shares to bring its total holdings to 482,226 shares valued at $49.7 million. This makes Walmart its 24th largest holding, representing approximately 0.6% of its investment portfolio. Despite significant insider selling over the past 90 days, Walmart recently achieved a $1.05 trillion market cap, beat earnings estimates, and maintains a "Moderate Buy" consensus rating with a target price of $125.06 among analysts.

title: Stifel reiterates Buy rating on Erasca stock, maintains $10 price target
summary: Stifel has reiterated its Buy rating and $10.00 price target for Erasca Inc (NASDAQ:ERAS) after a fireside chat with the company's CFO/CBO. The stock has seen significant returns recently, trading above the target price and near its 52-week high, despite the company remaining unprofitable. Erasca is positioned as a key player in the panRAS competitive landscape with its ERAS-0015 drug candidate, which is optimized for both PK and potency.

title: STMicroelectronics Extends Strategic Relationship With Amazon Web Services With Multi-Yr Deal
summary: STMicroelectronics has announced a multi-year, multi-billion dollar strategic collaboration with Amazon Web Services (AWS) covering various semiconductor solutions, high-bandwidth connectivity, and intelligent infrastructure management. The partnership aims to reduce customer total cost of ownership, accelerate time to market, and support AWS's growing AI and cloud workloads. As part of the agreement, STMicroelectronics has issued warrants to AWS for the purchase of up to 24.8 million ordinary shares, vesting over the contract term.

title: Marvell Technology, Inc. (NASDAQ:MRVL) Receives Consensus Recommendation of "Moderate Buy" from Analysts
summary: Analysts have given Marvell Technology, Inc. (NASDAQ:MRVL) a "Moderate Buy" consensus rating, with an average 12-month price target of $115.31. The company recently exceeded Q3 earnings and revenue estimates, and institutional ownership remains high despite some insider selling. Key analysts have recently adjusted their price targets and ratings on the stock.

title: Amazon.com Inc. – US$200bn CAPEX in FY26
summary: Phillip Securities Research upgraded Amazon.com Inc. (AMZN) from ACCUMULATE to BUY, setting a new target price of US$280. This decision follows strong 4Q25 results, with AWS showing significant growth and overall revenue outperforming expectations. The firm adjusted its FY26e revenue and PATMI upwards, while also increasing CAPEX forecasts due to higher-than-expected AI investments.

title: Allianz Asset Management GmbH Buys 142,600 Shares of Urban Outfitters, Inc. $URBN
summary: Allianz Asset Management GmbH significantly increased its stake in Urban Outfitters (URBN) by 316.5% in Q3, purchasing an additional 142,600 shares, bringing its total to 187,660 shares valued at approximately $13.4 million. This move contrasts with recent insider selling by CEO Richard Hayne and Margaret Hayne, who sold shares worth over $1.4 million in early February. Despite the insider selling, institutional ownership in Urban Outfitters stands at 77.61%, and the stock currently holds a consensus "Hold" rating from analysts with an average price target of $86.67.

title: MrBeast And Salesforce Launch Million Dollar Puzzle Hunt
summary: MrBeast and Salesforce collaborated on a Super Bowl 60 commercial that launched a $1 million interactive puzzle hunt. The campaign, which was developed in just 27 days, leveraged Salesforce's AI-powered Slackbot and incorporated clues across various media, social platforms, and real-world locations. This initiative marks a strategic move by Salesforce to target a younger, digitally native audience and demonstrates the increasing trend of integrating interactive experiences into advertising.

title: Amazon taps STMicroelectronics chips to power next-wave AI data centers
summary: STMicroelectronics has expanded a multi-year, multi-billion dollar commercial agreement with Amazon Web Services (AWS) to supply advanced semiconductors for AWS's compute and AI data-center infrastructure. This collaboration includes high-bandwidth connectivity, mixed-signal processing, microcontrollers, analog and power ICs, and warrants for up to 24.8 million ordinary shares to AWS. The deal positions ST as a strategic supplier for AWS's next-generation infrastructure, enabling more efficient and scalable AI and high-performance computing operations.

title: Tech Hits a Wall—Energy Breaks Out
summary: As tech stocks falter and the broader market corrects, energy stocks have surged, indicating a significant sector rotation. The article highlights that traditional energy companies have been top performers this year, with the iShares Global Energy ETF up almost 15%, while tech remains flat. This shift suggests that investors should focus on sectors demonstrating clear strength, particularly energy.

title: CMSI Chops Amazon.com(AMZN.US) TP to US$283, Rating Overweight
summary: CMSI has lowered its target price for Amazon.com (AMZN.US) to US$283 from US$301, while maintaining an "Overweight" rating. This decision follows Amazon's strong 4Q25 results, characterized by stable e-commerce, rapid advertising growth, and accelerated AWS growth. CMSI views the shift in sentiment towards AI capital expenditure as a good entry opportunity, citing Amazon's comprehensive tech stack and collaboration with Anthropic as competitive advantages.

title: Eldorado Gold Corporation (EGO): Strategic Growth, Strong Balance Sheet, and Long-Term Value
summary: Eldorado Gold Corporation is positioned for significant growth, with S&P Global Ratings placing it on CreditWatch positive due to strong gold prices and progress on its Skouries copper-gold project. The company recently acquired Foran Mining, which is expected to boost gold-equivalent production by over 80% to 900,000 ounces by 2027, projecting substantial increases in EBITDA and free cash flow. This strategic expansion is set to strengthen its balance sheet, with adjusted debt-to-EBITDA anticipated to fall below 1.0x once new projects are in full production.

title: Recent 7.1% pullback isn't enough to hurt long-term Build-A-Bear Workshop (NYSE:BBW) shareholders, they're still up 954% over 5 years
summary: Build-A-Bear Workshop (NYSE:BBW) shareholders have experienced a 17% decline in their share price over the past month, but the long-term outlook remains strong with a 954% total shareholder return over five years, largely due to dividends. The company transitioned from a loss to profitability during this period, and while EPS growth has been slower than the share price increase in the last three years, the market appears enthusiastic about the stock. This analysis suggests that despite recent pullbacks, the fundamentals and historical performance indicate a positive long-term trajectory for BBW investors.

title: Beyond the Chips: Why This Power Play Could Ride the AI Data Center Boom Higher
summary: Hyperscalers are projected to spend $500 billion on data center capital expenditures this year, driven by the booming AI industry. Quanta Services (NYSE: PWR), a Houston-based company providing infrastructure solutions for power and energy, is well-positioned to benefit from this trend. The company focuses on modernizing the electrical grid and has seen its backlog grow to a record $39.2 billion due to surging demand from utility, renewable energy, and technology sectors.

title: Applied Materials stock jumped 6% Friday — here’s what could move AMAT next week
summary: Applied Materials (AMAT) stock rose 6.09% on Friday, closing at $322.51, following a broader chip surge driven by increased capital expenditure plans from Amazon and Alphabet and strong AI chip demand. Investors are now looking forward to Applied Materials' fiscal first-quarter report on February 12th, with attention focused on management's views on chipmakers' factory spending and potential impacts from U.S. export controls on its China business. Macroeconomic factors like the U.S. jobs report and CPI data, delayed by a federal government shutdown, along with Federal Reserve commentary, could also influence the stock's performance.

title: Microsoft Corporation Shs Unsponsored Canadian Depository Receipt Hedged Trade Ideas — FWB:MSF1
summary: This article compiles several trade ideas and analyses for Microsoft Corporation (FWB:MSF1, NASDAQ:MSFT) from various TradingView users. Analysts present both bullish and bearish outlooks, discussing potential price movements, support and resistance levels, and the impact of recent news like Microsoft's investment in UAE's AI leader G42 and Rubrik's IPO. Technical indicators such as RSI, MACD, Fibonacci retracements, and Ichimoku Clouds are frequently cited to support predictions ranging from significant corrections to continued uptrends.

title: Quanta Services Benefits from Data Center Buildout
summary: Quanta Services is experiencing strong demand for its infrastructure solutions, driven by significant capital expenditures from hyperscalers like Microsoft and Amazon for data center buildout. The company, which specializes in electric infrastructure and grid modernization, has expanded its capabilities through acquisitions such as Cupertino Electric and boasts a record backlog of $39.2 billion. Analysts predict a positive outlook for PWR stock, citing the firm's growth potential in utility, renewable energy, and technology sectors.

title: How to Buy Ishares Ibonds Dec 2028 Term Muni Bond Etf (IBMQ) ETF?
summary: This article provides a comprehensive guide on how to buy Ishares Ibonds Dec 2028 Term Muni Bond Etf (IBMQ) ETF, covering steps from choosing a broker and opening an account to researching the ETF, deciding investment amounts, placing orders, and monitoring investments. It also emphasizes the importance of understanding and applying risk management strategies. The guide aims to help new investors navigate the process of investing in the stock market with IBMQ.

title: NAN FUNG TRINITY Loads Up KT Corp Stock With 1.49 Million Shares Bought
summary: NAN FUNG TRINITY (HK) LTD has acquired 1,492,440 shares of KT Corp (NYSE:KT), establishing a new position valued at $28.31 million. This move represents 2.24% of the fund's 13F reportable assets and makes KT its 11th largest holding. The investment appears to be off to a good start, with KT shares up double-digits since the beginning of the year, purchased at a reasonable P/E ratio of 15.

title: Here’s Why Analysts Believe Manulife Financial (MFC) Is A Top Canadian Financial Stock
summary: Manulife Financial Corporation (MFC) is considered a top Canadian financial stock by analysts, with Jefferies raising its price target to $42.58 and Barclays setting theirs at C$52. The company operates across various global markets in insurance, annuity products, and wealth management, with analysts citing steady cash flow, solid capital levels, and industry consolidation as positive factors for the life insurance sector. Despite positive analyst outlooks for MFC, the article suggests that some AI stocks may offer even greater short-term returns.

title: ASML stock price jumps into weekend as chip rally returns — here’s what matters next week
summary: ASML's U.S. shares gained 4.6% on Friday, closing at $1,413.01, as chip stocks rallied due to renewed investor interest in AI, spurred by new capital expenditure hints from major tech companies. The article highlights ASML's ex-dividend dates in Europe and the U.S. next week, alongside upcoming critical U.S. economic data releases like nonfarm payrolls and CPI, which could influence market sentiment. Despite the rally, experts caution about the "AI build-out trade" becoming too pricey and the potential for volatility, especially with ASML's vulnerability to changes in export regulations and customer demand shifts.

title: Costco stock price closes above $1,000 — what investors watch next for COST
summary: Costco Wholesale's stock closed above $1,000 for the first time on Friday, gaining 1.2% to $1,001.16. Investors are now looking ahead to the company's fiscal Q2 earnings report and February sales numbers on March 5. Despite broader market gains, with the Dow and S&P 500 seeing significant jumps, Costco's robust membership model and strong January sales performance (net sales up 9.3% to $21.33 billion) position it well, though market watchers will closely scrutinize upcoming reports for any signs of consumer spending shifts or potential hazards to its growth narrative.

title: Seagate Rallied 6% on Data Hoarding Boom: Path to a $530 Recovery in 2026
summary: Shares of Seagate Technology Holdings (STX) surged 6.1% to $430, driven by the increasing storage demands of AI models and a "Data Hoarding" trend among hyperscalers. The company's HAMR technology for mass capacity drives positions it as a primary beneficiary, with analysts at Wells Fargo noting a shift into a multi-year upcycle for the sector. TIKR's Advanced Valuation Model suggests a target price of $531.79, indicating a potential upside of 23.6%, fueled by robust revenue growth and recovering margins.

title: HA Sustainable Infrastructure Capital (HASI) Receives Analyst Approval Post Sunrun JV
summary: HA Sustainable Infrastructure Capital (HASI) received reaffirmed analyst approval following its joint venture with Sunrun. RBC Capital reiterated a Buy rating with a $39 price target, suggesting a 13% upside. The JV aims to accelerate residential solar and battery system deployment, with HASI investing up to $500 million to finance over 300 megawatts of capacity.

title: Sysco Corporation $SYY is Diamond Hill Capital Management Inc.'s 8th Largest Position
summary: Diamond Hill Capital Management Inc. reduced its stake in Sysco Corporation (SYY) by 9.7% in the third quarter, making Sysco its 8th largest holding. Analysts maintain a "Moderate Buy" consensus rating with an average target price of $89.38, having recently raised targets to the low $90s. Sysco reported solid Q3 earnings, beating EPS estimates, showing revenue growth, and announced a $0.54 quarterly dividend, while institutional investors continue to adjust their positions.

title: A "breakdown" in U.S. growth and hiring could impact Fed policy - Deutsche Bank
summary: Analysts at Deutsche Bank Research note a "breakdown" in the historical correlation between U.S. economic growth and hiring trends since the COVID-19 pandemic. This divergence has led to the Federal Reserve cutting interest rates despite solid growth, influenced by a weak labor market and negative household sentiment. The resolution of this disparity will be crucial for future Fed policy decisions and could even affect the outcome of midterm elections, depending on whether hiring catches up to growth, or growth slows to meet hiring.

title: Principal Financial Group Inc. Sells 180,434 Shares of Alphabet Inc. $GOOG
summary: Principal Financial Group Inc. reduced its stake in Alphabet Inc. ($GOOG) by 2.7% in Q3, selling 180,434 shares and retaining 6,465,384 shares valued at $1.575 billion. Despite Alphabet beating Q4 earnings estimates, its stock faced pressure due to management's aggressive 2026 capital expenditure guidance of $175–185 billion, which spooked investors. Insider selling, including CEO Sundar Pichai, also contributed to selling pressure, although the company recently declared a quarterly dividend.

title: Top Penny Stocks To Keep An Eye On – February 6th
summary: This article identifies three penny stocks to watch: Bitfarms (BITF), Peloton Interactive (PTON), and Direxion Daily MU Bear 1X Shares (MUD), based on their trading volume. It defines penny stocks as low-priced, highly volatile, and speculative investments. The piece provides brief descriptions of Bitfarms and Peloton's operations.

title: What Do Analysts Think About Salesforce, Inc. (CRM)?
summary: Salesforce, Inc. (NYSE: CRM) recently received reaffirmed Buy ratings from Stifel Nicolaus with a $300 price target and an Overweight rating from Piper Sandler, though Piper Sandler adjusted its price target to $280 from $315 due to mixed views on the software space. Analysts anticipate continued pessimism around software but recommend focusing on hyperscaler, consumption, and vertical sub-sectors. The article also mentions the company's cloud-based enterprise software offerings for customer relationship management.

title: AeroVironment, Inc. (AVAV) a Strong Buy, Wall Street Projects 65% Upside
summary: Wall Street analysts project a 65% upside for AeroVironment, Inc. (AVAV), rating it a Strong Buy with an average one-year price target of $390.75. This optimism is fueled by recent positive adjustments from Needham and KeyBanc, alongside a significant $75 million task order from the U.S. Air Force for next-generation biotechnology development. The company, known for its unmanned aerial and ground robot systems, is seen as a key player in defense modernization.

title: Arista Networks Surged 7% on AI Plumbing Boom: Why Analysts Expect $270 in 2026
summary: Arista Networks (ANET) saw its stock surge 6.7% due to significant investments in data centers by companies like Amazon, which are driving demand for high-speed AI networking infrastructure. Analysts believe Arista is undervalued, with TIKR's Advanced Valuation Model suggesting a price target of $271, representing over 110% upside, as the company is positioned to be a primary beneficiary of the multi-billion-dollar cloud capex wave. The company's specialized EOS software and strong profitability in high-performance cloud networking are expected to maintain its leadership in the AI infrastructure market.

title: Diamond Hill Capital Management trims Alphabet Inc. Class A
summary: Diamond Hill Capital Management, led by Ric Dillon, has reduced its holdings in Alphabet Inc. Class A (GOOGL) by 77,602 shares. Despite this trim, Wall Street analysts maintain a strong bullish outlook on GOOGL, citing robust Q4 2025 performance, accelerated Search growth, exceptional Google Cloud momentum, and an aggressive AI push. Spark, TipRanks' AI Analyst, rates GOOGL as "Outperform" due to strong financial performance and technical uptrend, though noting premium valuation and potential near-term pressure from large investment ramps.

title: GlobalFoundries stock jumps nearly 5% ahead of earnings — what could move GFS next week
summary: GlobalFoundries (GFS) stock saw a nearly 5% jump, closing at $42.91, as chip stocks rebounded, driven by renewed optimism in AI-driven demand and ahead of its Q4 and full-year 2025 earnings report on February 11. Analysts are focused on pricing and wafer shipment volumes, with consensus earnings at 47 cents per share on roughly $1.8 billion in revenue. The broader semiconductor industry outlook remains positive, projecting global chip sales to reach $1 trillion by 2026.

title: UMC stock price: United Microelectronics heads into Monday after AI capex talk sparks chip rebound
summary: UMC's U.S. shares closed up 0.9% at $10.06 on Friday, spurred by Amazon and Alphabet's plans for increased AI infrastructure spending, which also boosted other chip stocks. The broader semiconductor market saw gains, with the Philadelphia semiconductor index rising 5.7% and Nvidia up 7.8%. Investors are now looking to upcoming U.S. economic data and UMC's monthly sales figures on March 5 for further market cues.

title: Astera Labs (ALAB) stock closes near $170 after 19% jump as earnings week looms
summary: Astera Labs (ALAB) stock surged 18.9% to nearly $170 on Friday, driven by strong sentiment in the semiconductor sector following Amazon's AI investment plans. The company, a key player in AI data center connectivity chips, is set to report its fourth-quarter earnings next Tuesday. Investors are keenly watching if Astera Labs can meet revenue and margin expectations amid increased AI hardware infrastructure spending.

title: Intuit Is Down 33% Year to Date. Here’s Where the Stock Could Be Headed in 2026
summary: Intuit stock has fallen 33% year-to-date, trading near $444 per share, primarily due to a valuation reset in the large-cap software sector rather than business performance issues. Despite this, a valuation model suggests the stock is undervalued, with a target price of $783, implying a 76% upside over 2.5 years. This outlook is supported by sustained revenue growth from TurboTax, QuickBooks, and Credit Karma, coupled with AI-driven efficiency gains and strong operating margins.

title: KLA stock price jumps 8% as chip rebound lifts KLAC — what to know before Monday
summary: KLA Corp (KLAC) shares jumped 8.4% to $1,442.95 on Friday, leading gains among chip-equipment makers due to a broader chip rebound spurred by Amazon's increased capital spending and strong demand for AI products. The company also announced a quarterly cash dividend of $1.90 per share. Traders are watching if this momentum will continue into Monday, especially with upcoming U.S. jobs numbers and CPI data.

title: Applied Digital Stock Has Soared 246% in 3 Months: Why Analysts Now See Limited Upside Around a $23–$25 Target
summary: Applied Digital (APLD) stock has surged 246% in three months, primarily driven by its strategic shift from crypto-mining to high-performance AI data centers, notably through long-term lease agreements with CoreWeave. Despite this rapid growth and increased revenue, the company continues to face high costs and GAAP losses, remaining free-cash-flow negative. Analysts now see limited upside with an average price target of $23.70, suggesting a potential downside from its current trading price, due to concerns about customer concentration, capital expenditure requirements, and the need for sustained profitability.

title: Roth MKM Reaffirms Their Hold Rating on Reddit Inc Class A (RDDT)
summary: Roth MKM analyst Rohit Kulkarni has maintained a Hold rating on Reddit Inc Class A (RDDT) with a price target of $185.00. This comes despite recent negative insider sentiment, with 164 insiders showing an increase in selling shares. The company reported strong quarterly revenues of $725.61 million and a net profit of $251.6 million, significantly up from the previous year.

title: XCF Global Announces Termination of Chief Strategy Officer
summary: XCF Global Inc. (SAFX) announced the termination of its Chief Strategy Officer, Gregory Surette, on February 2, 2026. The company stated that the decision was not due to disagreements over operations or policies and expressed gratitude for Surette's contributions, indicating an orderly leadership transition. SAFX currently has a market cap of $36.52M and a "Sell" technical sentiment signal.

title: Jim Cramer On Amazon Stock Slip: Not Saying Downside Overdone, 'I Figure Tomorrow's Pretty Ugly'
summary: Jim Cramer commented on Amazon's recent stock decline, acknowledging that the immediate future for the stock looks "pretty ugly" but maintains that the company's significant investment in capital expenditures, particularly in AI infrastructure, is justifiable. Amazon's shares fell sharply despite beating Q4 revenue expectations, primarily due to CEO Andy Jassy's announcement of a projected $200 billion capital expenditure in 2026. Analysts like Gene Munster and Daniel Newman support Amazon's long-term strategy, viewing the increased spending as beneficial for the company and the broader AI market, as Amazon aims to catch up and leverage AI across various business segments.

title: Roth Capital Upgraded Energy Fuels Inc. (UUUU) to Neutral from Sell
summary: Roth Capital upgraded Energy Fuels Inc. (UUUU) to Neutral from Sell, raising its price target to $15.50 from $13.00, citing strong market sentiment and rising uranium prices. Other firms like Canaccord and B. Riley also increased their price targets and maintained Buy ratings for the company, attributing its outperformance to White Mesa’s rare earth refining capabilities and supportive U.S. critical minerals policy. Energy Fuels also exceeded its uranium production and sales guidance for Q4 2025.

title: Marvell Technology Surged 8% on Custom Silicon Wins: Why Analysts Expect $311 in 2026
summary: Marvell Technology (MRVL) saw an 8.2% surge after investors recognized its crucial role in the AI ecosystem, specifically benefiting from the rising demand for custom silicon. Analysts anticipate significant growth for Marvell's custom compute business, with a target price of $311 by 2026, representing a potential upside of 287.3% from its current price of ~$80. The company is positioned as an essential infrastructure partner for major cloud providers, designing bespoke chips for hyperscalers like Amazon and Google.

title: Data Center Stocks Surge Into the Weekend: Digital Realty, Equinix and Vertiv Set Up a Big Week Ahead
summary: Data center stocks like Digital Realty, Equinix, and Vertiv ended Friday with significant gains, driven by renewed investor focus on AI-linked infrastructure following substantial capital expenditure plans from tech giants. The market is increasingly scrutinizing these investments for clear returns, with upcoming earnings from Equinix and Iron Mountain expected to provide further insights into demand, capacity, and pricing challenges facing the sector.

title: Aterian recalls PurSteam Elite Travel Steamers and Mighty Lil Steamers due to risk of serious burn injury
summary: Aterian has recalled approximately 75,400 PurSteam Elite Travel Steamers and 119,000 PurSteam Mighty Lil Steamers due to a significant burn hazard. The steamers can expel hot water, with 80 reports of injury from the Elite Travel Steamer (14 burns) and 392 from the Mighty Lil Steamer (40 burns, two second-degree). Consumers are advised to immediately stop using the products and visit recall.pursteam.com for a refund after cutting the power cord and providing photographic evidence.

title: Why the AI capex cycle is built to persist
summary: The article argues that the current AI capital expenditure cycle, driven by hyperscalers, is not a traditional boom/bust scenario but a sustained competitive equilibrium likely to persist for another two to three years. This persistence is attributed to competitive dynamics, physical supply constraints like power infrastructure and semiconductor fabrication, and the continued validity of scaling laws in AI development. Ultimately, the piece suggests that focusing on long-term fundamentals and understanding how infrastructure advantage translates to monetizable outcomes is crucial for investors.

title: Microsoft (MSFT) Has a Lot of Firepower, Says Jim Cramer
summary: Jim Cramer discussed Microsoft's unexpected downgrade following its fiscal third-quarter earnings despite beating analyst estimates. He acknowledged Stifel's concerns about Azure's competition and supply constraints but reiterated Microsoft's significant "firepower." Cramer also humorously compared Google's Cloud head to Lebron James in the competitive cloud market.

title: Applied Digital stock jumps 25% as AI data-center names rebound — what’s next for APLD
summary: Applied Digital (APLD) stock surged 25.52% following a broader rebound in tech and AI data-center names after a recent selloff. The company reported a 250% revenue jump in Q2 and has leased 600 MW of capacity, with plans for a new 430 MW campus. However, financing costs and investor sentiment towards high capital expenditure in the AI sector remain key factors to watch.

title: Analysts Offer Insights on Consumer Cyclical Companies: Amazon (AMZN) and MasterCraft Boat Holdings (MCFT)
summary: Analysts have provided their insights on two consumer cyclical companies: Amazon (AMZN) and MasterCraft Boat Holdings (MCFT). Truist Financial assigned a Buy rating to Amazon with a $280.00 price target, while Citi also initiated coverage with a Buy rating and a $320.00 price target, leading to a Strong Buy consensus for AMZN. For MasterCraft Boat Holdings, Truist Financial maintained a Hold rating, with a consensus of Hold and a price target of $20.35, suggesting a downside.

title: New Buy Rating for Microchip (MCHP), the Technology Giant
summary: Piper Sandler analyst Harsh Kumar has issued a new Buy rating for Microchip (MCHP) with a price target of $85.00, citing his strong track record in the Technology sector. This rating aligns with Citi's Buy recommendation, though Morgan Stanley maintained a Hold rating on the stock. Microchip reported Q3 revenue of $1.14 billion and a net profit of $41.7 million, a decrease compared to the previous year.

title: Morgan Stanley Downgrades Himax Tech (HIMX) from Overweight to Equal Weight
summary: Morgan Stanley downgraded Himax Technologies Inc. (HIMX) from Overweight to Equal Weight with an $8 price target, citing weakened demand in computer, smartphone, and automotive sectors, gross margin pressure, and rising memory costs. This decision follows a recent collaboration between Himax and Vuzix Corp. to introduce a new optical component reference design for AR glasses at CES 2026. Himax is a fabless semiconductor company operating globally in Driver IC and Non-Driver Products segments.

title: Resmed director Farrell sells $502k in stock
summary: ResMed director Peter C. Farrell sold 2,000 shares of company stock for $502,620 on February 4, 2026, at a price of $251.31 per share. Since the sale, ResMed shares have risen to $271.56, indicating an 8.1% premium. The company, a medical equipment manufacturer, has a market capitalization of $39.57 billion and a P/E ratio of 26.81, and offers a 0.9% dividend yield, having maintained payments for 15 consecutive years.

title: Allianz Asset Management GmbH Acquires 24,308 Shares of Marvell Technology, Inc. $MRVL
summary: Allianz Asset Management GmbH increased its stake in Marvell Technology, Inc. by 8.7% in the third quarter of last year, acquiring an additional 24,308 shares to hold a total of 302,373 shares valued at approximately $25.42 million. Other significant institutional movements include Norges Bank's new $716.7 million stake and OVERSEA CHINESE BANKING Corp's substantial 1,292% increase in its holdings. With institutional investors owning about 83.51% of the stock, Wall Street analysts maintain a "Moderate Buy" consensus rating for Marvell Technology, with several firms raising their price targets following strong quarterly earnings.

title: Lucid stock jumps 14% as Dow tops 50,000 — what LCID investors watch next week
summary: Lucid Group shares gained 14% on Friday, closing at $10.86, as Wall Street saw a broad rebound with the Dow topping 50,000 for the first time. Attention now shifts to Lucid's upcoming Feb. 24 quarterly report for updates on cash levels, demand signals, and their 2026 forecast. Investors are closely watching if the EV maker can translate its production into consistent sales amidst fluctuating consumer sentiment and market pressures.

title: Lumentum stock hits a record close — Citi raises target, insider filing lands ahead of Monday
summary: Lumentum (LITE) stock closed at a new all-time high of $551.99, up 9.3%, driven by investor optimism around AI infrastructure spending. Citigroup and JPMorgan raised their price targets for Lumentum to $560 and $565 respectively, citing the company's strong fiscal Q2 results and potential from AI growth. Attention now shifts to the company's investor briefing on March 17 at OFC and Monday's market open, following a director's share sale filing.

title: Palantir's Ukraine Expansion Highlights Growing Power Of Private AI In Modern Warfare
summary: Palantir Technologies has expanded its defense support for Ukraine by providing its Brave1 Dataroom software platform to counter Russian drones, highlighting the increasing role of private AI in modern warfare. Ukraine has become a testing ground for battlefield technology, with other private US and European tech firms also contributing significantly to its war efforts. This private sector involvement, while crucial for Ukraine's defense, also raises questions about the long-term governance of battlefield AI and potential geopolitical risks.

title: Caterpillar stock price jumps 7% to $726 as Dow cracks 50,000 — what matters next week
summary: Caterpillar (CAT) stock surged 7.1% to $726.20, pushing the Dow Jones Industrial Average above 50,000 for the first time. This rally, along with gains in other industrial stocks like Deere and CNH Industrial, suggests investors are shifting towards economically sensitive companies beyond the tech and AI sectors. The market will closely watch upcoming U.S. jobs and inflation data next week to determine if Friday's gains have sustained conviction.

title: Amazon's (AMZN) Retail Will Help, Says Jim Cramer
summary: Jim Cramer believes Amazon's retail segment will provide support for the company despite recent poor performance. Amazon's shares have been down over the past year and year-to-date, falling significantly after revealing a $200 billion capital expenditure plan. Analysts from UBS and Stifel have increased their price targets for AMZN, citing strong AWS revenue potential and good performance in advertising and e-commerce.

title: Analysts Are Bullish on These Consumer Cyclical Stocks: Yum China Holdings (YUMC), Amazon (AMZN)
summary: Analysts from Bank of America Securities and Goldman Sachs have expressed bullish sentiments on Yum China Holdings (YUMC) and Amazon (AMZN), both in the Consumer Cyclical sector. Yum China Holdings received a "Strong Buy" consensus with a potential 8.2% upside, while Amazon also garnered a "Strong Buy" consensus with a projected 32.1% upside. These ratings are based on recent reports from financial analysts, highlighting confidence in both companies.

title: Trinity Street Asset Management LLP Sells 9,617 Shares of Microsoft Corporation $MSFT
summary: Trinity Street Asset Management LLP reduced its stake in Microsoft Corporation by 10.9% in the third quarter, selling 9,617 shares and holding 78,840 shares valued at $40.84 million. Despite this, Microsoft remains the firm's seventh-largest holding, accounting for 2.8% of its portfolio. The article also notes other institutional investor activities, analyst ratings, and recent insider selling by Microsoft executives.

title: Does JD.com’s Dim Sum Bond Plan Reshape Its Logistics‑Led Ecosystem Strategy (JD)?
summary: JD.com is reportedly exploring the issuance of up to ¥10 billion in offshore yuan "dim sum" bonds to fund its global logistics investments and expand its JD MALL concept. This strategy aims to reinforce its position as a full-service commerce and logistics provider, both domestically and internationally. While the bond issuance provides funding flexibility, the company's investment narrative focuses on capital discipline and ecosystem reach amidst market skepticism due to past share price performance.

title: Microsoft Corporation $MSFT Stake Lowered by Wright Investors Service Inc.
summary: Wright Investors Service Inc. reduced its stake in Microsoft Corporation (NASDAQ:MSFT) by 5.5% in the 3rd quarter, holding 37,443 shares valued at $19.39 million, making it their second-largest holding. Despite this reduction, Microsoft remains a "Moderate Buy" according to analysts, with an average target price near $596.95, following news of strong quarterly earnings and dividend announcements. Institutional investors continue to show significant interest, holding 71.13% of the stock.

title: Microsoft Corporation $MSFT is Harbour Trust & Investment Management Co's 5th Largest Position
summary: Harbour Trust & Investment Management Co increased its stake in Microsoft Corporation (MSFT) by 3.0% in Q3, making it their 5th largest holding, valued at $27.34 million. Microsoft reported strong Q3 earnings, beating revenue and EPS expectations, and declared a quarterly dividend of $0.91 per share. The company maintains a "Moderate Buy" consensus rating from analysts with an average price target of $596.95.

title: Raymond James Raises its Price Target on Cameco Corporation (CCJ) to C$165 While Keeping an Outperform Rating
summary: Raymond James has increased its price target for Cameco Corporation (CCJ) to C$165 from C$150, maintaining an Outperform rating due to a broader mining update. Bernstein also raised its price target for Cameco to $101 from $100, citing increased uranium prices driven by growth in nuclear generation. The article highlights Cameco's strong market position as a major uranium supplier and ongoing supply agreements, such as a potential $2.8 billion deal with India.

title: Intel, AMD Warn China Customers Of Months-Long CPU Delays
summary: Intel and AMD are experiencing significant server CPU supply shortages in China due to surging global demand for AI infrastructure. Intel has warned customers of potential delivery lead times up to six months, with prices already increasing by over 10% for some server products, while AMD is seeing lead times of eight to ten weeks. Both companies are working to address the constraints, with Intel expecting improvement in Q2 2026 and AMD expanding supply through TSMC.

title: J.M. Smucker names Katie Williams as chief marketing officer - Bizwomen
summary: J.M. Smucker Co. has appointed Katie Williams as its new chief marketing officer, effective March 9, 2026. Williams, who brings over 20 years of brand-building experience from companies like Haleon and Kraft Heinz, will succeed Gail Hollander. Her role will involve advancing Smucker's brand portfolio, particularly in optimizing its sweet baked snack brands, including the recently acquired Hostess Brands, despite a consumer shift towards healthier snack options.

title: Amazon Stock Price | AMZN Stock Quote, News, and History
summary: This article provides a comprehensive overview of Amazon (AMZN) stock, including its current price, market capitalization, and analyst ratings. It highlights that Amazon stock has a consensus "buy" rating with a median target price significantly higher than its current trading price. The report also includes detailed financial data, insider activity, dividend information, and a corporate profile of Amazon.

title: Google, Amazon, OpenAI and the race to find alternatives to Nvidia
summary: Major tech companies like Google, Amazon, OpenAI, and Microsoft are actively developing their own AI chips to reduce their dependence on Nvidia, which currently dominates the AI chip market. While Nvidia's market share is not immediately at risk, these efforts aim to provide alternatives and leverage in negotiations, potentially impacting Nvidia's long-term growth. Google, in particular, has seen success with its TPUs, training its Gemini 3 model entirely on them and securing deals with other AI startups.

title: Shopee Price Shift In Brazil And Sea’s Push Into AI And Banking
summary: Sea Limited's Shopee is adjusting commission rates in Brazil to align with competitors and improve unit economics. Concurrently, Sea is enhancing Shopee's platform through an expanded AI collaboration with OpenAI and expanding its financial services arm, MariBank Singapore. These strategic moves aim to optimize profitability in key markets, improve user experience, and diversify revenue streams beyond e-commerce and gaming.

title: InterDigital, Inc. (NASDAQ:IDCC) Q4 2025 Earnings Call Transcript
summary: InterDigital, Inc. (NASDAQ:IDCC) announced strong Q4 and full-year 2025 results, exceeding their outlook for revenue and EPS. The company highlighted record-setting achievements in smartphone licensing, including extended agreements with major vendors, and significant progress in CE, IoT, and video service licensing. InterDigital also emphasized its expanded AI research capabilities and growing patent portfolio, positioning itself for continued growth and shareholder value in 2026.

title: Antipodes Partners Ltd boosts stake in Amazon.com, Inc.
summary: Antipodes Partners Ltd, managed by Jacob Mitchell, has increased its holdings in Amazon.com, Inc. (AMZN) by adding 300,716 shares. Despite recent sideways price movement, Wall Street analysts maintain a "Strong Buy" consensus for AMZN, projecting significant upside driven by growth in Amazon Web Services (AWS), resilient retail performance, and an expanding advertising business. TipRanks' AI Analyst, Spark, rates AMZN as "Neutral" due to strong financials tempered by weakened free cash flow conversion and a weak technical picture.

title: How Investors May Respond To Prologis (PLD) Pivot Toward AI-Focused Micro Data Centers
summary: Prologis (PLD) is shifting its investment narrative by collaborating on AI-focused micro data centers, moving beyond traditional logistics. This strategic pivot, aimed at addressing emerging compute needs and leveraging underused utility substations, introduces new growth drivers but also execution risks and questions about its elevated valuation. Investors are now weighing how this new direction will impact the company's financial health and future returns.

title: How Stronger Cloud and AI Momentum At Alibaba Group Holding (BABA) Has Changed Its Investment Story
summary: Alibaba Group Holding's recent stronger-than-expected second quarter, driven by a 34% surge in its cloud division due to higher AI and enterprise demand, is reshaping its investment narrative. The company's increased focus and investment in AI, cloud, and automation, including its Qwen AI app and Cainiao's autonomous logistics, indicate a shift towards infrastructure over pure retail. While this acceleration in cloud growth presents new catalysts for monetization and AI workloads, it also introduces execution risks from increased AI spending and competition, which may impact margins.

title: News | Tesla expands in Silicon Valley factory hub as it pivots toward robots
summary: Tesla has expanded its presence in Fremont, California, by leasing a large advanced manufacturing space, signaling a strategic shift to become a leading company in humanoid robots and AI. This move comes as the company aims to reduce its reliance on car manufacturing, particularly with plans to phase out Model S and Model X production in favor of its Optimus robot program. The leased properties will bolster Tesla's efforts to develop and mass-produce Optimus robots, leveraging Silicon Valley's concentration of skilled AI talent.

title: Analog Devices stock lags chip rebound — what traders watch ahead of Feb. 18 earnings
summary: Analog Devices (ADI) stock slipped 0.5% despite a broader chip market rally fueled by increased AI-related capital expenditures from Amazon and Alphabet. While ADI's chips are crucial for various electronics, the company is not directly at the forefront of the AI boom, leading investors to weigh its reliability against more volatile AI chip stocks. Ahead of its Q1 earnings report on February 18, traders will be looking for updates on pricing, gross margins, backlog, and potential impacts from data-center construction on demand for power management components.

title: Alphabet CEO Pichai Sundar sells $10.9 million in shares
summary: Alphabet CEO Pichai Sundar sold 27,300 shares of Class C Capital Stock totaling $10.9 million on February 4, 2026, at prices ranging from $330.13 to $343.74. He also acquired over 1.3 million shares and disposed of 676,955 shares to cover tax obligations. Alphabet maintains a strong financial position, and its recent Q4 2025 results exceeded expectations, leading to several analysts raising their price targets.

title: KLA stock jumps 8% on Friday rebound as chip gear rallies; dividend set for March
summary: KLA (KLAC) shares surged 8.4% on Friday, closing at $1,442.95, as chip equipment stocks rallied amidst returning risk appetite and investor focus on AI infrastructure. The company's board also approved a quarterly cash dividend of $1.90 per share, payable on March 3 to shareholders of record by February 17. The market's reaction to upcoming U.S. jobs and inflation figures next week will be crucial for the rate-sensitive tech sector.

title: Why CSW (CSW) Stock Is Up Today
summary: Shares of industrial products company CSW (NYSE:CSW) rose 5.4% today as the broader market rebounded from a tech-driven sell-off. The rally was supported by a recovery in technology stocks, a bounce in Bitcoin, and an improvement in U.S. consumer sentiment, with the Dow Jones Industrial Average surpassing 50,000. CSW's shares are up 5.5% today at $290.25, though they are still down 1.6% year-to-date and 13.7% below their 52-week high.

title: AerSale, Luxfer, Owens Corning, Genco, and Deere Stocks Trade Up, What You Need To Know
summary: Several stocks, including AerSale, Luxfer, Owens Corning, Genco, and Deere, saw an upward trend after the broader market recovered from a tech-driven sell-off. This rally was attributed to a rebound in technology stocks, a stabilization in Bitcoin, improved U.S. consumer sentiment, and significant AI-related capital expenditures benefiting chipmakers. The Dow Jones Industrial Average notably crossed the 50,000 threshold for the first time.

title: United States shares higher at close of trade; Dow Jones Industrial Average up 2.47% By Investing.com
summary: US stocks closed higher on Friday, with the Dow Jones Industrial Average, S&P 500, and NASDAQ Composite all showing significant gains. NVIDIA Corporation, Caterpillar Inc, and 3M Company were among the top performers on the Dow, while Molina Healthcare Inc and Carbon Revolution PLC were among the worst performers across the broader markets. The CBOE Volatility Index decreased, and commodities like gold and oil saw price increases.

title: Amazon.com announces fourth quarter results
summary: Amazon.com, Inc. reported robust financial results for the fourth quarter and full year ended December 31, 2025. Net sales for Q4 2025 increased by 14% to $213.4 billion, while full-year net sales grew 12% to $716.9 billion, driven by strong performances in AWS, advertising, and international stores. The company highlighted significant innovation and investment in AI, custom chips, and delivery services, with CEO Andy Jassy projecting $200 billion in capital expenditures for 2026.

title: Tech Stocks, Crypto, and Gold Whipsaw After a Volatile Week
summary: Technology stocks, cryptocurrencies like bitcoin, and gold experienced significant volatility this week, characterized by a sharp three-day selloff followed by a strong rebound on Friday. Analysts attribute the initial market downturn to concerns over the short-term returns of massive AI investments, rather than a single event. The rebound suggests that these fears may have been overdone, though some software companies continue to struggle, and there are signs of a broader sector rotation towards less AI-exposed industries.

title: Howmet Aerospace Stock Rally: Up 6.4% on February 6, 2026 Market Surge - News and Statistics
summary: Howmet Aerospace (HWM) stock surged 6.4% on February 6, 2026, closing at $223.14, driven by a broader market rally including a rebound in technology stocks, a stabilized Bitcoin, and improved consumer sentiment. The Dow Jones Industrial Average crossed the 50,000 threshold for the first time on the same day. This positive movement for Howmet follows a recent price target increase by Baird and strong year-over-year revenue growth in commercial and defense aerospace segments.

title: Why Is Blue Bird (BLBD) Stock Soaring Today
summary: Blue Bird (BLBD) stock surged 5.2% following a broader market rebound and strong recent financial performance. The company recently reported better-than-expected Q4 2025 earnings and provided an upbeat full-year profit forecast, with adjusted EPS of $1.00 against an anticipated $0.80 and revenue exceeding forecasts. CEO John Wyskiel noted a significant 45% increase in Q1 order intake, pushing the backlog to 3,400 units, indicating confidence in future growth despite a mixed full-year revenue outlook.

title: Amazon.com, Inc Price Forecast: Amazon Stock Tests Major Support After Earnings Selloff
summary: Amazon (AMZN) stock experienced a significant selloff following its Q4 earnings release, dropping to a 36-day low. The stock found support around the $200.31 level, which aligns with major Fibonacci retracement levels and its 100-week moving average. The article suggests that if AMZN can maintain its position above $211.03 and eventually surpass the 50-week average at $217.55, it could signal a durable bottom and a recovery towards higher price targets.

title: U.S. shares higher at close of trade; Dow Jones Industrial Average up 2.47%
summary: U.S. equities closed higher on Friday, with the Dow Jones Industrial Average, S&P 500, and NASDAQ Composite all making gains, driven by strong performances in the Industrials, Technology, and Basic Materials sectors. The Dow hit a new all-time high, rising 2.47%. NVIDIA Corporation led Dow gainers, while Molina Healthcare Inc. was among the worst performers on the S&P 500.

title: FTAI Aviation Stock Up 5.2% Amid Market Rebound | February 2026 - News and Statistics
summary: Shares of aircraft leasing company FTAI Aviation (FTAI) rose 5.2% in afternoon trading on February 6, 2026, as the broader market rebounded from a tech-driven sell-off. The rally was supported by a recovery in technology stocks, stabilization in Bitcoin, improved U.S. consumer sentiment, and strong performance from AI-related chipmakers. Despite high volatility, FTAI Aviation's stock closed at $272.52, up 29.6% year-to-date and near its 52-week high.

title: Expro Group stock hits 52-week high at $16.79
summary: Expro Group Holdings NV has reached a new 52-week high of $16.79, reflecting significant growth with a 20.62% increase over the past year and a 47.48% surge in the last six months. This performance indicates strong investor confidence, supported by a Piotroski Score of 9 and more cash than debt. InvestingPro analysis suggests the stock is undervalued, offering additional insights and expert analysis to stakeholders.

title: Transcat, DXP, Caterpillar, MYR Group, and Allient Shares Are Soaring, What You Need To Know
summary: Shares of Transcat, DXP, Caterpillar, MYR Group, and Allient surged today after a broad market recovery, led by tech stocks and Bitcoin. This rally was bolstered by improved U.S. consumer sentiment and the recognition of significant AI-related capital expenditures benefiting chipmakers. The Dow Jones Industrial Average also crossed the historic 50,000 threshold for the first time.

title: Vicor, Primoris, Flowserve, WillScot Mobile Mini, and United Rentals Shares Skyrocket, What You Need To Know
summary: A number of stocks including Vicor, Primoris, Flowserve, WillScot Mobile Mini, and United Rentals, saw significant jumps in the afternoon trading session. This rally occurred as the broader market rebounded from a tech-driven sell-off, fueled by a recovery in technology stocks, a bounce in Bitcoin, and improved U.S. consumer sentiment. The Dow Jones Industrial Average also surged, crossing the 50,000 threshold for the first time.

title: GenAI drives $119B cloud revenue in Q4
summary: Cloud infrastructure service revenues reached $119.1 billion in Q4, bringing the 2025 total to $419 billion, with GenAI being a primary driver for this significant growth. Amazon, Microsoft, and Google collectively account for approximately two-thirds of enterprise spending on cloud infrastructure, with Amazon leading at 28%. The major cloud providers reported substantial year-over-year growth in their cloud segments, largely attributed to increasing AI adoption and workloads.

title: Chip Stocks Soar as Nvidia CEO Huang Says Demand Is 'Through the Roof'
summary: Semiconductor stocks, led by Nvidia, rallied significantly after Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang stated that demand for AI technology is "through the roof" and the industry may be at an "inflection point." This surge follows massive AI spending forecasts from major cloud providers like Amazon, which are investing heavily in AI hardware. While cloud giants shoulder the costs, chipmakers are benefiting from increased orders, sending their stocks higher.

title: Earnings live: Amazon stock sinks, Philip Morris retreats, Reddit spikes as Wall Street focuses on guidance
summary: The fourth-quarter earnings season is heating up, with 59% of S&P 500 companies already having reported. Wall Street is anticipating a 13% increase in earnings per share for the fourth quarter, driven largely by positive performances from tech companies. Key updates include Amazon's stock sinking despite topping earnings, Philip Morris retreating on a weaker profit forecast, and Reddit spiking due to an optimistic revenue forecast.
authors: Grace O'Donnell, Jenny McCall, Daniel Howley, Laura Bratton, Jake Conley

title: KLA stock jumps 8% as AI capex talk lifts chip equipment names
summary: KLA Corp's stock surged by 8% following increased capital expenditure announcements from Amazon and Alphabet, signaling strong demand for AI-related chipmaking equipment. The company, a key player in the AI ecosystem, recently reported solid quarterly revenue and announced a cash dividend of $1.90 per share, reiterating its goal to return at least 85% of free cash flow to shareholders. Despite broad market enthusiasm for AI spending, investor anxiety persists regarding the long-term returns and sustainability of this demand boom.

title: WiMi unveils hybrid quantum-classical neural network for image classification
summary: WiMi Hologram Cloud Inc. (NASDAQ:WIMI) has announced the development of a Hybrid Quantum-Classical Neural Network (H-QNN) for MNIST binary image classification, demonstrating improved accuracy and reduced computation time compared to traditional models.
