Despite this technological advancement, the company's stock has seen a significant decline, and InvestingPro suggests it is trading at a low Price/Book ratio of 0.11. WiMi plans further verification on quantum devices and aims to expand the H-QNN's applications beyond handwritten digit classification into areas like medical imaging.

title: nVent (NVT) Q4 2025 Earnings Call Transcript
summary: nVent (NVT) reported a record Q4 and full-year 2025, with sales exceeding $1 billion, organic growth of 24%, and adjusted EPS up 53%. The company's strategy has shifted towards infrastructure, particularly data centers, which now constitute 45% of sales and are projected to exceed 50% in 2026, driven by strong demand for liquid cooling and power products. nVent anticipates another record-breaking year in 2026, with forecast sales growth of 15%-18% and adjusted EPS growth of 20%-24%, supported by a robust $2.3 billion backlog primarily from AI data center builds.

title: Scalding Water Burns Dozens, Sparking Massive Clothing Steamer Recall
summary: Aterian, Inc. is recalling nearly 195,000 PurSteam-branded clothing steamers, including Mighty Lil Steamers and Elite Travel Steamers, due to a burn hazard. The steamers can expel hot water, leading to 54 reported burn injuries, with two cases involving second-degree burns. Consumers are advised to stop using the product, cut the cord, and submit a recall request online for a full refund.

title: Nexstar Media Group stock hits all-time high at 223.38 USD
summary: Nexstar Media Group's stock (NXST) reached an all-time high of $223.38, marking a 47.37% increase over the past year, driven by strong investor confidence and business fundamentals. This milestone comes as the company navigates its acquisition of TEGNA, Inc., despite reporting a Q3 2025 EPS miss. Benchmark has reiterated a Buy rating, highlighting potential value from the acquisition.

title: Lumentum Holdings Inc stock hits all-time high at 557.65 USD
summary: Lumentum Holdings Inc. (LITE) stock has reached an all-time high of $557.65, marking a 444.32% increase over the past year and a market capitalization of $39.73 billion. Despite being in overbought territory with a high P/E ratio, the surge reflects strong market confidence and favorable business developments, including impressive Q2 fiscal 2026 results and analyst upgrades citing the company's role in AI infrastructure. InvestingPro's Fair Value assessment, however, suggests the stock might be overvalued at its current price.

title: Celestica stock jumps as Big Tech AI capex forecasts lift suppliers
summary: Celestica Inc. shares surged by almost 6% due to increased investor confidence in AI-related hardware stocks, driven by major cloud providers' anticipated data-center spending. The company expanded its U.S. manufacturing capacity for Google's TPU systems and boosted its 2026 revenue target. While the boom signifies growth potential, risks remain if hyperscalers cut orders or delay deployments, which Nvidia's upcoming earnings report on February 25th may help clarify.

title: HP Inc. Sets Annual Meeting and Record Dates
summary: HP Inc. has announced the record date and meeting date for its 2026 annual stockholders meeting. Stockholders of record as of February 17, 2026, will be eligible to vote on matters considered at the meeting, which is scheduled for April 16, 2026. The company will provide further information to stockholders regarding the meeting.

title: Why Aehr Test Systems Soared Higher by 13% Today
summary: Aehr Test Systems' stock surged over 13% due to its strategic pivot towards providing test solutions for AI processors and the data center semiconductor markets. This increase is driven by massive projected spending increases from tech giants like Alphabet and Amazon on AI infrastructure, which is expected to significantly boost Aehr's order growth by impacting its total addressable market. The article also suggests potential for further upside if the electric vehicle market, Aehr's former core market, stabilizes.

title: Ameren Corp (AEE) Raises Quarterly Dividend 5.6% to $0.75; 2.9% Yield
summary: Ameren Corp (AEE) has announced a 5.6% increase in its quarterly dividend, raising it from $0.71 to $0.75 per share, which annualizes to $3. The dividend, representing a 2.9% annual yield, is payable on March 31, 2026, to shareholders of record by March 10, 2026, with an ex-dividend date of March 9, 2026.

title: Caterpillar stock hits all-time high of 723.32 USD
summary: Caterpillar Inc. (CAT) stock has reached an all-time high of $723.32, driven by strong demand in its construction and mining equipment sectors and strategic investments. The company's robust performance is further evidenced by an 88.16% appreciation over the past year and 56 consecutive years of dividend payments. This milestone follows a strong fourth quarter in 2025, where Caterpillar surpassed earnings and revenue expectations.

title: Amazon stock sinks after company touts $200 billion AI spending plans, offers cautious profit outlook
summary: Amazon's stock fell after the company announced a cautious Q1 operating income outlook and plans to significantly increase capital expenditures for 2026, allocating $200 billion primarily towards AI, chips, robotics, and satellites. Despite strong Q4 earnings results that largely met analyst expectations for revenue and slightly missed on EPS, investor concern over the massive spending jump and Q1 projections led to a share price decline. This spending increase mirrors similar moves by other tech giants like Google, Meta, and Microsoft, highlighting the industry's large investment in AI.

title: FedEx stock hits all-time high at 367.69 USD
summary: FedEx stock reached an all-time high of $367.69, reflecting strong performance with a 43.98% return over the past year. Despite an overbought RSI and potential overvaluation, the company has raised dividends for five consecutive years. Recent analyst upgrades and strategic advancements, including AI-powered tracking tools and plans to return grounded MD-11 cargo jets to service, underscore its strong market position.

title: Sotera Health Adds Independent Director to Board Committees
summary: Sotera Health has expanded its Board of Directors to twelve members by appointing Richard G. Kyle as a new independent Class III director, effective February 4, 2026. Kyle, a former Timken CEO, will serve on the Leadership Development and Compensation Committee and the Nominating and Corporate Governance Committee, aiming to strengthen the company's governance and strategic oversight. Despite mixed financial fundamentals and litigation risks, the company's stock has a "Buy" rating from analysts with a $24.00 price target.

title: Risk asset crash, IGV ETF nosedive, BoE & the week ahead
summary: This Market Insights Podcast episode features TraderNick and Jonny Hart discussing a crash in precious metals and crypto pricing, indicating a general move away from risk assets. They also cover the impact of AI developments on established tech companies and the latest news from the Bank of England. The episode aims to provide analysis on key market movements and economic trends.

title: Apple users told check spam as $95M ‘eavesdropping’ settlement payments go out
summary: Apple users are receiving payments from a $95 million settlement related to allegations that Siri recorded conversations without activation. Many recipients are concerned the emails and digital checks resemble phishing scams due to the sender's appearance. The settlement administrator advises checking spam folders and confirms the legitimacy of payments, while some users recommend using Venmo direct deposit to avoid sharing banking information with what appears to be a suspicious sender.

title: Why Alphabet Will Likely Leapfrog Nvidia To Become World's Most Valuable Company (GOOG)
summary: This article argues that Alphabet (GOOGL) is poised to surpass Nvidia (NVDA) as the most valuable company globally by the end of 2027, driven by its strong Q4 earnings, particularly in Google Search and Google Cloud, and its vast AI-monetization platform. The author contends that Nvidia's high-margin GPU market faces increasing competition, especially from Broadcom's XPUs and Google's own GPUs, giving Alphabet a superior long-term advantage. Despite the media's focus on Google's high cap-ex guidance, the author emphasizes the company's solid financial performance and strategic positioning in AI.

title: Textron, Boise Cascade, Martin Marietta Materials, Energy Recovery, and Hubbell Shares Skyrocket, What You Need To Know
summary: Several stocks, including Textron, Boise Cascade, Martin Marietta Materials, Energy Recovery, and Hubbell, saw significant jumps after the broader market rebounded from a tech-driven sell-off. This rally was attributed to a recovery in technology stocks, Bitcoin's stabilization, improved U.S. consumer sentiment, and the realization that massive AI investments are benefiting chipmakers. The Dow Jones Industrial Average also crossed the 50,000 threshold for the first time.

title: Form DEF 14A Dominari Holdings Inc. For: Mar 04
summary: Dominari Holdings Inc. has filed Form DEF 14A for a Special Meeting of Stockholders on March 4, 2026. The company is seeking approval to amend its 2022 Equity Incentive Plan to increase the number of shares reserved for issuance by 10,000,000 to a total of 21,720,750, and to clarify the calculation of its annual "evergreen" increase provision. These amendments are crucial for attracting and retaining talent, with a significant portion of the additional shares intended for special awards to CEO Anthony Hayes and President Kyle Wool in recognition of their contributions.

title: Sun Country Airlines stock hits 52-week high at $19.80 By Investing.com
summary: Sun Country Airlines (SNCY) stock reached a new 52-week high of $19.80, reflecting an 87.77% gain over the past six months and strong financial health indicated by a Piotroski Score of 9. However, the company is set to be acquired by Allegiant Travel Company, a deal that has led to analyst downgrades citing concerns over the merger pricing. Additionally, Sun Country Airlines is expanding its operations with a new base in Cincinnati/Northern Kentucky International Airport for its cargo business with Amazon.

title: The Honest Company Expands Skincare Portfolio with New Hydrorich Cream
summary: The Honest Company has launched its new Hydrorich Cream, an ultra-rich moisturizer designed for dry to extra-dry skin, offering up to 48 hours of hydration. This product integrates two types of Hyaluronic Acid, a Mushroom Complex, Red Algae Extract, Shea Butter, and Jojoba Esters to provide deep moisture and support the skin barrier. The launch reflects Honest's commitment to thoughtful innovation and high-performance, clean skincare solutions.

title: Why FTAI Aviation (FTAI) Stock Is Trading Up Today
summary: FTAI Aviation (NASDAQ:FTAI) shares jumped 5.2% today, closing at $272.52, as the market rebounded from a tech-driven sell-off. The surge was part of a broader market recovery, with technology stocks and Bitcoin stabilizing, and improved U.S. consumer sentiment boosting investor confidence. The Dow Jones also crossed the 50,000 threshold for the first time, contributing to the positive market mood.

title: Sea Ltd stock price target lowered to $170 by Bernstein SocGen
summary: Bernstein SocGen Group has lowered its price target for Sea Ltd. (NYSE:SE) to $170 from $185, while maintaining an Outperform rating. Despite the reduced target, which is still above the current trading price of $108.71, the firm believes the recent AI-led stock pullback is overdone and that Sea Ltd. can benefit from AI advancements. Other firms like Maybank Kim Eng and Phillip Securities have upgraded Sea Ltd.'s rating to Buy, citing attractive risk-reward profiles and improved growth expectations.

title: Microsoft's free cash flow considered 'most resilient' of hyperscalers: BNP Paribas
summary: BNP Paribas has identified Microsoft's free cash flow as the most resilient among major hyperscalers. This comes as the top five hyperscalers are projected to spend nearly $700 billion in capital expenditure this year, a significant increase from previous estimates.

title: Powell Industries stock reaches all-time high at 573.37 USD
summary: Powell Industries Inc. (POWL) stock has reached an all-time high of $573.37, marking a 146.21% increase over the past year due to strong investor confidence. The company reported robust first-quarter fiscal year 2026 results, with earnings per share exceeding analyst expectations at $3.40 and revenue climbing 4.4% year-over-year to $251 million. Cantor Fitzgerald also raised its price target for Powell Industries from $427.00 to $481.00, maintaining a Neutral rating, reflecting positive momentum for the company.

title: White Mountains Insurance stock hits all-time high at 2149.85 USD
summary: White Mountains Insurance Group (WTM) stock has reached an all-time high of $2149.85, reflecting a robust performance with gains of 19.29% over six months and 7.67% over the past year. Despite a "GOOD" financial health rating from InvestingPro, the stock's P/E ratio of 38.74 suggests it may be overvalued. Recent strategic moves include a share repurchase tender offer and the sale of a controlling stake in Bamboo, while retaining a 15% interest.

title: Zscaler stock hits 52-week low at 164.65 USD
summary: Zscaler Inc. (ZS) stock recently reached a 52-week low of 164.65 USD, marking a significant downturn for the cybersecurity firm with a 17.06% decline over the past year and 41.45% over six months. Despite challenges, the company maintains strong gross profit margins and a cash surplus, with InvestingPro analysis suggesting undervaluation and analysts revising earnings estimates upward. Zscaler is also focusing on innovation, launching an AI Security Suite and making key leadership appointments.

title: CSX Rose 5% Last Week. Here’s Where the Stock Could Go in 2026
summary: CSX Corporation's stock rose 5% last week, reaching near its 52-week high of $40 per share, driven by analyst target revisions and strong intermodal revenue growth in its Q4 results. Despite management guiding for low single-digit revenue growth and margin expansion in 2026, the valuation model suggests the stock is currently overvalued with a target price of $43, indicating future returns will depend more on operational consistency than valuation expansion. The company's ability to maintain high operating margins through cost discipline and network efficiency is key for its measured growth in a low-growth environment.

title: BMO Capital lowers PTC stock price target to $189 on 1Q results
summary: BMO Capital has reduced its price target for PTC Inc. (NASDAQ:PTC) to $189 from $219, while maintaining an Outperform rating, following the company's first-quarter results. Despite the lower target, PTC is trading below its Fair Value according to InvestingPro data, and BMO Capital is reassured by PTC's sustained profitability, strong gross profit margins, revenue growth, and plans for share repurchases. The firm remains confident in PTC's strategy to modernize CAD, data management, and life-cycle solutions for manufacturers, viewing current share prices as multi-year lows based on free cash flow multiples.

title: Coherent stock price target raised to $245 by JPMorgan on AI wins
summary: JPMorgan has increased its price target for optical technology company Coherent (NYSE: COHR) to $245 from $215, maintaining an Overweight rating due to increasing demand in AI-related markets. This adjustment follows Coherent's strong quarterly performance, which included new customer wins and upward revisions to earnings expectations by analysts. The company's expanding total addressable market in datacom transceivers and co-packaged optics solutions, coupled with significant revenue growth, underscores its robust position in the Electronic Equipment, Instruments & Components industry.

title: Google stock price slips as Alphabet’s AI spending push keeps GOOG in focus
summary: Alphabet Inc.'s Class C shares (GOOG) dipped slightly as investors reacted to the company's significant increase in AI-related capital expenditure for 2026, balancing robust cloud growth against rising costs. The market is increasingly scrutinizing the profitability and cash flow generation from these AI investments, a concern also impacting other tech giants like Amazon. Upcoming U.S. jobs and inflation data are expected to further influence market sentiment and tech stock valuations.

title: See DHT Holdings Rise with Institutional Inflows
summary: Shares of DHT Holdings, Inc. (DHT) have risen significantly due to strong institutional demand, with a 64.72% increase since early 2023. The company, which ships crude oil internationally, reported strong Q4 2025 revenues and net income, along with its 64th consecutive quarterly dividend payment. Coupled with healthy fundamentals like 65.4% 3-year EPS growth and a 42.5% profit margin, these factors suggest continued positive momentum for the stock.

title: Carlyle Group Q4 2025 Financial Results & Performance Review - News and Statistics
summary: Carlyle Group (NASDAQ:CG) reported strong fourth-quarter results for 2025, with revenue of $1.09 billion, surpassing market expectations. The private equity firm also exceeded analyst estimates for non-GAAP profit and Assets Under Management, which reached $477 billion. The article notes that while Carlyle's long-term revenue growth is solid, its demand has recently slowed compared to its five-year trend.

title: Needham reiterates Buy rating on Paylocity stock, citing solid results
summary: Needham has reaffirmed its Buy rating and a $250.00 price target for Paylocity Holding (NASDAQ:PCTY) after the company's strong second-quarter results. The research firm noted revenue outperformance and robust gross profit margins, highlighting positive sales performance from new solutions and strategic investment in product development. Despite some analysts adjusting price targets downward, the overall sentiment remains cautiously positive, with the stock trading significantly below its fair value.

title: Nvidia's Huang says tech is in a 'generational' buildout with AI; weighs in on China, OpenAI (NVDA:NASDAQ)
summary: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang stated that the tech industry is experiencing a "generational" buildout driven by AI, referencing significant capital spending by major tech companies. He also touched upon topics related to China and OpenAI. This observation comes as Nvidia continues to be at the forefront of technological advancements.

title: Digital Realty Trust, Inc. (NYSE:DLR) Q4 2025 Earnings Call Transcript
summary: Digital Realty Trust, Inc. (DLR) reported its Q4 2025 earnings, falling short of EPS expectations at $0.2806 versus an anticipated $1.83. Despite the earnings miss, the company highlighted record financial performance for 2025, exceeding revenue, EBITDA, and core FFO targets, with 10% FFO growth over 2024. The call focused on robust demand for data center capacity, particularly driven by AI adoption and cloud scaling, leading to record bookings and an expanded funding strategy through private markets.

title: Amazon.com, Inc. (NASDAQ:AMZN) Q4 2025 Earnings Call Transcript
summary: Amazon.com, Inc. (NASDAQ:AMZN) reported Q4 2025 earnings, with revenue of $213.4 billion, up 12% year-over-year excluding foreign exchange impact, and operating income of $25 billion. During the call, CEO Andrew Jassy highlighted the accelerating growth of AWS, now a $142 billion annualized run rate business, driven by strong demand in both core and AI workloads. The company is investing heavily in AI technologies, including custom silicon like Graviton and Trainium, and expanding its retail offerings with faster delivery options and AI-powered shopping assistants like Rufus.

title: Amazon Says It Will Spend $200 Billion This Year on AI Build-Out
summary: Amazon.com Inc. plans to spend $200 billion this year on its AI infrastructure, including data centers and chips, significantly more than the $150 billion analysts had projected. This massive investment, up from $130 billion in 2025, raised investor concerns about the long-term payoff, leading to a drop in Amazon's stock.

title: Ch Robinson Worldwide stock hits all-time high of 202.87 USD
summary: C.H. Robinson Worldwide Inc. (CHRW) stock has reached an all-time high of $202.87, almost touching its 52-week high, following a 109.32% increase over the past year. Despite its strong performance and sustained dividend payments for 29 years, InvestingPro data suggests the stock is overbought and overvalued. The company recently exceeded EPS expectations in Q4 2025, driven by AI-focused efficiency and market share growth.

title: Goldman Sachs raises StepStone Group stock price target on wealth growth
summary: Goldman Sachs has increased its price target for StepStone Group (NASDAQ:STEP) to $93.00 from $90.00, maintaining a Buy rating due to the strength of its Private Wealth franchise and upcoming fundraising cycles. The new target suggests a 57% upside from the current price. The firm also revised its earnings per share estimates upward for 2026, 2027, and 2028, projecting significant management fee and fee-related earnings growth.

title: Cummins, Belden, and Perma-Fix Shares Are Soaring, What You Need To Know
summary: Shares of Cummins (CMI), Belden (BDC), and Perma-Fix (PESI) jumped significantly after the broader market recovered from a tech-driven sell-off. Investors bought stocks at lower prices, fueled by a rebound in technology stocks, a bounce in Bitcoin, improved consumer sentiment, and significant AI-related capital expenditure announcements. The Dow Jones Industrial Average also surged past the 50,000 threshold for the first time.

title: AMAZON COM INC SEC 10-K Report
summary: Amazon.com Inc. has released its 2025 10-K report, revealing strong financial growth with total net sales of $716,924 million and net income of $77,670 million. The report highlights significant advancements across its e-commerce, cloud computing (AWS), and digital streaming segments, driven by strategic investments in technology, infrastructure, and new product launches like a global broadband satellite network and autonomous vehicles. Despite facing intense competition, operational risks, and evolving regulatory challenges, Amazon anticipates continued growth with projected Q1 2026 net sales increasing by 11% to 15%.

title: GrowGeneration Corp.'s (NASDAQ:GRWG) 25% Share Price Plunge Could Signal Some Risk
summary: GrowGeneration Corp. (NASDAQ:GRWG) has experienced a 25% drop in its share price over the last thirty days, contributing to a 26% decline over the past year. Despite this, its price-to-sales (P/S) ratio of 0.4x is considered "middle-of-the-road" compared to the Specialty Retail industry's median of 0.5x, which the article suggests might be overlooking underlying risks. Revenue has declined by 20% in the last year and 49% over three years, with future growth estimates of 4.6% lagging the industry's 7.5%, raising concerns about the current P/S ratio given the weak growth outlook.

title: Why We're Not Concerned Yet About Jumia Technologies AG's (NYSE:JMIA) 26% Share Price Plunge
summary: Jumia Technologies AG (NYSE:JMIA) saw its share price drop 26% recently, though it's up 159% over the last year. Despite a high price-to-sales (P/S) ratio of 7.4x compared to an industry average of 1.3x, the company is forecast to grow revenue by 20% annually over the next three years, outpacing the industry's 12% prediction. This future growth expectation appears to be the primary reason for investors maintaining confidence in the stock despite recent declines and past revenue contraction.

title: Fortinet Stock Rises After Earnings Beat. Why It Can Dodge the Tech Selloff.
summary: Fortinet (FTNT) stock rose on Friday after the cybersecurity company announced better-than-expected fourth-quarter earnings and revenue, along with strong guidance. This performance allowed Fortinet to defy a broader market downturn, suggesting it may be able to avoid a larger tech selloff. The company's financial results topped analysts' expectations.

title: Stock market today: S&P 500, Nasdaq poised to deepen tech rout as Amazon's earnings flop
summary: US stock futures, including the S&P 500 and Nasdaq, are set to fall further due to Amazon's post-earnings slide and broader concerns about tech valuations amid increased AI spending. Amazon shares tumbled after its operating income forecast fell short despite significant spending plans, contributing to the S&P 500 and Nasdaq Composite slipping into negative territory for 2026. Other market movements include silver's continued decline, Bitcoin's drop to 2024 levels impacting Strategy, and Reddit and Roblox surging on positive earnings and guidance.

title: TD Synnex stock hits all-time high at 167.95 USD
summary: TD Synnex (SNX) stock has reached an all-time high of $167.95, driven by a 16.0% gain over the past year and 16.22% in the last six months. The company's strong performance is supported by aggressive share buybacks, consistent dividend payments for 13 years, and positive analyst ratings, including a Buy from Goldman Sachs and an Outperform from RBC Capital, both raising price targets to $180. These factors, alongside solid Q4 2026 financial results with a 10% revenue increase and 24% non-GAAP diluted EPS rise, suggest the stock may still be undervalued, according to InvestingPro.

title: AMAZON.COM ANNOUNCES FOURTH QUARTER RESULTS
summary: Amazon.com, Inc. (NASDAQ: AMZN) announced strong financial results for its fourth quarter and full year ended December 31, 2025. The company reported a 14% increase in net sales for Q4 2025 to $213.4 billion and a 12% increase for the full year to $716.9 billion, driven by significant growth in AWS, advertising services, and its stores segments. Amazon also highlighted substantial investments in AI, chips, robotics, and low Earth orbit satellites, projecting approximately $200 billion in capital expenditures for 2026 to capitalize on these opportunities.

title: Bit Digital details January Ethereum holdings and staking metrics
summary: Bit Digital Inc. reported its January Ethereum holdings and staking metrics, holding approximately 155,239.4 ether valued at $380.2 million. The company staked about 89% of its ETH, generating 344 ETH in rewards for the month. Additionally, Bit Digital disclosed its ownership of 27 million shares of WhiteFiber, valued at $527.6 million, and committed to not selling these shares in 2026.

title: Apple Inc.: Facts and Statistics
summary: This article provides an in-depth look at Apple Inc. (AAPL), focusing on its history, product innovation (including the M4 chip and iPhone 15), key statistics, financial performance, and regional revenue breakdown. It highlights Apple's consistent growth, significant market cap, and the continued strong demand for its products despite macroeconomic challenges. The piece emphasizes Apple's association with knowledge, power, and wealth through its historical impact and ongoing success.

title: Is JDcom (JD) Now A Contrarian Opportunity After Prolonged Share Price Weakness
summary: JD.com (JD) has experienced a significant share price decline, making investors question if it's a value opportunity or a trap. Analysis through Discounted Cash Flow (DCF) and Price-to-Earnings (P/E) ratios suggests the stock is currently undervalued, with a potential intrinsic value of US$51.01 per share compared to its current US$27.32. The article encourages investors to use "Narratives" on Simply Wall St's platform to personalize their valuation assumptions and make informed decisions.

title: Hasbro, Inc. (NASDAQ:HAS) Receives Average Recommendation of "Moderate Buy" from Analysts
summary: Hasbro, Inc. (NASDAQ:HAS) has received a "Moderate Buy" consensus recommendation from analysts, with nine out of twelve rating the stock a buy. The average 12-month price target is set at $94.64. The company's stock performance shows a market capitalization of $13.39 billion and is influenced by recent licensing deals, analyst price target upgrades, and ongoing legal/reputational risks related to a lawsuit concerning Magic: The Gathering cards.

title: JBG Smith Properties Advances Growth Strategy with Key Approvals and Investor Backing
summary: JBG Smith Properties is expanding its presence in the Washington D.C. metropolitan area, with a recently approved 640-unit residential development in Alexandria and a significant 10.5% stake now held by Vanguard Portfolio Management LLC. The company is strategically positioned in the "National Landing" district and is preparing to release its full-year 2025 and Q4 earnings on February 17, with investors keen to assess occupancy rates and dividend distributions amid signs of market stabilization.

title: BI Asset Management Fondsmaeglerselskab A S Has $38.06 Million Holdings in Ulta Beauty Inc. $ULTA
summary: BI Asset Management Fondsmaeglerselskab A S significantly increased its stake in Ulta Beauty Inc. (NASDAQ:ULTA) by 70.5% in the third quarter, bringing its total holdings to 69,614 shares valued at $38.06 million. Ulta Beauty exceeded analyst expectations for the quarter with strong EPS and revenue, and institutional investors collectively own a substantial 90.39% of the company's stock. Analysts have a "Moderate Buy" consensus rating for Ulta Beauty with an average target price of $626.44.

title: SPX Technologies (SPXC) Well-Positioned for Data Center Infrastructure Evolution
summary: SPX Technologies (SPXC) is identified as one of the top industrial machinery and supplies stocks, with analysts giving it a moderately bullish outlook and an almost 8% upside potential. Despite concerns about Nvidia's cooling technology shifts affecting data center infrastructure, SPX's products are deemed integral for heat rejection in liquid-cooled systems, positioning the company well within the evolving market. The article also touches upon broader AI investment opportunities, emphasizing the massive energy demands of AI and highlighting overlooked companies in critical infrastructure roles, but clarifies that it considers other AI stocks to hold more promise than SPXC for higher, quicker returns.

title: Stock market today: Dow, S&P 500, Nasdaq futures slip as Amazon's earnings flop set to deepen tech rout
summary: US stock futures, including the Dow, S&P 500, and Nasdaq, slipped in early trading following Amazon's post-earnings decline, which further weighed on tech sentiment. Amazon shares plunged over 10% after missing earnings estimates and projecting high capital expenditures for AI. The tech rout also impacted Bitcoin and other related stocks, even as some companies like Reddit and Roblox saw gains due to positive earnings reports.

title: DoorDash Food Delivery Specialization Is Less Exposed to Autonomous Disruption, but Amazon Lurks
summary: DoorDash dominates the North American food and convenience delivery market with 65% share and has expanded globally through Wolt's acquisition. The company, which boasts 42 million monthly active users and 2.6 billion annual orders, is considered less vulnerable to autonomous disruption compared to other sectors, though Amazon's potential moves pose a competitive threat. Despite strong market positioning, analyst notes hint at pressure from significant tech investment plans.

title: Reassessing Sea Limited (NYSE:SE) Valuation After Recent Share Price Weakness
summary: Sea Limited (NYSE:SE) has experienced recent share price weakness, leading investors to reassess its valuation. Despite the pullback, many analysts consider Sea significantly undervalued, with a fair value estimate around $190 per share, compared to its current price of $108.57, driven by growth in its e-commerce, fintech, and gaming segments. However, its high P/E ratio relative to peers suggests potential valuation risk if growth expectations diminish.

title: Nvidia Reportedly Nears Record $20 Billion OpenAI Investment As Jensen Huang And Sam Altman Deny Reports Of Strained Partnership
summary: Nvidia is reportedly planning to invest $20 billion in OpenAI, marking its largest investment yet in the AI startup. This news comes amidst reports of a strained partnership between the two companies, which both Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang and OpenAI CEO Sam Altman have denied. The investment is part of OpenAI's latest funding round, which aims to raise up to $100 billion.

title: Stock market today: Dow, S&P 500, Nasdaq futures plummet as Amazon's earnings flop set to deepen tech rout
summary: US stock futures, including the Dow, S&P 500, and Nasdaq, plummeted after Amazon's disappointing earnings report, which showed a significant miss on EPS and projected high capital expenditures for AI. This added to a bruising session on Wall Street, pushing the S&P 500 and Nasdaq Composite into negative territory for 2026. The risk-off sentiment also affected Bitcoin, which slid to its lowest level since 2024, and led to a loss for Strategy (MSTR) due to the crypto sell-off.

title: Regency Centers earnings beat by $0.55, revenue fell short of estimates
summary: Regency Centers (NASDAQ: REG) reported Q4 EPS of $1.12, surpassing analyst estimates of $0.57 by $0.55. However, revenue for the quarter came in at $395.41M, falling short of the consensus estimate of $404.31M. The company's stock has shown positive performance over the last 3 and 12 months, and InvestingPro rates its financial health as "great performance".

title: Is Sea (SE) Prioritizing Monetization Over Expansion With Brazil Fee Hikes And AI-Powered Shopee?
summary: Sea Limited (SE) is showing a shift towards monetization over pure growth, as evidenced by increased commission rates for Shopee in Brazil and the integration of AI on the platform. Despite positive full-year outlooks and a significant share buyback, the market remains cautious due to increased investment spending and potential short-term pressure on margins. The article explores the investment narrative, risks, and varying fair value estimates for Sea, advising investors to weigh multiple perspectives on its balance between growth and profitability.

title: Stock Market Today: SPY, QQQ Tumble on Trio of Weak Jobs Data as Rate Cut Odds Surge
summary: The S&P 500 ETF (SPY) and Nasdaq 100 ETF (QQQ) both fell over 1% due to weak labor market data and a tech stock selloff, leading to increased odds of an interest rate cut. Job cuts in January were the highest for the month since 2009, and initial jobless claims rose above estimates, with significant layoffs from UPS and Amazon. These indicators of a slowing job market are fueling more aggressive predictions for a rate cut by the Federal Reserve.

title: Costco stock price closes near $1,000 after January sales jump and online surge
summary: Costco's stock closed near $989.29 after briefly topping $1,000, driven by a 9.3% increase in January net sales to $21.33 billion and a significant 34.4% surge in digitally-enabled comparable sales. This performance contrasted with a weaker market for other retailers, and investors are now anticipating Costco's fiscal Q2 earnings call on March 5 for updates on margins and membership figures. Oppenheimer raised its price target to $1,100, citing strong non-food categories and potential for a special dividend or stock split.

title: Salesforce stock sinks as ‘software-mageddon’ bites again — what to watch before earnings
summary: Salesforce shares dropped 4.8% due to investor concerns about AI impacting subscription-based revenue models, a trend dubbed "software-mageddon" affecting the broader SaaS sector. All attention is now on Salesforce's upcoming Q4 and full-year fiscal 2026 earnings report on February 25th, where investors will scrutinize the company's AI initiatives and guidance amidst the market selloff. Despite the downturn, some analysts remain bullish, viewing the selloff as a temporary “garage sale” and noting Salesforce's current valuation is below historical norms and the S&P 500.

title: Earnings call transcript: IBEX Q2 2026 earnings beat expectations
summary: IBEX Ltd reported a strong Q2 FY 2026, surpassing analyst expectations with a 16.7% revenue increase year-over-year to $164.2 million and adjusted EPS of $0.87, a 46% rise. The company raised its full-year revenue guidance to $620-$630 million, driven by growth in high-margin offshore revenues and health tech, and highlighted its leadership in AI-driven customer experience. IBEX's shares reacted positively, gaining in aftermarket trading as the company continues to focus on strategic investments in AI and geographic expansion.

title: Amazon.com, Inc. 2025 Q4 - Results - Earnings Call Presentation (NASDAQ:AMZN) 2026-02-05
summary: Amazon.com, Inc. announced its 2025 Q4 earnings results, beating analyst expectations. The company reported an EPS of $1.95 and revenue of $213.39 billion, a 13.63% increase year-over-year. A slide deck accompanying the earnings call was also published.

title: IBM Secures Hybrid Cloud Dominance as $6.4 Billion HashiCorp Integration Hits Full Stride
summary: IBM's $6.4 billion acquisition of HashiCorp, finalized in February 2025, has successfully integrated HashiCorp's tools like Terraform, Vault, and Consul into IBM's Red Hat ecosystem, positioning IBM as a leader in hybrid cloud management. This strategic move has shifted IBM's revenue towards high-margin software and quieted skeptics, demonstrating the company's commitment to a hybrid-first, AI-driven future. The integration has led to significant financial benefits for IBM, creating a powerful solution for enterprise automation and allowing AI agents to manage cloud environments autonomously through Project Infragraph.

title: Amazon Q4 2026 Earnings: Revenue Tops Estimates, AWS Drives Strong Growth, Small EPS Miss
summary: Amazon reported mixed but solid Q4 2026 results, with revenue exceeding expectations due to strong AWS performance, though EPS slightly missed estimates. AWS saw significant growth, beating forecasts with a 24% ex-FX revenue increase. While North America retail and physical stores performed as anticipated, the company's 2026 capex outlook of $200 billion significantly surpassed consensus, signaling heavy investments in AWS, AI, and logistics infrastructure.

title: California Water sets Feb. 26 call on 2025 earnings results
summary: California Water Service Group (NYSE: CWT) announced it will release its 2025 full-year and fourth-quarter earnings after market close on Wednesday, February 25, 2026. This will be followed by an earnings conference call on Thursday, February 26, 2026, at 11:00 a.m. ET. The company will also provide a live audio webcast of the call, with a replay available until April 27, 2026.

title: Molina Healthcare shares plunge 33% on surprise Q4 loss, disappointing guidance
summary: Molina Healthcare (NYSE: MOH) shares plummeted 33% after reporting a significant fourth-quarter adjusted loss of -$2.75 per share, far below analyst estimates of $0.34 per share. The company also issued disappointing 2026 guidance, projecting adjusted earnings of at least $5.00 per share against an estimated $13.71, and revenue guidance of at least $44.5 billion, falling short of the $46.785 billion analysts anticipated. Factors contributing to the poor performance include unfavorable retroactive premium adjustments and medical cost pressures, as well as burdens from a new Florida Medicaid contract and underperformance in Medicare Advantage Part D.

title: GOOG stock whipsaws after Alphabet flags up to $185 billion in AI capex
summary: Alphabet's Class C shares experienced significant volatility after the company announced plans to nearly double its capital spending on AI infrastructure, projecting $175 billion to $185 billion in capex for 2026. This aggressive investment, despite strong Q4 earnings and cloud growth, has raised investor concerns about the timeline and ultimate payoff of such large-scale AI expenditures. The market is increasingly questioning whether these massive investments by tech giants will justify their costs, especially with rising depreciation and operating expenses.

title: Amazon.com Announces Fourth Quarter Results
summary: Amazon.com (NASDAQ: AMZN) reported strong financial results for its fourth quarter and full year 2025. Fourth-quarter net sales increased 14% to $213.4 billion, with AWS sales up 24%. For the full year, net sales reached $716.9 billion, a 12% increase, and net income rose to $77.7 billion. The company highlighted significant innovation in AI, chips, and delivery speeds, and provided optimistic guidance for the first quarter of 2026.

title: Earnings Flash (AMZN) Amazon.com, Inc. Reports Q4 Revenue $213.39B, vs. FactSet Est of $211.44B
summary: Amazon.com, Inc. reported its Q4 revenue at $213.39 billion, surpassing FactSet's estimate of $211.44 billion. The company also posted Q4 EPS of $1.95, slightly below the FactSet estimate of $1.97. For Q1, Amazon expects revenue to range between $173.5 billion and $178.5 billion, compared to FactSet's estimate of $175.62 billion, and anticipates a 50% boost to capital spending this year.

title: UPS vs. FedEx: Which Logistics Giant Looks Like the Better Long-Term Play?​
summary: This article analyzes UPS and FedEx as long-term investments, highlighting FedEx's superior performance in stock returns and revenue growth compared to UPS. While UPS focuses on cost-cutting and margin expansion through significant layoffs and reduced Amazon shipments, FedEx prioritizes growth and market share. The analysis suggests FedEx appears to be the stronger investment currently, offering both growth and margin expansion, whereas UPS's aggressive cost-cutting may hinder future growth opportunities.

title: WPP PLC (WPP) 2K contracts of 2K contracts of August 17.50 calls trade
summary: This article reports on significant options trading activity for WPP PLC (WPP), specifically highlighting the trade of 2,000 contracts of August 17.50 calls. It notes WPP's 30-day implied volatility at 49%, within its 52-week range. The piece also includes a brief mention of Qiagen (QGEN) and Johnson Controls (JCI) options-related news.

title: Digital Realty Trust Stock Outlook: 117% Upside Potential by 2026
summary: Digital Realty (DLR) is expanding its global data center footprint to meet rising demand from cloud, AI, and enterprise customers across six continents. TIKR's valuation model projects a potential 117% upside by 2026, meaning DLR stock could reach $446 per share by December 2029, reflecting a 167.2% total return or 28.6% annualized return. This growth is driven by projected double-digit revenue and EBITDA growth, with forward two-year CAGRs of 10.0% and 11.3% respectively, largely influenced by high demand for digital infrastructure.

title: Is Walmart Stock a Buy at $1 Trillion?
summary: Walmart has recently reached a $1 trillion valuation after its stock hit a record high, outperforming Amazon and the S&P 500. The company reported strong Q3 fiscal 2026 results, exceeding revenue and EPS estimates, and raised its full-year outlook. Market analysts have issued a "Strong Buy" rating for WMT stock, aligning with its current trading price.

title: Dow's 525-point fall led by losses for Salesforce, Amazon.com Inc. shares
summary: This article reports on a significant 525-point decline in the Dow Jones Industrial Average. The fall was primarily attributed to notable losses experienced by shares of Salesforce and Amazon.com Inc., indicating a challenging day for these major technology and cloud computing companies on the stock market.

title: Intel Corporation (INTC): A Bull Case Theory
summary: This article summarizes a bullish thesis on Intel Corporation (INTC), focusing on an institutional investor's significant put trade signaling confidence in Intel's solvency and financial stability. The thesis highlights Intel's returning profitability, recovering gross margins, and strategic operational advancements like the 18A process node and foundry commitments, all supported by its hard asset base and government aid. Investors are presented with a high-conviction strategy to profit from perceived mispricing of risk.

title: This fund is shrinking share counts: 10 HERZ shares become 1 on Feb. 9
summary: Herzfeld Credit Income Fund (HERZ) announced a 10-for-1 reverse stock split, effective 5:00 PM ET on February 6, 2026, with post-split trading beginning on Nasdaq on February 9, 2026, under the same ticker. This action will consolidate outstanding shares, reducing the total count by approximately 90%, and introduce a new CUSIP (42804T205). The company's goal is to potentially boost its stock price and appear more stable to investors, following previous capital actions and distributions.

title: The AI Storage Pivot: Seagate Shares Rocket 19% as Hard Drive Demand Hits Unprecedented Peaks
summary: Seagate Technology Holdings plc (NASDAQ: STX) saw its stock surge by 19% after a strong fiscal second-quarter earnings report, driven by unprecedented demand for high-capacity hard drives due to the AI boom. The company's manufacturing capacity for nearline HDDs is fully allocated for the rest of the year, signaling a new "supercycle" for the storage industry. This shift highlights the critical need for cost-effective, high-capacity storage for AI training data, proving that hard drives remain essential alongside faster SSDs.

title: Earnings call transcript: First Industrial Realty Trust Q4 2025 earnings beat
summary: First Industrial Realty Trust (FR) reported a significant beat on its Q4 2025 earnings, with an EPS of $0.59 against a forecast of $0.42, and revenue of $188.4 million exceeding expectations. The company also announced a 12.4% increase in its quarterly dividend and provided optimistic guidance for 2026, including expected NAREIT FFO between $3.09 and $3.19 per share. Growth is anticipated from new projects in Miami and Dallas, strong leasing activity with a 32% cash rental rate increase on new and renewal leases for 2025, and a projected cash same-store net operating income growth of 5-6% for 2026.

title: Walmart debuts latest Supercenter in Jacksonville, Florida
summary: Walmart has opened its newest Supercenter in Jacksonville, Florida, featuring a fresh sushi bar and an updated store layout. This opening is part of Walmart's "Store of the Future" concept and its strategic plan to build or convert over 150 stores by 2029, following a multiyear pause on new large-format stores. The new Supercenter's debut comes shortly after Amazon revealed plans for its own large-format grocery store, highlighting the competitive retail landscape.

title: Stock of the week: Alphabet is no longer just a search engine (05.02.2026)
summary: Alphabet reported strong Q4 2025 results, with revenues exceeding $113 billion, driven by growth in Google Services, Search, and a significant 48% increase in Google Cloud revenue. The company plans to ramp up investment spending to $175–185 billion in 2026 to solidify its leadership in AI and cloud computing, despite potential short-term impacts on margins. A DCF analysis suggests an 18% upside potential, valuing Alphabet at $373.36 per share.

title: Reliance Steel stock reaches all-time high at 348.03 USD
summary: Reliance Steel & Aluminum Co. stock has hit an all-time high of 348.03 USD, reflecting a 23.07% increase over the past year and 21.53% in the last six months. This growth highlights strong investor confidence and the company's robust performance, supported by 32 consecutive years of dividend payments. However, InvestingPro analysis suggests the stock might be trading above its Fair Value, advising caution for potential new investors.

title: Epic's AI Charting goes live
summary: Epic has launched its AI Charting tool, a clinical documentation solution built into its AI scribe, Art. Seven healthcare organizations have already implemented AI Charting since its announcement in August, with positive feedback including reported time savings for clinicians. Epic plans to further expand the tool's functionality, aiming for Art to become an active assistant during patient visits.

title: Analysts Estimate Maplebear (CART) to Report a Decline in Earnings: What to Look Out for
summary: Analysts expect Maplebear (CART) to report a year-over-year decline in earnings but higher revenues for the quarter ended December 2025. The company's Most Accurate Estimate is lower than the Zacks Consensus Estimate, resulting in a negative Earnings ESP of -15.61%, which, combined with a Zacks Rank of #3, makes it difficult to definitively predict an earnings beat. Despite a strong history of beating EPS estimates over the last four quarters, investors should consider other factors beyond just earnings surprise history.

title: Global E Online Partnership Renewal With Shopify And Shift To Profitability
summary: Global-E Online (NasdaqGS:GLBE) has renewed its multi-year commercial partnership with Shopify, solidifying its role in cross-border e-commerce solutions for Shopify merchants. This renewal, coupled with GLBE achieving GAAP profitability, marks a significant milestone for the company, affirming its business model's ability to support both scale and cost discipline. Investors will likely focus on the durability of this relationship and GLBE's consistent profitability moving forward.

title: Oppenheimer Raises Amazon.com, Inc. (AMZN) Target as AWS Momentum and Margin Expansion Accelerate
summary: Oppenheimer has raised its price target for Amazon.com, Inc. (AMZN) to $315 from $305, maintaining an Outperform rating. This adjustment is based on anticipated accelerated growth in Amazon Web Services (AWS) and significant margin expansion in its e-commerce sector due to automation investments. The firm projects Amazon to be a leading mega-cap investment, despite news of Saks Global ending its e-commerce partnership with Amazon, which is not expected to materially impact Amazon's operations.

title: Here's Why Broadridge Financial (BR) is Poised for a Turnaround After Losing 13.4% in 4 Weeks
summary: Broadridge Financial Solutions (BR) has experienced a 13.4% decline in the past four weeks but is now showing signs of a potential turnaround. Technical indicators, specifically an oversold Relative Strength Index (RSI) of 25.73, suggest the selling pressure might be exhausting. Fundamentally, analysts have been raising earnings estimates for BR, and the company holds a Zacks Rank #2 (Buy), further indicating a possible rebound.

title: Dow drops 215 points on losses for shares of Amazon.com Inc., Microsoft
summary: The Dow Jones Industrial Average dropped by 215 points due to declines in shares of major tech companies, Amazon.com Inc. and Microsoft. This indicates a challenging day for the stock market, particularly for the technology sector.

title: Archer-Daniels-Midland Stock Outlook: Is Wall Street Bullish or Bearish?
summary: Archer-Daniels-Midland (ADM) has significantly outperformed the broader S&P 500 and the VanEck Agribusiness ETF over the last year and year-to-date. Despite beating Q4 EPS expectations, ADM’s revenue fell short, leading to a "Hold" consensus rating from analysts, although the sentiment is slightly less bearish than a month prior. Morgan Stanley maintained a "Sell" rating with a price target of $50, while the stock currently trades above its mean target but offers limited upside to the Street-high target.

title: Border patrol, Canadian ire dampening traffic at Simon malls
summary: Simon Property Group CEO David Simon stated that while tariffs continue to negatively impact retailers, the company views store closures and bankruptcies as opportunities to replace distressed tenants with more productive ones at higher rents. He also noted that border control activity and Canadian dissatisfaction are dampening traffic at northern U.S. border malls, despite overall positive trends in sales and tenant demand post-pandemic.

title: Electrovaya Sets February 12 Date for Q1 2026 Results and Investor Call
summary: Electrovaya (TSE:ELVA) announced it will release its Q1 2026 financial results on February 12, 2026, after market close, followed by a conference call with CEO Dr. Raj DasGupta and CFO John Gibson. This event will provide insights into the company's progress in scaling battery production and its market reach for its lithium-ion battery solutions. TipRanks' AI Analyst, Spark, rates ELVA as Neutral, noting strong financial performance but concerns about cash flow, debt reliance, and high valuation.

title: From Petah Tikva to orbit: Gilat Satellite Networks surges 160%, becoming an investor favorite
summary: Gilat Satellite Networks, an Israeli company, has seen its share price jump over 160% in the past year due to strategic acquisitions, defense contracts, and major tender wins in the burgeoning satellite communications industry. While companies like Starlink and Amazon focus on deploying satellites, Gilat specializes in providing the crucial ground equipment that connects them, catering to telecom operators and militaries worldwide. CEO Adi Sfadia details the company's transformation from a struggling firm to an investor favorite, now valued at approximately 3.5 billion shekels, with significant growth potential in defense and new satellite platforms.

title: Akari cancer ADC plans spotlighted in Webull’s Feb. 10 online event
summary: Akari Therapeutics will participate in Webull Financial’s Corporate Connect Webinar Series on February 10, 2026, where CEO Abizer Gaslightwala will provide an overview of the company's ADC platform and lead cancer drug candidates AKTX-101 and AKTX-102. The presentation will detail IND-enabling activities for AKTX-101, targeting a first-in-human trial in late 2026 or early 2027. Despite recent positive corporate updates, market reactions have often been muted or negative, suggesting a cautious investor sentiment.

title: Aterian Recalls PurSteam Elite Travel Steamers and Mighty Lil Steamers Due to Risk of Serious Burn Injury
summary: Aterian has recalled approximately 75,400 PurSteam Elite Travel Steamers and 119,000 PurSteam Mighty Lil Steamers due to a serious burn hazard. The steamers can expel hot water from the nozzle during use, with 80 incidents and 14 burn injuries reported for the Elite Travel Steamer, and 392 incidents with 40 burn injuries (including two second-degree) for the Mighty Lil Steamer. Consumers are advised to stop using the recalled products, cut the cord, and submit a refund request online.

title: Cummins (NYSE:CMI) Posts Better-Than-Expected Sales In Q4 CY2025
summary: Cummins (NYSE:CMI) reported better-than-expected revenue in Q4 CY2025, with sales increasing 1.1% year-on-year to $8.54 billion, surpassing analyst estimates. Despite robust sales and record full-year results in its Distribution and Power Systems segments, GAAP EPS missed expectations at $4.27 per share. The company's stock dipped slightly post-announcement, indicating mixed market reaction to the results.

title: Apple Becomes Apple Again
summary: Apple's stock has surged by 36% in the last six months, significantly outperforming the S&P 500, despite concerns about its lack of a proprietary AI product. This resurgence comes as other major AI companies like Amazon, Meta, and Microsoft face investor skepticism due to high investments and slow integration of AI into paid products. Apple's decision to integrate Google's Gemini AI into "Apple Intelligence" through a reported $1 billion annual deal is seen as a remarkably favorable move for the company.

title: Music streamer LiveOne slashes costs 52% and eyes three Fortune 500 deals
summary: LiveOne (NASDAQ: LVO) announced preliminary unaudited results for Q3 Fiscal 2026, estimating over $19.9 million in revenue and over $1.0 million in adjusted EBITDA, marking a 200% quarter-over-quarter increase. The company attributed this performance to a 52% year-over-year reduction in operating expenses, aiming for an additional $4-$5 million in headcount savings through AI, and the repayment of $2.5 million in debt. LiveOne also highlighted ongoing B2B partnerships and anticipates launching three Fortune 500 partnerships by year-end.

title: LiveOne (Nasdaq: LVO) Expects $57.9M+ Fiscal 2026 YTD
summary: LiveOne (Nasdaq: LVO) announced anticipated financial results for Q3 Fiscal 2026 and the nine months ended December 31, 2025, expecting over $57.9 million in YTD Fiscal 2026 revenue and over $19.9 million in Q3 Fiscal 2026 revenue. The company also anticipates over $1.0 million in Q3 Fiscal 2026 Adjusted EBITDA, a 200% quarter-over-quarter increase, driven by B2B partnerships and cost optimization through AI. LiveOne is targeting a 34% year-over-year headcount reduction, resulting in $4 million to $5 million in savings, and has paid off $2.5 million in debt.

title: Digital Brands taps college athletes in $36.4B sports merch push
summary: Digital Brands Group (NASDAQ:DBGI) announced plans for four campus photo shoots in February, expanding its Name, Image, and Likeness (NIL) strategic initiative. This includes new partnerships with the University of Colorado and Vanderbilt University, alongside return visits to the University of Alabama and the University of Mississippi. The company aims to capitalize on the licensed sports merchandise market, valued at $36.4 billion in 2024 and projected to reach $49.0 billion by 2030, through its AVO women’s apparel brand featuring female student athletes.

title: Amazon Earnings Are Imminent; These Most Accurate Analysts Revise Forecasts Ahead Of Earnings Call
summary: Amazon.com (NASDAQ: AMZN) will release its fourth-quarter earnings results after market close on Thursday, February 5th. Analysts are forecasting earnings per share of $1.97 and revenue of $211.32 billion. Several top-rated analysts have recently reiterated Buy/Outperform ratings and adjusted price targets for Amazon ahead of the earnings call.

title: Oracle's Larry Ellison is down an unmatched $49 billion this year after the plunge in software stocks
summary: Oracle cofounder Larry Ellison has seen his net worth drop by an "unmatched" $49 billion this year, largely due to a 5% slump in Oracle stock. This decline follows a broader sell-off in software stocks, fueled by fears that new AI tools like Anthropic's Claude Cowork AI agent could reduce corporate demand for traditional software. Despite Oracle's significant investments in the AI boom, some analysts, like Michael Burry, have expressed concerns about the company's aggressive spending and growing debt pile.

title: AI Spending Pays Off for Major Cloud Providers
summary: New research indicates that major cloud providers like Alphabet, Amazon, Meta, and Microsoft have seen their AI infrastructure investments pay off, with their combined capital expenditures more than doubling between 2022 and 2025 alongside a significant increase in return on invested capital (ROIC). This profitability gain is attributed to strong utilization of new compute infrastructure and robust cloud revenue. The Alger 35 ETF (ATFV) is highlighted as an investment option for those seeking exposure to companies central to AI infrastructure development.

title: Why SanDisk Is Still A Strong Buy Near All-Time Highs (NASDAQ:SNDK)
summary: SanDisk (SNDK) is considered a strong buy due to surging NAND demand driven by AI, coupled with constrained supply and robust pricing. Competitors prioritizing memory over SSDs are tightening enterprise NAND supply, benefiting SanDisk's pricing power. The article also notes that AI workloads accelerate NAND wear and replacement cycles, and hyperscalers are engaging in long-term supply contracts with SNDK, making its valuation attractive despite recent price rallies.

title: Ulta Beauty Inc.: How a Hybrid Retail Platform Became Beauty’s Powerhouse Product
summary: Ulta Beauty Inc. has evolved beyond a traditional retail chain to become a comprehensive hybrid beauty platform. It integrates physical stores, a robust loyalty program, advanced e-commerce, and in-store services, creating a unique ecosystem that offers discovery, consultation, and convenience across mass and prestige beauty categories. This strategic approach makes Ulta a formidable player in the beauty market, distinguishing it from rivals like Sephora, Target, and Amazon, and driving its strong market performance.

title: Citizens Maintains Outperform Rating On CRISPR Therapeutics (CRSP) Citing Undervalued Pipeline
summary: Citizens maintained an Outperform rating on CRISPR Therapeutics (CRSP) despite reducing its price target from $86 to $80, citing that much of the company's pipeline remains undervalued and anticipates late-stage development for up to seven opportunities in 2027. This follows a similar sentiment from Bank of America, which also reduced its price target but maintained a Buy rating, highlighting aligning factors for biotech growth. CRISPR Therapeutics is a gene editing company, though the article suggests that certain AI stocks may offer greater promise and lower risk for investors.

title: Graham Corporation (GHM) To Report Earnings Tomorrow: Here Is What To Expect
summary: Graham Corporation (GHM) is set to report its earnings tomorrow, with analysts predicting an 11.3% year-on-year revenue growth to $52.35 million and adjusted earnings of $0.18 per share. The company previously exceeded revenue expectations by 14.7% last quarter, and analyst estimates have remained consistent. Sentiment in the engineered components and systems segment, including Graham Corporation, has been positive, with share prices up 8% on average over the last month.

title: Cancer biotech Boundless Bio preps Guggenheim fireside chat with online webcast
summary: Boundless Bio (NASDAQ: BOLD) announced that its President and CEO, Zachary Hornby, will participate in a fireside chat at the Guggenheim Emerging Outlook: Biotech Summit 2026 on February 12, 2026, at 3:00 p.m. ET. A live and archived webcast of the session will be available on the company's website. Following the news, BOLD saw a moderate positive market reaction, with its stock gaining 4.59%.

title: Sun Country Airlines stock hits 52-week high at $19.80
summary: Sun Country Airlines (SNCY) stock reached a new 52-week high of $19.80, showcasing a significant upward trend with 21.34% growth over the past year and 87.77% over the past six months. This surge is likely due to strong investor confidence, a perfect Piotroski Score of 9, and a favorable PEG ratio of 0.62 suggesting undervaluation. The company also announced an acquisition by Allegiant Travel Company and plans to open a new operational base for cargo in January 2026.

title: Tower, NVIDIA silicon photonics offer up to 2x AI data speeds
summary: Tower Semiconductor announced a collaboration with NVIDIA on 1.6T data center optical modules, utilizing Tower's silicon photonics platform. This technology aims to achieve up to double the data-rate compared to previous silicon photonics solutions, boosting bandwidth and throughput for AI infrastructure. The partnership positions Tower as a key foundry for high-speed optical interconnects in AI, data center networking, and advanced telecom.

title: Jones Financial Companies Lllp Purchases 47,602 Shares of Marvell Technology, Inc. $MRVL
summary: Jones Financial Companies Lllp significantly increased its stake in Marvell Technology (NASDAQ:MRVL) by 76.9%, purchasing 47,602 shares to bring its total holdings to 109,501 shares valued at approximately $9.11 million. This comes as Marvell Technology completes its acquisition of Celestial AI, a strategic move focusing on AI/data-center connectivity, though it has garnered mixed reactions from analysts. The company recently exceeded quarterly earnings expectations with revenue up 36.8% year-over-year.

title: Alphabet Inc. SEC 10-K Report
summary: Alphabet Inc. has released its annual 10-K report, detailing strong financial performance with significant revenue growth and increased net income in the fiscal year. The report highlights strategic investments in AI, the expansion of Google Cloud services, and key acquisitions, while also addressing challenges related to AI integration, reliance on advertising revenue, international operations, and data privacy. The company plans further investment in technical infrastructure and expects its robust cash position to fund future operations.

title: Piper Sandler Maintains Overweight on Global-E Online Ltd. (GLBE) Amid Software Sector Reset
summary: Piper Sandler analyst Billy Fitzsimmons maintained an Overweight rating on Global-E Online Ltd. (GLBE) with a $48 price target despite a broader software sector reset. The firm noted mixed sentiment in the software sector but highlighted Global-e's strong Q3 2025 performance, with GMV up 33% and revenue up 25.5%. The company is well-positioned for sustained growth in cross-border e-commerce, driven by its platform and early traction in AI-driven commerce.

title: Stifel Maintains Hold on Etsy, Inc. (ETSY), Lowers Price Target Amid Near-Term Consumer Pressure
summary: Stifel analyst Mark Kelley lowered the price target for Etsy, Inc. (ETSY) to $62 from $65, maintaining a Hold rating due to potential incremental consumer pricing pressure in 2026, despite healthy overall e-commerce performance in Q4. This updated outlook also follows Etsy's recent leadership transition, with founder Josh Silverman moving to Executive Chair and Kruti Patel Goyal becoming CEO, a shift aimed at strategic continuity and execution.

title: Before the Bell: What every Canadian investor needs to know today
summary: Global markets experienced a downturn due to corporate results and concerns over AI valuations, with Canadian investors set to review earnings from major companies like Thomson Reuters, Barrick Mining, and BCE. Oil prices dropped, and the Canadian dollar weakened against the U.S. dollar, while central banks in Europe kept interest rates steady. The article also highlights economic news, including U.S. jobless claims and a scheduled speech by the Bank of Canada Governor.

title: Amazon to report Q4 earnings with capex, AI growth in focus
summary: Amazon is set to release its Q4 earnings report, with investor focus on capital expenditures (capex) and AI growth amid concerns about overspending in the AI sector. The company's results will follow Meta and Microsoft's recent announcements, with Amazon also having announced 16,000 job cuts and store closures. Wall Street will keenly observe Amazon's capex projections for 2025 and 2026, which could significantly impact its stock performance.

title: Amazon and Biogen Earnings: Still to Watch This Week
summary: Amazon and Biogen are set to release their earnings reports this week, adding to the ongoing earnings season. Amazon's report will conclude the earnings releases from several Magnificent Seven tech companies, while Biogen's results will contribute to the pharmaceutical industry's reports. The jobs report expected on Friday has been postponed due to a partial government shutdown.

title: XPO Scores Spot on Fortune List of Firms Poised for Long-Term Growth
summary: XPO Logistics Inc. has been recognized on Fortune's Future 50 list for its strong prospects for long-term growth, marking its first appearance on this list. Fortune highlighted XPO's success through both strategic acquisitions and organic growth, such as the launch of XPO Direct. CEO Bradley Jacobs emphasized the company's clear vision, agility, and technology investments as key drivers of its rapid expansion in the logistics market.

title: Baird Signals Continued Confidence in Maplebear Inc. (CART)'s Long-Term Growth Potential
summary: Baird has reiterated its Outperform rating on Maplebear Inc. (CART) despite a slight reduction in its price target to $49 from $50, signaling continued confidence in the company's long-term growth. The firm highlights Maplebear's expanding enterprise platform, which powers over 350 e-commerce storefronts, and its aggressive integration of AI to enhance retailer efficiency and drive new revenue streams. As Instacart, Maplebear Inc. is positioned to evolve into a broader retail technology enabler, supported by its growing advertising business and strategic AI initiatives.

title: Earnings Flash (CAH) Cardinal Health, Inc. Reports Q2 Revenue $65.63B, vs. FactSet Est of $65.08B
summary: Cardinal Health, Inc. reported its second-quarter revenue of $65.63 billion, surpassing FactSet's estimate of $65.08 billion. This financial update was published on February 5, 2026, at 07:32 am EST. The company also posted an adjusted EPS of $2.63 per share, exceeding the FactSet estimate of $2.34.

title: Amazon.com (AMZN) Set to Report Earnings as UBS Raises Price Target on AWS Outlook
summary: UBS analyst Stephen Ju raised the price target for Amazon.com (AMZN) to $311.00, maintaining a Buy rating ahead of its 4Q25 earnings report. The firm increased estimates for AWS revenue and capital expenditures, projecting that AWS revenue could double by 2028, potentially generating an additional $20 billion in free cash flow. This outlook suggests improved investor confidence and continued outperformance for AMZN shares.

title: Starbucks Corporation (NASDAQ:SBUX) Given Consensus Recommendation of "Moderate Buy" by Analysts
summary: Starbucks Corporation (NASDAQ:SBUX) has received a "Moderate Buy" consensus recommendation from analysts, with an average 12-month price target of $104.67. Despite missing EPS estimates in its latest quarterly results, the company exceeded revenue expectations and provided FY2026 EPS guidance. While long-term growth is supported by menu simplification and U.S. store expansion plans, risks like union activity, a pessimistic Citigroup forecast, and recent insider sales present near-term headwinds.

title: Amazon.com (AMZN) set to report earnings as UBS raises price target on AWS outlook
summary: UBS has raised its price target for Amazon (AMZN) to $215, citing an improved outlook for Amazon Web Services (AWS) in 2024, particularly as clients optimize cloud spending. The firm anticipates AWS revenue growth to accelerate throughout the year due to new workloads and AI monetization, which is expected to support overall earnings. Amazon is scheduled to report its Q4 2023 earnings after market close, with analysts keen on the company's retail performance, advertising revenue, and AWS growth trajectory.

title: Google Parent Alphabet Earnings Beat Fuels Analyst Price Target Hikes – But Capex Jitters Linger
summary: Alphabet Inc. (GOOG, GOOGL) surpassed Q4 analyst estimates with $113.8 billion in revenue and $2.82 EPS, driving multiple Wall Street firms to raise their price targets, citing strong AI and search momentum. However, shares fell over 2% premarket due to investor caution over the company's projected 2026 capital expenditure of $175 billion to $185 billion, significantly higher than previous estimates. Despite this, CEO Sundar Pichai remains optimistic about the revenue potential from these investments.

title: Transcat (TRNS) Quarterly Loss Challenges Bullish Earnings Growth Narratives
summary: Transcat (TRNS) reported a Q3 2026 loss of US$0.12 EPS and US$1.1 million net loss, despite revenue growth to US$83.9 million. While the company still shows a profit over the trailing twelve months, the quarterly loss and compressed net profit margin of 2.5% challenge bullish earnings growth forecasts of 26.2% annually. The stock's high P/E of 83.5x and a DCF fair value significantly below the current price suggest a rich valuation, prompting investors to scrutinize future profitability and growth execution.

title: IonQ, the biggest quantum computing company on the stock market, disputes short-seller claims it failed to disclose holes in its revenue
summary: IonQ, a leading quantum computing company, is disputing claims made by short-seller Wolfpack Research regarding the quality of its revenues and insider stock sales. Wolfpack alleges that IonQ misled investors about the origin of its revenue, claiming it was significantly dependent on "backdoor earmarks" in the Pentagon budget rather than commercial demand, and that these earmarks were subsequently canceled. IonQ has denied these claims, stating that the report contains false and misleading information and affirms its path to shareholder value creation, while Wolfpack suggests recent acquisitions by IonQ are a way to "acquire revenue" to mask organic growth issues.

title: IREN's $9.7 Billion Microsoft Bet Hits The Earnings Moment Of Truth
summary: IREN Ltd, formerly a Bitcoin mining company, has dramatically shifted its focus to AI infrastructure through a $9.7 billion partnership with Microsoft. As the company prepares to announce its second-quarter earnings, investors are closely watching whether this reinvention will prove visionary or an overreach, particularly amidst concerns about dilution risk and the company's ability to compete in the cloud market. The earnings report will be a critical test of IREN's credibility as a cloud contender.

title: How Investors May Respond To IAS Adding Streaming Ad Veterans To Its Board Of Directors
summary: Integral Ad Science Holding Corp. (IAS) recently appointed Bob Lord and Krishan Bhatia, both experienced in digital and streaming advertising, to its Board of Directors. These appointments are expected to enhance IAS's product development and partnerships in the streaming TV and data-driven media sectors. While the company's investment narrative focuses on its role in verification and measurement, investors should consider the potential for refinement in its product mix and the current valuation of its shares.

title: Sony Pictures Revenue Drops 12%, Music Posts Strong Results as Overall Company Operating Income Jumps Up 22% in December Quarter
summary: Sony Group exceeded expectations with a 22% increase in operating income during the December 2025 quarter, prompting an uplift in its fiscal year forecast. While Sony Pictures Entertainment saw an 11% revenue drop due to a challenging comparison to a blockbuster-filled prior year, the music division reported strong results with a 13% revenue increase. The PlayStation gaming segment experienced a 4% revenue decrease but a 19% rise in operating income, driven by network services and first-party game sales.

title: Tweedy Browne CO LLC Reduces Alphabet Inc. Stake
summary: Tweedy Browne CO LLC recently reduced its stake in Alphabet Inc. Class C (GOOG) by 6,272 shares. Despite this reduction, Alphabet Inc. Class C has seen a strong uptrend, with Wall Street maintaining a Strong Buy consensus due to the company's accelerating AI strategy and robust Google Cloud and Search outlook. Spark, TipRanks’ AI Analyst, rates GOOG as Outperform, citing strong financial performance and strategic investments in AI and cloud services as key drivers for its positive long-term outlook.

title: Alecta Pensionsforsakring, Omsesidigt reduces Amazon.Com, Inc. stake
summary: Alecta Pensionsforsakring, Omsesidigt, managed by Magnus Billing, has reduced its stake in Amazon.Com, Inc. (AMZN) by selling 96,600 shares. Despite this reduction and recent flat to modestly higher stock performance, Wall Street analysts maintain a strong bullish outlook on Amazon, citing anticipated acceleration in AWS growth driven by AI, resilient retail performance, and strong advertising growth. TipRanks' AI Analyst, Spark, rates AMZN as "Outperform," highlighting strong financials but noting short-term technical weakness and a high P/E ratio.

title: Institutional investors are Insteel Industries Inc.'s (NYSE:IIIN) biggest bettors and were rewarded after last week's US$55m market cap gain
summary: Insteel Industries Inc. (NYSE:IIIN) saw a US$55 million market cap gain, primarily benefiting institutional investors who collectively own 82% of the company. These institutions, including BlackRock, The Vanguard Group, and Dimensional Fund Advisors, hold a significant majority, influencing the company's stock price. While CEO Howard Woltz and other insiders also hold shares, the concentrated institutional ownership suggests their preferences heavily impact the company's direction.

title: Franklin Resources Inc. Acquires Significant Stake in Adicet Bio Inc.
summary: Franklin Resources Inc. has acquired 626,571 shares of Adicet Bio Inc. at $8.42 per share on December 31, 2025, marking a new holding for the prominent investment firm. This strategic move highlights Franklin Resources Inc.'s interest in the biotechnology sector and Adicet Bio Inc.'s potential for growth despite current financial challenges. The acquisition aligns with Franklin Resources Inc.'s diversified investment philosophy, focusing on sectors with robust growth potential.

title: Franklin Resources Inc. Expands Holdings in Contineum Therapeuti
summary: Franklin Resources Inc. has increased its holdings in Contineum Therapeutics Inc. by adding 223,819 shares, bringing its total to 1,879,367 shares. This move signals confidence in the biopharmaceutical company's long-term potential, despite its current financial challenges and a low GF Score. Contineum Therapeutics, a clinical-stage firm, focuses on innovative therapies, and its stock has shown recent gains, though profitability and growth metrics remain negative.

title: A Look At Sonoco Products (SON) Valuation After New Long Term Renewable Power Agreement
summary: Sonoco Products (SON) has begun receiving power from a long-term Virtual Power Purchase Agreement, leading to positive investor reaction and a recent stock price increase. Despite trading at a P/E ratio higher than its industry peers, the company is still considered undervalued by analysts, with a fair value of $53.75 compared to its current price of $51.62. Future growth is anticipated through robust expansion in metal packaging and new contract wins, though potential risks like integration issues and softer demand could impact margins.

title: Is Instacart’s Expanded Costco Partnership in Europe Altering The Investment Case For Maplebear (CART)?
summary: Instacart (Maplebear, CART) has expanded its partnership with Costco into France and Spain for same-day delivery and deepened its technology collaboration with Allegiance Retail Services in the US. These moves aim to monetize enterprise software, scale retail media, and test international opportunities. While potentially influencing investor sentiment positively through growth in order volume and high-margin services, the partnerships also highlight risks such as customer concentration and execution in new markets.

title: Radware Unveils Agentic AI Protection Solution to Shield Enterprises from New Agentic Threats
summary: Radware has launched its Agentic AI Protection Solution, expanding its platform into the AI security market. This solution is designed to protect autonomous AI agents from new threats like direct and indirect prompt injection attacks, tool abuse, and unauthorized data access. It leverages proprietary behavioral analysis to identify malicious intent in real-time, distinguishing it from traditional software-based guardrails, and comes after Radware's discovery of the "ZombieAgent" vulnerability.

title: Stock Market Today: SPY, QQQ Pressured by Tech Stocks as Trump Touts ‘Extremely Good’ U.S.-China Relationship
summary: The S&P 500 ETF (SPY) and Nasdaq 100 ETF (QQQ) closed lower due to a tech stock sell-off, with companies like Nvidia, Google, Amazon, and Tesla experiencing losses.
