This occurred despite former President Trump announcing positive developments in U.S.-China relations, including China's commitment to agricultural purchases. Additionally, an ADP jobs report indicated a slowdown in private payroll additions in January, though wage growth remained stable, and the ISM Services PMI showed continued economic expansion.

title: CRH Continues $300m Buyback with Purchase of 31,000 Shares in New York
summary: CRH plc has repurchased 31,000 of its ordinary shares on the New York Stock Exchange at a volume-weighted average price of $122.36 per share as part of its ongoing $300 million share buyback program. This transaction will result in the cancellation of the acquired shares, leaving CRH with 668.3 million ordinary shares in issue and holding approximately 5.4% of its share capital in treasury. The buyback reflects CRH's strategy of returning capital to shareholders and is expected to slightly boost earnings per share for remaining investors.

title: 3 Reasons KTB is Risky and 1 Stock to Buy Instead
summary: This article analyzes Kontoor Brands (KTB), arguing that despite a recent stock price increase, the company is risky due to weak constant currency growth, mediocre free cash flow margin, and declining return on invested capital. The author advises caution against buying KTB and suggests looking into other high-quality stocks.

title: Amcor Files Quarterly Form 10-Q for December 2025 Period
summary: Amcor plc has filed its Form 10-Q with the US SEC for the quarter ended December 31, 2025, providing an update on its financial and operational performance. This filing ensures regulatory compliance and transparency for global investors, given Amcor's dual listings on the NYSE and ASX. An analyst from TipRanks currently rates Amcor (AU:AMC) stock as a Buy with a A$75.00 price target.

title: Sea Limited’s Multi-Segment Growth Pairs Rising Profitability With Strong Cash
summary: Sea Limited is demonstrating strong business momentum across its e-commerce (Shopee), digital financial services (SeaMoney), and digital entertainment (Garena) segments. The company is achieving rising profitability and cash generation, highlighted by a net cash position of US$5.66 billion and faster EPS growth than revenue. This performance positions Sea well for future expansion, relying more on internal resources for growth.

title: UPS Overhaul Weighs RFID Automation Against Amazon Pullback And Margins
summary: UPS is implementing a major overhaul, including RFID package tracking and increased automation, while intentionally reducing its Amazon-related volumes to focus on higher-margin healthcare and small to medium-sized business customers. This strategy aims to improve efficiency and revenue quality, with management targeting $3 billion in cost savings by 2026 and an expected $6.5 billion in free cash flow, though risks like impairment charges and dividend coverage issues persist. Investors will be watching how these changes impact margins, cash flow, and revenue per piece.

title: Enact Holdings Inc stock hits all-time high at 42.15 USD
summary: Enact Holdings Inc (ACT) stock reached an all-time high of $42.15, reflecting a 22.72% increase over the past year. The company boasts a market capitalization of $5.82 billion, a P/E ratio of 9.22, and strong financial health, with diluted EPS of $4.36, positioning it as potentially undervalued. Despite a recent revenue miss, the mortgage insurance provider surpassed EPS forecasts for Q4 2025, signaling mixed but generally positive performance.

title: Marvell Technology, Inc. (MRVL): A Bull Case Theory
summary: This article summarizes a bullish thesis on Marvell Technology, Inc. (MRVL), highlighting that the stock is undervalued despite a recent selloff. The company delivered solid Q3 results and provided strong Q4 guidance, with robust earnings growth expected. The thesis suggests an attractive opportunity for patient investors due to compressed valuation and strong fundamentals, despite market volatility and misinformation regarding customer relationships.

title: Target’s new CEO admits retailer has lost trust with shoppers, staff: report
summary: Target's new CEO, Michael Fiddelke, has acknowledged that the retailer has lost the trust of both shoppers and employees. He stated that the company was not clear enough about its identity, causing confusion that was not adequately addressed. Fiddelke committed to rebuilding these connections and is taking over at a time when Target faces a lengthy sales slump and has pulled back from diversity initiatives.

title: Jim Cramer on Wells Fargo: "That's a Winner"
summary: Jim Cramer expressed a bullish sentiment on Wells Fargo & Company (NYSE: WFC), calling it "a winner" due to its strategic hiring of a technologist from Amazon Web Services to enhance efficiency through AI integration. He specifically highlighted Wells Fargo during a discussion about companies benefiting from AI advancements beyond chip producers, mentioning its strong approach to implementing technology for efficiency as a key reason for the Charitable Trust's investment. While acknowledging WFC's potential, the article also suggests exploring other AI stocks with potentially greater upside and less downside risk.

title: Amazon Q4 Preview: Analyst Sees 'Big Year for AWS' In 2026 — Here's What To Expect
summary: Analysts are optimistic about Amazon's upcoming Q4 earnings report, with a focus on strong performance from its Amazon Web Services (AWS) segment. Wedbush analyst Scott Devitt anticipates 2026 to be a significant year for AWS, potentially driving Amazon's stock towards a $340 price target. Citizens analyst Andrew Boone highlighted Anthropic's projected substantial spending on AWS as a key growth driver, expecting it to generate $10 billion in AWS revenue for 2026.

title: Upland Launches BA Insight Platform
summary: Upland Software has launched the Upland BA Insight Platform, featuring SmartHub, ConnectivityHub, AutoClassifier, Smart Preview, and Connectors to enhance search experiences. The platform utilizes knowledge graphs and agentic retrieval-augmented generation (RAG) for deeper insights and more accurate AI-driven answers. It also integrates with Amazon Q Business and AWS generative AI to provide conversational search capabilities to customers.

title: Jim Cramer on Wells Fargo: “That’s a Winner”
summary: Jim Cramer has expressed a bullish view on Wells Fargo & Company (NYSE: WFC), identifying it as a "winner" for its adoption of AI technology to enhance efficiency. He highlighted the company's hire of a technologist from Amazon Web Services to help bankers find savings, noting that banks, particularly Wells Fargo, are well-positioned to benefit from AI advancements beyond just chip producers. Cramer stated that Wells Fargo is a key holding for his Charitable Trust due to its strong approach to implementing AI for efficiency.

title: PayPal Leadership Shake-Up - Former HP Exec Hired As New CEO
summary: PayPal Holdings, Inc. (PYPL) experienced a leadership change with Enrique Lores, former HP Inc. CEO, appointed as its new President and CEO, effective March 1. The announcement led to a premarket stock decline, reflecting investor uncertainty despite the Board's confidence in Lores's ability to drive innovation. This shift follows PayPal's subpar Q4 performance, missing analyst estimates for both earnings and sales, and comes as analysts maintain a "Hold" rating on the stock with a cautious outlook due to weak momentum and quality scores.

title: New Walmart CEO is not afraid to take risks, analyst says
summary: John Furner, the new CEO of Walmart, is described by analyst Oliver Chen as a leader with a higher appetite for risk than his predecessor, a necessary trait in a technology-driven environment. Furner plans to spend his initial weeks visiting stores and facilities, engaging directly with employees to understand their challenges. This approach reinforces the company's commitment to innovation and improving operations, as it navigates challenges from competitors like Amazon in both grocery and pharmacy sectors.

title: Amazon expands access to digital assistant Alexa+
summary: Amazon has expanded access to its AI-upgraded digital assistant, Alexa+, to all US users, nearly a year after its early access launch. The service is designed to handle various tasks like managing calendars, booking reservations, and controlling smart home devices. Alexa+ is available on Alexa-enabled devices, the Alexa app, and web browsers, with free access for Prime members or a monthly subscription for non-members, and has seen high engagement during its preview.

title: SpaceX rivals AST SpaceMobile and Rocket Lab join space-stock selloff
summary: SpaceX rivals AST SpaceMobile and Rocket Lab are experiencing a significant selloff in their stock prices this week. An analyst suggests these losses might be partly connected to a broader software industry rout. AST SpaceMobile saw its shares drop over 10% after AT&T partnered with Amazon Web Services and Amazon's satellite-internet business.

title: Nebius Group Targets Early Nvidia Vera Rubin Deployment For AI Clients
summary: Nebius Group (NasdaqGS:NBIS) plans to be an early commercializer of Nvidia's Vera Rubin NVL72 AI infrastructure, integrating it into its cloud offerings for enterprise clients needing high-performance AI workloads. This strategic move aims to position Nebius more competitively against hyperscale cloud providers by offering advanced infrastructure for computationally intensive AI tasks. For investors, this development signals Nebius's commitment to scaling GPU supply and deepening its role in the AI ecosystem, though execution risks and competition from larger cloud platforms remain.

title: Freedom Holding plans to acquire another bank and marketplace in Kazakhstan
summary: Freedom Holding Corp. CEO Timur Turlov announced plans to acquire another bank and a local marketplace in Kazakhstan, as well as a second-tier bank in Turkey. The company is considering issuing up to $500 million in bonds to finance these acquisitions and also plans to expand its SuperApp into a digital ecosystem in the U.S. Additionally, Freedom Holding aims to raise an extra $200-300 million for technology investments, including a sovereign AI hub with Nvidia.

title: How AI commerce threatens eBay, Amazon
summary: Agentic AI shopping robots pose a significant threat to traditional retail marketplaces like Amazon and eBay by enabling fully autonomous transactions without human involvement. eBay has updated its user agreement to block unauthorized agentic commerce tools, while concurrently developing its own in-house AI capabilities. Amazon has sued Perplexity AI for unauthorized access and is promoting its own AI shopping assistant, Rufus, highlighting a tension between controlling AI agents and embracing their potential benefits for customer experience.

title: What’s up with… Amdocs, AT&T & AWS, MásOrange & Starlink
summary: Amdocs has announced Shimie Hortig as its new CEO, effective March 31, 2026. AT&T is expanding its strategic agreements with Amazon Web Services and satellite operator Amazon Leo to migrate workloads and extend broadband services. Meanwhile, MásOrange in Spain is partnering with Starlink to conduct the country's first direct-to-cell service pilot in Valladolid.

title: Amazon stock price today: AMZN edges lower before earnings as AWS flags power delays
summary: Amazon shares saw a slight dip ahead of its quarterly earnings report, with investors closely watching the performance of AWS, particularly after its head of energy markets noted power grid connection delays in Europe. The company is also expanding its physical grocery presence to cut "last-mile" delivery costs, even as a broader market mixed sentiment and potential disappointment in AWS growth pose risks to the stock.

title: CoreWeave, IREN, Equinix, Other 'Terrestrial' Data Center Plays In Focus As Jim Chanos Slams 'Space' Narrative
summary: Renowned short-seller Jim Chanos is challenging the "data centers in space" narrative, asserting that if orbital computing is the future, then current terrestrial data center investments are "terminal shorts." He questions the economic viability of space-based solutions due to massive launch costs and server weight, while also expressing skepticism about the depreciation schedules of land-based hardware given rapid innovation. Companies like CoreWeave, IREN, Equinix, and Oracle are highlighted as key players in the terrestrial data center market that could be impacted by this debate.

title: GOOG stock price drops as Alphabet earnings loom and DOJ appeal adds fresh antitrust risk
summary: Alphabet Inc.'s stock (GOOG) dropped ahead of its Q4 earnings report, with investors concerned about the impact of the latest AI surge on software and data-analytics stocks, alongside a fresh antitrust appeal from the U.S. government. The company's earnings call is expected to focus on AI deployments and data center spending, with analysts anticipating EPS near $2.63 on revenue of roughly $111.3 billion. Concerns also stem from a recent judge's ruling on Google's monopoly in search, which will be appealed by the DOJ, adding to market jitters.

title: The Sound of Money: How Spotify Turned Audio Into Profit Power
summary: Spotify (NYSE: SPOT) is proving to be a dominant force in the audio entertainment sector, successfully decoupling its financial performance from the struggles of video streaming services. While its stock has seen a recent dip, Spotify's shift to a variable-cost model, expanding margins, and strategic bundling of music, podcasts, and audiobooks are driving strong profitability. The company's unique position as a utility, coupled with minimal churn after price increases and a savvy approach to video content through partnerships, indicates a robust long-term growth trajectory amidst short-term market fluctuations.

title: Cantor Fitzgerald initiates Jumia Technologies stock coverage with Overweight rating
summary: Cantor Fitzgerald has initiated coverage of Jumia Technologies (NYSE:JMIA) with an Overweight rating and an $18 price target, citing the company's potential as the "Amazon of Africa" in the undersaturated African e-commerce market. The firm views Jumia as a high-risk, high-reward investment, acknowledging its current unprofitability but highlighting its transformation into a focused e-commerce business. This follows Jumia's recent report of a 25% year-over-year revenue increase in Q3 2025 and significant growth during its Black Friday event.

title: Alphabet Q4 2025 preview. Is the pace of AI monetization sustainable?
summary: This article previews Alphabet's Q4 2025 earnings, focusing on whether the company can maintain its AI monetization pace and cloud growth. Key areas of investor scrutiny include the efficacy of AI products like Gemini, the sustained expansion of Google Cloud and YouTube, and the management of rising infrastructure costs. The report emphasizes that the upcoming results will test the quality and sustainability of Alphabet's strategic investments in AI and cloud computing against high market expectations.

title: Will Amazon's Q4 Earnings Benefit From Healthy AWS Momentum?
summary: Amazon's upcoming Q4 2025 earnings are expected to be positively impacted by the strong performance of its cloud service, Amazon Web Services (AWS). AWS is projected to report $35.02 billion in sales, indicating significant year-over-year growth, driven by strategic initiatives like Project Rainier and product innovations from the re:Invent conference, including new AI chips and processors. The company also boasts a growing backlog and increasing power capacity, signaling sustained demand and future revenue visibility.

title: Broadcom Inc. (AVGO): A Bull Case Theory
summary: This article summarizes a bullish thesis on Broadcom Inc. (AVGO), highlighting its strong position in semiconductors and enterprise software, particularly driven by AI-related demand. The company reported record revenue and significant growth in AI-specific products, maintaining strong operating income and free cash flow. Despite high valuation multiples, its cash generation, AI demand, and strategic hyperscale relationships justify its premium valuation.

title: 12 High Growth E-commerce Stocks To Buy
summary: This article identifies high-growth e-commerce stocks. It highlights Etsy, Inc. (NYSE:ETSY) as one such company, detailing its revenue growth, hedge fund interest, and recent leadership changes. An analyst from Stifel lowered Etsy's price target due to potential consumer pricing pressure in 2026, despite a healthy broader e-commerce market.

title: Penserra Capital Management LLC Purchases 313,008 Shares of IonQ, Inc. $IONQ
summary: Penserra Capital Management LLC has significantly increased its stake in IonQ, Inc. by purchasing an additional 313,008 shares, bringing its total ownership to 800,141 shares valued at approximately $49.2 million. The quantum computing company holds a consensus "Moderate Buy" rating from analysts with an average price target of $75.91, though its latest quarterly earnings significantly missed expectations despite strong revenue growth. Insider selling has also been noted, with executives reducing their holdings in recent months.

title: Hasbro and Amazon MGM Studios Join Forces to Launch New Voltron Movie Toys
summary: Hasbro has announced a new licensing collaboration with Amazon MGM Studios to produce action figures, toys, and roleplay items for the upcoming live-action Voltron movie. This partnership aims to leverage Hasbro's experience with iconic 80s brands to strengthen the Voltron franchise and engage both longtime fans and new audiences. The film, directed by Rawson Marshall Thurber, will feature a cast including Henry Cavill, Sterling K. Brown, Alba Baptista, and Rita Ora.

title: Fiber, cloud and satellites: AT&T and Amazon team up on US connectivity
summary: AT&T, Amazon Web Services (AWS), and Amazon Leo are collaborating to modernize the connectivity infrastructure in the United States. This partnership involves AT&T migrating its workloads to AWS, connecting AWS data centers with high-capacity fiber, and utilizing Amazon Leo's low Earth orbit satellites to expand AT&T's network capabilities. The goal is to create a more resilient, adaptive, and future-ready connectivity solution, leveraging AT&T's fiber network with AWS's cloud and AI expertise to deliver fixed broadband services to businesses.

title: New Voltron movie is getting toys: Hasbro tapped by Amazon MGM
summary: Hasbro has announced a new licensing collaboration with Amazon MGM Studios to produce action figures, toys, and roleplay items for the highly anticipated live-action Voltron movie. This partnership aims to leverage Hasbro's experience with legacy franchises to expand Voltron's reach and engage both existing and new fans. The upcoming film, directed by Rawson Marshall Thurber, will feature a cast including Henry Cavill and Sterling K. Brown.

title: Vital Farms stock hits 52-week low at 26.61 USD
summary: Vital Farms (VITL) stock has dropped to a 52-week low of $26.61, marking a 31.19% decline over the past year. Despite this, InvestingPro data indicates strong financial health with 23.56% revenue growth and suggests the company is undervalued, with analysts largely maintaining bullish outlooks. Upcoming earnings on March 5th are anticipated as stakeholders monitor the company's future trajectory amidst analyst adjustments following recent conferences.

title: Maplebear Inc. (CART): A Bull Case Theory
summary: This article summarizes a bullish thesis on Maplebear Inc. (CART), also known as Instacart, focusing on its strong Q3 2025 performance, profitability, and expansion in enterprise technology. Despite a recent stock price depreciation, the thesis highlights Instacart's competitive moat as a consumer marketplace and enterprise partner, with strategic moves to expand enterprise adoption and improve profitability. The company's financial health is underscored by increased GAAP net income, adjusted EBITDA, and operating cash flow, alongside a significant share repurchase authorization.

title: Amazon.com's (AMZN) 2026 Could Mark an AI Script Flip, Evercore Says
summary: Evercore ISI analyst Mark Mahaney reiterated an Outperform rating for Amazon (AMZN) with a $335.00 price target, predicting a shift from an AI laggard to an AI winner by 2026. Despite softer Amazon-specific sales indicators, Evercore ISI anticipates Amazon will meet Q4 revenue expectations of $211 billion and operating income of $24.6 billion, highlighting potential acceleration in revenue growth and operating margin expansion in 2026. The firm emphasizes key investor focus areas including AWS growth acceleration, retail unit-economics, advertising growth durability, and updated capital spending guidance.

title: Why International Stocks May Win Gold Again in 2026
summary: International stocks meaningfully outperformed US stocks in 2025, a trend that continued into early 2026, leading to significant inflows into international-equity funds. This shift is attributed to factors like Trump's trade policies, an improved macroeconomic backdrop in Europe, corporate governance reforms in Japan, and global AI beneficiaries. While skeptics note the historical dominance of US markets, valuation-driven investors see international markets as a reversion to the mean, offering attractive opportunities due to formerly suppressed valuations and the cyclical nature of market leadership.

title: Analysts Offer Insights on Consumer Cyclical Companies: Restaurant Brands International (QSR) and Amazon (AMZN)
summary: Two analysts have issued bullish ratings for companies in the Consumer Cyclical sector. Dennis Geiger from UBS maintained a Buy rating on Restaurant Brands International (QSR) with an $85.00 price target, seeing a 17.3% upside. Brian Pitz from BMO Capital maintained a Buy rating on Amazon (AMZN) with a $304.00 price target, suggesting a 24.7% upside.

title: C WorldWide Group Loads Up 45,000 MercadoLibre Shares Worth $94 Million
summary: C WorldWide Group Holding A/S significantly increased its stake in MercadoLibre (NASDAQ: MELI) by purchasing 44,747 additional shares, a transaction valued at approximately $93.99 million. This investment increased their total holdings to 53,411 shares, now representing 1.88% of the fund's U.S. equity assets under management. The move is seen as an opportunistic long-term play despite MercadoLibre's recent struggles, potentially benefiting from economic improvements in Latin America.

title: Gaxos.ai (GXAI) slips in premarket after AWS-backed rally — what traders watch at the open
summary: Gaxos.ai (GXAI) saw a 7% drop in premarket trading after a 40% surge caused by an announcement that Amazon Web Services (AWS) would fund initial development of an AI sales coaching tool. Investors are closely monitoring the timing, commercialization plans, and potential for share dilution. The sell-off highlights the volatility in thinly traded AI stocks, where news of major cloud players can dramatically impact market perception.

title: Earnings call transcript: Silicom’s Q4 2025 sees revenue beat, stock surges
summary: Silicom (SILC) reported a strong Q4 2025 performance, exceeding revenue and EPS forecasts, which led to a significant pre-market stock surge and continued growth. The company reported $16.9 million in revenue, a 17% year-over-year increase, and a loss of $0.34 per share, outperforming expectations. Silicom is also focusing on new growth engines in AI inference networking, post-quantum cryptography, and white label switching, with expectations for double-digit revenue growth in 2026.

title: 3 Reasons to Sell SEM and 1 Stock to Buy Instead
summary: This article recommends selling Select Medical Holdings (SEM) despite its recent stock gains, citing three core reasons: stalled sales volumes indicating waning demand, a continuous decline in EPS over the last five years, and a decrease in Return on Invested Capital (ROIC) suggesting fewer profitable growth opportunities. The author suggests looking into "the Amazon and PayPal of Latin America" as better investment alternatives and mentions other high-quality growth stocks that have outperformed the market.

title: Home Depot stock beats Wall Street selloff as investors eye the next HD earnings read
summary: Home Depot (HD) shares rose by 0.8% to $381.11, outperforming a wider market downturn driven by concerns over AI's impact on software and data stocks. The company is heading into a critical earnings period, with investors focusing on demand signals for large projects, its 2026 outlook of flat to 2% comparable sales growth, and upcoming fourth-quarter earnings report on February 24. Challenges include weak housing activity, pricing competition, and the impact of recent job cuts and a mandatory return-to-office policy aimed at improving agility.

title: WSBF's Q4 Earnings Jump 57% Y/Y on Margin Expansion, Credit Gains
summary: Waterstone Financial (WSBF) reported a significant 57.1% year-over-year increase in fourth-quarter 2025 net income to 44 cents per share, driven by margin expansion and credit gains. Both its Community Banking and Mortgage Banking segments showed strong performance, with the latter returning to profitability. The company's CEO highlighted improvements in net interest margin, deposit growth, and asset quality, contributing to a strong finish for 2025 and positive momentum for 2026.

title: Rep. David Taylor Buys Medpace Holdings, Inc. (NASDAQ:MEDP) Stock
summary: Representative David Taylor (R-Ohio) recently purchased between $1,001 and $15,000 worth of Medpace Holdings (NASDAQ:MEDP) stock on January 29, 2026, as disclosed on February 2. This purchase was part of several trades made by Taylor on that day, including buying shares in other major companies and selling stakes in others. Despite Taylor's acquisition, Medpace currently holds a "Reduce" consensus rating from analysts with an average price target of $491.27, and company insiders have recently sold a significant number of shares.

title: Rep. David Taylor Buys Prologis, Inc. (NYSE:PLD) Shares
summary: Representative David Taylor (R-Ohio) recently purchased shares of Prologis, Inc. (NYSE:PLD) valued between $1,001 and $15,000 on January 29th, as well as multiple other trades including buys of Microsoft, Broadcom, Amazon, Salesforce, and JPMorgan, and sales of Amgen, Vertex, and Procter & Gamble. Prologis reported strong quarterly results with EPS in line and revenue above estimates, and analysts maintain a "Moderate Buy" rating with an average target of $135.32. Institutional investors hold a significant stake in the company, with notable recent purchases by Norges Bank and Franklin Resources.

title: Rep. David Taylor Purchases Shares of Apple Inc. (NASDAQ:AAPL)
summary: Representative David Taylor (R-Ohio) recently purchased between $1,001 and $15,000 worth of Apple Inc. (NASDAQ:AAPL) stock on January 16th and made several other trades on January 29th, buying Microsoft, Broadcom, Amazon, Salesforce, Prologis, Installed Building Products, and Medpace, while selling Amgen, Vertex, and Procter & Gamble. This news comes after Apple reported strong quarterly earnings, beating expectations with an EPS of $2.84 and revenue of $143.76 billion, leading analysts to maintain a "Moderate Buy" rating with an average price target of $291.70. The report also details Apple's dividend announcement, stock performance metrics, and significant hedge fund activity, alongside mixed sentiment news regarding AI integration, talent drain, and supply chain concerns.

title: Prologis (NYSE:PLD) Stock Unloaded Rep. David Taylor
summary: Representative David Taylor (R-Ohio) recently sold between $1,001 and $15,000 worth of Prologis (NYSE:PLD) stock on January 16th and repurchased a similar amount on January 29th, alongside other trades. Prologis reported Q4 EPS in line with estimates and revenue above consensus, setting FY2026 guidance at $6.00-$6.20 EPS. The company maintains a "Moderate Buy" consensus from analysts with a target price of $135.32 and offers a 3.1% dividend yield.

title: Rosen Law Firm Encourages Simulations Plus, Inc. Investors to Inquire About Securities Class Action Investigation - SLP
summary: The Rosen Law Firm is investigating potential securities class action claims against Simulations Plus, Inc. (NASDAQ: SLP) following allegations that the company issued materially misleading business information. This investigation comes after Simulations Plus' stock significantly dropped on July 15, 2025, due to lower-than-expected third-quarter sales reported by Benzinga. Investors who purchased Simulations Plus securities are encouraged to contact the law firm to learn about their potential compensation rights in the prospective class action.

title: Josh D’Amaro Takes the Helm: A New Era for The Walt Disney Company
summary: Josh D’Amaro has been appointed as the new CEO of The Walt Disney Company, concluding a two-year selection process. D'Amaro, previously head of Disney's parks and consumer products, will succeed Bob Iger, with his tenure beginning March 18, 2026. Dana Walden has also been promoted to president and chief creative officer, reporting to D'Amaro, as Disney focuses on a strong succession plan after previous leadership challenges.

title: Plug Power Inc. (PLUG): A bull case theory
summary: This article presents a bullish case for Plug Power Inc. (PLUG), highlighting key aspects such as its position in the rapidly growing green hydrogen market, its comprehensive vertical integration strategy, and its significant market share in hydrogen fueling. It suggests that despite current challenges, Plug Power is well-positioned for long-term growth and profitability as renewable energy adoption accelerates. The company's expansion into new markets and strategic partnerships further solidify its potential for future success in the hydrogen economy.

title: AMTEK Stock Price Today | NYSE: AME Live
summary: This article provides live stock exchange data for Ametek Inc. (AME) on the NYSE, including its current stock price, historical data, and analyst ratings. It also details the company's Q4 2025 earnings which exceeded forecasts and highlights projections for future growth.

title: Akamai Stock: Quiet Cloud Veteran Suddenly Looks Like A Growth Story Again
summary: Akamai Technologies, traditionally a CDN provider, is transforming into a higher-margin cloud and security platform. The company's stock has seen significant gains, driven by strong earnings, analyst upgrades, and increasing demand for its security and compute services. Akamai's strategic shift to offer integrated security and edge computing, particularly for content-heavy and latency-sensitive applications, is re-positioning it as a growth story in the tech market.

title: Davis Selected Advisers boosts Amazon.com stake by 291,276 shares
summary: Davis Selected Advisers, managed by Chris Davis, has significantly increased its stake in Amazon.Com, Inc. (AMZN) by adding 291,276 shares. Despite a recent choppy and broadly flat stock performance, Wall Street analysts maintain a strong bullish outlook with an average 12-month price target implying substantial upside, driven by expected strong Q4 2025/early 2026 results, accelerating AWS growth, resilient retail demand, and expanding advertising business. TipRanks’ AI Analyst, Spark, rates AMZN as "Outperform" due to strong financials and positive earnings sentiment, though noting short-term technical weakness and premium valuation.

title: Amazon Web Services CEO Says Space-Based Data Centers 'Not Economical' Despite Jeff Bezos Pursuing The Idea
summary: The CEO of Amazon Web Services, Matt Garman, has stated that placing data centers in space is currently impractical and uneconomical, largely due to the high cost and logistical challenges of launching heavy equipment into orbit. This perspective stands despite the growing interest from tech giants like Amazon's Blue Origin and Alphabet, which are exploring orbital data center concepts to meet increasing AI computing demands. Garman emphasizes that while space offers benefits like continuous solar power and easier cooling, the lack of sufficient rockets and the massive expense make it a long-term, rather than immediate, solution.

title: Spotify stock slides 7% below $500 — Checkout.com deal and Feb. 10 earnings keep SPOT in focus
summary: Spotify (SPOT) shares dropped nearly 7% following an expanded deal with Checkout.com for global payment processing, as investors anticipate its Q4 earnings report on February 10th. The upcoming earnings will be scrutinized for insights into the impact of recent price hikes, subscriber churn, and overall margins, with competition from tech giants adding to market pressures. The stock's performance will be closely watched, particularly around the $464 support level.

title: AI Infrastructure ETF Shows Balance Sheet Strength
summary: New research from Alger indicates that the significant investments in AI infrastructure today are backed by stronger corporate balance sheets and better interest coverage ratios compared to the dot-com bubble era. The Alger AI Enablers & Adopters ETF (ALAI) invests in companies funding expansion through free cash flow rather than debt, attracting substantial inflows and returning 40.3% in 2025. This suggests a more sustainable and financially sound buildout of AI infrastructure.

title: Criteo stock hits 52-week low at $18.98 By Investing.com
summary: Criteo (CRTO) stock has fallen to a 52-week low of $18.98, marking a 49.54% decline over the past year due to challenges in the digital advertising industry and increased competition. Despite this, the company maintains a strong balance sheet and an attractive P/E ratio, with InvestingPro analysis suggesting it is significantly undervalued. Criteo is also undertaking a corporate restructuring, including a proposed domicile change from France to Luxembourg and a direct Nasdaq listing for its ordinary shares, while Stifel has reiterated a Buy rating with a $42 price target.

title: Alphabet (GOOGL) Q4 Earnings Preview: Can AI and cloud momentum sustain the $4 trillion valuation?
summary: Alphabet (GOOGL) is set to release its Q4 2025 earnings, with high investor expectations due to its stock's significant growth and $4 trillion market cap. The market will focus on whether heavy AI investments are translating into sustained revenue and margin improvements, specifically through AI monetization, Gemini integration, and Google Cloud's performance. Analysts expect strong revenue and EPS growth, but the market's reaction will hinge on guidance for 2026 amid increasing capital expenditures and regulatory scrutiny.

title: News | Landlord Simon Property expects to hike rents at former Saks Off 5th stores
summary: Simon Property Group anticipates a significant increase in rent from new tenants occupying former Saks Off 5th stores, despite writing off its $100 million investment in Saks Global. The mall owner expects a roughly 50% uptick in rents from these spaces, leveraging high demand for retail space. Simon Property also gained property and lease termination rights as part of its initial investment, providing additional control over its portfolio.

title: Amazon.com, Inc. Shs Unsponsored Canadian Depository Receipt Hedged Reg S Trade Ideas — FWB:AMZ0
summary: This article compiles several trade ideas and analyses for Amazon (AMZN) stock from various contributors on TradingView, covering technical setups, fundamental insights, and market sentiment, particularly in anticipation of upcoming earnings reports. Multiple perspectives are presented, including bullish outlooks based on institutional demand and AI growth, and cautious or bearish views stemming from technical patterns like rising wedges and liquidity sweeps. Key price levels, targets, and risk considerations are highlighted for potential traders.
