title: Amazon moving ahead with massive San Francisco parcel delivery facility after years of delay
summary: Amazon is proceeding with its plans for a 710,000-square-foot parcel delivery facility in San Francisco's Showplace Square neighborhood. The project, for which Amazon acquired land in late 2020 for over $200 million, had faced delays due to a Board of Supervisors moratorium. This development marks a significant step forward for the e-commerce giant's logistics presence in the city.

title: Cipher targets $2B HPC data center funding as BTC mining profitability continues to slip
summary: Cipher Mining's subsidiary, Black Pearl Compute LLC, is issuing $2 billion in senior secured notes to finance the construction of its 300-megawatt Black Pearl Facility in Wink, Texas. This move signifies Cipher's pivot from Bitcoin mining, which has become less profitable, to high-performance computing (HPC) and AI hosting. The company has already secured significant long-term leases with major tech companies, aiming for more stable, predictable revenue streams.

title: Macroeconomic Strength to Drive AeroVironment Inc’s (AVAV) Shareholder Returns
summary: KeyBanc analyst Michael Leshock raised AeroVironment Inc.'s (AVAV) price target from $285 to $330, maintaining a Buy rating and forecasting a 12.5% upside, driven by an expected attractive macroeconomic environment through 2026. The firm anticipates this environment will foster growth and potential re-ratings for space and defense technology stocks. Additionally, AeroVironment's division, UES, secured a $75 million task order from the United States Air Force to modernize defense systems with next-generation biotechnology materials science.

title: Amazon shares ‘a coiled spring’ going into Q4 report: UBS
summary: UBS analysts have raised their price target for Amazon to $311 from $310 and reiterated a 'Buy' rating ahead of the company's Q4 2025 earnings report. The optimism stems from increasing confidence in Amazon Web Services (AWS) growth, with expectations of AWS revenue doubling by 2028, and significant increases in capital expenditure forecasts for cloud and AI infrastructure. The firm also anticipates continued investor conviction as AWS growth accelerates and sees additional upside from e-commerce improvements and high-margin Prime Video advertising.

title: GXAI Shares Surged More Than 45% Today — What’s The Amazon Connection?
summary: Shares of Gaxos.AI Inc. (GXAI) surged over 45% after Amazon Web Services committed to funding the preliminary development of its AI-powered sales coaching platform, Gaxos Labs. This collaboration, which also involves cloud services company Caylent, is expected to enhance Gaxos.AI's credibility, future revenue generation, and strategic partnership opportunities. Retail sentiment on Stocktwits for GXAI shares shifted to "extremely bullish" following this announcement.

title: Star Bulk Carriers stock hits 52-week high at 23.27 USD
summary: Star Bulk Carriers Corp (SBLK) stock has reached a new 52-week high of $23.27, representing a surge of over 52% in the past year. This milestone is driven by strong market demand and favorable industry conditions in dry bulk cargo transportation. The company recently exceeded Wall Street expectations in its Q3 2025 earnings, further bolstering investor confidence.

title: Why Procter & Gamble stock is rising today while U.S. tech slides
summary: Procter & Gamble shares rose about 1.6% today, outperforming the U.S. stock market as investors shifted to defensive consumer staples away from sliding tech stocks. This rotation was influenced by concerns over tech valuations, potential disruptions from AI, and a U.S. government shutdown causing data blackouts. P&G is also preparing for its Feb. 17 dividend payment, and big-tech earnings later this week will likely determine if this defensive rotation continues.

title: New Upland BA Insight Platform Delivers Integrated AI Search Experiences for Enterprises
summary: Upland Software has launched the Upland BA Insight Platform, a new offering designed to provide integrated AI search experiences for enterprises. This platform incorporates SmartHub, ConnectivityHub, AutoClassifier, Smart Preview, and various connectors to deliver more connected, contextual, and actionable search results. Key features include Knowledge Graphs, Agentic Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG), and Amazon Q Business Integration, aiming to enhance AI-driven search securely and efficiently while allowing for traditional search utilization.

title: Should Investors Buy Amazon Stock Ahead of Q4 Earnings Release?
summary: Amazon (AMZN) is poised to report its fourth-quarter 2025 earnings, with projections for net sales between $206 billion and $213 billion, and an estimated EPS of $1.98. The company is expected to benefit from strong performance in AWS, generative AI capabilities, e-commerce, and advertising, despite a "stretched valuation." While Amazon has a strong earnings surprise history, its Earnings ESP suggests a potential miss this quarter, yet its strong Zacks Rank #2 indicates a favorable outlook for investors.

title: Will Kroger (KR) Beat Estimates Again in Its Next Earnings Report?
summary: Kroger (KR) is projected to beat its upcoming earnings estimates, continuing a streak of surpassing expectations. The company has a positive Zacks Earnings ESP of +0.52% and a Zacks Rank #3 (Hold), indicating a strong likelihood of another earnings beat. Investors should monitor the Earnings ESP and Zacks Rank to assess the potential for positive financial surprises.

title: Worldwide IT spending to grow 10.8 percent to $6.15 trillion in 2026, says Gartner
summary: Gartner forecasts worldwide IT spending to reach $6.15 trillion in 2026, marking a 10.8 percent increase from 2025, driven significantly by accelerated server and data center spending, especially for AI infrastructure. While software spending growth is slightly revised downward to 14.7 percent, it will remain above $1.4 trillion, with generative AI models expected to see an 80.8 percent growth. Device spending will reach $836 billion but growth will slow to 6.1 percent due to rising memory prices and market-demand constraints.

title: Dispersion
summary: Oaktree Capital believes the market is entering a new era of dispersion in financial asset performance, characterized by bifurcated outcomes for winners and losers despite buoyant index averages. The article highlights divergences in the U.S. economy ("k-shaped" recovery), equity performance heavily driven by AI stocks, and significant dispersion in credit markets between healthy and struggling names. This trend necessitates a nuanced, selective investment approach rather than relying on broad market averages.

title: What's Going On With Gaxos.AI Stock Today?
summary: Shares of Gaxos.ai (NASDAQ: GXAI) surged after Amazon Web Services committed to funding the preliminary development of its AI-powered sales coaching platform. This collaboration, supported by AWS partner Caylent, will create a real-time AI sales platform with live call transcription, automated coaching, and post-call analytics. Additionally, Gaxos.ai aims to raise $3 million through an at-the-market stock offering with H.C. Wainwright.

title: Broadcom Launches Wi-Fi 8 System To Fix AI Networking Headaches
summary: Broadcom (NASDAQ: AVGO) has launched its first Wi-Fi 8 access point and switch solution specifically designed for AI-driven enterprise networks. This new platform, featuring the BCM49438 chip with AI acceleration and enhanced security, aims to optimize wireless networking and AI processing. Analysts are optimistic about Broadcom's market position, driven by increasing AI adoption and demand for custom silicon from hyperscalers.

title: You'll Never Guess the Top-Performing Stock of the 21st Century
summary: Monster Beverage (MNST) has been identified as the top-performing stock of the 21st century, outperforming tech giants like Nvidia, Apple, and Amazon with returns of 179,800% (and recently 197,800%). Its success is attributed to strategic partnerships, such as the distribution deal with Coca-Cola, and a key advantage: a significantly lower research and development budget compared to large tech companies, allowing more capital for shareholder rewards. This lean operational model has compounded over the decades, placing Monster Beverage in a unique position in market history.

title: Boom continues as Fabrinet posts 36% surge in sales revenues
summary: Fabrinet, a Bangkok-based contract manufacturer, announced record-breaking sales of $1.13 billion for the final quarter of 2025, a 36% increase year-over-year, driven by strong demand for photonics components in AI data centers. The company is significantly expanding its manufacturing capacity in Thailand and is focused on emerging technologies like co-packaged optics (CPO) and optical circuit switches (OCS) to sustain growth. Despite a recent dip in stock price due to geopolitical concerns, Fabrinet remains confident in continued sales boom.

title: BTIG Flags Mortgage Policy Tailwind for Dynex Capital, Inc. (DX)
summary: BTIG has identified Dynex Capital, Inc. (NYSE: DX) as a top pick, citing a potential boost from President Trump's directive for government-sponsored enterprises to purchase up to $200 billion in mortgage-backed securities. This policy is expected to narrow agency MBS spreads, which BTIG projects could increase Dynex's mark-to-market net asset value by about 8%. The firm maintains a Buy rating on DX with a $16 price target, following Dynex's strong 2025 performance, including a 29.4% total shareholder return and a significant increase in book value per common share.

title: Barclays Initiates Coverage on Apple Hospitality REIT, Inc. (APLE) as Hotel REITs Face Long-Term Skepticism
summary: Barclays has initiated coverage on Apple Hospitality REIT, Inc. (APLE) with an Overweight rating and a $14 price target, viewing hotel REITs as a short-term trading space rather than a source of long-term excess returns. The firm favors companies with clear business strategies and strong balance sheets, a description that fits Apple Hospitality, which owns 221 upscale, room-focused hotels across 37 states. Despite the positive coverage, the article suggests that certain AI stocks may offer greater upside potential and less risk compared to APLE.

title: RBC Capital Says Agree Realty Corporation (ADC)’s Q4 Deal Activity Remains Within Guidance
summary: RBC Capital reaffirmed an Outperform rating on Agree Realty Corporation (ADC) while slightly trimming its price target to $79 from $80. The firm noted that Q4 acquisitions were slightly below expectations but still within management's guidance, and cap rates met their projections. Agree Realty has a strong dividend history, consistently increasing payouts annually since the 2008-09 financial crisis, and plans to invest up to $1.65 billion in real estate in 2025, supported by long-term tenant leases.

title: Rep. David Taylor Has Bought Up to $345K Worth Of Amazon.com Stock: Here's What You Should Know
summary: Representative David Taylor recently purchased Amazon.com stock, with the value estimated between $23,023 and $345,000, according to a February 2, 2026 report. This transaction occurred on January 29, 2026. The article also highlights the importance of congressional transactions as a factor for investors, noting that members of Congress are prohibited from using private information for personal gain under the STOCK Act.

title: Gaxos.AI Partners with Amazon Web Services for AI Sales Platform
summary: Gaxos.AI Inc. (GXAI) shares surged over 45% following the announcement of a partnership with Amazon Web Services (AWS) for its new AI sales platform, Gaxos Labs. This platform, built on AWS-native infrastructure, will feature live call transcription, automated coaching, and post-call analytics to enhance sales team performance. The collaboration has generated strong market optimism, shifting retail sentiment from bearish to extremely bullish on Stocktwits.

title: Intuit stock drops nearly 12% as AI fears sweep software — what investors watch next
summary: Intuit shares fell almost 12% amid widespread selloff in software stocks, driven by renewed concerns about AI-driven disruption, despite a recent deal with Affirm. Investors are now scrutinizing software companies as vulnerable to AI tools and watching Intuit's fiscal second-quarter earnings on February 26 for guidance and AI monetization insights. This market reaction suggests that some fear AI could commoditize tasks like tax preparation and bookkeeping, impacting software sector valuations.

title: Linde's (LIN) Global Expansion and Hydrogen Strategy Shape Its Long-Term Outlook
summary: Linde plc (LIN) is strategically expanding its global footprint and investing significantly in clean energy, particularly hydrogen solutions. The company has a strong track record of dividend increases and is preparing for broader adoption of hydrogen technology, despite management's view that the market needs more time to mature. Recent achievements include building a renewable hydrogen plant for Shell and acquiring Airtec in the Middle East.

title: Google and V2X bring secure AI to U.S. national security missions
summary: V2X (NYSE: VVX) announced a partnership with Google Public Sector to deploy secure, accredited AI and cloud solutions for U.S. defense and intelligence agencies. This collaboration will integrate Google’s generative AI within V2X’s secure, on-premises environments, adhering to strict security and data governance standards. The initiative aims to enhance operational speed, mission resilience, and modernized digital infrastructure for national security operations through applications like multi-modal data analysis, training and simulation, and optimized logistics.

title: Is Wall Street Bullish or Bearish on NRG Energy Stock?
summary: NRG Energy, an energy and home services company, has outperformed the S&P 500 over the past year despite a 6.4% decline in early 2026. Analysts maintain a "Moderate Buy" consensus for NRG stock, with a mean price target suggesting a significant upside. The company's strong Q3 2025 results and consistent earnings beats further support a bullish outlook.

title: What Inseego is bringing to the world’s largest connectivity event
summary: Inseego (Nasdaq: INSG) announced its participation in Mobile World Congress Barcelona (MWC 2026) from March 2-5, 2026, where it will showcase 5G-Advanced hardware, cloud software, and edge connectivity solutions. The company plans to demonstrate commercially available devices, highlight its Inseego Subscribe SaaS platform, and hold executive meetings and product demonstrations, emphasizing its leadership in 5G mobile broadband and fixed wireless access. This announcement aligns with Inseego's recent focus on ecosystem partnerships and visibility events, including prior FWA deals and corporate milestones.

title: Amazon AWS Funds Gaxos AI Sales Platform Development
summary: Amazon Web Services (AWS) has committed to funding the preliminary development of Gaxos Labs' AI-powered sales coaching platform. This collaboration, with development partner Caylent, aims to create a scalable, AWS-native platform featuring live call transcription, automated coaching intelligence, and post-call analytics. Gaxos expects this AWS support to significantly advance its roadmap, enhance credibility, and open doors for future commercial opportunities and strategic partnerships in the multibillion-dollar sales technology market.

title: December CRE deal volume sinks further, but office is a surprising bright spot
summary: Commercial real estate deal volume dropped 20% in December year over year, though the full year 2025 saw a 17% increase compared to 2024. A surprising bright spot was the office sector, with deal volume up 21% due to return-to-office mandates and AI employment growth. Moody's analysis indicates a resilient recovery in 2025 despite economic challenges, with investor interest shifting towards Class A office assets, multifamily and retail, and significant growth in alternative property sectors and larger dollar deals.

title: OpenAI Trashes Nvidia
summary: OpenAI is reportedly dissatisfied with Nvidia's latest AI chips and is actively seeking alternatives, complicating the relationship between the two dominant players in the artificial intelligence market. This tension may also be linked to Nvidia's alleged reluctance to participate in a $100 billion investment round for OpenAI, suggesting a potential erosion of belief in OpenAI's future valuation. The move signals a new chapter in the escalating competition for AI supremacy, with other tech giants like Amazon, Google, and Microsoft also developing their own AI chip solutions.

title: Nine Out of Ten Costco Members Renew: Inside the Metric That Powers a $14B Profit Engine
summary: Costco boasts an impressive membership renewal rate of 92.3% in the US and Canada, and 89.8% worldwide, which is central to its profitable business model. Membership fees are nearly pure profit, subsidizing low merchandise margins and driving a significant portion of the company's income and sales. The company is seeing growth in executive memberships and is actively acquiring younger members online, who, despite slightly lower initial renewal rates, represent long-term value.

title: Wells Fargo and Bernstein upgrade FedEx ahead of investor day next week
summary: Wells Fargo and Bernstein have upgraded FedEx stock to overweight, citing overlooked value and potential for growth ahead of the company's investor day next week. Both firms highlighted improving parcel fundamentals, the freight spin, and potential profit upside in FedEx's Express business as key drivers. Price targets were significantly raised, reflecting an expected rally for the stock.

title: Amazon backs Gaxos.ai’s AI coach for high-stakes sales calls
summary: Amazon Web Services (AWS) has committed to fund the preliminary development of an AI-powered sales coaching platform by Gaxos.ai (NASDAQ: GXAI), selecting Caylent as the development partner. This initiative aims to create an AWS-native platform with features like live call transcription and automated coaching intelligence for enterprise deployment. The news led to a significant 69.15% surge in GXAI's stock, despite no specific financial terms being disclosed and the project currently being in early development.

title: Gen Digital Inc. $GEN Position Increased by National Pension Service
summary: National Pension Service increased its stake in Gen Digital Inc. (NASDAQ:GEN) by 26.1% in the third quarter, now owning 822,756 shares valued at $23.36 million. This move is part of a broader trend where institutional investors, including Amundi, Arrowstreet Capital, and Vanguard Group, have significantly increased their positions in the cybersecurity company, collectively owning about 81.38% of the stock. Gen Digital also reported strong Q3 earnings, beating estimates with $0.62 EPS and $1.22 billion in revenue, and provided optimistic FY 2026 guidance.

title: Cipher Mining Inc Announces $2 Billion Senior Secured Notes Offering
summary: Cipher Mining Inc. announced a $2 billion offering of senior secured notes due in 2031. The funds will be used by Black Pearl Compute LLC to finance its facility and reimburse prior capital expenditures. Amazon Data Services will lease 100% of Black Pearl's capacity.

title: Caylent Collaborates with Gaxos.ai and AWS to Develop AI-Powered Sales Coaching Platform
summary: Gaxos.ai Inc. has partnered with Caylent and Amazon Web Services (AWS) to develop an AI-powered sales coaching platform. AWS is funding the initial development, which will focus on creating an AWS-native infrastructure for scalability and efficiency, incorporating features like live call transcription and automated coaching. This collaboration aims to validate Gaxos's platform, enhance its credibility, and open up significant commercial opportunities in the sales technology market.

title: Fubo Delivers Strong Q1 FY 2026 Results Following Hulu + Live TV Business Combination
summary: Fubo reported strong Q1 FY2026 results, with revenue reaching $1.549 billion, a 40% increase year-over-year, following its business combination with Hulu + Live TV. The company significantly narrowed its net loss and saw improved pro forma adjusted EBITDA, while also announcing a strategic reseller and marketing agreement with ESPN. These results highlight Fubo's growth and improved financial performance after the merger.

title: Maplebear (CART) Faces Marketplace Competition but Expands AI-Powered Caper Cart Rollout
summary: Maplebear Inc. (NASDAQ: CART) is expanding its AI-powered Caper Carts rollout despite facing marketplace competition, which led Stifel to reduce its price target to $46. The company, operating as Instacart, is strengthening its partnership with Allegiance Retail Services to improve technological solutions for independent grocers. While acknowledging CART's growth potential, the article suggests other AI stocks may offer higher returns and lower risk, promoting a paid report on a more promising AI investment.

title: SPY ETF Daily Update, 2/3/2026
summary: The SPDR S&P 500 ETF Trust (SPY) saw a 0.29% increase in pre-market trading, driven by a potential U.S.–India trade deal and strong earnings from Palantir and Teradyne. Key catalysts for the week include earnings reports from Amazon and Alphabet, which will serve as an "AI earnings stress test," and labor market data releases. Analysts give SPY a Moderate Buy rating with an average upside potential of 16.88%.

title: UBS Maintains Buy on Amazon.com, Inc. (AMZN) Feb 02, 2026
summary: UBS reaffirmed its Buy rating for Amazon (AMZN) on February 2, 2026, citing strong cloud demand and ongoing AI investments, as summarized by StreetInsider. The firm did not issue a new price target, implying a confirmation of its prior conviction rather than an upgrade or downgrade. The market reaction was modest, with investors focusing on AWS growth, AI adoption, and margin trends.

title: Jim Cramer on Amazon: "Lost in the Shuffle Is the Greatness of the Company Itself"
summary: Jim Cramer expressed his belief in Amazon (AMZN) despite its recent volatile stock performance, emphasizing the underlying "greatness of the company itself." He highlighted Amazon Web Services' accelerated growth, the company's investment in Anthropic, and the continued strong performance of its retail business, underscoring how Amazon's AI infrastructure investments are directly driving revenue. Cramer anticipates significant gains for AMZN in 2026, noting a recent stock surge.

title: Amazon’s 13B same-day and next-day drops in 2025 saved U.S. Prime members $550
summary: Amazon announced a new Prime delivery speed record in 2025, with over 13 billion items delivered globally arriving the same or next day. U.S. Prime members received over 8 billion items same or next day, saving an average of $550 each and collectively $105 billion worldwide on fast, free delivery. The company achieved this by expanding its geographic reach, increasing perishable grocery selection, expanding prescription delivery, and utilizing AI for inventory management, significantly enhancing the value of a Prime membership.

title: Amazon Sets New Prime Delivery Speed Record in 2025 With Over 13 Billion Items Arriving the Same or Next Day Around the World
summary: Amazon announced it delivered over 13 billion items worldwide the same or next day in 2025, setting a new Prime delivery speed record for the third consecutive year. U.S. Prime members received over 8 billion items same or next day, saving an average of $550 on fast, free delivery. The company achieved this by expanding geographic reach, integrating perishable groceries into Same-Day Delivery, and leveraging AI models for inventory placement.

title: Lumentum stock jumps into earnings day as LITE traders brace for after-bell report
summary: Lumentum (LITE) shares surged by 8.1% before its fiscal second-quarter earnings report, driven by heightened expectations and strong demand in data centers, particularly for AI-driven hardware. Investors are keenly awaiting guidance to assess whether data-center investments are yielding positive results. The report will provide critical insights into shipment schedules, product mix, and margins, serving as a benchmark for the optical and networking sector.

title: Amazon Plans to Cut 2,200 More Corporate Jobs in Washington
summary: Amazon (AMZN) is planning to cut an additional 2,200 corporate jobs in Washington state, building on previous global layoffs. CEO Andy Jassy states these reductions, totaling approximately 57,000 jobs since 2021, are aimed at streamlining operations and increasing efficiency rather than being driven by financial hardship or AI. The company expects to discuss AWS margins, e-commerce growth, and efficiency improvements in its upcoming earnings reports.

title: Amazon delivered 8 billion items to its US Prime members in less than 2 days last year
summary: Amazon announced that its US Prime members received 8 billion items in less than two days last year, a 30% increase from 2024, as the company prioritizes faster delivery. Globally, Prime members received 13 billion items in under two days. Amazon continues to invest in expanding its same-day and next-day delivery services, even as competitors like Walmart also enhance their delivery networks.

title: V2X (VVX) partners with Amazon for AI models on government warehouses
summary: V2X (VVX) has partnered with Amazon to deploy AI models in government warehouses. This collaboration aims to leverage Amazon's AI capabilities to enhance operations within critical government infrastructure. The initiative is expected to improve efficiency and decision-making in warehouse management through advanced technology.

title: Natural Gas Player EQT (EQT) Projects Gaining $114M from Derivatives for Q4 2025
summary: EQT Corporation (NYSE: EQT) expects to gain $114 million from derivatives and receive $35 million in net cash settlements for Q4 2025. These gains include $44 million from NYMEX natural gas hedge positions, offset by $9 million in cash settlements paid on basis and liquids hedge positions. Analyst ratings for EQT included two Holds with price targets of $50 and $62, and one Buy with a $69 price target.

title: Earnings call transcript: 1-800-FLOWERS.COM beats Q2 2026 EPS forecast
summary: 1-800-FLOWERS.COM (FLWS) reported a Q2 2026 EPS of $1.20, significantly exceeding the forecast of $0.86, with revenue marginally surpassing expectations at $702.2 million. Despite a 9.5% consolidated revenue decline year-over-year, largely due to a 22.7% drop in the Consumer Floral & Gifts segment, the company's stock rose 6.93% in pre-market trading. The company is focusing on cost savings, operational efficiency, and a refined marketing strategy while anticipating a low double-digit revenue decline for H2 2026, alongside a slight increase in normalized Adjusted EBITDA.

title: Earnings call transcript: Celestica Q4 2025 EPS beats but stock slides
summary: Celestica Inc. (CLS) reported Q4 2025 EPS of $2.56 and revenue of $4.95 billion, exceeding analyst forecasts of $2.42 and $4.82 billion respectively. Despite the strong performance, the stock declined 10.7% in after-hours trading, closing at $403.89. The company also raised its 2026 revenue outlook to $17 billion, anticipating significant growth driven by demand in communications and AI/ML compute markets, and announced substantial capital investments to expand manufacturing capacity.

title: Williams-Sonoma stock hits 52-week high at 219.72 USD
summary: Williams-Sonoma Inc. (WSM) reached a 52-week high of $219.72, signaling strong market performance, despite its current price of $217.06 suggesting overvaluation. The company boasts a 1-year return of 6.29% and a year-to-date return of 20.22%, with 20 consecutive years of dividend increases, currently yielding 1.23%. While analysts have adjusted price targets due to tariff concerns, the company recently announced a cash dividend of $0.66 per share and reported significant Q3 sales growth, reflecting investor confidence.

title: Walmart’s new CEO asks workers to air complaints in first memo
summary: John Furner, Walmart's new CEO, has issued his first companywide memo since taking over on February 1st, asking employees to share what hinders their work. He plans to visit stores and facilities globally to gather direct feedback from workers. This initiative aims to identify and remove obstacles, similar to approaches taken by CEOs at Amazon and JPMorgan Chase, as Walmart focuses on integrating AI and maintaining its market valuation.

title: Where is Walmart Inc. (WMT) Headed?
summary: Walmart Inc. (WMT) is considered a strong long-term, low-volatility investment. UBS recently raised its price target for WMT to $135 with a Buy rating. Walmart is also expanding its presence in the Health & Wellness domain by investing in pharmacy associates, elevating 3,000 roles to team lead positions with increased pay, and strengthening digital offerings to compete with companies like Amazon in the pharmacy market.

title: First BanCorp. (FBP) Hit a 52 Week High, Can the Run Continue?
summary: First BanCorp. (FBP) recently reached a new 52-week high, with its stock up 6% over the past month and 8.5% since the start of the year. The company has a strong record of positive earnings surprises and holds a Zacks Rank of #2 (Buy), suggesting potential for further gains. Valuation metrics like its P/E and P/CF ratios are favorable compared to its industry peers.

title: O'Reilly (ORLY) To Report Earnings Tomorrow: Here Is What To Expect
summary: O'Reilly Automotive (ORLY) is scheduled to report its earnings tomorrow after the bell. Analysts expect the company's revenue to grow 7.3% year-on-year to $4.39 billion, with adjusted earnings projected at $0.72 per share. The stock has seen positive investor sentiment in the automotive retail segment, with its share price up 7.8% over the last month.

title: Analysts Offer Insights on Consumer Cyclical Companies: Amazon (AMZN) and Autoliv (ALV)
summary: Two consumer cyclical companies, Amazon (AMZN) and Autoliv (ALV), have recently received bullish sentiments from analysts. Jefferies maintained a Buy rating on Amazon with a $300.00 price target, while Barclays maintained a Buy rating on Autoliv with a $140.00 price target. The average analyst consensus for Amazon is a Strong Buy, and for Autoliv, it is a Moderate Buy.

title: ACI Worldwide Report: Global Refund Volumes Surge 18% as Retailers Tighten Returns
summary: A new report from ACI Worldwide reveals that global retail refund volumes increased by 18.1% in 2025, with a 12.7% rise in refund value, despite significant eCommerce growth. The holiday season saw a sharp peak in returns, putting pressure on retail margins. Retailers are now focusing on AI-driven solutions to manage returns and fraud more effectively, balancing loss prevention with customer experience.

title: AMAZON COM INC : Buy rating from UBS
summary: UBS analyst Stephen Ju has reiterated a Buy rating for Amazon.com, Inc. (AMZN). The target price for the stock remains largely unchanged at USD 310, a slight adjustment from the previous USD 311, indicating continued confidence in the company's attractiveness.

title: Should Winmark’s (WINA) S&P Index Additions and Dividend Hike Require Action From Investors?
summary: Winmark Corporation's recent inclusion in multiple S&P indices and its approved quarterly dividend of US$0.96 per share enhance the company's visibility and liquidity, particularly for institutional and income-focused investors. While these developments strengthen Winmark's investment narrative by attracting new shareholders, they do not mitigate underlying risks like high leverage and a dividend not fully covered by free cash flow. Investors should consider these financial challenges and the stock's valuation, which is currently above some fair value estimates, despite the increased market presence.

title: KeyBanc remains bullish on Amazon.com (AMZN) amid improved FY26 and FY27 estimates
summary: KeyBanc has reiterated its Overweight rating and $200 price target for Amazon.com (AMZN), citing improved estimates for fiscal years 2026 and 2027. The firm anticipates strong growth momentum, particularly driven by AWS reacceleration and advertising expansion. KeyBanc's financial models show a substantial increase in Amazon's EBITDA due to these factors.

title: V2X (VVX) Partners with Amazon for AI Models on Government Warehouses
summary: V2X Inc. (VVX) has partnered with Amazon to deploy Amazon's warehouse automation technology and computer-vision AI models in V2X-managed government warehouses. This collaboration aims to streamline workflows and inventory management for federal agencies. The partnership follows a recent downgrade of V2X stock by Truist due to valuation concerns, despite the company's recent share price increase.

title: KeyBanc Remains Bullish on Amazon.com (AMZN) Amid Improved FY26 and FY27 Estimates
summary: KeyBanc analyst Justin Patterson reiterated an Overweight rating and increased his price target for Amazon.com (AMZN) to $308, citing improved revenue and EPS projections for 2026 and 2027. The firm believes the market understates AWS re-acceleration and overestimates risks from agentic commerce, making Amazon a top large-cap idea in Internet and Retail. Despite recent layoffs aimed at efficiency, Amazon's cloud and consumer ecosystems continue to show strong momentum.

title: The Truth About Costco Wholesale Corp.: Why Everyone Is Obsessed With This Stock Right Now
summary: This article explores why Costco Wholesale Corp. (COST) stock is generating significant buzz, driven by its unique membership model, strong price performance, and quiet technological advancements. It delves into Costco's competitive advantages against rivals like Walmart and Amazon, highlighting its steady growth and loyal customer base. The piece concludes with an analysis of whether Costco stock is a valuable long-term investment despite its current high valuation, advising potential investors to consider their risk tolerance and investment horizon.

title: Arm Holdings (ARM) Is Down 6.8% After Record AI Deals With Meta, Apple, AWS, Google
summary: Arm Holdings (ARM) experienced a 6.8% stock drop despite reporting its best-ever quarter and announcing significant AI collaborations with Meta, Apple, AWS, and Google. These deals reinforce Arm's central role in AI infrastructure, but the stock's rich earnings multiple and reliance on large AI customers present risks. The article advises investors to consider various perspectives and conduct thorough research before investing.

title: National HealthCare Corp stock hits all-time high at 146.95 USD
summary: National HealthCare Corp (NHC) stock has reached an all-time high of $146.95, reflecting a 44.44% increase over the past year and a 52.83% gain in the last six months. The company's strong financial performance, including 22.67% revenue growth and 22 consecutive years of dividend payments, has contributed to investor confidence. InvestingPro analysis suggests the stock is currently trading near its Fair Value, and the company recently announced a quarterly dividend of 64 cents per common share.

title: Why Elastic Could Be the Next AI Winner in 2026
summary: Elastic N.V. (NYSE: ESTC), known for its AI-powered search and analytics tools, is positioned for a strong comeback in 2026 despite a recent share price decline. The company has launched key product upgrades like Elastic Cloud Serverless and Agent Builder, demonstrating strong fundamentals with increased revenue and subscription growth, and analysts are generally bullish with significant price target upside. Despite competition and potential volatility, Elastic's valuation discount and strategic advancements suggest it could emerge as an AI search leader.

title: Denali to outline enzyme delivery to the brain in 2026 WORLDSymposium webcast
summary: Denali Therapeutics (Nasdaq: DNLI) will host a live webcast on Thursday, February 5, 2026, to discuss presentations previously delivered at the 22nd Annual WORLDSymposium. The webcast will highlight the company's Enzyme TransportVehicle (ETV) programs, focusing on their potential to deliver enzyme replacement therapies across the entire body, including the brain. This event provides further visibility into Denali's platform, following recent positive market reactions to milestones and funding, and will be accessible via their investor website.

title: Wedbush Reiterates Outperform on Amazon (AMZN) Ahead of Earnings
summary: Wedbush has reiterated an Outperform rating on Amazon (AMZN) with a $340 price target, driven by strong AWS momentum and a robust Q4 setup. The firm anticipates a significant year for AWS in 2026, which could serve as a catalyst for shares, and sees attractive risk-reward ahead of Amazon's fourth-quarter earnings report. Wedbush forecasts a Q4 operating income of $25.2 billion and a full-year operating income of $103.0 billion, making Amazon its top eCommerce pick for 2026.

title: AMZN stock $242.96 close 02 Feb 2026 Amazon.com, Inc. (NASDAQ): AWS margins in focus
summary: Amazon (AMZN) closed at $242.96 on February 2, 2026, ahead of its earnings report on February 5, 2026. Key focuses for investors include AWS operating margins, North America revenue growth, and advertising momentum. Meyka AI rates AMZN a B+ (BUY) with a projected monthly price of $245.78, though it forecasts a yearly downside to $214.11.

title: T-Mobile lays off hundreds of Washington workers amid 'changing business needs'
summary: T-Mobile has announced new layoffs affecting 393 employees in Washington, primarily in senior and managerial roles. This follows a previous round of 131 layoffs in August. The Bellevue-based company cited "changing business needs" as the reason for the job cuts.

title: The Bull Case For Bio-Techne (TECH) Could Change Following New Synthetic Organoid ECM And Neuro Biomarker Tools
summary: Bio-Techne has launched new Cultrex Synthetic Hydrogel for 3D stem cell and organoid research and ultra-sensitive Simple Plex assays for neurodegenerative biomarker detection. While these innovations reinforce Bio-Techne's position in high-value research areas, they may not immediately alter the company's near-term outlook of modest revenue growth and compressed profit margins. The article suggests that execution on these product launches will be crucial for influencing investor perception, especially given the company's current valuation.

title: Dow joins a growing list of companies announcing layoffs
summary: Dow is planning to cut approximately 4,500 jobs, citing an increased emphasis on artificial intelligence and automation. This move is expected to incur $600 million to $800 million in severance costs as part of a broader plan to simplify operations. Shares of Dow Inc. fell 2% following the announcement, joining other major companies like Amazon and UPS in recent large-scale layoffs.

title: TSMC’s US$165b US Chip Bet And The New Taiwan US Tariff Deal
summary: TSMC is investing US$165 billion in new semiconductor factories in the U.S., a move complemented by a new U.S.-Taiwan trade agreement that reduces tariffs on key tech products. This substantial investment is part of a larger US$250 billion push by Taiwanese corporations into American semiconductor and AI sectors, aiming to secure production closer to end markets and critical customers. For investors, this development raises considerations regarding capital intensity, policy risks, and the long-term balance between Taiwan-based and U.S.-based manufacturing capacity.

title: Alphabet GOOG stock closes higher after-hours as Waymo lands $16B round and earnings loom
summary: Alphabet's (GOOG) Class C shares rose 1.9% after Waymo, its self-driving car unit, announced a $16 billion funding round valuing it at $126 billion. This news comes just before Alphabet's earnings report, where investors will be looking for how new AI features will impact revenue and costs. Analysts like Jefferies have raised price targets for Alphabet, but the stock remains sensitive to future advertising or cloud outlooks and autonomous driving developments.

title: Cathie Wood Doubles Down on Amazon Stock Ahead of Earnings
summary: Cathie Wood's ARK Invest has increased its stake in Amazon (AMZN) by purchasing 8,088 shares valued at approximately $1.9 million, just days before Amazon is set to report its fourth-quarter earnings. Analysts anticipate Amazon to post earnings of $1.97 per share, with revenue expected to climb by about 13% to $211 billion. This move follows Amazon's strong third-quarter performance, driven by Amazon Web Services, and comes as analysts like Wedbush maintain a "Buy" rating and a $340 price target for the stock.

title: How Investors Are Reacting To Advanced Drainage Systems (WMS) Rising Earnings Optimism Despite Softer Revenue Expectations
summary: Advanced Drainage Systems (WMS) is seeing increased analyst optimism for its upcoming December 2025 earnings, with expectations for higher year-over-year earnings despite softer revenue. This positive sentiment, driven by a "Most Accurate Estimate" exceeding the "Consensus Estimate," highlights a focus on margins and capital discipline. However, investors are cautioned to consider the company's premium valuation and recent insider selling, suggesting the news might offer only a short-term confidence boost without changing the broader risk profile.

title: Amazon sets new Prime delivery speed record in 2025
summary: In 2025, Amazon achieved its fastest-ever delivery speeds for Prime members globally for the third consecutive year, delivering over 13 billion items the same or next day. U.S. Prime members received over 8 billion items same or next day, a 30% increase from the previous year, with groceries and everyday essentials making up half of these deliveries. This record speed, coupled with expanded geographic reach and selection, saved U.S. members an average of $550, reinforcing the value of a Prime membership.

title: Dialysis Demand Delivers: DaVita’s Q4 2025 Results Reinforce Growth Story
summary: DaVita Inc. (NYSE: DVA) announced strong financial and operating results for Q4 and the full year 2025, with revenue of $3.62 billion and an adjusted EPS of $3.40 for the quarter. The company demonstrated efficiency through increased Revenue Per Treatment and cost discipline, maintaining resilient operating margins. DaVita also provided an aggressive 2026 guidance, projecting adjusted EPS significantly higher than analyst estimates, signaling strong future growth and a commitment to shareholder returns through share repurchases.

title: Amazon’s AI Shift With OpenAI Talks And Layoffs Meets Undervaluation Concerns
summary: Amazon is reportedly in preliminary discussions to invest up to $50 billion in OpenAI, alongside announcing layoffs of over 16,000 corporate employees as part of a strategic shift towards an AI-powered organization. This move highlights Amazon's focus on integrating AI across its diverse operations including e-commerce, cloud computing (AWS), and advertising, while also addressing concerns about its current stock undervaluation. Investors are advised to monitor how this significant AI spending and workforce adjustment will impact the company's margins and earnings trajectory.

title: Amazon stock (AMZN) climbs after-hours as earnings loom and fresh filing hits tape
summary: Amazon's stock (AMZN) rose 1.5% in after-hours trading as investors anticipate its upcoming quarterly earnings report, which will offer insights into cloud demand and AI costs. The company's results are a key indicator for corporate IT budgets and consumer spending. Investors are also monitoring Amazon's capital spending, recent job cuts, and an extension request for its satellite broadband project.

title: Scaling Automation Without Complexity: Strategies for Streamlined Growth
summary: This article discusses strategies for scaling automation effectively without introducing unnecessary complexity. It emphasizes starting with simple, high-volume tasks, empowering citizen developers, and using cloud-native architectures. The author also highlights the importance of centralizing control, standardizing processes before automating, and leveraging AI to ensure streamlined growth and avoid common pitfalls like automating broken processes or neglecting the human element.

title: Earnings call transcript: Synchrony Financial’s Q4 2025 results show steady EPS but revenue miss
summary: Synchrony Financial (SYF) announced its Q4 2025 earnings, where it met EPS expectations at $2.04 per diluted share but missed revenue forecasts, reporting $3.79 billion against an expected $3.84 billion. Following the announcement, the stock dropped by 5.28% in pre-market trading due to investor concerns over the revenue miss. The company provided a 2026 EPS guidance of $9.10 to $9.50, projecting mid-single-digit loan receivable growth and continued net interest income expansion, supported by new product strategies and partnerships like with Bob's Discount Furniture and Polaris, and investments in technology.

title: Rio Tinto (RIO) 6-K details voting rights and new collaborations
summary: Rio Tinto plc filed a 6-K report detailing its share capital and voting rights as of December 31, 2025, confirming 1,254,292,412 voting rights after excluding treasury shares. The filing also summarized various January 2026 announcements, including collaborations with Amazon Web Services and BHP, and a joint acquisition with Chalco in the low-carbon aluminium sector. This report provides crucial information for shareholders to assess disclosure thresholds under UK transparency rules and highlights the company's dual-listed structure.

title: Amazon to eliminate another 2,200 corporate jobs (AMZN:NASDAQ)
summary: Amazon is reportedly planning to eliminate another 2,200 corporate jobs, as indicated by a Worker Adjustment and Retraining Notification (WARN) filed with the Washington Employment Security Department. These permanent job cuts are anticipated in the Washington state region. This follows previous reports of Amazon reducing its workforce.

title: New CEO Fiddelke Plots Target’s Design-Forward Renaissance
summary: Target's new CEO, Michael Fiddelke, is initiating a design-forward renaissance for the company, focusing on larger-format stores, differentiated product assortments, and enhanced technology to improve efficiency and customer experience. This strategy aims to drive sustainable and profitable growth, addressing challenges like declining sales in discretionary categories and increasing competition. Fiddelke emphasizes the importance of design leadership in merchandising, elevating the shopping experience both in-store and digitally, and leveraging AI tools to forecast trends and personalize customer interactions.

title: Jim Cramer on Rio Tinto: "I Just Think It's a Great Hedge Against All the Chaos That We See in the World"
summary: Jim Cramer expressed his long-standing approval of Rio Tinto, viewing it as a valuable hedge against global instability. While Cramer suggests owning the stock, Cullen Capital Management recently sold their position due to concerns about potential iron ore oversupply and declining demand from China, despite acknowledging Rio Tinto's long-term growth potential. They instead favor AI stocks for better upside and less risk.

title: Why Is Expedia (EXPE) Stock Soaring Today
summary: Expedia's stock jumped by 5.2% due to an expanded partnership with Affirm, making Affirm the exclusive Buy Now, Pay Later (BNPL) provider for Expedia's US brands. This multi-year agreement covers Expedia, Hotels.com, and Vrbo, aiming to offer travelers more flexible payment options. The news was perceived as meaningful but not fundamentally changing the company's perception, with Expedia's shares having experienced prior volatility due to tariff news.

title: The Algorithm as Architect: Inside Amazon’s 14,000-Role AI Displacement Strategy
summary: Amazon is undergoing a radical transformation, cutting 14,000 corporate jobs and replacing middle management and operational oversight with AI-driven systems like "Project Dawn," Amazon Q Developer, and Blue Jay robotics. This strategic shift, driven by CEO Andy Jassy’s efficiency mandate, signals a move from human-led management to AI-orchestrated operations, setting a precedent for other tech giants. While it promises significant cost savings and agility, it also raises concerns about the erosion of middle-class corporate roles and the long-term societal impact of large-scale AI-driven job displacement.

title: SAP SE (SAP): A Bull Case Theory
summary: This article summarizes a bullish thesis on SAP SE, highlighting its strong cloud business momentum with 27% year-over-year cloud revenue growth in Q3 2025 and an expanding gross margin. The company's competitive advantage lies in its integrated suite approach, strategic differentiation through capital discipline, and agentic AI integration. Despite challenges like declining software license revenue and market volatility, management is optimistic about future revenue growth and cloud adoption, with AI-led RISE migrations expected to accelerate growth.

title: Amazon Stock Is Cheap Heading Into Q4 Earnings (NASDAQ:AMZN)
summary: Amazon.com, Inc. (AMZN) stock is consolidating and appears undervalued ahead of its Q4 2025 earnings report. Despite recent underperformance, the author believes AMZN offers a favorable risk-reward profile due to its discount compared to peers, ongoing margin improvements, and steady AWS growth. A potential OpenAI investment is noted as a risk if not strategically aligned with AWS.

title: Here are the retailers with the most store openings and closures planned for 2026
summary: U.S. retailers are projected to see fewer store closures and more store openings in 2026 compared to 2025, driven largely by value-focused retailers like Dollar General and Aldi. While department stores and legacy retailers continue to reduce their footprints, demand for retail space is increasing, potentially leading to new strip mall developments if construction costs stabilize. GameStop, Francesca's, and Walgreens are expected to lead in closures, while the overall retail landscape reflects evolving consumer preferences and economic factors.

title: Sea Limited’s Multi Engine Growth Meets Discounted Valuation And Profit Focus
summary: Sea Limited (NYSE:SE) is showing accelerated growth across its e-commerce, digital finance, and entertainment segments, coupled with improved profitability. The company is trading significantly below analyst targets and its estimated fair value, presenting a potentially discounted opportunity despite recent short-term stock price declines. Investors are advised to monitor user growth, Shopee's margins, and the company's P/E ratio relative to the industry average.

title: 3 Reasons Investors Love Remitly (RELY)
summary: Remitly (RELY) has seen its shares drop by 17.3% over the last six months, despite the S&P 500 gaining 9.6%. This article highlights three key reasons for optimism about the company: significant growth in active customers, a positive shift in long-term EPS, and an increasing free cash flow margin, all contributing to its potential as a strong business. The article suggests that after the recent dip, the stock might be an opportune buy.

title: How Novo Nordisk’s new Wegovy pill is transforming the weight-loss drug market
summary: Novo Nordisk's new Wegovy pill is rapidly reshaping the obesity drug market, drawing in new patients and accelerating a shift towards cash-pay obesity care, according to telehealth executives and early prescription data. The pill's lower cost for starting doses compared to injectables and its ease of use for some patients are contributing to its strong demand, particularly among first-time GLP-1 users. This launch is also affecting the economics of compounded drugs and highlights a growing consumer-driven approach in the weight-loss medication industry, with drugmakers increasingly partnering with telehealth companies.

title: ASML Holding N.V. (ASML) Investors Press Executives on the Outlook Despite the Bookings Success
summary: ASML Holding N.V. (ASML) reported record fourth-quarter bookings of €13.2 billion, significantly exceeding analyst expectations, driven by demand for chipmaking equipment for AI infrastructure. The company projects 2026 revenue of €34 billion-€39 billion, surpassing previous forecasts. Barclays upgraded ASML to Overweight, increasing its price target to €1,500 from €1,200 due to strong demand and order intake, despite management's cautious guidance.

title: Morgan Stanley survey shows electronics spending intentions are worsening
summary: A recent Morgan Stanley AlphaWise Consumer Survey indicates a notable decline in U.S. consumer intentions to spend on electronics, including PCs, despite an overall improvement in economic sentiment and household finances. Both one-month and six-month spending intentions for consumer electronics have worsened, particularly among lower and higher-income households. The report suggests that moderation in electronics spending could be a headwind for the sector in the coming months, with tariffs having minimal impact on purchasing decisions.

title: Walmart Membership Growth Hits Record High
summary: Walmart's paid membership program, Walmart+, has reached a record 28.4 million members in January, indicating growing customer loyalty. This 12% year-over-year growth highlights Walmart's successful strategy to attract and retain shoppers with benefits like free delivery, fuel discounts, and streaming access. Analysts suggest this strong performance is helping Walmart compete more effectively with Amazon Prime.

title: BofA Cites Near-Term AV Uncertainties Affecting Uber Technologies, Inc. (UBER) Valuation
summary: BofA Securities analyst Justin Post reduced Uber Technologies' price target due to near-term uncertainties surrounding autonomous vehicles, reiterating a Buy rating. Despite this, he foresees valuation expansion in 2025 with steady revenue growth, improved margins, and a stabilized AV outlook. Uber recently launched AV Labs to use real-world data to accelerate autonomous vehicle development.

title: Home Depot cuts 800 jobs
summary: Home Depot has laid off approximately 800 employees, primarily in its technology organization at its Atlanta support center, and is mandating a full return to office for corporate staff. This restructuring aims to simplify corporate operations and improve agility, following a third quarter where the company missed profit expectations and cut its full-year guidance. The job cuts are part of a broader trend of layoffs in the retail industry, which has seen a significant increase in job eliminations over the past year.

title: Amazon.com, Inc. (AMZN) is in Talks to Invest Up to $50 billion in OpenAI, Source Reports
summary: Amazon.com, Inc. (AMZN) is reportedly in preliminary talks to invest up to $50 billion in OpenAI, potentially becoming the largest contributor to OpenAI's fundraising round. This comes as OpenAI seeks up to $100 billion in capital at an $830 billion valuation, preparing for a potential $1 trillion IPO. Separately, Amazon recently announced significant corporate layoffs, totaling 16,000 positions, aimed at increasing efficiency.

title: Oracle Is Raising Billions to Fund Its AI Buildout. Today, Investors Are Cheering
summary: Oracle plans to raise $45 billion to $50 billion this year through a mix of debt and equity to expand its cloud computing capacity for major AI customers like Nvidia, Meta, OpenAI, and TikTok. This aggressive buildout, while risky due to debt-financing and reliance on a few large clients, aims to meet surging AI-driven demand and compete with cloud leaders. Despite concerns about its investment-grade rating, the move led to a more than 3% jump in Oracle shares on Monday.

title: Palantir, AMD, Amazon and More Stocks with Earnings This Week
summary: The first week of February is packed with earnings reports from over 100 S&P 500 companies, including major tech players like Amazon, Palantir, AMD, and Alphabet, as well as pharmaceutical giants and other prominent firms. Investors will be closely watching metrics such as AI platform adoption, profitability, server CPU market share gains, and cloud division growth. Key reports are scheduled throughout the week, with significant releases from Disney, Palantir, AMD, Alphabet, and Amazon.

title: SPY ETF Daily Update, 2/2/2026
summary: The SPDR S&P 500 ETF Trust (SPY) is down 0.45% in pre-market trading due to a broad market sell-off and uncertainty over Federal Reserve leadership. This week's key catalysts include earnings reports from major tech companies like Amazon and Alphabet, which will offer insights into AI capital expenditure, and semiconductor companies such as AMD, Qualcomm, and ARM, indicating hardware demand for AI. Additionally, important labor market data like nonfarm payrolls and JOLTS job openings are expected, while TipRanks' ETF analyst consensus gives SPY a "Moderate Buy" rating with an 18.22% upside potential based on its average price target of $818.02.

title: Jeffs’ Brands’ KeepZone AI Will Serve as Hydrogen-Powered Drone Systems’ Prime Contractor to Support Government and Defense Clients
summary: Jeffs' Brands' subsidiary, KeepZone AI Inc., has secured exclusive rights in Mexico to market, sell, and support advanced hydrogen-powered drone systems. KeepZone AI will act as the prime contractor for these drones, which are designed for various operational, logistical, and security missions, targeting government and defense clients in Mexico. This collaboration aims to integrate these drones with KeepZone’s existing AI-driven security portfolio.

title: Violich Capital Management Inc. Raises Position in Alphabet Inc. $GOOGL
summary: Violich Capital Management Inc. increased its stake in Alphabet Inc. (NASDAQ:GOOGL) by 2.4% during the third quarter, now owning 320,128 shares valued at $77.8 million, making it their third-largest holding. Despite mixed news regarding Google's AI advancements, autonomous vehicle incidents, and significant insider selling, analysts maintain a "Moderate Buy" rating for Alphabet with an average price target of $334.60. The stock currently trades around $338, with a market capitalization of $4.08 trillion.

title: Quilter Plc Decreases Stake in Alphabet Inc. $GOOG
summary: Quilter Plc reduced its stake in Alphabet Inc. by 11.2% during the third quarter, selling 11,256 shares and holding 89,584 shares valued at $21.8 million. While major institutions like Vanguard and State Street have increased their holdings, insiders have been net sellers of Alphabet stock. The company has an average "Buy" rating from analysts with an average price target of $330.83 and pays a quarterly dividend of $0.21.

title: Courier Capital LLC Raises Stock Holdings in Alphabet Inc. $GOOGL
summary: Courier Capital LLC increased its stake in Alphabet Inc. by 18.8% in Q3, bringing its total holdings to 25,999 shares valued at $6.32 million. Despite significant insider selling over the past quarter, institutional investors collectively own 40.03% of the company. Alphabet faces mixed catalysts and risks, with advancements in AI and autonomous vehicles alongside intellectual property and regulatory concerns, yet analysts maintain a "Moderate Buy" rating with a consensus target price of $334.60.

summary: Convergence Investment Partners LLC significantly reduced its stake in Walmart Inc. by 31.4% in the third quarter of 2025, selling 18,536 shares and now holding 40,556 shares valued at $4.18 million. Analysts generally maintain a positive outlook on Walmart, with a "Moderate Buy" rating and an average target price of $123.37, while the company continues to focus on digital expansion and operational investments.

title: Allstate Corp Purchases 200,087 Shares of Alphabet Inc. $GOOGL
summary: Allstate Corp significantly increased its stake in Alphabet Inc. (NASDAQ:GOOGL) by 1,758.1% during the third quarter, purchasing an additional 200,087 shares. Other institutional investors have also adjusted their holdings in Alphabet, while the company faces both positive news, such as its AI model Project Genie, and negative events like intellectual property theft and a Waymo incident.

title: Alphabet Inc. $GOOGL is Fisher Funds Management LTD's 2nd Largest Position
summary: Fisher Funds Management LTD reduced its stake in Alphabet Inc. (NASDAQ:GOOGL) by 33.1% in the third quarter, yet Alphabet remains its second-largest holding, comprising approximately 4.2% of its portfolio. Other institutional investors have shown mixed activity, with some increasing and others decreasing their positions. Recent news highlights both positive developments for Alphabet, such as AI advancements and Waymo expansion, and negative ones, including trade secret theft and a Waymo incident under NHTSA investigation.

title: Verdence Capital Advisors LLC Buys 3,226 Shares of Alphabet Inc. $GOOGL
summary: Verdence Capital Advisors LLC increased its stake in Alphabet Inc. Despite this, the company plans to prioritize long-term growth investments in logistics, fulfillment, and membership programs over short-term margin expansion. The stock has seen mixed performance, with recent declines but a significant gain over three years, as investors weigh profitability against continued investment in growth initiatives.

title: Nvidia Poised To Make Record Investment In OpenAI's Current Funding Round
summary: Nvidia (NVDA) CEO Jensen Huang confirmed the company's intent to participate in OpenAI's current funding round, which could be Nvidia's largest investment to date. While the exact amount was not disclosed, Huang indicated it would be significantly less than $100 billion. However, internal doubts within Nvidia could present a challenge to these investment plans, potentially impacting the future strategies of both companies.

title: Nvidia CEO Huang denies he is unhappy with OpenAI, says 'huge' investment planned at 'trillion-dollar dinner'
summary: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang refuted claims that he is unhappy with OpenAI, stating that Nvidia plans to make a "huge" investment in the company, potentially its largest ever. This comes after reports suggested a previous $100 billion investment plan stalled due to internal doubts and Huang's private criticisms of OpenAI's business approach. Huang expressed strong belief in OpenAI's work and its CEO Sam Altman, confirming Nvidia's involvement in the ongoing investment round.

title: Northland Raises Innovative Aerosystems, Inc. (ISSC) Price Target to $24, Maintains Outperform on Retrofits Momentum
summary: Northland has increased its price target for Innovative Aerosystems, Inc. (ISSC) to $24 from $17.50, reiterating an Outperform rating due to the company's strong momentum in retrofitting projects. The firm projects revenue growth of 7.5% in fiscal 2027 and an improvement in EBITDA margins to 29%. This follows ISSC's robust Q4 and FY2025 results, with significant increases in revenue and adjusted EBITDA, supported by a strong backlog and their "IA Next" growth plan.

title: Gran Tierra Energy (GTE) Soared This Week. Here is Why
summary: Gran Tierra Energy Inc. (NYSE:GTE) saw its share price surge by 27.03% this week, reaching a 52-week high after reporting its highest monthly production in company history for December 2025. The company also announced successful discoveries in Ecuador and provided revenue and adjusted EBITDA guidance for 2025. Despite GTE's potential, the article suggests that certain AI stocks offer greater promise and upside potential.

title: Wayfair Google Alliance Puts AI Shopping And Valuation In Focus
summary: Wayfair (NYSE:W) has partnered with Google to develop the Universal Commerce Protocol, aiming to enhance online shopping through AI and create shared industry standards. This collaboration highlights Wayfair's reliance on major tech providers for core commerce infrastructure and AI capabilities. Investors should monitor this initiative's impact on Wayfair's valuation, especially given the current price being below analyst targets and Simply Wall St's fair value estimate.

title: Amazon class action settlement to pay $309M to customers allegedly shortchanged on refunds
summary: Amazon has agreed to a $309 million settlement to resolve a class action lawsuit alleging the company shortchanged customers on refunds for returned items. This payment is in addition to the approximately $570 million already issued to customers. The proposed settlement, filed on January 23rd, also includes changes to Amazon's return and refund practices to ensure timely processing and clear customer notifications.

title: Seabridge Gold Inc. (SA) Released a 2025 Year-End Report
summary: Seabridge Gold Inc. (NYSE:SA) released its 2025 year-end report, detailing operational, exploration, and corporate initiatives completed by December 18, 2025. The company advanced power infrastructure and geotechnical drilling at KSM for a feasibility assessment and anticipates improvements in 2026. A B. Riley analyst boosted Seabridge Gold's price target from $50 to $65, maintaining a Buy rating amidst joint venture talks, KSM project advancements, and rising gold prices.

title: How Investors Are Reacting To MercadoLibre (MELI) Leveraging E‑Commerce Scale To Build a Regional Digital Bank
summary: MercadoLibre's e-commerce scale is enabling its expansion into a regional digital bank, significantly impacting its investment narrative. A recent report highlights Latin American e-commerce growth and Mercado Pago's evolution into a full digital bank, emphasizing the company's long-term growth potential. While this strategy supports the thesis, investors are also considering execution risks related to credit quality and competition from entities like Amazon.

title: Colgate-Palmolive (CL) Climbs 6% on Upbeat Outlook Despite Headwinds
summary: Colgate-Palmolive (CL) stock rose 6.10% after providing a cautiously optimistic outlook for 2026, despite a challenging market in 2025. The company anticipates net sales growth of 2% to 6% and organic sales growth of 1% to 4% for the full year 2026. This comes after a significant drop in attributable net income in 2025, although net sales slightly increased.

title: Percentil a subsidiary of MySize Expands Second-Hand Fashion Distribution Across Europe Through Amazon Marketplace
summary: MySize Inc.'s subsidiary, Percentil, has expanded its reach into the European second-hand fashion market by launching distribution on Amazon's marketplace, beginning with Spain. This move allows Percentil to access a wider consumer base while maintaining operational control. Percentil, which aims to improve inventory rotation and generate incremental revenue, will continue to prioritize its proprietary marketplace as its core strategic channel.

title: Analysts’ Opinions Are Mixed on These Consumer Cyclical Stocks: Birkenstock Holding plc (BIRK), Tesla (TSLA) and Amazon (AMZN)
summary: This article summarizes analyst ratings for Birkenstock Holding plc (BIRK), Tesla (TSLA), and Amazon (AMZN), highlighting mixed sentiments in the Consumer Cyclical sector. Birkenstock received a Strong Buy consensus, Tesla a Hold, and Amazon a Strong Buy. The report details specific analyst price targets and success rates for each company.

title: Alphabet Inc: director Arnold sells $34,680 in stock
summary: Alphabet Inc. director Frances Arnold sold 102 shares of Class C Capital Stock for $34,680 on January 29, 2026, with the stock trading near its 52-week high. Following the sale, Arnold directly owns 18,307 shares and numerous Google Stock Units with varying vesting schedules. This transaction occurred amidst Alphabet's actions against cybersecurity threats and positive analyst outlooks, though facing increasing competition from Microsoft in cloud services.

title: Amazon stock slips after hours as layoffs and store exits sharpen focus on Feb. 5 earnings
summary: Amazon's stock slipped approximately 1% in after-hours trading following announcements of 16,000 corporate job cuts and the closure of its remaining physical grocery and Go stores. Investors are closely watching the upcoming Q4 earnings report on February 5th for insights into AWS demand and future spending plans amidst concerns about cloud sector growth and capital expenditure. The company's restructuring efforts, including discontinuing its Amazon One payment service, are aimed at strengthening operations, though the rollout has had some issues.

title: How Investors Are Reacting To Alibaba Group Holding (BABA) Gaining Access To Nvidia H200 AI Chips
summary: Alibaba Group Holding (BABA) has gained Chinese regulatory approval to purchase Nvidia H200 AI chips, coinciding with its upgraded Qwen AI models and deeper AI integration across its platforms. This development strengthens Alibaba's position as a full-stack AI provider, though concerns about price competition, regulatory constraints, and slowing revenue growth remain. Despite improved sentiment and recent share price gains, execution risk and potential earnings estimate cuts could limit upside according to analysts.

title: HSBC Upgrades New Oriental Education & Technology Group to Buy Following Strong Q2 FY2026 Results
summary: HSBC has upgraded New Oriental Education & Technology Group (NYSE: EDU) from Hold to Buy after the company reported strong Q2 FY2026 results. The company's net revenue reached $1.19 billion, exceeding estimates by $28.62 million, and adjusted EPS were $0.45, surpassing estimates by $0.11. This positive performance was driven by growth in overseas test preparation, domestic test preparation, and new educational business initiatives.

title: America's only fully integrated rare earth producer sets Feb. 26 Q4 results call
summary: MP Materials Corp. (NYSE: MP) will release its financial results for the fourth quarter ended December 31, 2025, after U.S. markets close on Thursday, February 26, 2026. The company will host a conference call and webcast on the same afternoon at 2:00 p.m. Pacific Time (5:00 p.m. Eastern Time). A press release and slide presentation will be made available beforehand on their investors relations website.

title: Oracle may slash up to 30,000 jobs to fund AI data-center expansion as US banks retreat
summary: Oracle Corporation is reportedly considering slashing between 20,000 and 30,000 jobs and potentially selling its Cerner health-care software unit to secure financing for its ambitious AI data-center expansion. This comes as key US banks have withdrawn from funding Oracle's data-center projects, leading to increased borrowing costs and stalled deals. The company is exploring alternative financing methods, including requiring upfront deposits from customers and offering "bring your own chip" arrangements, while industry analysts debate the severity of these financial challenges and advise multi-cloud strategies for enterprises.

title: Afraid of an AI Correction This Year? This Industrial Stock Has AI Upside With Value Pricing
summary: Prologis (NYSE: PLD), the world's largest REIT specializing in industrial properties, is being highlighted as an attractive investment for AI exposure due to its increasing focus on data centers. Despite concerns about high valuations in the AI sector, Prologis offers a reasonable price-to-FFO ratio and is aggressively investing in data center development. The company's strong financial position and scale put it in a prime position to capitalize on the rapidly growing global data center market.

title: HubSpot (HUBS) Derives Its Strength From Large Customers
summary: HubSpot (HUBS) is highlighted as a promising cloud stock, with several analysts maintaining Buy ratings and offering significant upside potential. A key insight from a Raymond James webinar with an Elite partner indicated strong growth in late 2025, primarily driven by larger customers. However, the article also notes that while HUBS has potential, the authors believe certain AI stocks may offer even higher returns with limited downside risk.

title: GameSquare’s Stream Hatchet Publishes Annual 2025 Live Streaming Trends Report
summary: GameSquare Holdings, Inc.'s Stream Hatchet has released its annual 2025 Live Streaming Trends Report, revealing that global live streaming viewership grew 6% year-over-year to 36.4 billion hours watched, nearly matching the 2021 pandemic peak. The report highlights increased competition, broader platform use, and creator-led strategies as key drivers, noting a redistribution of attention due to enforcement actions, multistreaming, and esports content. Non-gaming content also saw significant growth, reinforcing live streaming as a mature and sustainable ecosystem for brands.

title: Is WhiteFiber (WYFI) One of the New Stocks on the Rise?
summary: WhiteFiber Inc. (NASDAQ: WYFI) is identified as a rising stock, following a recent co-location agreement with Nscale for 40 MW of critical IT load expected to generate $865 million in revenue. Despite a lowered Q2 and FY26 EBITDA estimate by B. Riley due to conservative cloud service assumptions, the firm maintained a Buy rating. The article also discusses the broader AI market, highlighting its revolutionary potential and suggesting alternative, more promising AI stocks than WYFI.

title: Is Ovid Therapeutics (OVID) One of the Best Fast Growing Penny Stocks to Buy According to Analysts?
summary: Ovid Therapeutics (NASDAQ: OVID) is considered a top fast-growing penny stock by analysts after LifeSci Capital initiated coverage with an Outperform rating and a $4 price target. The company announced successful Phase 1 results for OV350, validating its mechanism for treating neurodegenerative conditions, and is now prioritizing an oral activator, OV4071, with regulatory submission expected in Q1 2026. Despite Ovid's potential, the article suggests specific AI stocks may offer greater returns and mentions exclusive reports for subscribers about these AI investment opportunities.

title: Amazon.com, Inc. (AMZN) Is a Trending Stock: Facts to Know Before Betting on It
summary: This article analyzes Amazon.com, Inc. (AMZN) as a trending stock, highlighting factors such as earnings estimate revisions, revenue growth forecasts, and valuation. Zacks.com has rated AMZN as a Zacks Rank #2 (Buy) due to positive earnings estimate revisions and strong revenue growth. While the stock is currently trading at a premium according to its Zacks Value Style Score, its overall outlook suggests it may outperform the broader market.

title: 1-800-FLOWERS.COM, Inc. (NASDAQ:FLWS) Q2 2026 Earnings Call Transcript
summary: 1-800-FLOWERS.COM, Inc. beat earnings expectations for Q2 2026, reporting an EPS of $1.2 against an expectation of $0.86. The company discussed operational improvements, strategic changes including a shift to a function-based operating structure and disciplined marketing, and initiatives to stabilize the business for future growth. Revenue and adjusted EBITDA saw declines, attributed to efficient marketing spend and changes in search engine results, but the company anticipates significant cost savings and improved performance in the long term.

title: Analyst Remains Buy on VNET Group as Its Shares Soar Over 67% In One Year
summary: VNET Group, Inc. (NASDAQ: VNET) has seen its shares rise over 67% in the past year, with 11 out of 12 analysts rating the stock as a Buy and predicting a 34.50% upside. A BofA analyst recently reaffirmed a Buy rating with a $15.10 price target. The company, an investment holding firm providing hosting and related services in China, is expected to post significant Q1 2026 earnings and revenue growth, driven by strong interest in data center and cloud infrastructure.

title: iShares MSCI World ETF: Technologie-Dominanz
summary: The iShares MSCI World ETF (URTH) demonstrates strong returns but is heavily concentrated in US technology stocks, with NVIDIA alone making up over 5% of its portfolio. Despite its impressive performance, the ETF faces criticism for its higher expense ratio compared to competitors and its exclusion of emerging markets, leading to a strong correlation with the US tech sector. Investors are advised to consider these factors, including potential currency fluctuations and central bank decisions, when evaluating the ETF.

title: Rosenblatt lowers Elastic stock price target to $110 on multiple compression
summary: Rosenblatt Securities has lowered its price target for Elastic N.V. (NYSE:ESTC) to $110 from $130, while maintaining a Buy rating, primarily due to recent multiple compression and macroeconomic concerns. Despite the reduced target, Elastic is expected to report in-line to slightly better-than-expected Q3 fiscal 2026 results and is well-positioned for growth through tool consolidation and AI integration. The company has also introduced new developments like Agent Builder and enhanced its Cloud Serverless service, though another analyst, DA Davidson, issued a lower price target of $80 with a Neutral rating due to mixed growth trends.

title: Amazon (NASDAQ: AMZN) Stock Price Prediction for 2030: Bull, Bear, & Baseline Forecasts (Jan 30)
summary: This article provides bull, bear, and baseline stock price predictions for Amazon (NASDAQ: AMZN) in 2030, based on analyses of its e-commerce, Amazon Web Services (AWS), and advertising segments. The bull case anticipates a stock price of $431, driven by continued AWS growth, e-commerce profitability, and strong advertising revenue. Conversely, the bear case projects a decline to $77 due to intense cloud competition, unprofitable business segments, and unsustainable "moonshot" investments, while the baseline forecast, considering Wall Street projections and moderated growth, sets the price at $250.

title: BofA Trims Amazon.com (AMZN) Target but Sees Upside from AWS and Advertising
summary: BofA Securities analyst Justin Post lowered the price target for Amazon.com (AMZN) to $286 ahead of its Q4 earnings report, while maintaining a "Buy" rating. The firm expects Amazon to surpass revenue and operating income consensus, driven by strong Amazon Web Services (AWS) growth at 22% year-over-year and improved North American retail margins. This positive outlook is attributed to factors like increased AWS capacity, solid advertising trends, lower fuel costs, and cost efficiencies from layoffs.

title: Ziff Davis Taps AI In Unified RetailMeNot Group To Deepen Engagement
summary: Ziff Davis has launched the unified RetailMeNot Group, consolidating several shopping platforms and integrating AI-powered tools to enhance the online shopping experience. This strategic move aims to deepen customer engagement within its ecosystem, leveraging existing assets and data capabilities to compete with larger players in the coupon and cashback market. Investors will be observing the rollout and user adoption of these new AI features.

title: GPS Wealth Strategies Group LLC Sells 18,807 Shares of Marvell Technology, Inc. $MRVL
summary: GPS Wealth Strategies Group LLC significantly reduced its stake in Marvell Technology, Inc. (NASDAQ:MRVL) by 71.8% in the third quarter, selling 18,807 shares and retaining 7,383 shares valued at approximately $621,000.
