This comes as Marvell Technology exceeded earnings estimates, reporting $0.76 EPS and $2.07 billion in revenue, with forward guidance of $0.74–$0.84 EPS for Q4 2026. Despite insider selling by an EVP, the stock maintains a "Moderate Buy" consensus rating from analysts with an average price target of $115.09.

title: Amazon in talks to invest $50 billion in OpenAI, expand ties
summary: Amazon is reportedly in discussions to invest up to $50 billion in OpenAI, aiming to expand their partnership. This potential investment could form a significant portion of a $100 billion funding round for OpenAI, with other investors like Nvidia and SoftBank also considering contributions. The deal would also involve Amazon utilizing OpenAI's AI models across its products and platforms.

title: Expedia Group and Affirm deepen partnership, with US exclusivity and plans for further expansion
summary: Expedia Group and Affirm have expanded their partnership, making Affirm the exclusive Buy Now, Pay Later provider for lodging and packages across Expedia Group's US brands, with plans to extend to Canada. This collaboration offers travelers flexible payment options with no hidden fees, aiming to enhance the booking experience. The partnership emphasizes transparency and aims to empower travelers to confidently plan and book their trips.

title: Colgate-Palmolive’s (NYSE:CL) Q4 CY2025 Sales Top Estimates
summary: Colgate-Palmolive (NYSE: CL) exceeded Wall Street's revenue and non-GAAP profit estimates for Q4 CY2025, with sales increasing by 5.8% year-on-year to $5.23 billion and adjusted EPS reaching $0.95. The company reported accelerated growth momentum in both top and bottom lines, driven by oral care and pet nutrition, despite flat sales volumes. Analysts anticipate a 3.1% revenue growth over the next 12 months, indicating potential demand challenges as current growth is primarily from price increases rather than volume.

title: Analyst Sees Mature Streaming Market, But Pricing Could Drive Spotify Technology S.A. (SPOT) Growth
summary: MoffettNathanson initiated coverage of Spotify Technology S.A. (NYSE:SPOT) with a Neutral rating and a $487 price target, noting that while subscriber growth in developed markets is saturated, pricing strategies could drive future revenue growth. Spotify exceeded expectations in Q3 2025 across revenue and gross margin, showing strong operational execution and increasing engagement, particularly in video podcasts. TCW Concentrated Large Cap Growth Fund also highlighted Spotify's strong market position, pricing power, and potential for growth beyond current valuations.

title: V2X and Amazon to Partner on Smart Warehousing and Global Logistics Automation
summary: V2X, Inc. announced a strategic partnership with Amazon to provide smart warehousing and automation technologies to their U.S. Government customers. This collaboration will leverage Amazon's expertise in warehouse automation and AI models to optimize inventory, streamline logistics, and enhance decision-making for critical missions. The partnership aims to improve operational speed, mission resilience, and supply chain readiness across defense and government environments.

title: Nisource stock hits all-time high at 44.95 USD By Investing.com
summary: NiSource Inc. (NI) stock achieved an all-time high of $44.95, reflecting strong investor confidence and a 24.41% total return over the past year. Despite trading above its InvestingPro Fair Value, the company demonstrates financial stability with a 2.71% dividend yield and sustained dividend payments for 40 years. Recent developments include a declared quarterly dividend, reaffirmed fiscal year 2025 guidance, new 2026 guidance, and analyst target adjustments following a $15 billion Amazon data center campus announcement.

title: The Bull Case For V2X (VVX) Could Change Following New Amazon AI Logistics Partnership – Learn Why
summary: V2X (VVX) recently partnered with Amazon to integrate smart warehousing and AI-powered logistics for U.S. Government customers, a move that could shift V2X's investment narrative towards higher-value, tech-enabled work. While the financial impact is not immediately clear, this collaboration highlights the potential for combining Amazon's AI with V2X's mission support to enhance government operations. Investors should consider the potential for increased execution risk, the early stage of the partnership, and existing concerns about V2X's stock valuation compared to fair value estimates.

title: BofA Raises DigitalOcean (DOCN) PT as Viral “Clawdbot” Success Fuels Agentic AI Growth
summary: Bank of America (BofA) analyst Wamsi Mohan raised DigitalOcean's (DOCN) price target to $72 from $60 with a Buy rating, citing the success of agentic AI assistants like Clawdbot and the company's position to capitalize on early-stage AI agent deployments. This increase reflects the firm's belief in the early adoption of agentic AI and expanding use cases. Other analysts, including Barclays and Piper Sandler, have also adjusted their price targets for DigitalOcean, with Barclays raising its target due to a favorable software outlook for 2026 and Piper Sandler making slight adjustments after a cohort update.

title: TAL Education (TAL) Soars 18% on Earnings Blowout
summary: TAL Education Group (NYSE:TAL) saw its stock jump 18.03% following an impressive earnings report for the third quarter of fiscal year 2026. The company reported a 465% surge in attributable net income to $130.6 million and a 27% increase in revenues to $770.2 million. Alex Peng, President and CFO, highlighted continued steady growth and a focus on integrating technology to enhance learning experiences and support student development.

title: Tractor Supply Co. stock underperforms Thursday when compared to competitors
summary: Tractor Supply Co. (TSCO) stock saw a decline on Thursday, underperforming its competitors. The stock closed at $247.93, a decrease of 0.82%, while the S&P 500 had a positive day.

title: Amazon in Talks to Invest $50 Billion in OpenAI, Expand Ties
summary: Amazon.com Inc. is reportedly in discussions to invest up to $50 billion in OpenAI, aiming to further expand the AI startup's existing agreement for computing power. OpenAI, known for ChatGPT, has also held talks with other major investors such as Nvidia Corp. and SoftBank Group Corp. for a new funding round. The deal is not yet finalized and terms are subject to change.

title: Stryker’s (NYSE:SYK) Q4 CY2025 Sales Top Estimates
summary: Stryker (NYSE: SYK) reported strong Q4 CY2025 results, exceeding Wall Street's revenue and adjusted EPS expectations. The medical technology company achieved an 11.4% year-on-year sales increase, reaching $7.17 billion, and its non-GAAP profit per share of $4.47 surpassed analyst estimates. The company's CEO highlighted an "outstanding finish to 2025" with double-digit sales and adjusted earnings per share growth, along with operating margin expansion.

title: Whole Foods Market planned for revamped Mount Sinai Shopping Center
summary: Regency Centers Corp. has purchased the Mount Sinai Shopping Center, renaming it Crystal Brook Corner, and plans a $15 million renovation to revitalize the property. The revamped center will feature a Whole Foods Market as its anchor tenant, aiming to attract national, regional, and local retailers, fitness studios, restaurants, and personal/pet services. The renovation will include new facades and a new freestanding building, with completion expected by spring 2028.

title: Cipher Mining Turns To AI And Cloud With Amazon AWS Deal
summary: Cipher Mining (NasdaqGS:CIFR) has announced a deal with Amazon Web Services to provide 300 megawatts of capacity, signifying a strategic shift from its traditional focus on bitcoin mining towards AI and cloud infrastructure. This agreement connects the crypto infrastructure player to the growing demand in the tech sector, prompting investors to monitor its impact on Cipher Mining's revenue, capital needs, and its ability to balance bitcoin mining with new AI opportunities. Despite strong short-term momentum from the AWS deal, investors are cautioned to consider the stock's volatile trading and insider selling risks, while analyst targets suggest a significant upside potential for the share price.

title: Alibaba Robovan Merger Highlights Push Into AI-Driven Last Mile Logistics
summary: Alibaba's logistics arm, Cainiao, is merging its autonomous driving operations with Chinese robovan maker Zelos Technology to form a new standalone entity valued at $2 billion. This move reinforces Alibaba's focus on AI-driven last-mile logistics, aiming to improve fulfillment speed and cost efficiency for its e-commerce ecosystem. The merged company will concentrate on automated last-mile delivery, offering potential for better delivery economics and external partnerships, though it faces execution and capital intensity risks.

title: From Clicks to Carts: Amazon Bets Big on a Walmart-Style Supercenter
summary: Amazon is shifting its retail strategy by planning to open its first large-format supercenter in the Chicago suburbs in 2027, which will be larger than an average Walmart Supercenter. This move signifies Amazon's intention to compete directly with established big-box retailers like Walmart and Costco in the grocery and general merchandise sectors. The company is also closing smaller Amazon Go and Amazon Fresh stores, indicating a new focus on expansive, one-stop shop locations.

title: Grocery Outlet Enters Sixteenth State with Store Opening in Virginia; Jason Potter Comments
summary: Grocery Outlet Holding Corp. is expanding its footprint by opening its first store in Falls Church, Virginia, on February 12, 2026. This marks the retailer's entrance into its sixteenth state and the beginning of a series of openings across Virginia, aligning with its long-term growth strategy. CEO Jason Potter emphasized the company's commitment to offering significant savings and unique deals to help families stretch their budgets.

title: Forget Intel: This Semiconductor Titan Looks Built to Keep Compounding Through the AI Supercycle
summary: This article argues that Broadcom (AVGO) is a more compelling investment than Intel (INTC) despite Intel's recent manufacturing breakthroughs and stock performance. While Intel faces a "prove it" stage with its foundry business and trades at a high valuation, Broadcom is already a semiconductor industry staple with significant contracts and a crucial role in AI infrastructure, benefiting from increased demand in AI accelerators and networking chips. Broadcom's financial performance and lower valuation relative to its earnings make it a more attractive and less speculative investment in the AI supercycle.

title: Sandisk Corp. Reveals Rise In Q2 Income
summary: Sandisk Corp. (SNDK) announced a significant rise in its second-quarter earnings, with net income surging to $803 million, or $5.15 per share, compared to $104 million, or $0.72 per share, in the prior year. Excluding certain items, adjusted earnings reached $967 million or $6.20 per share. The company's revenue also saw a substantial increase of 61.5% to $3.02 billion from $1.87 billion year-over-year.

title: Why Best Buy’s in-store ads are a big hit with brands
summary: Best Buy's "takeover packages" for in-store advertising, which allow brands to activate creative storytelling across multiple screens, are largely booked for the year due to high demand. This approach contrasts with typical programmatic retail media and is seen as a significant driver for Best Buy Ads. Analysts highlight Best Buy's unique advantage in in-store media given its numerous screens, and the growing importance for retailers to better monetize owned media assets, including in-store networks.

title: Elastic NV stock hits 52-week low at 67.96 USD
summary: Elastic NV (ESTC) has fallen to a new 52-week low of $67.96, representing a significant year-over-year decline. Despite this, the company shows financial stability with ample cash and a healthy current ratio, and analysts expect it to become profitable this year. Elastic is also actively enhancing its AI and cloud offerings, including new tools like Agent Builder and strengthened AWS collaborations.

title: Dow to cut about 4,500 jobs as emphasis shifts to AI and automation
summary: Dow is planning to cut approximately 4,500 jobs and anticipates $600 million to $800 million in severance costs as it shifts its emphasis to artificial intelligence and automation. This move is part of a broader plan to simplify operations and streamline the business. The job cuts follow similar actions by other major companies like Amazon, UPS, and Pinterest, reflecting a trend of increased AI adoption and economic uncertainty leading to workforce reductions.

title: What Does Wall Street Think About AbCellera Biologics Inc. (ABCL)?
summary: AbCellera Biologics Inc. (NASDAQ:ABCL) is considered a strong buy stock, especially for under $5, according to Wall Street analysts. The company is set to announce its full-year 2025 financial results on February 24, 2026, and recently received a reiterated Buy rating from Truist Financial after announcing the dosing of its first patients in Phase 2 of a clinical trial for ABCL635, a potential non-hormonal treatment for menopause-associated vasomotor symptoms. AbCellera Biologics specializes in antibody discovery using integrated data science and technology platforms.

title: Amazon in talks to invest up to $50 billion in OpenAI, WSJ says
summary: Amazon.com Inc. is reportedly in discussions to invest up to $50 billion in OpenAI, according to the Wall Street Journal. This potential deal would strengthen the ties between Amazon's cloud computing services and OpenAI's leading AI tools. OpenAI is said to be seeking up to $100 billion in new capital, with Amazon CEO Andy Jassy leading negotiations with OpenAI's Sam Altman.

title: C.H. Robinson Worldwide, Inc. (NASDAQ:CHRW) Q4 2025 Earnings Call Transcript
summary: C.H. Robinson Worldwide, Inc. (NASDAQ:CHRW) held its Q4 2025 earnings call, discussing its performance in a challenging macroeconomic environment characterized by weak global freight demand and falling ocean rates. Despite these headwinds, the company reported market share growth, particularly in its North American Surface Transportation (NAST) segment, and expanded gross margins in Global Forwarding. Executives highlighted their "lean AI" strategy, combining operational efficiency, technology, and human expertise to drive productivity gains, reduce costs, and enhance customer service, while expressing confidence in achieving their 2026 operating income targets.

title: V2X and Amazon form partnership on AI-driven warehousing
summary: V2X, Inc. has partnered with Amazon to integrate smart warehousing and automation, including computer-vision AI models, across V2X-operated facilities serving U.S. government clients. This collaboration aims to enhance inventory management, logistics visibility, and operational efficiency through robotics-enabled warehousing, predictive analytics, and AI-powered insights. The initiative seeks to strengthen federal supply chain resilience and support real-time decision-making in complex environments.

title: QQQ ETF Holdings Increased by Activest as Nvidia, Apple, Microsoft Dominate
summary: Activest Wealth Management has significantly increased its holdings in the Invesco QQQ Trust (QQQ) by 10.2%, signaling strong institutional confidence in large-cap U.S. growth stocks, particularly those benefiting from AI and semiconductor investments. The QQQ ETF, which tracks the Nasdaq-100, is heavily concentrated in technology giants like NVIDIA, Apple, and Microsoft, which collectively account for a substantial portion of the fund's weight. This strategic move by Activest aligns with broader market trends favoring companies with strong cash flow and AI leadership as AI spending projections continue to rise.

title: A Closer Look at the iShares MSCI World ETF’s Steady Performance
summary: The iShares MSCI World ETF (URTH) concluded 2025 with a gain of 21.28%, slightly outperforming its benchmark, the MSCI World Index. The ETF, heavily influenced by large-cap U.S. technology stocks and led by holdings like NVIDIA, Apple, and Microsoft, follows a physical replication strategy across 1,322 holdings. While positioned as a diversified option for developed markets, its valuation is above historical averages due to its growth-oriented focus.

title: Zacks Investment Ideas feature highlights: Applied Optoelectronics,Amazon, Oracle and Microsoft
summary: Zacks Investment Ideas highlights Applied Optoelectronics (AAOI), Amazon (AMZN), Oracle (ORCL), and Microsoft (MSFT), focusing on AAOI's pivotal role in the AI revolution. AAOI, a Zacks Rank #1 (Strong Buy) stock, manufactures critical laser transceivers for data centers, essential for massive, low-latency data flow in AI models. The company recently secured a significant 800G transceiver order from a major hyperscale customer, rumored to be Amazon, signaling substantial revenue growth and market demand for its fiber-optic products.

title: BranchOut Food Delivers Record ~$14M Net Revenue, 113% YoY growth, Secures Major Retail Wins, Expands Capacity & Product Offering
summary: BranchOut Food reported record revenue of approximately $14 million in 2025, a 113% year-over-year increase, with Q4 being the best quarter in company history. The company secured major retail partnerships, including a nearly $2 million order from a new warehouse club customer and development of nine new SKUs for the world's largest retailer, targeting an additional $10 million in revenue. BranchOut also expanded its production capacity by installing a fourth large-scale REV drying line, enabling new product categories like shelf-stable dehydrated cheesecake and high-protein snacks, and anticipates significant gross margin expansion in 2026.

title: Dow says it will cut 4,500 jobs, shifting emphasis to artificial intelligence and automation
summary: Dow announced plans to cut approximately 4,500 jobs and incur $600 million to $800 million in severance costs, along with $500 million to $700 million in other one-time costs, as it focuses more on artificial intelligence and automation. This follows similar job reduction announcements from other major companies like Amazon, UPS, and Pinterest, driven by rising operational costs and a strategic shift towards AI. The news comes amid increased economic anxiety the lowest consumer expectations since 2014.

title: MercadoLibre and Chipotle: 2 Consumer Names With Serious Pricing Power​
summary: MercadoLibre and Chipotle Mexican Grill are highlighted as consumer-facing companies with significant pricing power. MercadoLibre demonstrates this through its increasing transaction take rate and expanding ecosystem in Latin America, while Chipotle has consistently raised menu prices without losing demand, indicating strong customer value proposition. Both companies show promising long-term growth potential through their business models and strategic expansions.

title: How Investors Are Reacting To Sify Technologies (SIFY) Data Center IPO Plans And Widening Losses
summary: Sify Technologies reported increased sales but also widened net losses in Q3 2025, with management highlighting strong data center growth and plans for an IPO of its Sify Infinit Spaces subsidiary. The company's investment narrative is heavily focused on its transition to a capital-intensive data center and digital infrastructure platform. While the IPO could alleviate balance sheet pressure, investors face risks from persistent losses and high sales multiples, especially given the shared price has risen sharply.

title: Live Social Shopping Expansions
summary: QVC® has announced a significant expansion of its live social shopping platform, welcoming new beauty and wellness brands like K18 and Make Time Wellness, and extending offerings from existing vendors. This move aims to enhance its immersive retail experience through "exclusive value bundles" across various platforms including TikTok Shop, QVC.com, and QVC+ streaming. The expansion highlights key trends in live social shopping, science-driven beauty, and the convergence of e-commerce with streaming media.

title: Barclays Highlights Durable Cash Return Strategies for Antero Resources (AR) Despite Market Swings
summary: Barclays has reiterated the durability of cash return strategies for Antero Resources (AR) despite market fluctuations, though it lowered the price target due to commodity price uncertainty. Bank of America also reduced its price target, citing increasing risk of natural gas market oversupply by 2027. Despite these adjustments, the firm highlighted US onshore operations as attractive opportunites for Antero Resources, an independent oil and natural gas company.

title: UPS Resets Network And Cuts Amazon Ties To Sharpen Profit Focus
summary: United Parcel Service (UPS) is reconfiguring its network and reducing its partnership with Amazon to prioritize higher-margin business, including an expansion into healthcare logistics with the acquisition of Andlauer Healthcare Group. This strategic shift aims to enhance profitability and capital discipline, even as it faces declining revenue. Investors are monitoring how this change in business mix, noted as "Efficiency Reimagined," will impact future earnings and the company's stock risk profile amidst network rationalization and integration of new acquisitions.

title: EXCLUSIVE: Interparfums Inc. Picks Up Licenses for David Beckham, Nautica
summary: Interparfums Inc. has secured long-term fragrance licenses for David Beckham and Nautica from Authentic Brands Group, deepening their existing partnership. The deal follows Interparfums' acquisition of the Guess fragrance license, also owned by Authentic Brands Group. The licenses will transfer from Coty Inc. in 2028 for David Beckham and 2030 for Nautica, with Interparfums projecting first-year sales of over $50 million and $70 million respectively for the brands.

title: Veritone's Impressive Performance in 2025
summary: Veritone (VERI) saw impressive growth in 2025, with its shares soaring by nearly 42% due to strong demand for AI stocks and market confidence. The company secured a $10 million direct stock offering, a significant contract with the U.S. Air Force, and achieved over 200% year-over-year growth in non-legacy software revenue, boosting overall revenue by 32% to over $29 million. Analysts maintain a "Moderate Buy" rating with an average 1-year price target of $8.33, reflecting optimism about its AI platform and market penetration.

title: STERIS plc announces $0.63 quarterly dividend payable in March
summary: STERIS plc announced a quarterly dividend of $0.63 per share, payable on March 19, 2026, continuing its 21-year streak of dividend payments. The company, which specializes in infection prevention solutions, boasts a "GREAT" financial health score from InvestingPro and an annual yield of 0.96%. This dividend announcement follows the company's Q2 fiscal year 2025 earnings report where it surpassed EPS expectations but missed revenue projections.

title: Home Depot Cuts Jobs and Orders Staff Back to Office
summary: Home Depot is reducing its workforce at the store support center and requiring corporate employees to return to the office five days a week. This restructuring is a response to slowing sales caused by high interest rates and a stagnant housing market, with CEO Ted Decker stating the changes aim for greater agility and improved support for workers and customers. The company continues to face challenges including slowing sales, affordability issues, and disruptions from immigration enforcement.

title: Alumis stock hits all-time high at 27.28 USD
summary: Alumis Inc. (ALMS) stock reached an all-time high of $27.45, reflecting strong investor confidence and a 293.34% one-year return. The biotechnology company, with a market capitalization of $3.24 billion, recently raised $345.1 million through a public offering and saw increased price targets from analysts following positive Phase III trial results for its oral TYK2 inhibitor, Envudeucitinib.

title: Prediction: ARM Holdings Will Be 2026's Most Surprising AI Winner
summary: Despite a couple of disappointing years for Arm Holdings (NASDAQ: ARM) shares, the company is poised for significant growth in 2026 due to its crucial role in AI data centers. Arm's power-efficient microchip architecture and unique licensing business model, with long-term deals with tech giants like Amazon, Google, and Apple, position it as a surprising AI winner as these agreements mature and revenue streams increase. Analysts predict substantial top-line and sales growth for Arm Holdings in the coming years as its foundational work in the AI industry begins to fully materialize.

title: A Meta deal just turned this 175-year-old company into a linchpin of the AI data center boom
summary: Corning, a 175-year-old company known for various glass innovations, has become a crucial supplier for AI data centers following a deal with Meta. Meta has committed up to $6 billion to Corning by 2030 for fiber-optic cable, prompting Corning to expand its manufacturing facility in North Carolina. This deal, which sent Corning's stock soaring 16%, highlights the company's re-invention as a key player in the AI boom by providing essential fiber-optic infrastructure for connecting powerful GPUs within data centers.

title: United Parcel Service Inc (NYSE:UPS) Beats Market Expectations
summary: United Parcel Service Inc (NYSE:UPS) reported Q4 FY25 results that beat market expectations, despite a 1.13% stock dip. The company announced adjusted earnings per share of $2.38 and revenue of $24.5 billion, surpassing analyst estimates. UPS also approved a Q1 2026 dividend of $1.64 per share and provided a full-year 2026 revenue outlook of approximately $89.7 billion.

title: ServiceNow posts better-than-expected fourth-quarter results
summary: ServiceNow exceeded Wall Street's expectations for its fourth-quarter earnings and provided optimistic guidance. The company's recent strategic acquisitions, intended to bolster its AI and security capabilities, reinforce its commitment to accelerating organic growth rather than pivoting away from it. Despite a post-earnings dip in share price, the enterprise software firm demonstrated strong financial performance and a significant increase in subscription revenues.

title: Stifel Stays Bullish on Amazon (AMZN) Ahead of Earnings
summary: Stifel analyst Mark Kelley reiterated a Buy rating on Amazon (AMZN) and raised the price target to $300 from $295, citing strong advertising checks, e-commerce trends, and robust AWS growth. This optimistic outlook comes ahead of Amazon's earnings report on February 5, with Stifel predicting that Amazon's strengths will help it overcome challenges like consumer spending weakness and lead to stock outperformance in 2026.

title: Amazon.com, Inc. (AMZN) Stock: Shares Hold Near $245 As Amazon Cuts 16,000 Corporate Jobs In AI-Driven Restructuring
summary: Amazon is cutting approximately 16,000 corporate jobs, marking its second major layoff round in three months, driven by an AI-led restructuring aimed at streamlining operations and reducing management layers. Despite these workforce reductions, Amazon reported strong profits and revenue, with investors reacting positively to the efficiency gains. The company's stock, AMZN, has shown resilience, outperforming the S&P 500 year-to-date, as the market prioritizes profitability and AI integration over job numbers.

title: Costco Wholesale Corporation (COST): A Bull Case Theory
summary: This article summarizes a bullish thesis on Costco Wholesale Corporation (COST), highlighting its strong financial position with over $15 billion in cash and robust free cash flow generation. The company's exceptional balance sheet and disciplined capital allocation are emphasized, despite its high valuation multiples. The primary risks identified are valuation-driven and the need to maintain its core values to preserve member trust and volume.

title: Cipher Mining (CIFR) Jumps 13.7% as Tech Giants Pour More Funds Into AI
summary: Cipher Mining (CIFR) saw its share prices jump by 13.71 percent due to increased investor interest in high-performance computing operators, following Nvidia Corp.’s $2 billion investment in CoreWeave Inc. The investment firm Keefe, Bruyette and Woods also raised Cipher Mining's price target to $22, citing the company's strong execution of its AI colocation strategy. This positive sentiment highlights confidence in the AI sector despite some concerns about a potential AI bubble.

title: TeraWulf (WULF) Rebounds 11% on AI Bets
summary: TeraWulf (WULF) saw an 11% rebound on Tuesday, closing at $15.31 per share, following news of Nvidia's $2 billion investment in CoreWeave, a cloud computing services provider. This surge reflects growing confidence in the AI sector despite "AI bubble" concerns. TeraWulf itself has active partnerships with Fluidstack and Google to develop high-performance computing capacity for AI needs, including an $8.7 billion leasing agreement and plans for a 168-MW HPC facility.

title: Assessing Alibaba Group Holding (NYSE:BABA) Valuation After Nvidia H200 Chip Approval
summary: Alibaba Group Holding received approval to order Nvidia’s H200 AI chips, alleviating supply concerns and boosting investor interest in its AI ambitions. Despite a recent share price decline over 90 days, Alibaba's one-year return is strong, and the company is seen as undervalued by analysts, with a fair value estimate of $254. However, potential risks include future regulatory pressure in China or tighter export controls on advanced chips.

title: Bank of America resets Amazon stock price target before earnings
summary: Bank of America has updated its price target for Amazon (AMZN) stock to $286 from $303 ahead of the company's Q4 earnings release on February 5. Analyst Justin Post and his team project Amazon to exceed Wall Street's estimates for Q4 revenue and EBIT, expecting 22% year-over-year AWS revenue growth. The lowered price target reflects broader software as a service sector multiple compression, despite positive indicators like AWS's new European Sovereign Cloud and strategic partnerships.

title: €30B–€40B used fashion market: Percentil brings stock to Amazon Spain
summary: MySize's subsidiary, Percentil, has expanded its reach into the European second-hand fashion market by listing curated inventory on Amazon Spain. This move taps into a significant market opportunity estimated at €30-40 billion, allowing Percentil to leverage Amazon's broad customer base while maintaining control over sourcing and quality. The company views this initial rollout in Spain as a blueprint for potential expansion into other European markets, complementing its existing primary marketplace, percentil.com.

title: Synchrony Financial (NYSE:SYF) Q4 2025 Earnings Call Transcript
summary: Synchrony Financial reported strong Q4 2025 earnings, with net earnings of $751 million ($2.40 diluted EPS), beating expectations. The company highlighted robust purchase volume growth, successful partner renewals, and strategic investments in digital capabilities and multi-product offerings like Pay Later. Despite a flat EPS outlook for 2026, Synchrony anticipates mid-single-digit loan growth driven by new programs, including Walmart, and aims for long-term double-digit EPS growth.

title: Amazon to Open Largest Retail Store in Chicago Suburb
summary: Amazon is set to open its largest retail store in the Chicago suburbs, specifically in Orland Park, after securing approval from the village board. The 230,000-square-foot store will sell groceries and household items, and is expected to create 500 permanent jobs. This move signifies Amazon's renewed focus on physical retail, aiming to balance its online and in-person shopping presence.

title: TD Cowen Raises United Parcel Service (NYSE:UPS) Price Target to $115.00
summary: TD Cowen has increased its price target for United Parcel Service (UPS) to $115.00 from $101.00, maintaining a "hold" rating, suggesting a potential 7.24% upside. This adjustment follows UPS beating Q4 earnings estimates with an adjusted EPS of $2.38 and revenue of $24.5 billion, and providing higher 2026 revenue guidance. Despite positive sentiment from earnings and dividend announcements, the company faces near-term execution risks due to planned job cuts and a strategic shift away from low-margin Amazon volume.

title: Attractive Valuations Drive Interest in QXO Inc (QXO)
summary: QXO Inc (NYSE: QXO) is gaining interest due to attractive valuations, with RBC Capital Markets and Citi reaffirming Outperform and Buy ratings despite lowering target prices slightly. The company is a tech-enabled distributor of building products aggressively expanding and is seen as a strong large-cap stock. The article also discusses broader AI investment opportunities, suggesting some AI stocks offer even greater promise for returns.

title: The AI Data Lake: A Deep-Dive into Western Digital’s (WDC) Resurgence in 2026
summary: Western Digital (WDC) has undergone a significant transformation, pivoting into a critical infrastructure provider for the AI era after separating its Flash unit. Now a pure-play hard disk drive (HDD) company, WDC is experiencing a resurgence driven by the massive data storage needs of AI, with its stock performing exceptionally well. Despite risks associated with technological transitions and industry cyclicality, strong leadership and market position make WDC a compelling investment in 2026.

title: The Architect of the Grid: Why GE Vernova (GEV) Tumbled 3.3% Amidst a Blockbuster Earnings Beat
summary: GE Vernova (GEV) experienced a 3.3% stock drop despite reporting a blockbuster fiscal year 2025 earnings beat, exceeding analyst estimates and raising 2026 revenue guidance. The decline is attributed to market expectations, with investors weighing the company's crucial role in the "AI Power Supercycle" against a high valuation and challenges within its Wind segment. The article details GE Vernova's business model, strong financial performance, leadership, and competitive landscape, concluding that the dip is likely a brief pause in a larger growth story.

title: Amazon cuts 16,000 jobs globally in broader restructuring
summary: Amazon announced it is cutting 16,000 jobs worldwide, marking its second major round of layoffs in three months. The company is restructuring after pandemic-era over-hiring and focusing on expanding the adoption of artificial intelligence tools, which its CEO believes will lead to more automation and corporate job losses. These cuts contribute to a broader goal of trimming about 30,000 corporate roles across various departments.

title: Celestica Inc. (CLS): A Bull Case Theory
summary: This article summarizes a bullish thesis on Celestica Inc. (CLS), highlighting its transformation from a low-margin Electronics Manufacturing Services provider to a high-margin Connectivity & Cloud Solutions partner, especially in AI data centers. The strategy involves selling deep out-of-the-money put options to acquire the high-growth company at a discount while generating immediate premium income. The thesis points to the company's strong balance sheet, free cash flow, and integral role in the AI Capex supercycle as key drivers for future growth and stability.

title: Amazon slashing16,000 corporate jobs
summary: Amazon is cutting 16,000 corporate jobs to reduce bureaucracy, increase ownership, and streamline its operations. This move follows a pandemic-era hiring surge and a previous wave of layoffs, bringing the total job reductions to 30,000 in three months. Other tech companies like ASML, Meta, Pinterest, and Autodesk are also announcing layoffs and reallocating resources, often towards AI initiatives.

title: Eli Lilly (LLY) Drives Q4 Gains as Pharma Fundamentals Shine Amid Sector Rotation
summary: Polen Capital Management's Q4 2025 investor letter highlighted Eli Lilly and Company (LLY) as a top relative contributor to their Polen Focus Growth Strategy despite the overall fund underperforming due to market volatility. Eli Lilly's stock rallied over 40% in Q4 2025, driven by strong financial results, market leadership, and a new agreement with the White House regarding GLP-1 drug pricing, which is expected to expand its addressable market. The company remains a significant holding among hedge funds, although Polen Capital Management also noted a focus on AI stocks for potentially higher, shorter-term returns.

title: AeroVironment, Inc. (AVAV) Gains Tailwinds as Geopolitical Tensions Drive Defense Investment
summary: AeroVironment, Inc. (AVAV) is benefiting from increased geopolitical spending, with analysts reiterating "Market Outperform" ratings due to its position in drone and cyber spaces and strong international presence. Despite a stop-work order on a key program, the company is seen as a defense technology leader. The article also includes promotional content for AI-related investment opportunities.

title: BTIG lowers Synchrony Financial stock price target to $96 on expense concerns
summary: BTIG has lowered its price target for Synchrony Financial (NYSE:SYF) to $96 from $100, while maintaining a Buy rating. The adjustment follows Synchrony's 2026 guidance, which was "inline to slightly worse" than anticipated, leading to a 6% share price drop considered "overly draconian" by BTIG. The firm emphasizes that Synchrony's future valuation hinges on successful growth through new partnerships and effective expense control to meet long-term efficiency targets.

title: NapLab Shares Mattress Report on Current Brand Variety
summary: NapLab has released a report detailing the mattress industry, revealing that a few major companies own most popular mattress brands despite the appearance of wide variety. The report identifies key players like Somnigroup International, Ashley Global Retail, 3Z Brands, Saatva Inc., The Flex Bedding Group, Serta Simmons Bedding LLC, and GoodMorning.com, outlining their acquisitions and the brands they control. This consolidation means consumers often choose among brands owned by the same parent company, making tools like NapLab's reports valuable for informed decision-making.

title: UPS to Eliminate 30,000 Positions and Shut Facilities While Cutting Amazon Dependence
summary: United Parcel Service (UPS) plans to eliminate up to 30,000 operational jobs and close 24 facilities in 2026. This move is part of a strategy to reduce its dependence on Amazon deliveries and achieve $3 billion in cost savings. The company aims for a more profitable model by scaling back Amazon shipments, which previously accounted for 12% of its revenue, and increasing automation.

title: Dollar General expands reach of rural same-day delivery service
summary: Dollar General is expanding its same-day delivery service, MyDG Delivery, to over 17,000 locations, primarily targeting underserved rural areas. This initiative is part of the company's broader digital strategy to personalize user experience and reach more customers, building on a successful third quarter with increased net sales and income. Other major retailers like Walmart and Amazon are also increasing their focus on rapid delivery services to a wider range of U.S. households, including rural communities.

title: UMB Financial earnings beat by $0.38, revenue topped estimates
summary: UMB Financial (NASDAQ: UMBF) reported strong fourth-quarter results, beating analyst estimates for both earnings per share (EPS) and revenue. The company posted an EPS of $3.08, surpassing the consensus of $2.70, and revenue of $720.9 million, exceeding the $677.77 million estimate. UMBF's stock has shown positive performance, rising 16.82% in the last three months and 2.66% over the past year.

title: News | Blackstone sells shopping center in Chicago suburbs at massive discount
summary: Blackstone has sold the Streets of Woodfield shopping center in Schaumburg, Illinois, for $69 million to Hutensky Capital Partners, representing a significant loss from its 2015 purchase price of $168.5 million. This discounted sale highlights challenges in the retail property market, including the impact of COVID-19, retailer bankruptcies, and changing consumer habits. Hutensky Capital plans to invest further in the property, seeing it as an opportunity to build on an already strong tenant lineup and fill vacant spaces.

title: Kroger Launches Fast, Convenient Delivery on Uber Apps Nationwide; Jody Kalmbach and Hashim Amin Comment
summary: Kroger and Uber Technologies have partnered to launch delivery services from nearly 2,700 Kroger Family of Companies stores on Uber Eats, Uber, and Postmates apps. This collaboration expands access to groceries and household essentials, offering on-demand and same-day delivery. Customers can also benefit from launch discounts and Uber One member perks.

title: How 2026 AI Spending Forecasts Could Reshape Big Tech Stock Performance
summary: This article discusses how capital expenditure projections for AI spending by hyperscalers like Microsoft, Meta, Alphabet, and Amazon will be crucial for their stock performance in 2026. While financial results for the past quarter might meet expectations, the market's focus will primarily be on the future capex guidance for AI development. Analyst David Sekera suggests that if these spending forecasts do not continue to increase, investors in AI stocks, many of which are already considered overvalued, could face disappointment.
authors: David Sekera, CFA, Susan Dziubinski, Jess Bebel

title: Safe Pro Group (NASDAQ: SPAI) Partners With Lantronix to Advance Edge AI Threat Detection for Defense Drones
summary: Safe Pro Group (NASDAQ: SPAI) has partnered with Lantronix Inc. (Nasdaq: LTRX) to develop and commercialize embeddable chipsets for drone and autonomous vehicle platforms. The collaboration aims to integrate Safe Pro's AI threat detection algorithms with Lantronix's system-on-module solutions. This will enable real-time, on-device detection of threats like landmines, enhancing performance for defense and commercial unmanned systems without relying on cloud connectivity.

title: Amazon.com Inc. (AMZN) Analysts Update Coverage
summary: Bank of America has lowered its 12-month price target for Amazon (AMZN) to $286.00 from $303.00, maintaining a "Buy" rating, due to a more conservative near-term outlook on consumer spending and increased investment in logistics and AI. In contrast, Stifel Nicolaus raised its price target to $300.00 from $295.00, reinstating a "Buy" rating, driven by accelerating profitability in AWS and improving operating leverage in North American retail. Both firms, however, expressed continued confidence in Amazon's long-term growth fundamentals, especially in AWS and AI-driven services.

title: Rackspace names Joseph Vito to lead global alliances
summary: Rackspace Technology has appointed Joseph Vito as Senior Vice President of Strategic Alliance Partnerships, where he will lead the company's global strategy for technology and channel relationships. Vito, who has over 25 years of experience in technology leadership, joins Rackspace from Amazon Web Services and Dell-EMC, and has held significant roles in financial services. His appointment underscores Rackspace's focus on modern cloud environments, AI-related workloads, and strengthening partnerships with hyperscale cloud firms and channel partners.

title: Amazon Go is shutting down
summary: Amazon announced it is shutting down both its Amazon Go convenience store chain and Amazon Fresh grocery brand due to not achieving a "truly distinctive customer experience with the right economic model needed for large-scale expansion." The company plans to convert some of these locations to its Whole Foods Market brand. This marks an end to a challenging period for Amazon's physical retail presence, despite its "Just Walk Out" technology being widely adopted by third parties.

title: Broadcom set to retain leadership position as AI server compute ASIC partner through 2027: Counterpoint
summary: Counterpoint Research projects Broadcom will maintain its leading position in the AI server compute ASIC market, holding approximately 60% of the partner share by 2027. This growth is largely fueled by hyperscalers like Google, AWS, Meta, and Microsoft, who are increasingly deploying in-house AI accelerators to meet escalating computing demands and reduce reliance on general-purpose GPUs. While Google and Amazon's shares are expected to decline due to diversification, Marvell's new technologies could expand its presence in scale-up connectivity.

title: Does Azure AI Growth Make Microsoft Stock a Buy Ahead of Q2 Earnings?
summary: Microsoft's upcoming Q2 fiscal 2026 earnings are expected to highlight significant growth in its Intelligent Cloud segment, primarily driven by Azure and its AI initiatives. Key factors include a major partnership with OpenAI, expansion of its AI ecosystem through Azure Ignite innovations like Microsoft Foundry, and enhanced infrastructure, all contributing to increased Azure consumption and making Microsoft stock a potential buy. The company faces competition but solidifies its position through strategic investments and product development.

title: Meta signs deal to pay Corning up to $6 billion for fiber-optic cables, CNBC reports
summary: Meta Platforms has reportedly signed a deal with Corning worth up to $6 billion through 2030 for fiber-optic cables to support its AI data centers. Corning expects AI hyperscalers like Meta, Amazon, Alphabet, and Microsoft to be its primary customers next year, driving significant growth and prompting an expansion of its cable factory in North Carolina. This agreement underscores Meta's aggressive investment in AI infrastructure despite recent challenges with its AI models.

title: Responsive Playbooks and the AMZZ Inflection
summary: This article analyzes Graniteshares 2x Long Amzn Daily Etf (NASDAQ: AMZZ), noting a strong near-term sentiment but neutral mid and long-term outlook. AI models have generated specific trading strategies for different risk profiles, highlighting a mid-channel oscillation pattern and an exceptional risk-reward setup. Key findings indicate a potential 16.0% gain versus 0.3% risk.
authors: Mike Midland, Thomas H. Kee Jr.

title: Form DEF 14A Eaton Vance Municipal For: Mar 11 Filed by: Eaton Vance California Municipal Income Trust
summary: Eaton Vance California Municipal Income Trust filed Form DEF 14A, a definitive proxy statement, for its Annual Meeting of Shareholders scheduled for March 11, 2026. Shareholders will vote on the election of three Class III Trustees: Alan C. Bowser, Keith Quinton, and Marcus L. Smith. The document provides detailed information on the Trustees, their compensation, the Board's committees, risk oversight, and auditor information, and outlines the meeting agenda and voting procedures.

title: $5.2T social shopping market: Amaze backs SoCom 2026 creator summit
summary: Amaze (AMZE) announced its sponsorship of the second annual SoCom Conference, the first dedicated social commerce conference, set to take place in Venice Beach on February 26, 2026. This sponsorship highlights Amaze's commitment to creator-led retail, supporting the rapidly growing social commerce market projected to reach $5.2 trillion by 2030. As part of the event, Amaze will host a private Creator Dinner and a post-conference mixer to foster connections and collaboration among creators, brands, and platform leaders.

title: ptc launches ai-powered parts management tool for manufacturers
summary: PTC has launched Windchill AI Parts Rationalization, an AI-powered tool designed to help manufacturers manage parts more efficiently within their product lifecycle management solution. This new capability aims to reduce inventory costs, accelerate engineering work, and improve data quality by detecting duplicate parts and driving consolidation. The tool minimizes operational disruption as it deploys as a plugin and is part of PTC's broader Intelligent Product Lifecycle vision.

title: Joseph Vito Joins Rackspace Technology to Lead Strategic Alliance Partnerships
summary: Rackspace Technology has appointed Joseph Vito as Senior Vice President of Strategic Alliance Partnerships to lead the company's global strategy for building and strengthening technology and channel partnerships. Vito brings over 25 years of experience in technology leadership, cloud transformation, and enterprise solutions, having previously served as a Strategic Transformation Principal at Amazon Web Services (AWS). His expertise is expected to be crucial in advancing Rackspace's mission to deliver modern cloud environments that enable AI at scale.

title: Synchrony Financial (NYSE:SYF) Misses Q4 CY2025 Sales Expectations
summary: Synchrony Financial (NYSE:SYF) reported Q4 CY2025 sales of $3.79 billion, missing market expectations and staying flat year-on-year, though GAAP profit per share was in line with estimates at $2.04. The company's net interest margin exceeded forecasts, but its efficiency ratio and tangible book value per share fell short. This performance led to a slight dip in stock price following the announcement.

title: UPS Releases 4Q 2025 Earnings And Provides 2026 Guidance
summary: UPS announced its fourth-quarter 2025 consolidated revenues reached $24.5 billion, with diluted EPS of $2.10 and non-GAAP adjusted diluted EPS of $2.38. The company also declared a quarterly dividend of $1.64 per share. For the full year 2026, UPS projects consolidated revenue of approximately $89.7 billion and a non-GAAP adjusted operating margin of about 9.6%.

title: AI's business future: What's to come in the next 5 years
summary: This article forecasts the business implications of AI over the next five years, highlighting its increasing adoption despite early stages. It predicts AI's impact on areas like customer interaction, auditing, logistics, and even C-level management, alongside potential challenges such as sustainability, ongoing hallucination issues, and security vulnerabilities. The author emphasizes that while AI will automate many tasks, it will also necessitate a shift in human roles, focusing on higher-level strategic work.

title: A Deep Dive into the iShares MSCI World ETF: A U.S.-Powered Global Vehicle
summary: The iShares MSCI World ETF (URTH) offers diversified exposure to developed market equities but is heavily concentrated in U.S. technology stocks, which has driven recent performance but introduces significant risk. Its future hinges on the continued success of these major U.S. tech giants, the broader AI trend, and the global economic climate. Investors should consider its high U.S. weighting and tech focus when comparing it to other global equity ETFs.

title: The Mid-Cap Renaissance: A Deep Dive into DigitalOcean’s Specialized Cloud Strategy
summary: DigitalOcean Holdings, Inc. (NYSE: DOCN) is highlighted as a key player in the "Mid-Cap Renaissance" within the tech sector, shifting investor sentiment away from mega-caps. The article details DigitalOcean's specialized cloud strategy, focusing on developers and SMBs, its aggressive pivot into AI inference cloud services, and strong financial performance. It also covers the company's competitive landscape, leadership, and future opportunities, positioning DOCN as a promising mid-cap growth stock.

title: Pattern Group stock jumps 13% in afternoon trade as momentum swings return
summary: Shares of Pattern Group Inc. (NASDAQ:PATG) saw a significant jump of approximately 13% in afternoon trading, reaching as high as $16.27, despite no specific company announcement. The rise is attributed to broader market trends and investor positioning, as the young public stock is known for sharp swings based on risk appetite. Investors are now awaiting the company's upcoming financial results and any updates regarding its Amazon exposure and growth guidance.

title: Alibaba Deepens AI And Chip Efforts As Valuation Gap Persists
summary: Alibaba Group Holding is advancing its artificial intelligence and chip design efforts, with plans for an IPO of its in-house chip unit T-Head and the launch of its Qwen3-Max AI model. The company, which trades significantly below analyst targets and Simply Wall St's fair value estimate, is also expanding its ecosystem by supporting partner Moonshot AI and joining Open Invention Network 2.0. These strategic moves aim to bolster Alibaba's position in AI infrastructure and domestic chip capabilities amidst persistent valuation gaps for investors.

title: TotalEnergies signs 10-year green power deal with papermaker SWM
summary: TotalEnergies has signed a 10-year agreement to supply 800 gigawatt-hours of renewable electricity to papermaker SWM at three sites in France. This deal, which commenced this month, is part of TotalEnergies' strategy to expand its integrated power business and helps SWM secure half of its French electricity needs from renewable sources for the next decade, significantly reducing its Scope 1 and 2 emissions. TotalEnergies aims to increase its electricity production by approximately 20% annually, reaching 100 terawatt-hours by 2030, through similar agreements with other major companies.

title: Wix.com’s (WIX) Downslide Makes It An Attractive Buy
summary: Wix.com (WIX) is considered an attractive buy despite a recent downslide, with analysts maintaining price targets that suggest significant upside potential. The company recently launched "Wix Harmony," a new AI website builder offering advanced visual editing capabilities and addressing security concerns, which has improved investor sentiment. Although there are investment risks, the article suggests Wix could be a promising AI stock, also featuring promotional material for other AI investment opportunities.

title: Lantronix and Safe Pro Group Launch Partnership to Advance AI-Driven Edge Intelligence for Defense and Autonomous Systems
summary: Lantronix and Safe Pro Group have announced a partnership to advance AI-driven edge intelligence for defense and autonomous systems. They will jointly develop Qualcomm-based edge compute solutions to deliver real-time, on-device threat detection for drones and unmanned systems without cloud reliance. This collaboration aims to integrate Safe Pro's AI algorithms with Lantronix's Open-Q™ System-on-Module solutions to enhance the performance of next-generation unmanned systems and expand Lantronix's presence in the secure defense and commercial drone market.

title: Stifel Sees Signs of a Demand Recovery for Texas Instruments (TXN)
summary: Stifel analyst Tore Svanberg raised Texas Instruments' price target to $200 from $170, maintaining a Hold rating, as demand for analog chips appears to be recovering. The report noted solid AI infrastructure spending and the growing reality of edge AI, both of which Texas Instruments' products support through various end markets like AI-focused data centers, aerospace, and industrial automation. The company is poised to benefit as more customers integrate AI into their systems, increasing demand for supporting analog semiconductors.

title: 3 Reasons to Sell RGEN and 1 Stock to Buy Instead
summary: Repligen Corp (RGEN) has seen a significant stock price increase, outperforming the S&P 500, but the author advises caution. Reasons to sell include slow organic growth indicating waning demand, shrinking adjusted operating margins, and declining return on invested capital. Instead, the article suggests looking at other market-beating stocks, particularly those identified by StockStory's High Quality list.

title: Vornado JV Completes $250 Million Refinancing of 7 West 34th Street
summary: Vornado Realty Trust's 53% owned joint venture has completed a $250 million refinancing of its 7 West 34th Street property, a Class A Manhattan office building fully leased by Amazon. The new non-recourse, five-year interest-only loan has a fixed rate of 5.79% and matures in February 2031. This refinancing paid down the prior $300 million loan by $50 million, replacing a higher-interest, fully recourse loan.

title: Analyst Raises Comstock Resources (CRK) Price Target to $20
summary: Comstock Resources (NYSE:CRK) saw its share price surge by 14.35% from January 16-23, 2026, making it one of the top-gaining energy stocks. Morgan Stanley increased its price target for CRK from $19 to $20, maintaining an ‘Equal Weight’ rating, following a rebound in natural gas prices and the company's strong performance in 2025. The article notes that while CRK has potential, "AI stocks hold greater promise for delivering higher returns."

title: Microsoft Stock 'Still In The Lead In The AI Revolution': Analyst Expects 'Robust' Q2 Results
summary: Wedbush analyst Dan Ives has maintained an Outperform rating on Microsoft (NASDAQ: MSFT) with a $625 price target, anticipating robust Q2 results driven by Azure's growth and the company's lead in the AI revolution. Ives believes the market is underestimating Azure's AI-driven growth trajectory and positions Microsoft as a compelling large-cap tech stock. Despite increased competition and concerns about its OpenAI relationship, Microsoft is expected to continue heavy spending on AI buildout, solidifying its front-runner position in enterprise hyper-scale AI.

title: Intel's Make-or-Break Foundry Moment Arrives This Year
summary: Intel's foundry business faces a critical year as it seeks external customers for its advanced manufacturing processes, particularly Intel 14A. While the Intel 18A process is producing chips internally, major external customer commitments are lacking. CEO Lip-Bu Tan emphasizes that future capacity for Intel 14A relies on securing these customer deals, making 2026 a make-or-break year for the company's long-term foundry strategy.

title: Microsoft unveils latest AI chip to reduce reliance on Nvidia
summary: Microsoft has introduced its second-generation AI chip, the Maia 200, to improve the efficiency of its services and offer an alternative to Nvidia's hardware. The chip, produced by TSMC, is being deployed in Microsoft's data centers and will power internal AI teams and cloud services. This move follows similar initiatives by Amazon and Google, aiming to reduce costs and dependence on external chip suppliers.

title: Dollar General rolls out same-day delivery shake-up to rival Amazon
summary: Dollar General is expanding its same-day delivery service, myDG Delivery, to over 17,000 stores, primarily in rural areas, to compete with Amazon. The company's move comes after Amazon's own billion-dollar effort to enhance its rural delivery network. Additionally, Dollar General customers may be eligible for a slice of a $15 million class action settlement regarding alleged pricing discrepancies.

title: Amazon.com to Webcast Fourth Quarter 2025 Financial Results Conference Call
summary: Amazon.com, Inc. (NASDAQ: AMZN) announced it will hold a conference call on Thursday, February 5, 2026, at 2:00 p.m. PT/5:00 p.m. ET to discuss its fourth quarter 2025 financial results. The event will be webcast live, with audio and associated slides available on the company's investor relations website for at least three months. This announcement provides key details for investors and media regarding Amazon's upcoming financial disclosure.

title: Mattel Brick Shop expands product line with Hot Wheels
summary: Mattel Brick Shop is expanding its Hot Wheels vehicle line in 2026 through new collaborations with Lamborghini, Aston Martin, and Toyota. These customizable building sets, which feature real metal parts, will aim to engage adult collectors and automotive enthusiasts by reflecting each automaker's unique heritage. The new products will be available globally at select retailers and directly via Mattel Creations.

title: Can Oracle's FedRAMP Push Unlock Federal Cloud Opportunities?
summary: Oracle is strategically targeting federal cloud opportunities by pursuing FedRAMP authorization for its Primavera Cloud platform, which specializes in project management for government infrastructure. This move aims to leverage Oracle's niche in complex federal projects, allowing it to compete with established federal cloud providers like Amazon, Microsoft, and Salesforce. By meeting stringent compliance requirements, Oracle seeks to secure long-term revenue streams within the government sector.

title: Digital Realty Trust Is Quietly Eating the Internet – Is This Data-Center Giant Your Next Power Mo
summary: Digital Realty Trust is presented as a crucial, behind-the-scenes player in the internet infrastructure, owning the data centers that house AI and cloud servers. The article discusses whether this REIT, known for its steady dividends and long-term growth potential from AI and cloud expansion, is a smart investment. It contrasts Digital Realty with competitor Equinix and evaluates the stock based on AI tailwinds, dividend potential, and risk factors like interest rates, concluding it's a "cop" for long-term, income-focused investors.

title: The 100MW AI Factory: Siemens and nVent Standardize the Future of Hyperscale Infrastructure
summary: Siemens AG and nVent Electric plc have collaborated to introduce a standardized 100MW blueprint for "AI Factories," designed to address the intense power and cooling demands of next-generation AI compute clusters. This modular architecture, featuring liquid cooling and grid-interactive power systems, aims to significantly reduce the deployment time for hyperscale AI infrastructure. The partnership positions them competitively in the AI infrastructure market, offering a more efficient and sustainable solution for building large-scale AI data centers.

title: AT&T Launches Our First End-to-End IoT Solution on the AWS Marketplace with Connected Spaces
summary: AT&T has launched its Connected Spaces solution, an end-to-end IoT offering, on the AWS Marketplace, simplifying smart business operations for SMEs. This plug-and-play solution allows businesses to monitor environmental conditions in near real-time, optimize resources, and enhance customer experiences. This collaboration streamlines procurement and accelerates time-to-value for various industries.

title: Amazon com : Web Services announces new agreement with Nationwide Building Society to accelerate digital innovation and enhance customer experience
summary: Amazon Web Services (AWS) has announced a new agreement with Nationwide Building Society. This partnership aims to accelerate digital innovation within Nationwide and improve the overall customer experience.

title: Wells Fargo Names Faraz Shafiq as Head of AI Products and Solutions
summary: Wells Fargo has appointed Faraz Shafiq as its Head of AI Products and Solutions, effective February 9, 2026. Shafiq, formerly of Amazon Web Services, will oversee the vision and development of enterprise-wide AI products, reporting to Saul Van Beurden, Head of AI and Co-CEO of Consumer Banking and Lending. This move underscores Wells Fargo's strategic commitment to leveraging AI to innovate financial services and enhance its operations for customers and employees.

title: AI tool from Home Depot turns hours of job planning into minutes
summary: The Home Depot has launched Material List Builder AI, a new free tool for Pro Xtra members that streamlines creating project material lists. This AI-powered capability converts voice, text, or existing documents into organized lists of materials, saving professionals hours of manual work. The tool also provides product recommendations, preferred pricing, and inventory availability, allowing for efficient ordering and saving lists for recurring jobs.

title: AI malware tool that flags 39 malicious functions in minutes
summary: Booz Allen Hamilton has made its AI-powered malware reverse engineering and threat intelligence product, Vellox Reverser, generally available. This tool automates in-depth malware analysis, rapidly delivering actionable intelligence and countermeasures for complex cyber threats. Built with an agentic AI architecture using AWS Lambda and Amazon Bedrock, Vellox Reverser streamlines threat detection and response for federal and commercial customers, significantly reducing investigation time and strengthening cyber defenses.

title: $44.13 Billion Hyperlocal Grocery Delivery Market Outlook,
summary: The global hyperlocal grocery delivery market is projected to reach $44.13 billion by 2031, growing at a CAGR of 10.77%, driven by increasing demand for rapid delivery, urbanization, and convenience. Key catalysts include the expansion of quick commerce infrastructure and dark stores, facilitating faster last-mile deliveries. Challenges persist in the economic viability of last-mile delivery due to high operational costs and thin profit margins in the food retail sector, but trends like AI-driven logistics and eco-friendly fleets are emerging to optimize efficiency and sustainability.

title: Mitsubishi UFJ Trust & Banking Corp Sells 34,796 Shares of Marvell Technology, Inc. $MRVL
summary: Mitsubishi UFJ Trust & Banking Corp significantly reduced its stake in Marvell Technology, Inc. by selling 34,796 shares, retaining 365,227 shares valued at approximately $30.7 million. Despite this trimming, other institutions like OVERSEA CHINESE BANKING Corp Ltd substantially increased their holdings, contributing to institutional ownership of 83.51%. Marvell Technology reported strong Q3 earnings, beating expectations, and provided optimistic Q4 guidance, while analysts largely maintain a "Moderate Buy" rating with an average target price of $115.09.

title: Jim Cramer Shares How Amazon.com (AMZN) is Popular With Budget-Conscious Customer
summary: Jim Cramer highlighted Amazon.com (AMZN)'s popularity among budget-conscious customers, noting that people are "trading down" to cheaper options available on the platform despite competition from Walmart. Analysts at TD Cowen and Bernstein have maintained Buy and Outperform ratings, respectively, based on Amazon's advertisement business growth potential and the strength of Amazon Web Services and retail margins. The article also touches on the potential of AI stocks as an alternative investment.

title: Winmark’s S&P SmallCap 600 Debut Might Change The Case For Investing In Winmark (WINA)
summary: Winmark Corp. (WINA) was added to the S&P SmallCap 600 index on January 26, 2026, which may increase its visibility and liquidity among institutional investors. While this inclusion is largely a recognition event rather than a change to its core business, Winmark’s investment narrative remains centered on its high-margin franchising model, robust earnings, and dividends, despite high valuation and debt. Investors are advised to consider the unchanged risk factors like a leveraged balance sheet and a premium P/E ratio, which could amplify operational challenges.

title: Bull of the Day: Nvidia (NVDA)
summary: Nvidia (NVDA) is highlighted as a "Bull of the Day" due to its dominant position in the artificial intelligence sector, a market expected to see trillions in investment. Despite a recent plateau in stock price, its fundamentals have strengthened, leading to a more attractive valuation. The company is also poised for further growth with the expansion of AI into new verticals like physical AI and robotics, and a new deal allowing it to sell H20 AI chips in China.

title: Hasbro names Nintendo, Honest Co. executives to its board - Bizwomen
summary: Hasbro has appointed Carla Vernón, CEO of The Honest Co., and Doug Bowser, former president of Nintendo of America, to its board of directors. Vernón brings experience from Amazon and General Mills, while Bowser's tenure at Nintendo included the launch of the Switch and Switch 2. The appointments come as Hasbro prepares to relocate its headquarters to Boston later this year.

title: Viking Therapeutics, Inc. (VKTX) Advances Obesity Drug Development and Expands Metabolic Disease Pipeline
summary: Viking Therapeutics, Inc. (VKTX) is making significant strides in obesity drug development with its drug VK2735, which achieved 14.7% weight loss in a Phase 2 trial and is now in Phase 3. The company, a clinical-stage biopharma firm, is also developing drugs for other metabolic and endocrine diseases. The article notes the potential growth of VKTX but suggests that some AI stocks might offer even higher returns with less downside risk.

title: Evaluating Shopify (SHOP) After Partnerships Restructuring AI Push And Legal Victory
summary: Shopify (SHOP) is under evaluation after restructuring its partnerships, cutting roles, and focusing on AI-driven commerce, alongside a recent legal victory. Despite a weaker short-term stock performance, its long-term shareholder return remains strong. The article discusses Shopify's valuation, noting it is considered undervalued by some metrics while trading above estimated future cash flow by others, raising questions about whether market narrative or financial numbers are leading the perception.

title: Bitfarms Ltd. (BITF) Accelerates Strategic Shift Toward AI and High-Performance Computing Infrastructure
summary: Bitfarms Ltd. (BITF) is strategically shifting its focus from Bitcoin mining to AI and high-performance computing infrastructure, including developing data centers for NVIDIA GPUs. This move aims to diversify revenue, reduce crypto-volatility reliance, and align with long-term AI growth. The company is also redomiciling to the U.S. and has appointed Edie Hofmeister as board chair to attract U.S. capital and broaden its investor base.

title: Needham Reiterates Buy on Docebo Inc. (DCBO), Sees Significant Upside From Current Levels
summary: Needham has reiterated a Buy rating for Docebo Inc. (DCBO), setting a price target of $38.00, which suggests a significant upside of roughly 84% from current levels according to the average analyst sentiment. The education technology company is focusing on growing its customer base with high annual contract values and has introduced a credit-based pricing model for its AI-powered modules, enhancing flexibility and monetization. Docebo's management highlighted new customer acquisitions and expanded adoption within existing clients, indicating strong demand and deeper platform penetration.

title: Orla Mining (ORLA) Climbs 25% on Record-Breaking Gold Production
summary: Orla Mining Ltd. (ORLA) saw its shares climb 25% last week, reaching a new all-time high, driven by surging gold prices and reporting record-breaking gold production for the last year. The company exceeded its annual production guidance, delivering over 300,000 ounces of gold, thanks to strong operational execution in Mexico and Canada. This performance positions Orla Mining favorably amidst rising precious metal demand due to geopolitical tensions.

title: Barclays Sees 2026 as a Pivotal Year for Comcast Corporation (CMCSA) and the Broader Telecom Landscape
summary: Barclays analyst Kannan Venkateshwar has lowered Comcast's price target to $28 from $30 but maintained an "Equal Weight" rating, as part of a broader adjustment for the telecom sector's 2026 outlook. The analyst believes 2026 will establish a long-term operating roadmap for convergence and capital allocation in the industry, suggesting Comcast could still be an interesting value opportunity. Comcast has been focusing on new distribution channels, including a partnership with Amazon to roll out Amazon Luna on Xfinity devices.

title: Analog Devices, Inc. (ADI) Stands to Benefit as BofA Highlights Sector Tailwinds
summary: BofA raised its price target for Analog Devices, Inc. (ADI) to $350 from $320, maintaining a Buy rating, citing expected Q4 earnings beats and strong Q1 guidance for diversified analog semiconductor companies. The bank anticipates industrial-focused chipmakers to lead growth, driven by improving demand, steady pricing, and AI-related buildouts. Analog Devices is also investing heavily in R&D to maintain its technology advantage in various markets and align with themes like factory digitization and AI infrastructure expansion.

title: A Shift in Leadership: NVIDIA Tops Holdings in iShares MSCI World ETF
summary: The iShares MSCI World ETF (URTH) has seen a significant shift in its top holdings, with NVIDIA surpassing Apple and Microsoft to become its largest single position, now over 5% of the portfolio. This indicates a growing concentration in major U.S. technology stocks, despite URTH's robust performance in 2025. The article highlights the fund's portfolio concentration, compares it to other global ETFs, and discusses its forward outlook, including an anticipated index rebalance in February 2026.

title: After Taxis Then Uber, a New Player Arrives and Will Disrupt All Mobility
summary: Uber is poised to disrupt the mobility industry again with its new robotaxi service, developed in partnership with Lucid Motors and Nuro, and powered by NVIDIA DRIVE AGX Thor. This initiative, starting with early runs in San Francisco in December 2025 and aiming for broader service in 2026, raises questions about the future role of human Uber drivers as it competes with other autonomous vehicle players like Waymo and Tesla. The company emphasizes that robotaxis will enhance service, though the long-term impact on the gig economy and its business model remains to be seen.

title: OGE Energy Corp. (OGE) in Focus as RBC Capital Reassesses Utility Capital Plans
summary: RBC Capital analyst Stephen D’Ambrisi recently raised the price target for OGE Energy Corp. (OGE) to $51 from $49, maintaining a "Sector Perform" rating, in anticipation of fourth-quarter earnings in the utilities sector. This adjustment is part of a broader reevaluation of utility capital plans that have seen frequent changes over the past 18 months. BMO Capital also initiated coverage with a "Market Perform" rating and a $45 price target, highlighting opportunities for capital investment balanced against regulatory and political risks.

title: Capital Investment Counsel Inc Acquires 60,861 Shares of Marvell Technology, Inc. $MRVL
summary: Capital Investment Counsel Inc. significantly increased its stake in Marvell Technology, Inc. (NASDAQ:MRVL) during the third quarter of 2025, purchasing 60,861 additional shares and bringing its total holdings to 124,351 shares valued at $10.45 million. This move positions Marvell Technology as the fund's 13th largest holding, comprising about 1.3% of its investment portfolio. The increased investment comes as Wall Street analysts have turned more positive on the stock, raising price targets and assigning a "Moderate Buy" consensus rating, following Marvell's strong Q3 earnings beat and positive Q4 guidance.

title: Why Wall Street Is Wrong About Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Stock
summary: This article argues that Wall Street's consensus price target for Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing (TSMC) is too low, despite 98% of analysts rating it a buy. The author believes TSMC's stock can go "much higher" due to increasing demand for semiconductors from the AI industry, the company's dominant market position, and its attractive P/E ratio. TSMC's plans to increase capital expenditure and projected 30% sales growth in 2026 are highlighted as key drivers for future stock performance.

title: TrueMark Investments LLC Acquires Shares of 406,011 Blue Owl Capital Inc. $OWL
summary: TrueMark Investments LLC has acquired a new position of 406,011 shares in Blue Owl Capital Inc. (NYSE:OWL), valued at approximately $6.87 million, making it their 28th largest holding. This comes amidst a legal overhang from a securities class-action lawsuit covering purchases between February 6 and November 16, 2025, with a lead-plaintiff deadline of February 2, 2026. Despite this, company insiders, including the CFO and CEO, have been net buyers, purchasing 395,670 shares in the last 90 days.

title: How Walmart Inc. Turned Its Everyday Retail Empire Into a High-Tech Commerce Platform
summary: Walmart Inc. is transforming from a traditional retailer into a technology-driven commerce platform, integrating its physical stores with e-commerce, a marketplace, and advertising. This shift is powered by omnichannel shopping, the Walmart+ membership program, an expanded third-party marketplace, and a sophisticated AI and data backbone. The company leverages its extensive physical footprint and technological investments to offer competitive pricing, convenience, and a growing retail media business, positioning itself as a major contender against rivals like Amazon, Target, and Costco.

title: Amazon.com, Inc. (AMZN) Expands Its Reach in Digital Advertising
summary: Amazon.com, Inc. (AMZN) is expanding its digital advertising reach, with TD Cowen reiterating a Buy rating and raising its price target to $315 due to positive indicators from an annual advertising buyer survey. The firm expects a significant increase in advertising spending on Amazon's platform, projecting its advertising revenue to more than double to $141.7 billion by 2030. This growth is anticipated from an increased share in the global digital advertising market, expansion of its DSP product, Prime Video advertising, and generative AI-powered optimization.

title: Assessing Maplebear (CART) Valuation As Mixed Analyst Updates And Earnings Outlook Draw Fresh Attention
summary: Recent analyst updates and the upcoming Q4 and full-year 2025 earnings report for Maplebear (CART) have brought its valuation into focus. Despite a recent decline in its one-month and one-year share price, short-term momentum has picked up. The company, trading below an average analyst price target, is considered 20.8% undervalued with a narrative fair value of $50.37, driven by deepening enterprise partnerships and diversified revenue streams, provided it can manage rising costs and competition.

title: Target Corp.’s Quiet Flagship: How Its Omnichannel Machine Became Retail’s Real Product
summary: Target Corp. has transformed its store network and digital services into a cohesive omnichannel "product" that integrates its app, physical stores, and private labels to offer a seamless shopping experience. This strategy positions Target as a consumer-grade logistics platform, differentiating it from rivals like Walmart and Amazon by focusing on curated assortments, efficient same-day services, and a design-forward approach that minimizes shopping friction. The company's stock performance reflects investor confidence in this model, which aims for profitability through higher-margin private brands and cost-effective store-fulfilled orders, rather than solely competing on price or scale.

title: Sea In Focus As Indonesia E Commerce And Live Streams Shape Valuation
summary: Sea (NYSE:SE) is a key player in Indonesia's growing e-commerce market, especially with the rise of live-stream shopping impacting its valuation. The company's stock shows mixed performance, with short-term gains but a significant five-year decline. Investors are evaluating how effectively Sea can leverage live streams for engagement and conversion in the Indonesian market, considering its current valuation and the industry average P/E.

title: Data center stocks brace for a “show-me” week as Intel flags AI chip bottlenecks
summary: Data center stocks are entering a crucial week with mixed trends, as investors await major tech earnings and the Federal Reserve's announcement.
