Intel's recent revelation about not meeting AI chip demand signals both continued data center buildouts and potential timing challenges. The market is in a "show-me" phase, where companies must demonstrate revenue growth to justify high AI-related stock valuations, with the Fed's interest rate decision poised to impact rate-sensitive sectors.

title: Costco stock (COST) ends Friday higher; what to watch before the next U.S. session
summary: Costco (COST) shares closed Friday 0.7% higher at $983.25, just under the $1,000 mark. Investors are looking forward to several key dates, including a dividend record date on January 30, the release of January sales figures on February 4, and the fiscal second-quarter earnings call on March 5. Additionally, the company faces a new class-action lawsuit regarding "no preservatives" claims on its rotisserie chicken products.

title: Amazon.com (AMZN)'s E-Commerce Platform Faces Tariff-Related Price Spikes
summary: Amazon's e-commerce platform is experiencing short-term pressure due to tariff-related price spikes, with sellers passing costs onto consumers, causing investor sensitivity and a decline in shares. Despite this, Amazon is making strategic moves for long-term growth by securing Rio Tinto as a copper supplier for its data centers, reflecting AWS's role in boosting demand for AI infrastructure. The article suggests that while AMZN has potential, other AI stocks might offer greater upside with less risk.

title: BofA Keeps an Underperform Rating on Sigma Lithium Corporation (SGML)
summary: BofA has maintained an "Underperform" rating on Sigma Lithium Corporation (NASDAQ: SGML), increasing its price target from $13 to $14 due to potential dilutive equity raising and an insignificant operational update. Separately, Canaccord downgraded SGML to "Hold" from "Buy" and raised its price target to C$20.50, citing the company's inability to utilize waste piles and uncertainties regarding mining resumption. Despite a significant rise in quarterly net revenue for Sigma Lithium, the article suggests that AI stocks might offer greater returns in a shorter timeframe.

title: Rakuten Investment Management Inc. Makes New $2.55 Million Investment in Marvell Technology, Inc. $MRVL
summary: Rakuten Investment Management Inc. has initiated a new stake in Marvell Technology, Inc. (NASDAQ:MRVL) in Q3, purchasing 30,365 shares valued at approximately $2.55 million. This investment comes amidst various institutional changes in Marvell Technology's holdings and a broadly positive sentiment from analysts, who currently rate the stock as a "Moderate Buy" with an average price target of $115.09. Additionally, an executive at Marvell Technology recently sold a portion of their shares, reducing their ownership by over 20%.

title: Amaze Announces Expanded Partnership with Contend to Scale the Next Generation of Creator-Led Commerce
summary: Amaze Holdings, Inc. announced an expanded strategic partnership with Contend, a creative studio that has advised Amaze for some time. This collaboration will integrate Contend's expertise in building audience-first formats that drive demand with Amaze's global commerce platform. The partnership aims to scale creator-led commerce by developing high-conversion product launches across various sectors, enabling creators to build sustainable businesses through immersive storytelling and integrated fulfillment.

title: Blackhawk Capital Partners LLC Invests $1.69 Million in Marvell Technology, Inc. $MRVL
summary: Blackhawk Capital Partners LLC has acquired a new position in Marvell Technology, Inc. (NASDAQ:MRVL) during the third quarter, purchasing 20,092 shares valued at approximately $1.69 million. This investment comes as Marvell Technology reported strong third-quarter results, beating EPS and revenue expectations, and analysts maintain a "Moderate Buy" rating with an average price target of $115.09. Other institutional investors have also increased their stakes, bringing total institutional ownership to 83.51%.

title: Roku’s Expanding FAST and Commerce Partnerships Could Be A Game Changer For Roku (ROKU)
summary: Roku is experiencing rapid growth in engagement and reach, with The Roku Channel gaining a 3% share of U.S. TV viewing and its platform expanding to 90 million streaming households, supported by new distribution partnerships. The company is actively pursuing free ad-supported streaming TV (FAST), AI-driven personalization, and commerce-enabled programming to diversify revenue streams. This strategy aims to leverage increasing viewership despite ongoing advertising monetization pressures, potentially reshaping Roku's investment narrative for long-term investors.

title: Micron & NVIDIA: The Kings of AI Stocks
summary: This article highlights Micron (MU) and NVIDIA (NVDA) as leading investment opportunities in the artificial intelligence (AI) sector, both holding a Zacks Rank #1 (Strong Buy). Micron, a memory and storage solutions provider, is benefiting from surging demand for AI infrastructure due to memory bottlenecks, while NVIDIA continues to dominate the AI GPU market. Both companies have reported stellar financial results, emphasizing their crucial roles in the ongoing AI frenzy.

title: Enovix Corporation (ENVX) Declares Leadership Transition to Support Manufacturing Scale-up
summary: Enovix Corporation (ENVX) announced a leadership transition in its operations group, including the retirement of COO Ajay Marathe, to support its manufacturing scale-up. The company is preparing for the commercial introduction of its AI-1 battery, which has demonstrated the highest energy density for a smartphone battery. Enovix aims to expand production capabilities at Fab2 and advance key customer programs, expressing optimism for mass production and commercial deployment of its AI-1 cells.

title: Deutsche Bank declares 'the honeymoon is over for AI' —‎ here's why
summary: Deutsche Bank analysts Adrian Cox and Stefan Abrudan predict that 2026 will be a challenging year for AI, marking an end to its "honeymoon" period. They identify disillusionment, dislocation, and distrust as key themes impacting the sector, despite AI's significant contribution to global economic and earnings growth, particularly in the U.S. The analysts highlight limited widespread impact beyond early adopters, various bottlenecks in compute capacity, energy, and talent, and rising anxiety about AI's societal implications.

title: Assessing JD.com (NasdaqGS:JD) Valuation As Buybacks AI Demand And Global Expansion Draw Fresh Attention
summary: JD.com (JD) is attracting investor interest due to significant share buybacks, robust demand for its AI-related products, and new global expansion initiatives through its National Pavilion online shops. Despite a recent short-term share price increase, the company has seen a long-term decline in shareholder return. Simply Wall St estimates JD.com to be approximately 47% undervalued, with a fair value of $45.26, driven by diversification into high-growth areas and international expansion, though this is contingent on managing logistics costs and competition.

title: AI set to boost cloud spending — again: S&P Global
summary: Hyperscalers are projected to increase capital spending by nearly 40% in 2026, reaching almost $600 billion, to build out AI infrastructure according to S&P Global. This substantial investment comes as enterprises wait for their own AI investments to yield significant returns, with nearly eight in 10 executives not expecting substantial revenue contributions from AI until 2030. Despite the slow return, enterprise IT budgets are expected to continue increasing their AI investments, driving global IT spend past $6 trillion in 2026.

title: Cipher Mining Signs $5.5 Billion Amazon Deal, Boosting AI Infrastructure
summary: Cipher Mining has secured a significant 15-year, $5.5 billion deal with Amazon for 300 megawatts of AI data center capacity, ensuring a stable revenue stream and strengthening its market position. The company emphasizes its use of renewable energy, which provides a competitive edge, especially with increasing regulatory scrutiny on AI infrastructure. With over 3 gigawatts in its development pipeline and a forecasted surge in AI data center demand, Cipher Mining is strategically positioned for substantial growth in the evolving AI landscape.

title: Erste Group upgrades Rio Tinto stock rating to Buy from Hold
summary: Erste Group has upgraded Rio Tinto's stock rating from Hold to Buy, citing the mining company's high return on equity of 18% and favorable valuation. The firm expects stronger sales growth in 2026, driven by increased copper and silver production in Mongolia. Rio Tinto also reported achieving its 2025 production guidance and is exploring a potential merger with Glencore.

title: Scott McPherson Named New CEO of Performance Food Group as Merger Talks End
summary: Scott McPherson is set to become the new CEO of Performance Food Group (PFG) on January 1, following the departure of George Holm, who transitions to executive chair. This leadership change occurs after PFG and US Foods mutually ended their merger discussions, a deal that could have significantly impacted the foodservice logistics sector. Despite the scuttled merger, PFG continues its strategic acquisition activities, maintaining its strong market position and focusing on growth opportunities in the food logistics industry.

title: Costco stock nears $1,000 as SEC filing spotlights $1.30 dividend and consumer mood improves
summary: Costco shares are nearing the $1,000 mark, trading up 0.6% at $982.29, following an SEC filing that confirmed a $1.30 quarterly dividend with a record date of January 30. The stock's climb is attributed to improving consumer sentiment, as indicated by the University of Michigan's Surveys of Consumers, and strength in other retail stocks. Investors are closely watching the upcoming Fed decision and Costco's Q2 2026 earnings call on March 5 for further market direction.

title: iRobot emerges from Chapter 11 as restructured Picea U.S. subsidiary
summary: iRobot has emerged from Chapter 11 bankruptcy after being acquired by Shenzhen Picea Robotics Co., its contract manufacturer. As part of the restructuring, iRobot formed iRobot Safe Corp., a U.S.-based subsidiary with an independent board, to protect U.S. consumer data and devices. The company, now privately held by Picea, will continue its operations in Bedford, Mass., focusing on smart home robotics innovation while aiming for financial stability and enhanced customer trust.

title: Jabil Announces Appointment of New Chairman, Directors to the Board
summary: Jabil Inc. has announced the appointment of Steve Raymund as the new Chairman of its Board of Directors. Additionally, Thomas T. Edman and Raejeanne Skillern have been named to the Board. Raymund previously served as Lead Director, while Edman brings experience from TTM Technologies and Applied Materials, and Skillern from Amazon Web Services, Flex, and Intel.

title: Amazon.com Inc.’s (AMZN) AWS Struck a Deal with Rio Tinto Group, Bloomberg Reported
summary: Amazon Web Services (AWS), a subsidiary of Amazon.com Inc., has signed a two-year agreement with Rio Tinto Group to source copper from an Arizona mine for its US data centers. This deal, reported by Bloomberg, marks Amazon as the first customer to use copper produced with Rio Tinto's Nuton bioleaching technology. AWS will also provide cloud-based data and analytics to optimize the Nuton technology, highlighting copper's growing importance for renewable energy and AI.

title: Google stock price today: Alphabet GOOG Class C ticks up as judge keeps search antitrust suit alive
summary: Alphabet's non-voting Class C shares (GOOG) saw a slight increase after a U.S. judge allowed a consumer antitrust lawsuit against Google regarding its search dominance to proceed. The stock's movement also comes as analysts set a $400 target on Alphabet ahead of its early-February earnings report, with increasing bets on cloud and AI driving future growth despite regulatory pressures. The legal challenge focuses on Google's default search engine placement, which coincides with the company's significant investment in AI-powered search features.

title: Amazon Fires 30,000. Is AI to Blame?
summary: Amazon is reportedly preparing to lay off an additional 15,000 corporate employees, following 14,000 cuts last year, with artificial intelligence cited as a primary reason for making jobs redundant. This comes as Amazon plans to double the number of products it sells but aims not to increase its U.S. workforce, suggesting that AI will significantly impact its employee headcount. The article highlights a broader trend in tech, with other companies like Microsoft also using AI to automate tasks, fueling the debate about AI's role in job elimination versus creation.

title: Here’s What Barclays Has to Say About ​Fabrinet (FN)

Susquehanna also initiated coverage with a Buy rating and a $550 price target, highlighting Fabrinet's strong position in the optical networking market and benefits from increased transceiver demand in data centers.

title: The Truth About MercadoLibre Inc: Why Everyone Is Suddenly Obsessed With MELI Stock
summary: MercadoLibre (MELI) is gaining significant attention, often dubbed the "Amazon of Latin America," due to its dominant e-commerce platform and robust fintech arm, Mercado Pago. While the market generally supports Meta's AI-first strategy, investors seek a better balance between investment pace and margin delivery.

title: Amazon Plans Fresh Round Of Corporate Layoffs As Andy Jassy Pushes Overhaul Of 'Culture' At The Tech Giant
summary: Amazon is reportedly preparing for another round of corporate layoffs, impacting white-collar workers as part of an effort to streamline its operations and enhance efficiency. These cuts are a continuation of earlier reductions that saw thousands of positions eliminated, and similar numbers are expected in the upcoming phase across various departments. CEO Andy Jassy emphasized that these decisions are driven by cultural changes rather than primarily financial or AI factors.

summary: Citi Research anticipates Amazon.com (AMZN.US) to surpass market expectations for its 4Q25 revenue and operating profit, driven by accelerated AWS revenue growth and strong performance in its retail segment during the online holiday shopping season. title: 14 Stocks Jim Cramer Talked About
summary: This article discusses 14 stocks that Jim Cramer has commented on, focusing on D.R. Horton, Inc. (NYSE: DHI). Cramer's remarks on D.R. Horton are analyzed in the context of interest rates and its performance. The piece also includes an overview of D.R. Horton's financial results, analyst ratings, and a hedge fund's perspective on the company.

title: The Truth About iRobot Corp: Why Everyone Is Watching (But Not Buying Yet)

The piece concludes that while iRobot is still respected for its foundational contributions to robot vacuums, its current market position requires consumers to weigh price versus features carefully, especially given intense competition and recent business challenges such as the failed Amazon acquisition.

title: Jabil appoints Steve Raymund as chairman, adds two board members

Amazon, a global leader in e-commerce and cloud services through AWS, is considered one of the 15 Best S&P 500 Stocks to look for in 2026.

title: For Retailers, Agentic Commerce Is Here

McKinsey projects agentic commerce could orchestrate up to $1 trillion in U.S. B2C retail revenue by 2030, necessitating a fundamental shift in how retailers structure data and integrate AI. SAP proposes solutions like machine-readable product data, semantic summaries, and product tagging by problem solved, while emphasizing that AI must be deeply embedded across business processes for true value.

title: U.S. National Security Concerns Threaten iRobot’s Bankruptcy Rescue
summary: The U.S. Department of Justice has formally warned against the proposed sale of iRobot Corp. to a Chinese manufacturer, citing national security risks, which jeopardizes iRobot's Chapter 11 restructuring plan. This intervention could delay or derail the bankruptcy process, increasing the threat of a total loss for shareholders. The DOJ's action comes after legislators raised concerns about transferring sensitive U.S. technology and data to a Chinese-controlled entity, potentially leading to a lengthy CFIUS review and significant financial challenges for iRobot.

title: Okupe, CFO of Hims & Hers, sells $275k in HIMS stock

title: A Deep Dive into the iShares MSCI World ETF’s 2025 Performance

The company must also demonstrate profitable international expansion, particularly in newer markets like China, ensuring new stores lead to high-quality, high-renewal memberships. Ultimately, maintaining steady operating leverage and profit growth will be crucial to satisfying elevated investor expectations and reinforcing its long-term growth story.

Guggina, noted for his extensive experience in e-commerce and supply chain rather than traditional retail operations, reflects Walmart's significant investments in integrating technology into its sprawling business. This repositioning is further highlighted by its move to Nasdaq and partnerships in AI-assisted shopping, aiming to solidify its status as a tech-forward retailer.

title: Form 424B2 ROYAL BANK OF CANADA
summary: This Form 424B2 filing by Royal Bank of Canada details a new offering of $392,000 Market Linked Securities that provide leveraged upside participation to a cap and fixed percentage buffered downside principal at risk, linked to an equally weighted stock basket of Amazon, Microsoft, and NVIDIA. Investors may receive a positive return reflecting 125% of the basket's increase up to a maximum return of 31.50%, but face loss of up to 85% of the face amount if the basket declines significantly beyond a 15% buffer. The securities are unsecured obligations of Royal Bank of Canada, subject to its credit risk, and do not pay periodic interest or dividends.

title: Rackspace Email Hosting Prices Soar Up to 706%, Fueling Customer Exodus

This move has caused widespread outrage among businesses and resellers, who are now scrambling to find alternative providers like Microsoft 365 or Google Workspace. The strategic shift by Rackspace appears to prioritize profitability, but risks considerable customer churn and highlights the challenges of vendor lock-in in the cloud services market.

title: After Decades Shaping Walmart’s Strategy, Latriece Watkins Takes The Helm At Sam’s Club

She previously served as Walmart's chief merchant, where she was responsible for approximately $500 billion worth of products annually and successfully attracted higher-income shoppers. Her leadership is expected to bring innovation, particularly in technology, and focus on increasing market share by developing Sam's Club's private label and competing with rivals like Costco and Amazon.

title: Harmony Biosciences CFO Kapadia sells $752k in stock

Wainwright to maintain a Buy rating on the stock.

This rebound mirrors Alphabet's earlier success with its Gemini AI model, suggesting a similar trajectory for Amazon as it leverages AI across its operations.

title: Apple tops 'Most Admired' list again as AI giants surge in 2026

Discovery studios and HBO Max for $72 billion. Both bring extensive experience in consumer brands, franchise management, and business transformation to support Hasbro's long-term innovation and growth strategy.

title: Murry, Applied Optoelectronics CFO, sells $2310 in shares
summary: Stefan J. Murry, CFO of Applied Optoelectronics (NASDAQ:AAOI), sold 66 shares totaling $2310 on January 15, 2026, under a pre-arranged trading plan. Despite the sale, the stock has shown strong recent momentum and is trading near its 52-week high. The company recently received a significant order for 800G data center transceivers from a hyperscale customer and introduced a new laser technology for AI data centers, leading to increased price targets from analysts.

title: $2.5B Amazon Prime membership FTC settlement
summary: Amazon has agreed to a $2.5 billion settlement with the Federal Trade Commission (FTC) regarding claims it violated the Restore Online Shoppers’ Confidence Act concerning its Prime membership. The settlement benefits consumers who enrolled in Prime between June 23, 2019, and June 23, 2025, under challenged enrollment methods or faced difficulties canceling. Eligible consumers could receive up to $51, with a claim filing deadline of July 27, 2026.

title: Hudson Pacific Properties, Inc. (HPP): A bull case theory
summary: This article argues a bull case for Hudson Pacific Properties (HPP), a commercial real estate investment trust focused on office and studio properties on the West Coast. The author suggests that despite current challenges in the office market and high interest rates, HPP is undervalued, citing its experienced management, high-quality assets, attractive valuations, and potential for a dividend hike. The analysis highlights HPP's strategic locations, environmental initiatives, and compares its valuation favorably against peers, forecasting significant upside potential.

title: JBG SMITH Announces Date of Fourth Quarter and Year-End 2025 Results
summary: JBG SMITH (NYSE: JBGS) announced that it will report its fourth quarter and year-end 2025 financial results after the close of trading on February 17, 2026. The full investor package, including the earnings release, will be made available on the Investor Relations section of their website. JBG SMITH is a major owner, operator, and developer of mixed-use properties in the Washington, DC metropolitan area, with a significant concentration in National Landing.

title: RBC Initiates Astera Labs (ALAB) at Outperform, Sees Retimer Growth and Scorpio Ramp Driving Upside
summary: RBC Capital analyst Srini Pajjuri initiated coverage of Astera Labs (ALAB) with an Outperform rating and a $225 price target, citing strong retimer growth and the Scorpio-P switch ramp as drivers for near-term strength. Despite recent underperformance due to concerns over future networking standards and potential impact from Google TPU, the analyst believes Astera's fundamentals remain robust. RBC justifies a premium valuation due to the company's 40% growth, $10-15 billion Serviceable Addressable Market (SAM), and over 70% gross margins, seeing long-term opportunities in multiple scale-up standards.

title: Adobe to acquire Semrush in $1.9bn deal
summary: Adobe plans to acquire Semrush Holdings, Inc. for $1.9 billion in an all-cash deal, expanding its AI marketing capabilities. The acquisition aims to integrate Semrush's brand visibility platform into Adobe's Digital Experience business, enhancing marketers' ability to understand brand appearance across various digital channels, including generative AI-driven search. The move seeks to capitalize on the growing importance of generative engine optimization (GEO) alongside traditional SEO.

title: Denison Mines stock steadies near $3.70 as uranium prices stay in focus
summary: Denison Mines shares remained stable near $3.70 in early trading as uranium prices stayed in focus around $85 per pound. The company is focused on securing permitting and approvals for its Phoenix project in Saskatchewan, aiming for an investment decision by late February and production by mid-2028. Denison highlights a key de-risking move with the completion of a new 138 kV transmission line for grid power at the Phoenix site.

title: Plug Power CEO Andy Marsh to Host Reddit AMA on January 22, 2026
summary: Plug Power CEO Andy Marsh will host a Reddit Ask Me Anything (AMA) session on January 22, 2026, from 2:00-3:00 p.m. ET. The AMA will focus on preparing stockholders for the upcoming Special Meeting on January 29, 2026, which addresses critical proposals such as modernizing voting standards and increasing authorized common stock. A second AMA with incoming CEO Jose Luis Crespo is planned for March 2026 to discuss 2025 results.

title: A Steady Performer: Analyzing the iShares MSCI World ETF’s Trajectory
summary: The iShares MSCI World ETF (URTH) started the new year strong with a 2% year-to-date gain, following a 21.28% return in 2025. It provides broad exposure to global large and mid-cap stocks, heavily weighted towards the U.S. and technology, with top holdings including NVIDIA and Apple. The ETF maintains robust liquidity and trades efficiently, though its valuation is elevated and its future performance depends on tech earnings, U.S. monetary policy, and benchmark changes.

title: TCV and Blackstone back Pennylane at $4.25bn valuation
summary: TCV and Blackstone have co-led a €175 million funding round in Pennylane, a French accounting software company, valuing it at approximately $4.25 billion. This investment reinforces Pennylane's position as a valuable European startup and will fuel its research and development, including AI-powered assistants, and expansion into markets like Germany. The deal highlights continued investor interest in strong European software platforms despite a selective venture funding environment.

title: Arkadios Wealth Advisors Purchases 24,871 Shares of Walmart Inc. $WMT
summary: Arkadios Wealth Advisors increased its stake in Walmart Inc. (NASDAQ:WMT) by 12.5% in the third quarter, acquiring an additional 24,871 shares to own a total of 224,410 shares valued at $23.13 million. This makes Walmart its 27th largest position. Despite this accumulation by Arkadios and other institutional investors, there have been significant insider sales from CEO C. Douglas McMillon and EVP Donna Morris, totaling over $15 million in the last 90 days. Analysts maintain a "Moderate Buy" rating for Walmart, with a consensus target price of $123.03, highlighting strong e-commerce and advertising momentum.

title: Hedge Fund Titans Sell Amazon, Boost iShares Bitcoin Trust Positions
summary: Billionaire hedge fund managers Philippe Laffont and Steven Schonfeld divested Amazon shares while increasing their stakes in the iShares Bitcoin Trust during Q3, signaling growing confidence in Bitcoin as a strategic asset. Wall Street analysts predict a 19% annual earnings growth for Amazon over the next three years, with a target price of $300, indicating a 25% upside. Demand for Bitcoin is anticipated to rise with the advent of spot Bitcoin ETFs, making it more accessible to investors, and analysts suggest that risk-tolerant investors consider Bitcoin exposure despite its recent dip.

title: MEXC Adds 32 Tokenized Stocks from Ondo Finance, Expanding Blue-Chip Access for 40 Million Users
summary: MEXC has expanded its tokenized stock offerings by adding 32 new U.S. stock trading pairs in partnership with Ondo Finance, bringing its total to 101 spot pairs and 52 perpetual futures pairs. This move allows MEXC's 40 million users to trade blue-chip equities like Johnson & Johnson and Amazon with zero fees, furthering MEXC's mission to integrate traditional equities with blockchain technology. The collaboration aims to provide seamless, blockchain-powered access to institutional-quality assets and enhance portfolio diversification for users.

title: Amazon vs. MercadoLibre: Which Stock Will Make You Richer?
summary: This article compares Amazon (AMZN) and MercadoLibre (MELI) to determine which stock offers greater potential for investor returns. While Amazon is a mature e-commerce giant with diversified revenue streams including AWS and advertising, MercadoLibre is presented as a high-growth company in the emerging markets of Latin America, excelling in e-commerce, fintech (Mercado Pago), and advertising. The author suggests that growth-focused investors might find MercadoLibre more appealing due to its rapid expansion, particularly in its fintech credit portfolio and its presence in the fastest-growing e-commerce market.

title: The Truth About Alibaba Group Holding: Why Everyone Is Watching BABA Right Now
summary: Alibaba Group Holding (BABA) is attracting significant attention due to its massive price drop from previous highs, drama around its operations, and potential for a comeback. The article explores whether BABA is a valuable investment or a 'total trap,' analyzing its e-commerce dominance, cloud computing ambitions, and the persistent risks from Chinese regulation and geopolitics. It concludes that BABA is a high-reward, high-drama situation suitable for risk-takers rather than cautious investors.

title: QQQ vs VOO: What's the Better ETF Buy?
summary: This article compares the Invesco QQQ Trust (QQQ) and the Vanguard S&P 500 ETF (VOO), evaluating which is the better investment. While QQQ has historically outperformed due to its heavy tech concentration, the author suggests VOO is currently a better buy as the market shows signs of broadening beyond the tech sector. The piece highlights that VOO offers better diversification and lower risk in the current economic climate.

title: Sen. Markwayne Mullin Buys ServiceNow, Inc. (NYSE:NOW) Shares
summary: Senator Markwayne Mullin (R-Oklahoma) recently disclosed purchasing between $15,001 and $50,000 worth of ServiceNow (NYSE: NOW) stock on December 29th, 2025. This purchase comes amidst a recent 2.9% drop in NOW shares due to analyst downgrades and insider selling, although the consensus rating remains a "Moderate Buy" with potential for growth driven by AI-led workflows and a recent stock split. Senator Mullin also made several other substantial purchases in companies like Amazon and JPMorgan on the same day, indicating a diversified investment strategy.

title: Zedge Shareholders Back Leadership, Board Declares Quarterly Dividend
summary: Zedge shareholders have re-elected its directors, ratified UHY LLP as its accounting firm, and approved an increase in the stock option plan. The company's board also declared a quarterly cash dividend of $0.016 per share, payable in February 2026. This indicates continued support for Zedge's leadership and a consistent approach to returning capital to investors.

title: A Look At Macy's (M) Valuation As Bold New Chapter And Saks Fallout Reshape Expectations
summary: Macy's (M) stock is under investor scrutiny due to its "Bold New Chapter" restructuring, positive analyst actions, and potential market share gains following Saks Global's bankruptcy. Despite mixed recent performance, Macy's shows stronger long-term momentum with a 20.91% 90-day return and 62.93% one-year return. The company is currently trading near its analyst target, with a 24% intrinsic value gap, suggesting it may be undervalued given its ongoing modernization efforts and positive earnings.

title: Koninklijke Philips N.V.: How a 130-Year Giant Is Rebuilding Healthcare’s Digital Frontline
summary: Koninklijke Philips N.V. (Philips) has transformed itself from a consumer electronics brand into a focused health-technology company, concentrating on imaging, monitoring, and AI to create an integrated healthcare ecosystem. The company's strategy involves leveraging platforms like Azurion, IntelliVue, and HealthSuite to connect hardware, software, and clinical workflows, addressing challenges like staff shortages and data overload in global healthcare. Despite past setbacks, particularly with product recalls, Philips aims to drive growth and expand margins by shifting towards recurring revenue models from software platforms and managed services, positioning itself as a key player in the ongoing digital transformation of healthcare.

title: Oak Ridge Investments LLC Takes $1.84 Million Position in IonQ, Inc. $IONQ
summary: Oak Ridge Investments LLC has opened a new position in IonQ, Inc. (NYSE:IONQ), purchasing 29,896 shares valued at approximately $1.84 million in the third quarter. IonQ's recent earnings report showed a significant revenue beat but a severe EPS miss, with a consensus analyst rating of "Moderate Buy" and a target price of $75.91. The company has seen increased institutional ownership, with major players like Amazon and Norges Bank holding substantial stakes, and some key insider trading activity.

title: Nippon Life Global Investors Americas Inc. Has $1.14 Million Holdings in Marvell Technology, Inc. $MRVL
summary: Nippon Life Global Investors Americas Inc. significantly reduced its stake in Marvell Technology, Inc. (MRVL) by 95.2% in Q3, selling 269,960 shares and retaining 13,600 shares valued at $1.14 million. Despite this reduction, other large institutions like Norges Bank, DZ BANK, Amundi, and Franklin Resources Inc. either initiated or substantially increased their positions in Marvell Technology, with institutional investors now holding approximately 83.51% of the stock. Marvell Technology reported strong Q3 financial results, including an EPS beat and 36.8% year-over-year revenue growth, announced a $5.0 billion share buyback program, and declared a quarterly dividend, while analysts maintain a "Moderate Buy" rating with an average target price of $115.70.

title: ETF of the Week: WisdomTree Cloud Computing ETF (WCLD)
summary: The WisdomTree Cloud Computing ETF (WCLD) tracks the BVP Nasdaq Emerging Cloud Index, focusing on public companies delivering cloud-based software. The article highlights cloud computing's growth during the pandemic, its categories (SaaS, PaaS, IaaS), and the attractive business model advantages of cloud companies, including recurring revenue and high client retention. WCLD's performance is also discussed, showing significant returns compared to the S&P 500.

title: International Business Machines Corporation $IBM Shares Bought by Occidental Asset Management LLC
summary: Occidental Asset Management LLC significantly increased its stake in International Business Machines Corporation (IBM) by 903.5% in the third quarter, bringing its total holdings to 12,604 shares valued at $3,556,000. Other institutional investors like Mattson Financial Services LLC, Vise Technologies Inc., and Vanguard Group Inc. also made notable changes to their IBM positions. The article details IBM's stock performance, recent earnings report with an EPS of $2.65, and a declared quarterly dividend of $1.68 per share, while analysts maintain a "Moderate Buy" consensus rating with a target price of $303.38.

title: QRG Capital Management Inc. Has $10.74 Million Stake in Kimberly-Clark Corporation $KMB
summary: QRG Capital Management Inc. has significantly reduced its stake in Kimberly-Clark Corporation (KMB) by 52.5% in the third quarter, now holding 86,337 shares valued at $10.74 million. Despite this reduction, other institutional investors have made slight increases to their positions, collectively owning 76.29% of the company's stock. Kimberly-Clark recently reported strong quarterly earnings, beating analyst expectations, and announced a quarterly dividend.

title: Atai Beckley N.V. (ATAI) Achieves Significant Milestone on Pipeline Development and Corporate Foundation
summary: Atai Beckley N.V. (ATAI) has achieved significant milestones, including its addition to the NASDAQ Biotechnology Index following a $300 million capital raise to advance clinical programs. The company's CEO, Srinivas Rao, highlighted progress in pipeline development and corporate foundation, which also includes a strategic partnership with Beckley Psytech and redomiciliation to a U.S. entity for cost savings and streamlined operations. Atai Beckley is focused on developing next-generation mental health therapeutics, utilizing psychedelic and non-psychedelic compounds for various mental health disorders.

title: Here's What Analysts Think About Amazon.com (AMZN)
summary: Analysts are generally positive on Amazon.com (AMZN), with Raymond James, Evercore ISI, and TD Cowen maintaining "Outperform" or "Buy" ratings. Raymond James recently cut its price target slightly but expects a positive Q4 due to strong trends and AI as a primary driver. TD Cowen significantly raised its price target to $315, citing the strong growth potential of Amazon's advertising business, expecting revenues to nearly double by 2030, driven by AI tools and increased advertiser spending.

title: Alliance Entertainment Named Exclusive Physical Media Distribution Partner for Amazon MGM Studios in North America
summary: Alliance Entertainment has announced an exclusive home entertainment license agreement with Amazon MGM Studios Distribution for physical media distribution in the U.S. and Canada. This partnership designates Alliance as the sole distributor for Amazon MGM's iconic library and new titles, including franchises like James Bond and Rocky, aiming to expand reach and offer premium formats to collectors and fans. The agreement highlights Alliance Entertainment's leadership in physical media and Amazon MGM Studios' commitment to providing content in various formats.

title: Strong Analyst Sentiment on Advanced Micro Devices (AMD) Amid CES AI Processor Launches Despite Nvidia Competition
summary: Analysts are largely bullish on Advanced Micro Devices (AMD) following its AI processor launches at CES, including the MI455 for data centers and the MI440X for enterprise, expecting significant growth in AI compute infrastructure. Despite positive sentiment and an OpenAI deal, analysts acknowledge Nvidia's continued dominance. AMD is also partnering with Generative Bionics on a humanoid robot, showcasing its expansion into physical AI applications.

title: Delek US Holdings (DK) Price Target Reduced by $6
summary: Delek US Holdings, Inc. (NYSE: DK) recently saw its share price fall by 9.6%. Scotiabank reduced its price target on DK from $40 to $34, maintaining a 'Sector Perform' rating, citing an updated outlook for US Integrated Oil, Refining, and Large Cap Exploration & Production stocks. Piper Sandler also lowered its price target from $47 to $40 earlier, maintaining a 'Neutral' rating due to a bearish crude outlook, though expecting the refining sector to perform better than in 2025.

title: Sen. Markwayne Mullin Purchases Shares of NVIDIA Corporation (NASDAQ:NVDA)
summary: Senator Markwayne Mullin (R-Oklahoma) recently disclosed purchasing between $100,001 and $250,000 worth of NVIDIA (NASDAQ:NVDA) stock on December 29th, 2025, alongside other significant investments in companies like Amazon and JPMorgan. NVIDIA recently surpassed quarterly earnings estimates, reporting $1.30 EPS against an expected $1.23, and generated $57.01 billion in revenue, a 62.5% year-over-year increase. Despite material insider selling, institutional investors hold a substantial 65.3% of the company, with analysts maintaining a "Moderate Buy" rating and an average price target of $263.41 for the stock.

title: Palantir Stock vs. Sandisk Stock: Wall Street Says Buy One and Sell the Other
summary: This article compares Palantir Technologies (PLTR) and Sandisk (SNDK) stocks, highlighting their significant gains in 2025 driven by the AI trade. While Wall Street analysts suggest buying Palantir due to an implied 17% upside, its valuation is extremely high. Conversely, Sandisk is recommended for selling due to an implied 23% downside, despite benefiting from the flash memory shortage, as its current valuation appears very expensive and future growth might be overestimated.

title: AMD stock price rises into long weekend as $311 million data-center lease puts AI demand in focus
summary: AMD shares rose after Riot Platforms announced a $311 million data-center lease and services agreement with AMD, signaling strong demand for AI infrastructure. This deal highlights the market's focus on power and data-center space as critical for AI computing, benefiting chipmakers like AMD. Investors are monitoring AI spending as earnings season approaches, with AMD set to report its Q4 and full-year 2025 results on February 3rd.

title: Can Costco Stock Reach $1,000 in 2026?
summary: This article examines whether Costco's stock (COST) can reach the $1,000 mark by the end of 2026. Given its current price of $954, it would only require a 5% gain. The author highlights Costco's consistent same-store sales and earnings growth, strong membership accounts, and the economy's current stimulus environment as tailwinds, despite its high valuation.

title: PriceSmart (PSMT) Valuation Check After Q1 Growth And Ongoing Expansion Investments
summary: PriceSmart (PSMT) reported higher revenue and net income in Q1 alongside continued investments in expansion, supply chain, and digital services. Despite a 63.39% year-over-year share price return, Simply Wall St estimates the stock to be 14.2% overvalued with a fair value of US$123.33, compared to its current price of US$140.86, primarily due to currency pressures and rising operational costs. The company's expansion into new markets and cities, including exploration of Chile, is expected to support future revenue growth and market diversification, though risks remain.

title: A Deep Dive into the iShares MSCI World ETF: Concentration and Global Exposure
summary: The iShares MSCI World ETF (URTH) provides diversified exposure to developed equity markets but is heavily concentrated in major U.S. technology stocks, with over 70% of its assets in U.S. equities. The top ten holdings, including NVIDIA, Apple, and Microsoft, significantly influence its performance due to their substantial weighting. Upcoming semi-annual index rebalancing and valuation disparities among its core technology components will be key factors affecting the ETF's future trajectory.

title: The Truth About F5 Inc.: Sleeper Tech Stock That Might Be Way Undervalued
summary: The article analyzes F5 Inc. (FFIV) as a potentially undervalued "sleeper tech stock" that quietly powers essential internet infrastructure. Despite lacking the viral social media presence of AI or meme stocks, F5 plays a crucial role in application delivery and security for large enterprises. The piece delves into its business model, competitive landscape against Cloudflare and Akamai, and offers a "cop or drop" verdict for long-term investors seeking stable growth rather than high-hype volatility.

title: Gap Inc. Creates Chief Entertainment Officer Role, Tapping Pam Kaufman to Lead Entertainment Strategy
summary: Gap Inc. has appointed Pam Kaufman as Executive Vice President, Chief Entertainment Officer, a new role established to expand the company's entertainment, content, and licensing initiatives across various platforms. Reporting to CEO Richard Dickson, Kaufman will lead the development of Gap Inc.'s "Fashiontainment" strategy, embedding the brands within pop culture through collaborations in music, film, sports, and gaming. The company will also open a Los Angeles office to support these efforts, leveraging Kaufman's extensive experience from Paramount to drive brand relevance and growth.

title: Gary Black Likes Elon Musk's Tesla But Not TSLA, Draws Comparison With Amazon—Says Nvidia 'Democratizes Autonomy'
summary: Investor Gary Black, managing director of The Future Fund LLC, has exited his position in Tesla (TSLA) due to its stock valuation, despite liking the company itself. He compared his past investment in Amazon, noting that while both companies built significant infrastructure (Amazon in fulfillment, Tesla in EVs), competition has now entered the EV market. Black suggests that Nvidia's Alpamayo technology is "democratizing autonomy," further complicating Tesla's competitive landscape.

title: Liberty All-Star® Equity Fund December 2025 Monthly Update
summary: The Liberty All-Star® Equity Fund (NYSE: USA) released its monthly update for December 2025, detailing its investment approach, top holdings, and performance. The fund combines five investment managers (three value, two growth) and showed a monthly performance of 0.74% (NAV) and 2.45% (market price), ending the month with total net assets of $2,061.7 million. Key highlights included its top 20 holdings, sector breakdown, and changes in its portfolio with new additions and liquidations.

title: Assessing Maplebear (CART) Valuation After Recent Share Price Pullback And Earnings Figures
summary: This article assesses Maplebear (CART) following a recent share price pullback, examining its valuation based on reported revenue and net income. While one narrative suggests the stock is undervalued with a fair value of $50.92 per share due to deepening enterprise partnerships and diversified revenue streams, another perspective using P/E ratios indicates potential valuation risk. Investors are encouraged to consider both the growth potential and associated risks.

title: Walmart Inc. $WMT Shares Purchased by Pinnacle Financial Partners Inc
summary: Pinnacle Financial Partners Inc. increased its stake in Walmart Inc. by 5.1% during the third quarter, bringing its total holdings to 216,793 shares valued at approximately $22.34 million. Analysts maintain a "Moderate Buy" consensus rating with an average price target of $123.03, supported by leadership changes, AI initiatives, and fintech growth. However, recent insider selling and a pending India tax case pose potential short-term concerns for the company.

title: First Majestic Silver stock jumps nearly 6% after dividend boost; what to watch next for AG
summary: First Majestic Silver Corp. shares rose nearly 6% following updates on production, outlook, and dividends, despite a retreat in silver prices from recent record highs. The company reported record 2025 silver production and higher fourth-quarter output, setting 2026 production forecasts and capital expenditure plans. Investors are now focused on Tuesday's market reopening after the extended U.S. holiday, as well as the company's upcoming earnings report and dividend announcement on February 19th.

title: Nordea Investment Management AB Has $10.77 Million Holdings in SK Telecom Co., Ltd. $SKM
summary: Nordea Investment Management AB reduced its stake in SK Telecom Co., Ltd. (NYSE:SKM) by 9.7% in Q3, now holding 499,727 shares valued at $10.77 million. Despite this reduction, several other institutional investors, including Arrowstreet Capital and JPMorgan Chase & Co., significantly increased their positions, indicating growing institutional interest. SK Telecom currently holds a consensus "Hold" rating from analysts and recently reported a quarterly EPS loss of ($0.29).

title: Spirepoint Private Client LLC Purchases 2,578 Shares of Alphabet Inc. $GOOGL
summary: Spirepoint Private Client LLC increased its stake in Alphabet Inc. (GOOGL) by 3.0%, purchasing an additional 2,578 shares, bringing its total holdings to 89,872 shares valued at $21.8 million. The report also highlights recent insider selling from CEO Sundar Pichai and CAO Amie Thuener O'Toole. Despite some negative sentiments related to antitrust and copyright litigation, Alphabet is receiving positive analyst outlooks and benefiting from AI momentum, contributing to its ~$4 trillion valuation.

title: Focus On Amazon (AMZN)'s Retail Business As Well, Says Jim Cramer
summary: Jim Cramer advises investors to consider Amazon's retail business, not just AWS, when evaluating the stock, highlighting Walmart as a significant competitor. While Cantor Fitzgerald recently lowered Amazon's price target due to AI synergy potential, Jefferies maintained a Buy rating, focusing on AWS strength. Cramer suggests Walmart's strong e-commerce initiatives and widespread presence pose a legitimate challenge to Amazon's market position.

title: MACOM Technology stock price target raised to $215 by Stifel on growth outlook
summary: Stifel has raised its price target on MACOM Technology Solutions (NASDAQ:MTSI) to $215 from $185, maintaining a Buy rating, citing confidence in MACOM's future performance and long-term growth prospects. The semiconductor company's stock is currently trading above this new target. The revision is based on anticipated gross margins exceeding 58% and operating margins above 25% due to its Wolfspeed RF acquisition and growth across key end markets.

title: Spotify Lifts Monthly Premium Fee to $12.99
summary: Spotify Technology S.A. (NYSE:SPOT) announced a price hike for its premium subscriptions, increasing the monthly fee from $11.99 to $12.99 starting in February 2026. This marks the second U.S. price increase since June 2024. Jefferies maintained a 'Buy' rating and a $750 price target for Spotify, citing revenue acceleration in 2026 due to price increases and subscriber growth.

title: The Truth About Knowles Corp: Is This Quiet Audio Giant About To Go Viral?
summary: Knowles Corp, a behind-the-scenes maker of micro-acoustic components for various devices, is exploring how to gain more visibility. While not a mainstream brand, its technology is crucial for high-quality audio in hearables, wearables, and smartphones. The article explores whether Knowles, despite its currently subdued stock performance, has the potential to become a significant player in the evolving audio technology landscape.

title: The Stock Market Flashes a Warning Never Seen Before: 2 Brilliant Index Funds to Buy Now
summary: The S&P 500 is currently more concentrated than ever before, with its 10 largest stocks accounting for 40% of its weight, raising concerns among some analysts about future returns. To hedge against this concentration risk, the article suggests two alternative S&P 500 index funds: the Invesco S&P 500 Revenue ETF and the Invesco S&P 500 Equal Weight ETF, which re-weight components based on revenue or equal weighting, respectively, to mitigate the influence of a few dominant companies.

title: Q3 2025 Results Highlight Sify’s Data Center Pivot Might Change The Case For Investing In Sify Technologies (SIFY)
summary: Sify Technologies (SIFY) reported Q3 2025 results with an 11% revenue increase to ₹11,596 million but a net loss of ₹329 million. The company's data center pivot, driven by strong demand for AI and hyperscaler co-location capacity, is central to its investment narrative. While revenue growth supports the long-term thesis, continued losses reflect heavy investment and high depreciation, interest, and build-out costs, with investors focused on how quickly new data center capacity translates into profitability.

title: Amazon FSx for NetApp ONTAP gets performance enhancements
summary: Amazon announced performance and capacity updates for its Amazon FSx for NetApp ONTAP storage service at AWS re:Invent. This fully managed ONTAP file system in AWS now offers up to 36 GB/s throughput and 1.2M IOPS, making it suitable for high-performance workloads such as EDA, chip design, VFX, and graphics rendering. Users can access this enhanced service via the AWS console, with more information available on the NetApp website.

title: Digital Realty Trust: Can The Data Center Giant Keep Powering This Rally?
summary: Digital Realty Trust has seen a significant rebound, driven by investor interest in data center and AI infrastructure. The stock is near 52-week highs, supported by Wall Street upgrades and shifting interest rates, leading to questions about its future growth potential. The market now views Digital Realty Trust as an infrastructure growth story tied to cloud and AI demand, rather than a traditional defensive REIT.

title: Is Sea (SE) Using Shopee’s VIP Push To Cement A Lasting Edge In Emerging Markets?
summary: Recent analyst attention on Sea Limited (SE), including an upgrade from Maybank, highlights Shopee's VIP program and fulfillment investments as key strategies to strengthen its e-commerce presence in Southeast Asia. This optimism suggests that Sea's focus on customer loyalty and improved logistics could enhance its long-term competitive edge in emerging markets. However, the company still faces potential risks from intensifying competition in Brazil and Southeast Asia which could pressure margins and market share.

title: Novo Nordisk Stock (NVO) Jumps as UK Clears Higher Wegovy Dose
summary: Novo Nordisk's stock (NVO) jumped after the UK's drug regulator approved a higher weekly dose of its Wegovy weight loss injection, allowing patients to take up to 7.2 mg, administered as three 2.4-milligram shots. This decision follows a similar positive opinion from the EU medicines regulator and precedes a pending application with the U.S. FDA. The higher dose demonstrated greater average weight loss (20.7%) compared to the 2.4mg injection (17.5%) in clinical trials.

title: Walmart’s John Furner overhauls leadership
summary: Walmart Inc.'s incoming CEO John Furner is implementing significant leadership changes, including appointing David Guggina as the new CEO for Walmart U.S. and Latriece Watkins as CEO for Sam's Club U.S. These changes, effective next month, aim to streamline operations and leverage AI advancements in retail. Furner emphasizes the importance of a strong leadership bench and a restructured organization to adapt to the evolving retail landscape.

title: Is Carter's Wholesale Segment Weakness Dragging Overall Growth?
summary: Carter's, Inc. is experiencing constrained overall growth due to significant weakness in its U.S. Wholesale segment, particularly with the Simple Joys brand on Amazon. Declines in wholesale have largely offset gains in U.S. Retail and International markets, leading to a marginal net sales decline in the third quarter of 2025 and a substantial drop in adjusted operating income. The company is working to align better with Amazon's operating model to leverage its broader brand portfolio beyond Simple Joys.

title: News | Blockbuster Amazon deal adds to record industrial leasing year for Los Angeles
summary: Amazon's recent lease deal for a 615,000-square-foot Prologis-owned warehouse in the City of Commerce marks one of Los Angeles's largest industrial leases of the year. This move by the e-commerce giant significantly contributes to what is being recorded as a banner year for industrial leasing in the region. The building itself is notable for being the largest freestanding facility constructed in the greater Los Angeles area in the decade leading up to its opening in 2014.

title: Focus On Amazon (AMZN)’s Retail Business As Well, Says Jim Cramer
summary: Jim Cramer emphasizes that investors should pay close attention to Amazon's retail business, not just AWS, when analyzing the stock. He notes that Walmart is proving to be a strong challenger in the e-commerce space with its robust delivery initiatives and widespread presence. Cantor Fitzgerald recently cut Amazon's price target, while Jefferies raised its target, highlighting the strength of AWS and its exposure to AI inference opportunities.

title: Walmart taps insider as U.S. CEO amid leadership team overhaul
summary: Walmart has announced significant changes to its C-suite leadership team, effective February 1, as John Furner prepares to take over as CEO. David Guggina, a long-time company veteran with a background in e-commerce and supply chain, will succeed Furner as president and CEO of Walmart U.S. Other key appointments include Chris Nicholas leading Walmart International and Latriece Watkins heading Sam's Club U.S., reflecting internal promotions and a strategic alignment for future growth driven by AI.

title: Amazon vs. Oracle: Which Cloud Computing Stock is the Better Buy Now?
summary: This article compares Amazon (AMZN) and Oracle (ORCL) as cloud computing investments, highlighting Amazon's dominant AWS performance, diversified revenue, and strong growth fundamentals. While Oracle shows significant growth in cloud infrastructure and RPOs, the article points out its execution challenges, negative free cash flow, and customer concentration risk. Amazon is ultimately recommended as the superior buy due to its stronger risk-reward profile and more sustainable growth.

title: AI-Shopping Assistant Rufus to Drive Amazon.com, Inc. (AMZN) e-Commerce Growth: Evercore ISI
summary: Evercore ISI projects that Amazon's AI-powered shopping assistant, Rufus, will significantly drive the company's e-commerce growth. Analysts reiterated an outperform rating with a $335 price target for Amazon, expecting Rufus and other AI features to boost retail gross merchandise volume by 4.44% and ad revenue by $4 billion by 2028. This growth is anticipated as 60% of Rufus users complete purchases, and Amazon expands its AI functionalities and strategic partnerships for advanced enterprise services.

title: 12 Best Future Stocks to Buy For the Long Term
summary: Broadcom Inc. (NASDAQ: AVGO) is highlighted as one of the best future stocks for long-term investment, with analysts at Citi and Wells Fargo issuing "Buy" and "Overweight" ratings, respectively, driven by accelerating AI sales and Google TPU upside. This growth is anticipated due to its current revenue trajectory, with significant acceleration expected from its AWS cloud computing division, particularly through leveraging artificial intelligence partnerships and substantial data center expansions. While other companies like Nvidia are growing rapidly, Amazon's combination of existing scale and AI-driven potential positions it to reach this milestone first.

title: Amazon (NASDAQ: AMZN) Stock Price Prediction in 2030: Bull, Bear, & Baseline Forecasts (Jan 16)
summary: This article provides bull, bear, and baseline stock price predictions for Amazon (NASDAQ: AMZN) in 2030, based on analyses of its e-commerce, Amazon Web Services (AWS), and advertising segments. The bull case forecasts a share price of $431, the bear case projects $77, and the baseline forecast is $250, considering factors like market share, profitability, and P/E ratios.

title: Tractor Supply downgraded as growth likely to be muted in 2026

Truist also highlighted rising competitive risks from companies like Walmart and Amazon expanding their rural delivery capabilities, which pressure Tractor Supply to compete on price, assortment, and speed.

He likens the current tech landscape to the genuine adoption and profitability of mid-1996, rather than the speculative bubble of 1999. This outlook follows a strong performance by Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Co. Ltd. (TSMC), indicating continued growth in the AI industry.

title: AlphaTON Capital Closes $46M AI Infrastructure Expansion to Address Significant Market Demands for Confidential Compute
summary: AlphaTON Capital has secured a $46 million deal to expand its AI compute infrastructure, adding 576 NVIDIA B300 chips to its holdings. This expansion focuses on providing confidential, privacy-preserving AI compute power through integration with Telegram's Cocoon AI, targeting a significant market gap for AI workloads that cannot run on Big Tech infrastructure due to privacy concerns. The project projects a 27% IRR, 282% ROI, and an $11 million Net Present Value, positioning AlphaTON to capitalize on the growing demand for privacy-first AI solutions.

title: 15,374 Shares in Marvell Technology, Inc. $MRVL Purchased by Gratus Wealth Advisors LLC

The author concludes it's a "maybe-cop" for long-term, high-risk investors who understand its inherent volatility and unique market position.

authors: David Sekera, CFA and Susan Dziubinski

(NASDAQ:AMZN) holdings during the third quarter, but the e-commerce giant still represents its fourth-largest position, valued at $43.06 million. The company's revenue and profits have surged, particularly driven by new licensing deals with major tech companies like Apple, Amazon, and Samsung, and renewed contracts with existing licensees. This strategy has resulted in substantial returns for shareholders through increased earnings, dividends, and stock repurchases, despite the cyclical nature of its revenue tied to technological adoption.

Despite recent financial struggles and lower guidance, analysts see potential upside, with a "Moderate Buy" consensus and an average price target of $2.33, implying a 195% potential increase.

summary: FMR LLC significantly reduced its stake in Treehouse Foods Inc by 76.78% on December 31, 2025, although it still retains a 1.60% position. title: United Rentals, Inc. Fourth Quarter and Full Year 2025 Conference Call and Audio Webcast Thursday, January 29, 2026 at 8:30 a.m. (ET)

However, its P/E ratio of 23.4x suggests a premium compared to the industry and peers, warranting further scrutiny of future earnings potential.

title: Judge denies Amazon’s effort to block Saks Global bankruptcy

Amazon, a creditor, had invested $475 million in Saks in 2024 to help it acquire Neiman Marcus and objected to the new plan, arguing it further jeopardizes their investment due to Saks's alleged failure to meet financial terms and budgets. Saks argued that without the financing, it would be forced into liquidation.

title: Behavioral Health Executives Chart 2026 Opportunities, Challenges at JPM
summary: At the J.P.M. Healthcare Conference, behavioral health leaders from Talkspace, Teladoc’s BetterHelp, and Acadia Healthcare outlined their strategies and challenges for 2026. Talkspace is focusing on specialized AI development for mental health and expanding its in-network payer partnerships. BetterHelp is also shifting from a cash-pay model to in-network insurance coverage to improve conversion and utilization, while Acadia Healthcare is looking to expand bed count and joint ventures to overcome financial headwinds and Medicaid cutbacks faced in 2025.

title: Sify Technologies (NasdaqCM:SIFY) Valuation After Q3 Revenue Growth, Wider Loss And Data Center And AI Investments
summary: Sify Technologies reported Q3 earnings with increased sales but a wider net loss, attributed to investments in hyperscale data centers and AI. While a "most popular narrative" suggests Sify is 36.8% undervalued with a fair value of $22, the article notes that its current market multiple (P/S of 2.1x) is higher than the US Telecom industry and peers, implying potential overvaluation.

title: Big Blue’s Renaissance: How IBM Reclaimed the Enterprise Throne in the AI Era
summary: IBM has undergone a significant transformation, moving from a legacy hardware provider to a dominant leader in Enterprise AI and Hybrid Cloud sectors, with its stock trading near record highs. The company's focus on regulated industries, data governance, and strategic acquisitions like HashiCorp and Confluent has positioned it to capitalize on the "Agentic AI" trend, where AI autonomously executes complex business workflows. IBM's "Client Zero" strategy, utilizing AI for internal automation, and its focus on "Cloud Repatriation" demonstrate a lucrative path that has led to substantial growth and market outperformance.

summary: The iShares Russell 3000 ETF offers investors a single solution for exposure to the broad U.S. equity market, tracking 98% of investable U.S. stocks. The fund, which employs a full replication strategy and market-capitalization weighting, began 2026 with an AI-driven "January rally" tempered by valuation concerns. A significant structural change for the fund will be the transition to semi-annual index reconstitution for the Russell US Index family, starting in June 2026, which aims to enhance responsiveness and market reflection.

title: Uber's 2025 Reality Check: 3 Shifts Investors Can't Ignore

Three key shifts are driving this transformation: its mobility business now consistently generates profits and free cash flow, Uber Eats is expanding beyond food delivery into diverse local commerce, and a high-margin advertising business is significantly improving its earnings quality. These developments demonstrate Uber's progress toward sustainable profitability and solidifies its position for long-term value creation.

title: TRX Gold earnings missed by $0.04, revenue fell short of estimates
summary: TRX Gold (NYSE: TRX) reported first-quarter EPS of $-0.0100, missing analyst estimates by $0.04, and revenue of $25.2M, falling short of the $28M consensus estimate. title: Where is JD.com (JD) Headed According to the Street?

title: Rio Tinto and Amazon Web Services collaborate to bring low-carbon Nuton copper to U.S. data centres

AWS will also provide cloud-based data and analytics to optimize Nuton's bioleaching technology at the Johnson Camp copper mine. This partnership aims to strengthen domestic supply chains for critical materials and contribute to more sustainable, lower-carbon mining practices.

title: Amazon Unleashes Europe-Only Cloud In $9 Billion Expansion Push

This new cloud environment is physically and logically separate, designed to meet strict European data sovereignty requirements for governments and businesses handling sensitive data. AWS plans to expand these sovereign cloud services to other EU countries like Belgium, the Netherlands, and Portugal, reinforcing its commitment to advanced cloud and AI infrastructure in the region.

title: Is Sea (SE) Offering Value After Recent Share Price Volatility And Conflicting Valuation Signals

Despite a Discounted Cash Flow (DCF) analysis suggesting the company is undervalued by 54.6% at an estimated intrinsic value of $275.60 per share, its Price/Earnings ratio of 52.28x is above both its industry average and Simply Wall St's proprietary "Fair Ratio" of 34.81x, indicating it might be overvalued based on earnings. title: S&P Global's Top 10 Sustainability Trends to Watch in 2026

The report also addresses the fragmented regulatory landscape, evolving supply chain risks, the financial materiality of nature loss, the challenges in sustainable finance, and the impact of aging populations on labor markets.
authors: Lindsey Hall, Harald Francke Lund, Bruno Bastit, Beth Burks, Patrice Cochelin, Terry Ellis, Roman Kramarchuk, Jennifer Laidlaw, Victor Hazell Laudisio, Matt Macfarland, Anna Mosby, Paul Munday, Ph.D., Zoe Parker, Bruce Thomson, Esther Whieldon
