Doustdar emphasized accelerating commercial execution, progressing the pipeline, and balancing financial discipline, particularly focusing on direct-to-patient and cash pay channels for its metabolic medicines, including new product launches like the Wegovy pill. He also stressed the vast unmet need in diabetes and obesity, advocating for expanding access beyond the current competitive landscape.

title: Could MercadoLibre Stock Set Patient Investors Up for Life?​
summary: MercadoLibre has seen substantial growth since its IPO, rising 120-fold, raising the question of whether it can still set investors up for life. While early investors likely benefited significantly, the company's current $110 billion market cap means exponential gains from smaller investments are less probable. However, with rapid revenue growth and a vast untapped Latin American e-commerce market, MercadoLibre remains a strong growth stock capable of providing significant returns.

title: Data Storage Corporation Announces Strategic Advisory
summary: Data Storage Corporation (Nasdaq: DTST) has appointed a team of strategic advisors and launched a redesigned corporate website to support its post-tender offer strategy. The company aims to focus on acquiring and supporting high-margin, recurring-revenue technology-enabled services, while also exploring AI-adjacent and GPU-oriented opportunities. This move signifies a pivotal moment for Data Storage as it refines its strategic focus for future growth.

title: Franco-Nevada Corporation $FNV Shares Acquired by PKO Investment Management Joint Stock Co
summary: PKO Investment Management Joint Stock Co increased its stake in Franco-Nevada Corporation (FNV) by 9.6% in the third quarter of 2025, bringing its total holdings to 62,764 shares valued at $13.98 million. This makes FNV the 17th largest position for PKO Investment Management. Franco-Nevada exceeded Q3 earnings estimates with EPS of $1.43 and revenue of $487.7 million, a 76.9% increase year-over-year, and pays a quarterly dividend of $0.38 per share.

title: Lionsgate Play South Asia Sold to President Jain in Starz Restructure
summary: Rohit Jain, president of Lionsgate Play Asia, has acquired the South and Southeast Asian streaming platform from Starz Entertainment Corp. This strategic divestment positions Lionsgate Play under founder-led ownership to target Asia's dynamic digital market, emphasizing regional expansion. The platform, which has 5 million subscribers and $100 million invested in content, will continue to license the Lionsgate brand and content under a multi-year agreement.

title: Technology Sector Powers Strong Returns for iShares MSCI World ETF
summary: The iShares MSCI World ETF (URTH) has shown strong performance, reaching new 52-week highs primarily driven by U.S. technology stocks. The fund, with $6.97 billion in assets and significant investor inflows, tracks the MSCI World Index and achieved a 21.28% return in 2025. It maintains a strong concentration in U.S. equities and the technology sector, with major holdings like NVIDIA, Apple, and Microsoft.

title: CVS Health Corp.: How a Pharmacy Giant Is Rebuilding the Front Door to U.S. Healthcare
summary: CVS Health Corp. is transforming from a drugstore chain into a vertically integrated healthcare platform, combining retail pharmacies, insurance, primary care, and digital health services. This strategy aims to offer a coordinated, omnichannel experience to consumers, positioning CVS as the "front door" to healthcare. The company faces competition from UnitedHealth Group's Optum, Walgreens/VillageMD, and Amazon Health, but leverages its physical footprint, integrated services (Aetna, Caremark), and data capabilities as key competitive advantages.

title: Riding the AI Wave: iShares MSCI World ETF Maintains Momentum
summary: The iShares MSCI World ETF (URTH) has shown significant momentum, trading near its 52-week high in early 2026, largely driven by its substantial allocation to US technology giants and beneficiaries of the AI wave. The ETF slightly outperformed its benchmark in 2025, despite its focused exposure to developed markets and higher expense ratio compared to more diversified global peers. Its performance, however, comes with notable concentration risks due to its heavy weighting in tech and AI-related stocks.

title: 3 Reasons to Sell BUSE and 1 Stock to Buy Instead
summary: This article recommends selling First Busey Corp (BUSE) due to its low net interest margin, weak EPS growth, and projected decline in tangible book value per share. The author suggests looking into other high-growth opportunities instead, mentioning past top performers like Nvidia and Tecnoglass. The piece highlights the company's underperformance compared to the S&P 500 and points out its reasonable but risky valuation.

title: AI will help Home Depot staff fine-tune in-store customer service
summary: The Home Depot (NYSE: HD) is partnering with Rilla to implement its AI-powered real-time coaching platform for service and sales professionals nationwide. This tool will analyze communication patterns to provide coaching insights, aiming to standardize customer experience and enhance frontline development across the retailer's extensive network. The collaboration underscores both companies' commitment to operational consistency and leveraging technology to improve service quality for millions of customers.

title: Domo, Amplitude, and LiveRamp Stocks Trade Down, What You Need To Know
summary: Shares of Domo, Amplitude, and LiveRamp, among other enterprise software companies, experienced a downturn in an afternoon session due to competitive anxiety in the sector. This sell-off was triggered by a high-profile downgrade of Adobe, concerns about Snowflake facing pressure from Amazon and Oracle, and DocuSign and Asana struggling with market commoditization. Despite the market overreaction, these price drops could present buying opportunities for high-quality stocks in the long run.

title: What You Need To Know Ahead of IQVIA’s Earnings Release
summary: IQVIA Holdings Inc. (IQV) is expected to report its fourth-quarter fiscal 2025 results soon, with analysts projecting a 7.9% year-over-year profit increase to $3.13 per share. The company has a strong history of exceeding consensus estimates and recently announced a partnership with Amazon Web Services (AWS) to enhance healthcare analytics. While IQV's stock has underperformed the broader market over the past year, it has outperformed over the last six months and its sector over both periods, with analysts issuing a "Strong Buy" consensus rating and a mean price target implying a 6.1% upside.

title: Ulta Beauty’s Kecia Steelman on AI, Cultural Relevance, International and More
summary: Kecia Steelman, CEO of Ulta Beauty, discussed the retailer's "Ulta Beauty Unleashed" growth strategy at NRF's B ig Show 2026, focusing on driving the core U.S. business, developing new margin-creating ventures, and realigning foundational growth. Steelman emphasized a data-driven, omnichannel approach using AI for personalization, and highlighted the expansion into wellness, exclusive offerings, and international markets like Mexico and the Middle East, while stressing the importance of not neglecting the core business.

title: Google stock (GOOG) rises after-hours on Apple’s Gemini-Siri deal as earnings near
summary: Alphabet Inc. (GOOG) Class C shares rose 1.1% in after-hours trading following news of Apple's plan to integrate Google's Gemini AI models into Siri and other AI features. This partnership is seen as a significant win for Alphabet in the generative AI space, especially as the company approaches its Q4 and full-year 2025 earnings release on February 4th. Investors are closely watching how AI advancements will impact revenue and costs, and whether this high-profile deal will boost Gemini usage and Google Cloud demand.

title: GPIX ETF 8% Monthly Yield and S&P 500 Upside at $53
summary: The article analyzes the Goldman Sachs S&P 500 Premium Income ETF (GPIX), highlighting its 8% monthly yield and structure designed to capture S&P 500 upside with a dynamic covered-call strategy. GPIX uniquely blends exposure to "Magnificent 7" tech stocks with a flexible overwrite mechanism (25%-75%) to generate income while aiming to avoid the common NAV bleed seen in static covered-call funds. The article concludes that GPIX is a buy for investors seeking high, tax-efficient income and exposure to AI-driven tech, while accepting equity-like drawdowns.

title: Bernstein says AI competition fears around Broadcom (AVGO) are overblown
summary: Bernstein analysts believe that fears regarding increased competition in the AI sector for Broadcom (AVGO) are exaggerated. They argue that Broadcom's custom AI chips have a strong market position and that concerns about Google and Amazon developing their own chips are overblown. Bernstein maintains an Outperform rating on AVGO, raising its price target to $1,500.

title: Why Salesforce (CRM) Shares Are Plunging Today
summary: Salesforce (CRM) shares dropped 6.3% today following a broader sell-off in enterprise software stocks. This was triggered by an analyst downgrade of Adobe, citing slower-than-expected AI tool adoption, and related downgrades for Snowflake, DocuSign, and Asana due to competitive pressures and market commoditization. Despite the significant price drop, which the market appears to view as meaningful, the company's shares are down 4.9% year-to-date and 33% below their 52-week high.

title: The Truth About Target Stock: Is This Viral Retail Giant a Sleeper Money Machine?
summary: This article analyzes Target Corp. (TGT) stock, evaluating its potential as an investment given its strong brand presence and cultural impact. It delves into Target's price performance, omnichannel strategy, and dividend policy, comparing it to competitors like Walmart and Amazon. The piece concludes that Target could be a sensible long-term investment for those who appreciate its brand strength and aren't seeking hyper-growth.

title: A ação da AMD dispara 7% após ligação otimista de analistas: veja o que a atualização do KeyBanc significa
summary: A ação da Advanced Micro Devices (AMD) subiu 7% após o analista do KeyBanc, John Vinh, elevar a classificação da fabricante de chips para "sobreponderar" e aumentar a meta de preço para US$ 270. A atualização é impulsionada pela escassez de CPUs de servidor da AMD, quase esgotadas até 2026, e pela maior demanda por aceleradores de IA. A empresa pode considerar um aumento de preço de 10-15% para suas CPUs de servidor no 1º trimestre, e projeta um crescimento de 50% em CPUs para servidores e US$ 14-15 bilhões em receita de IA até 2026.

title: Cisco stock gains on inflation day; here’s what CSCO investors watch before Feb. 11 earnings
summary: Cisco shares rose by approximately 1.3% in afternoon trading, going against a broader market decline, as investors reacted to new inflation data. The company is set to announce its earnings on February 11, with analysts anticipating $1.02 per share, and will pay a quarterly dividend of $0.41 per share on January 21. Investors are closely monitoring key metrics like AI-driven order momentum, client networking upgrades, and their impact on margins, ahead of the earnings report, which will be crucial for the stock's future direction.

title: Walmart expands drone delivery with Wing to 150 more stores
summary: Walmart is significantly expanding its drone delivery service in partnership with Wing (an Alphabet subsidiary) to 150 additional stores, aiming to reach over 40 million people by 2027. This expansion builds on successful operations in Dallas-Fort Worth and Atlanta, with new launches planned for Houston, Orlando, Tampa, and Charlotte. The initiative is a key part of Walmart's strategy to meet increasing consumer demand for fast delivery and compete with rivals like Amazon.

title: Gordon Reid's Top Picks: Meta, Morgan Stanley & RTX Corp
summary: This article highlights Gordon Reid's top stock picks: Meta, Morgan Stanley, and RTX Corp. It also features Darren Sissons, partner and portfolio manager at Campbell, Lee & Ross Investment Management, who shares his own stock picks and market outlooks. The content includes a series of videos from other financial experts discussing their top picks and market insights from the past few days.

title: Microsoft vows to ‘pay its way’ as it seeks to defuse data centre backlash
summary: Microsoft is pledging to pay higher electricity rates and replenish water used by its AI data centers to address public backlash over rising energy costs and environmental concerns. This move comes as the Trump administration faces criticism for increased electricity bills despite prioritizing AI development. Other utilities, like Georgia Power, are also reassuring customers that data center energy demands will not impact their rates.

title: Delivery giants face share loss, Amazon threat, leading BNP Paribas to downgrade FedEx and UPS (FDX)
summary: BNP Paribas has downgraded FedEx and UPS, citing concerns over market share loss and increased competition from Amazon. The investment bank believes the delivery giants' growth potential is undermined as Amazon expands its logistics capabilities and captures more package volume.

title: FedEx Corp (NYSE:FDX) Mixed View
summary: FedEx (NYSE: FDX) is experiencing a mixed investment outlook. BofA upgraded the company to Buy with a $365 price target, citing potential benefits from cost reductions, network consolidation, and an expected freight market recovery. Conversely, BNP Paribas Exane downgraded FedEx to Neutral despite strong recent performance, raising concerns about increasing competition from players like Amazon.

title: Quantum Computing Stocks: UBS Eyes IBM, Google, IonQ. Infleqtion To Go Public.
summary: UBS has joined other Wall Street firms in focusing on quantum computing stocks, highlighting tech giants like IBM for their competitive strength in this sector. The report mentions that quantum computing uses advanced technologies to solve problems currently too complex for traditional computers. Additionally, Infleqtion is expected to go public, adding another player to the quantum computing stock market.

title: Crane Co stock hits all-time high at 205.92 USD
summary: Crane Co's stock recently achieved an all-time high of $205.92 USD, reflecting strong investor confidence and a 34.6% increase over the past year. Despite appearing overvalued by Fair Value models, the company boasts strong financial health, a 55-year history of dividend payments, and recently exceeded Q3 2025 earnings expectations. Analysts see potential for further upside, with Wolfe Research initiating Outperform coverage.

title: Will Lumentum (LITE) Finance Transition Shape Its Credibility In AI-Driven Optical Infrastructure?
summary: Lumentum (LITE) announced the upcoming retirement of Chief Accounting Officer Matthew Sepe and the appointment of Eric Chang, a high-tech finance executive, to the role. This leadership transition occurs amidst strong external analyst projections for AI-related optical demand for Lumentum's products. The article explores how this finance transition might influence the company's investment narrative, particularly concerning its stability in providing optical infrastructure for AI and cloud computing, while also highlighting the risks of customer concentration.

title: Hewlett Packard Enterprise: How HPE Is Re?Architecting the Enterprise for the AI Era
summary: Hewlett Packard Enterprise (HPE) is transforming its business by focusing on hybrid cloud, its GreenLake platform, and AI-native infrastructure to cater to the evolving needs of the enterprise. The company aims to provide consistent workload management across public clouds, data centers, and edge locations with cloud economics and on-prem control. This strategy positions HPE as a formidable competitor against traditional hardware rivals and hyperscale cloud providers, offering a compelling alternative for organizations seeking to modernize while avoiding vendor lock-in.

title: AI Sentiment on Amazon (AMZN) Could Improve in 2026, BofA Says
summary: BofA Securities analyst Justin Post reiterated a Buy rating on Amazon (AMZN) with a $303.00 price target, predicting improved AI sentiment for the stock in 2026. This positive outlook is attributed to anticipated AWS growth acceleration from new capacity, leadership changes, and increased Rufus usage, which could enhance Amazon's AI positioning despite its 2025 underperformance compared to the S&P 500 and Nasdaq. The firm believes Amazon's proprietary AI tech could provide a significant cost advantage for inference if it improves against competitors.

title: Zacks Investment Ideas feature highlights: CoreWeave, Amazon, IBM, Nvidia, Nebius, Astera Labs, Intel and Advanced Micro Devices
summary: Zacks Investment Ideas highlights several "picks and shovels" AI stocks, arguing that investing in foundational AI infrastructure can be more lucrative and predictable than betting on the ultimate large language model (LLM) leaders. The article features CoreWeave, Nebius Group, and Astera Labs, detailing their roles in providing crucial computing power, infrastructure, and semiconductor solutions for AI development, and their strong partnerships with industry giants like Nvidia and Microsoft. It emphasizes their strong growth potential and strategic positions in the rapidly expanding AI market.

title: Helmerich & Payne (HP) Price Target Raised to $35
summary: TD Cowen analyst Marc Bianchi raised the price target for Helmerich & Payne (HP) from $33 to $35, maintaining a 'Hold' rating. This adjustment follows news of potential US action in Venezuela, which could provide American oil companies access to significant oil reserves. Helmerich & Payne itself is still seeking payment for invoices and the return of drilling rigs seized by Venezuela in 2010.

title: Why DocuSign (DOCU) Stock Is Falling Today
summary: DocuSign (NASDAQ:DOCU) shares fell 5.6% after a wave of competitive anxiety hit the enterprise software sector, triggered by an Adobe downgrade and broader sell-off in high-valuation cloud stocks. Analysts warned about Adobe's AI tools not boosting sales quickly, and Snowflake also faced a downgrade due to pressure from competitors. DocuSign and Asana are struggling against the narrative that their core markets are becoming commoditized amidst these industry concerns.

title: Cipher Mining stock pops as bitcoin firms, with CEO due at Needham fireside chat
summary: Cipher Mining (CIFR) shares surged over 6% in early trading, outpacing other U.S.-listed crypto miners, driven by a nearly 2% jump in Bitcoin's value. Investors are closely watching CEO Tyler Page's upcoming fireside chat at Needham & Company's Growth Conference for updates on Cipher's expansion into high-performance computing (HPC) hosting, including a significant $5.5 billion lease with Amazon Web Services. This strategic shift aims to diversify revenue beyond mere Bitcoin mining, though potential risks like construction delays and market volatility remain concerns.

title: Thomson Reuters Convenes Global AI Leaders to Advance Trust in the Age of Intelligent Systems
summary: Thomson Reuters, through its innovation research center, Thomson Reuters Labs, has launched the "Trust in AI Alliance." This alliance brings together leading AI organizations like Anthropic, AWS, Google Cloud, and OpenAI to collaborate on advancing trustworthy, agentic AI systems. The initiative aims to define shared principles and technical pathways for responsible AI, particularly in high-stakes professional environments, by focusing on reliability, interpretability, and verification.

title: What You Need To Know Ahead of IQVIA's Earnings Release
summary: IQVIA Holdings Inc. (IQV) is set to release its Q4 fiscal 2025 earnings, with analysts predicting a profit of $3.13 per share, an increase of 7.9% year-over-year. The company has a strong record of exceeding consensus estimates and its stock has outperformed its sector in the last six months, partly due to a recent partnership with Amazon Web Services (AWS) to improve healthcare analytics. Wall Street analysts maintain a "Strong Buy" consensus rating for IQV, with a mean price target suggesting a 6.1% upside.

title: New daily spray from Clorox that neutralizes indoor pollen and pet dander
summary: The Clorox Company (NYSE: CLX) has launched Clorox™ PURE™ Allergen Neutralizer, a new line of daily air and fabric sprays designed to neutralize common household allergens like pollen, dust mite matter, and pet dander. These products utilize a plant-based active ingredient with Aller-Fresh™ Technology to change allergen protein shapes, preventing allergic reactions. Available in four allergen-free fragrances, the sprays are sold at major retailers including Walmart and Amazon, and are aimed at expanding Clorox's product portfolio into indoor wellness.

title: Stock Market Today, Jan. 13: Netflix Rises After HSBC Upgrade Sparks Optimism Ahead of Earnings
summary: Netflix (NFLX) shares rose after HSBC Global Research upgraded the stock to "strong buy," anticipating a rebound and potential acquisition catalysts, including Warner Bros. Discovery. Trading volume for Netflix reached 43.8 million shares, and the company has shown significant growth since its 2002 IPO. The broader market saw the S&P 500 and Nasdaq Composite slip slightly, while other entertainment peers like Disney (DIS) and Amazon (AMZN) had mixed performance.

title: From Control to Command: The Future of Multicloud Security
summary: The article discusses the evolution of multicloud security, moving from reactive control to proactive command through an automated security fabric. It highlights the failings of traditional security models in modern, dynamic cloud environments and proposes a new operating model focused on continuous visibility, automated deployment, advanced threat prevention, and flexible operationalization. The piece emphasizes that managed firewall-as-a-service (FWaaS) is foundational to achieving this future state, specifically across AWS and Azure.

title: Should You Forget Sirius XM? This Stock Has Made Far More Millionaires.
summary: The article compares Sirius XM and Amazon as investment opportunities, suggesting investors should favor Amazon. While Sirius XM offers attractive dividend yields and low valuation, it faces growth challenges due to competition. Amazon, despite its higher valuation, is presented as a "millionaire maker" stock with durable growth driven by e-commerce, cloud computing (AWS), and AI.

title: Application Gateway Market Trends, Investment Opportunities,
summary: The report provides a comprehensive analysis of the Application Gateway Market, forecasting trends, investment opportunities, and growth through 2033. It includes detailed segmentation, competitive strategies of key players like A10 Networks, Akamai Technologies, and AWS, and a robust research methodology covering global regions. The study aims to offer actionable insights to businesses, investors, and decision-makers in the evolving market landscape.

title: Marvell Technology, Inc. $MRVL Shares Sold by Nordea Investment Management AB
summary: Nordea Investment Management AB reduced its stake in Marvell Technology (NASDAQ:MRVL) by 18.0% in the third quarter, selling 1,294,325 shares but still holding 5,901,344 shares valued at $494.2 million. Marvell Technology reported strong quarterly earnings, beating estimates with $0.76 EPS and a 36.8% revenue increase year-over-year, and announced a $5.0 billion share buyback program. The company maintains a "Moderate Buy" consensus rating from analysts with an average price target of $116.03.

title: S Bank Fund Management Ltd Grows Stock Holdings in Marvell Technology, Inc. $MRVL
summary: S Bank Fund Management Ltd has increased its stake in Marvell Technology, Inc. (NASDAQ:MRVL) by 23.3%, now holding 111,781 shares valued at $9.397 million. This makes Marvell its 17th largest holding, comprising about 1.2% of the fund's portfolio. Other major institutions like Norges Bank, DZ BANK, Amundi, and Franklin Resources Inc. also significantly boosted their holdings, leading to institutional investors owning 83.51% of the company.

title: Microsoft Wants to Power Retail Without Competing With It
summary: Microsoft is expanding into agentic commerce with its new Copilot Checkout, allowing users to complete purchases within its AI chatbot while retailers manage fulfillment. The company aims to provide AI tools and cloud infrastructure to retailers, enhancing their operations without competing for customer relationships. Analysts remain bullish on Microsoft (MSFT) stock, seeing it as well-positioned in the AI stack despite recent dips, with a Goldman Sachs price target of $655.

title: Productivity Surprise Supports 2026 Setup - WisdomTree, Inc. - Commentaries
summary: Jeremy J. Siegel of WisdomTree, Inc. discusses surprising macro data showing slow job growth but stable unemployment, coupled with a significant surge in output. This points to a powerful productivity surge driven by reduced low-productivity labor influx and increased technology investments, supporting disinflation without recession. Siegel anticipates continued equity strength, particularly in small caps and non-tech cyclicals, with international markets also becoming more compelling due to reasonable valuations and improved corporate governance.

title: SM Energy (SM) Is Undervalued According to This Analyst
summary: KeyBanc analyst Tim Rezvan maintained a Buy rating on SM Energy Company (NYSE:SM) with a $28 target price, suggesting a 55% upside. This follows a previous skepticism about the company's $12.8 billion merger with Civitas Resources (NYSE:CIVI), announced in November 2025. Despite a lowered price target by Mizuho, analysts generally remain bullish on SM Energy, anticipating rapid deleveraging and improved free cash flow post-merger.

title: Plug Power Inc. to Showcase Hydrogen Solutions at UBS Global Energy & Utilities Winter Conference 2026
summary: Plug Power Inc., a leader in hydrogen solutions, will participate in the UBS Global Energy & Utilities Winter Conference from January 12-14, 2026, in Park City, Utah. President Jose Luis Crespo and Vice President of Investor Relations Roberto Friedlander will meet with institutional investors to discuss the company's strategic roadmap including its comprehensive hydrogen ecosystem. Plug Power is focused on expanding its operational capacity with hydrogen plants in several states and serves major clients like Walmart and Amazon, highlighting its prominent role in the hydrogen economy.

title: Plug Power to attend UBS energy conference in Park City
summary: Plug Power (NASDAQ: PLUG) is set to participate in the UBS Global Energy & Utilities Winter Conference from January 12-14 in Park City, Utah. Company executives will meet with institutional investors to discuss its strategic roadmap for building a hydrogen economy ecosystem, which includes production, storage, delivery, and power generation. Plug Power has deployed over 72,000 fuel cell systems and 285 fueling stations, serving major customers like Walmart, Amazon, and BMW.

title: GDS to Realize 6.5x Return on Partial Exit From DayOne, Redirect Proceeds to China Core Business
summary: GDS Holdings Ltd. (HK:9698) is selling $385 million worth of its shares in DayOne Data Centers, achieving a 6.5x return on its original principal investment while retaining a significant stake valued at over $2.2 billion. The proceeds from this partial exit will be redirected to new high-return opportunities within its core China data center business, aiming to enhance capital deployment efficiency and strengthen its domestic growth. Currently, analysts have a Hold rating on GDS Holdings Ltd. stock with a price target of HK$30.00.

title: GPIX: A Strong Covered Call ETF Option For 2026 (NASDAQ:GPIX)
summary: The Goldman Sachs S&P 500 Premium Income ETF (GPIX) offers investors high income and potential upside through a covered call strategy heavily focused on Magnificent 7 tech stocks. GPIX has shown strong performance since its inception, outperforming SPYI and providing an attractive 8% yield. While its concentration in the tech sector introduces risk, the ETF aims to balance income generation with NAV appreciation, serving as a middle ground for covered call investors.

title: GRIMES & Co WEALTH MANAGEMENT LLC Has $25.02 Million Stock Position in Avantis U.S. Large Cap Equity ETF $AVLC
summary: GRIMES & Co WEALTH MANAGEMENT LLC significantly increased its stake in the Avantis U.S. Large Cap Equity ETF (AVLC) by 43.0% in the third quarter, holding 327,058 shares valued at $25.02 million. This ETF, which invests in US large-cap stocks with high-growth characteristics and attractive valuations, also saw new or increased positions from other institutional investors. The article details AVLC's stock performance and introduces the fund, which was launched in September 2023 by American Century Investments.

title: BNP Paribas Exane downgrades FedEx stock rating to Neutral on competition concerns
summary: BNP Paribas Exane has downgraded FedEx (FDX) from Outperform to Neutral, citing increasing competition in the delivery market despite raising its price target to $280.00. The stock is currently trading above this target, appearing overvalued by InvestingPro Fair Value estimates, and has seen a significant rise of over 30% in the past six months, reaching overbought territory. The firm notes Amazon's growing market share and improved next-day delivery as a mid-term risk, even as FedEx has benefited from strong domestic performance and onboarding Amazon as a customer.

title: Synchrony Financial (SYF): Navigating High Yields and Regulatory Headwinds in 2026
summary: Synchrony Financial (SYF) is at a crossroads in early 2026, balancing strong financial performance and a resilient consumer base with significant regulatory uncertainty, primarily a proposed 10% federal interest rate cap on credit cards. The article highlights Synchrony's evolution from GE Capital, its B2B2C business model, and its innovative offerings like CareCredit. While the company demonstrates financial strength and growth opportunities, investors face increased volatility due to political risks, despite a generally moderate buy sentiment from analysts.

title: Should You Buy Oracle Stock Now?
summary: Oracle (ORCL) stock has fallen 11% in the last six months due to concerns about its rising debt from AI expansion and skepticism regarding backlog conversion to revenue. Despite these concerns, Trefis believes ORCL stock is undervalued, projecting a 46% upside to $300 per share, driven by a massive $523 billion backlog and significant AI infrastructure contracts. The article suggests that the market is overly pessimistic and not adequately pricing in Oracle's clear revenue growth visibility.

title: 2026 Investment Perspectives
summary: Blackstone's 2026 Investment Perspectives report highlights five key dynamics shaping markets: AI investment and productivity gains, solid but uneven growth, a cooling labor market, moderating inflation, and declining global cost of capital. The firm believes these factors create an attractive environment for investors who can adapt and act with conviction, especially within private markets. The report delves into opportunities across private equity, real estate, credit, and infrastructure, emphasizing their potential for growth, durability, and downside protection amidst market shifts.

title: NVIDIA Corporation $NVDA Shares Sold by Dupont Capital Management Corp
summary: Dupont Capital Management Corp reduced its stake in NVIDIA Corporation by 3.4% in the third quarter of 2025, selling 14,647 shares and holding 416,669 shares valued at $77.74 million. Other institutional investors also adjusted their positions in NVDA. The article also details key positive, neutral, and negative news impacting NVIDIA, including an AI co-innovation lab with Eli Lilly, expanded BioNeMo platform, and insider selling, alongside analyst ratings and price performance data.

title: IonQ, Inc. (NYSE:IONQ) Receives Average Recommendation of "Moderate Buy" from Brokerages
summary: IonQ, Inc. (NYSE:IONQ) has received an average "Moderate Buy" rating from sixteen brokerages, with an average one-year price target of $75.91. While the company missed EPS expectations, it significantly beat revenue estimates, reporting a 221.5% year-over-year increase. Insider activity shows a director buying shares, but overall insider selling of 125,000 shares in the last three months.

title: Jim Cramer Calls Alphabet's Gemini 3 a "Home Run"
summary: Jim Cramer praised Alphabet's Gemini 3 AI platform, calling it a "home run" and noting its potential to compete with ChatGPT for mindshare. He reiterated his positive outlook on Alphabet, particularly its AI capabilities through Gemini, despite having previously sold it from his Charitable Trust. Cramer believes that Alphabet, along with NVIDIA, will be a significant outperformer in 2026 due to its strong AI platform, YouTube, Waymo, Google Cloud, and reasonable valuation considering its growth rate.

title: Plug to Participate in UBS Global Energy & Utilities Winter Conference
summary: Plug Power Inc. (NASDAQ: PLUG) will participate in the UBS Global Energy & Utilities Winter Conference from January 12-14 in Park City, Utah. President and CRO Jose Luis Crespo and Vice President of Investor Relations Roberto Friedlander will meet with institutional investors to discuss Plug's strategic roadmap. This participation highlights the company's strong leadership in the hydrogen economy and its engagement with the investment community.

title: Energous Reports Preliminary Financial Results for Fiscal Year 2025, Marking a Transformational Year of Growth and Platform Expansion
summary: Energous Corporation reported preliminary financial results for fiscal year 2025, achieving record annual revenue of approximately $5.6 million, representing over 630% year-over-year growth. The company also improved its operating performance significantly and strengthened its balance sheet by raising $23.9 million in equity capital. Energous expanded its product portfolio with four new offerings and secured 15 new patents, while also joining the Amazon Web Services Partner Network to further commercial validation and market reach.

title: Expedia Group Inc.: Can the Original Online Travel Giant Still Set the Pace?
summary: Expedia Group Inc. is transforming itself into an AI-powered travel operating system, focusing on a unified tech stack, loyalty program (One Key), and B2B solutions to compete with Booking Holdings, Airbnb, and Google. The company is using generative AI for conversational trip planning and consolidating its loyalty programs across brands to enhance personalization and customer retention. This strategic shift aims to re-rate Expedia's stock as a scalable, high-margin travel operating platform rather than just a traditional online travel agency.

title: A Deep Dive into the iShares MSCI World ETF: Concentration and Performance
summary: This article provides a deep dive into the iShares MSCI World ETF (URTH), an ETF that has significantly benefited from the global equity rally since late 2025. It highlights the fund's heavy concentration in major U.S. technology stocks, outlining performance data, fund structure, portfolio composition, and market context. The analysis also compares URTH with competitors and discusses critical drivers for its performance in 2026, emphasizing the dual nature of its U.S. mega-cap concentration.

title: Microsoft expands Copilot into online commerce with in-chat checkout and seller tools
summary: Microsoft is expanding its Copilot AI capabilities into the retail sector, introducing new tools for online commerce, merchandising, store operations, and fulfillment. These updates include Copilot Checkout, allowing in-chat purchases in the US, and personalized shopping agents for conversational product discovery. Additionally, new Copilot Studio templates aim to automate catalog enrichment and assist store operations with intelligent insights.

title: Spence Asset Management trims Amazon.com stake by 3,667 shares
summary: Spence Asset Management, led by Eric Walton, has reduced its holdings in Amazon.Com, Inc. (AMZN) by 3,667 shares. This transaction comes as TipRanks’ AI Analyst, Spark, rates AMZN as "Outperform," citing strong financial performance and positive earnings sentiment in AWS and advertising, despite short-term technical weakness and a high P/E ratio.

title: Apple Stock: Despite The Selloff, 2026 Still Priced At A Premium (NASDAQ:AAPL)
summary: Despite a recent selloff, Apple Inc. (AAPL) is still considered a Hold due to its stretched valuation at 31.4x forward P/E, even with technical oversold signals. The company is projected to have high single-digit revenue growth and an EPS CAGR of 7.8% from FY2022 to FY2026. The article questions the sustainability of AI-driven iPhone upgrade cycles, suggesting Apple needs stronger AI monetization strategies beyond just product sales.

title: Alaska Air Group to upgrade tech systems after costly outages
summary: Alaska Air Group is planning to upgrade its technology systems, including exploring cloud-based platforms with providers like Amazon Web Services and Microsoft Azure, to prevent future costly outages. This decision follows significant disruptions such as a primary data center failure in October that led to the cancellation of over 400 flights. The airline expects to increase its annual technology investments by tens of millions of dollars to enhance redundancy and resiliency.

title: Trump says Microsoft, peers, to make ’major changes’ in AI data center power bills
summary: Donald Trump announced that his administration is collaborating with major American technology firms, starting with Microsoft, to address the rising utility costs associated with running AI data centers. The goal is to prevent these higher costs from being passed on to household bills, ensuring companies "pay their own way." Trump emphasized that while more data centers are crucial for U.S. dominance in AI, concerns about increased electricity and water costs for American consumers must be mitigated.

title: Trump Touts New Microsoft Data-Center Pledges After Local Backlash
summary: President Trump announced that Microsoft has pledged to cover higher utility bills for all its U.S. data centers powering AI models, addressing local concerns about rising electricity prices. This move by Microsoft is part of a broader effort by the tech industry and the administration to assuage fears among consumers and local governments, with other tech giants like Meta, Amazon, and Google taking similar steps. Trump indicated that further announcements regarding collaborations with top tech companies are expected.

title: Applied Materials stock tags new record after Susquehanna upgrade — CPI and earnings loom
summary: Applied Materials (AMAT) shares hit a new 52-week high after Susquehanna upgraded the stock to "Positive" with a significant price target increase to $400. The upgrade reflects strong forecasts for wafer fab equipment spending. Investors are now keenly awaiting upcoming U.S. CPI data and Applied Materials' earnings report for further market direction.

title: Alaska Air undertakes tech upgrades after painful outages
summary: Alaska Air Group Inc. is undertaking significant technology upgrades to address past operational outages and strengthen its position as a global carrier. The revamp includes evaluating cloud migration for operational, back-office systems, and data center operations, with Amazon Web Services and Microsoft's Azure being considered.

title: Sonos adds three directors to board as company refines strategy By Investing.com
summary: Audio technology company Sonos, Inc. (NASDAQ:SONO) has appointed three new directors, Carmine Arabia, Mandy Fields, and Joe Kennedy, to its Board of Directors to support its next growth phase and refine its platform-driven "Sonos System" strategy. This announcement comes amid significant stock volatility and follows strong financial performance in Q4 2025, with analysts expecting a return to profitability this year. The company is actively buying back shares and maintains a solid financial position with ample liquidity.

title: Adobe Firefly gets GPT-Image 1.5 support, limited-time free images
summary: Adobe Firefly now supports OpenAI’s GPT-Image 1.5 model, allowing Firefly Pro and Premium subscribers to generate unlimited images with this model until January 15. This integration is part of Adobe's broader strategy to incorporate AI-based features across its products, including Photoshop, Illustrator, and Adobe Express. Firefly offers various subscription plans based on generative credits, which are used for generating high-quality image, vector, video, and audio outputs.

title: Equinix Inc.: The Quiet Super?Infrastructure Powering the Cloud Wars
summary: Equinix Inc. has evolved beyond a traditional data center operator to become a critical software-defined backbone for the internet and multi-cloud environments. The company's strategy focuses on neutrality, interconnection services, and a global, consistent platform to cater to growing demands from AI, cloud, and data-intensive applications. This positioning allows Equinix to maintain a premium valuation as a growth-oriented digital infrastructure asset in a competitive market.

title: Allegiant to absorb Sun Country’s Amazon cargo business
summary: Allegiant Travel Co. is set to acquire Sun Country Airlines in a $1.5 billion deal, creating a significant leisure-focused airline. Amazon has committed to adding two more cargo aircraft to Sun Country's fleet this year, indicating confidence in the continued partnership despite the merger. This acquisition is expected to leverage Sun Country's diversified business model, including its Amazon cargo and charter operations, to provide consistent revenue and optimize aircraft utilization for the combined entity.

title: CVRx Issues 2026 Outlook and Expands Loan Facility
summary: CVRx announced its preliminary unaudited Q4 2025 and full-year 2025 revenue, showing growth and a strong cash position. The company also provided 2026 guidance, forecasting increased revenue and gross margins, benefiting from new CPT codes. Additionally, CVRx expanded its loan facility for greater financial flexibility and is making a significant clinical investment with the FDA-approved BENEFIT-HF trial design, aiming to enlarge the addressable market for its Barostim device.

title: Walmart to expand drone delivery to 150 more stores
summary: Walmart and Wing are significantly expanding their drone delivery service to 150 additional stores, aiming for 270 locations by 2027. This expansion includes launching in major metro markets like Los Angeles, St. Louis, Cincinnati, and Miami. The service has seen positive results in Dallas-Fort Worth and Atlanta, with frequent orders for groceries and a tripling of deliveries in the past six months.

title: Home Depot, Walmart expand Google partnerships as agentic AI reshapes ecommerce
summary: Home Depot and Walmart are expanding their partnerships with Google Cloud to integrate agentic AI tools into their e-commerce operations. These initiatives, announced at the NRF 2026 conference, aim to streamline the discovery, decision-making, ordering, and delivery processes for both consumer and B2B customers. Home Depot is enhancing its Magic Apron assistant and rolling out AI-powered materials lists for professionals, while Walmart is embedding its shopping experience directly into Google's Gemini app for conversational commerce.

title: Marcus & Millichap Closes Sale of Mallard Point Apartments in Suburban Chicago
summary: Marcus & Millichap announced the sale of Mallard Point Apartments, a 173-unit multifamily asset in Channahon, Illinois, for $24.625 million. The property, located in a fast-growing county near major distribution centers, was 99% occupied at the time of sale and attracted over 30 offers. It was acquired by Loboda Properties, a California-based family office, which assumed an existing HUD loan.

title: Alphabet Inc. (Class C): The Quiet Engine Powering Google’s Next Decade
summary: Alphabet Inc. (Class C) (GOOG) is highlighted as a critical investment vehicle for global exposure to Google's AI, cloud, and advertising empire. This non-voting share class offers pure economic exposure to Alphabet's diversified engines, including Google Search, YouTube, Google Cloud, and AI initiatives, without diluting founder control. The article underscores Class C's competitive advantages in data scale, integrated AI infrastructure, and multiple monetization streams compared to rivals like Microsoft, Apple, Amazon, and Meta.

title: The Great Storage Pivot: How Western Digital Outpaced the Field in the AI Data Supercycle
summary: Western Digital has emerged as a dominant force in the AI data storage market, largely due to its strategic corporate split in early 2025. By spinning off its flash memory business into SanDisk, the company focused on high-capacity HDDs, benefiting immensely from the "AI Data Lake" era and a global shortage of nearline HDDs. This pivot led to significant stock price surges and strong financial performance, positioning Western Digital as a key player in the ongoing "Storage Supercycle."

title: Google-Parent Alphabet Becomes Newest $4 Trillion Company, Joining Nvidia
summary: Alphabet's market capitalization briefly surpassed $4 trillion, making it the latest tech company to hit this valuation, driven by optimism over its AI advancements. This surge follows the successful launch of its Gemini 3 model and Apple's decision to integrate Gemini into Siri. Alphabet joins Nvidia above the $4 trillion mark, while Apple and Microsoft have fallen slightly below it.

title: AlphaTON expands exposure to decentralized Telegram-based Cocoon AI with NVIDIA deal
summary: AlphaTON Capital Corp (Nasdaq: ATON) has secured a $46 million compute infrastructure deal to scale the decentralized, Telegram-native Cocoon AI network, which compensates users in Toncoin for GPU rental to process AI queries. The agreement involves acquiring 576 NVIDIA B300 chips, with financing through cash, non-recourse debt, and equity. Cocoon AI, built on the TON blockchain, aims to offer a privacy-preserving alternative to larger AI platforms like Google's Gemini or OpenAI's ChatGPT to Telegram's approximately 1 billion monthly active users.

title: Smart Data-Driven Pest Control
summary: Rentokil Initial plc has developed a "Smart Data-Driven Pest Control" system utilizing IoT, sensor networks, and cloud-based analytics for real-time monitoring and predictive pest management. This approach aims to improve responsiveness and resource allocation by shifting from scheduled visits to condition-based service delivery, reducing chemical use and operational disruption. The system provides prioritized work orders for technicians and dashboards for compliance, informing site design and sanitation changes for long-term effectiveness.

title: AI is Driving More Online Traffic, Conversions, and Revenues, Adobe Analytics Says
summary: Adobe Analytics reports that artificial intelligence significantly boosted online shopping during the 2025 holiday season, leading to a nearly seven-fold increase in online retail traffic through AI referrals. These AI-driven conversions were also substantially higher than non-AI sources, with shoppers arriving via AI assistants spending more time on sites and having higher purchase confidence. The findings indicate a growing trust in AI among consumers, repositioning generative AI as a primary channel for commerce discovery.

title: Walmart, Wing to scale drone delivery operations to 270 stores
summary: Walmart is expanding its drone delivery partnership with Wing, a subsidiary of Alphabet, aiming to serve 150 U.S. stores in the next year and eventually reach over 270 locations by 2027. This initiative will cover major cities like Los Angeles and Cincinnati, positioning Walmart to compete in the fast-shipping market against Amazon and meet growing consumer demand for rapid deliveries. The expansion builds on existing operations and has already tripled delivery volume in the last six months, despite challenges like regulatory hurdles and noise complaints.

title: DigitalOcean (DOCN) Stock Trades Up, Here Is Why
summary: DigitalOcean (DOCN) shares rose 4.4% after Barclays maintained an "Overweight" rating and increased the price target to $63 from $49, naming it a top pick for 2026 due to anticipated software sector rebound. The stock's volatility is noted, and the recent increase follows a previous drop caused by a broader market rotation out of tech stocks. DigitalOcean has seen a 14.7% increase year-to-date and hit a new 52-week high, making early investors profitable.

title: 5 takeaways from Xcel CEO Bob Frenzel’s talk at the Minneapolis Fed
summary: Xcel Energy CEO Bob Frenzel discussed the dramatic impact of data center growth on electric utilities at the Minneapolis Fed, highlighting multiple drivers of demand growth, degrading supply chains, and the need for alternative rate structures. He also advocated for nuclear energy as a preferred source for data centers and noted the significant rise in engineering, procurement, and construction costs due to competition from hyperscalers. The utility is adapting its strategies to manage this evolving landscape, including long-term contracts and advocating for national initiatives in nuclear power.

title: BBVA completes its global move to the cloud with a single data and artificial intelligence platform
summary: BBVA has successfully completed the global rollout of its ADA data and artificial intelligence platform, built on Amazon Web Services. This platform is now operational across all the bank's geographies, enabling more agile, personalized, and efficient services for clients. ADA's technological strength and business impact were recognized with several international awards in 2025.

title: Mission Produce appoints new president, COO
summary: This article announces that Mission Produce has appointed a new president and COO. The exact name and details of the appointment are not provided in the snippet, as the body of the article appears to be missing and replaced by other news summaries.

title: The Zacks Analyst Blog Highlights NVIDIA, Alphabet, Amazon.com and CBL & Associates Properties
summary: Zacks Equity Research released a blog highlighting new research reports on NVIDIA, Alphabet, Amazon.com, and micro-cap stock CBL & Associates Properties. The reports detail the financial performance, growth drivers, and potential challenges for each company, emphasizing their AI advancements, market positions, and future outlooks. This daily research output aims to provide investors with comprehensive analysis ahead of market openings.

title: AlphaTON Capital Closes $46M AI Infrastructure Expansion to
summary: AlphaTON Capital has announced a $46 million AI infrastructure expansion to address the demand for confidential compute, involving the deployment of 576 NVIDIA B300 chips. This deal is projected to deliver a 27% IRR and 3.82x equity multiple, focusing on privacy-preserving, decentralized AI infrastructure through its integration with Telegram's ecosystem and Cocoon AI. The company aims to provide alternatives to Big Tech infrastructure for AI workloads requiring data sovereignty and privacy.

title: Moderna says its expects $1.9 billion in 2025 sales amid better-than-expected vaccination rate
summary: Moderna projects $1.9 billion in revenue for 2025, exceeding previous guidance, primarily due to higher-than-anticipated COVID-19 vaccination rates despite political challenges. The company, which has seen financial losses since 2023, aims to break even by 2028 through cost-cutting and new product development like norovirus and combination COVID-19/flu vaccines. This financial update was shared at the JPMorgan Healthcare Conference.

title: RedCloud Activates Early Customer Access to RedAI Trading Co-Pilot, Putting Agentic AI to Work in Global FMCG Trade
summary: RedCloud Holdings plc has launched an Early Access Program for its RedAI Trading Co-Pilot, an agentic AI solution designed to revolutionize global Fast-Moving Consumer Goods (FMCG) trade. Powered by NVIDIA and Amazon Web Services, this system aims to close a $2 trillion global inventory gap by providing predictive insights and actionable recommendations for pricing, inventory, and sales. The program allows select FMCG partners to test the RedAI co-pilot in live trading environments before its public launch in February 2026, transitioning global trade from reactive to intelligent decision-making.

title: Amazon (NASDAQ: AMZN) Stock Price Prediction for 2026: Where Will It Be in 1 Year
summary: Amazon (AMZN) stock is projected to have a "Strong Buy" rating despite facing headwinds, driven by strong performance in AWS, AI, and ad sales. Analysts have a median price target of $294.55, indicating a potential upside of 19.08% over the next 52 weeks. The company's recent Q3 earnings beat expectations, and its ongoing investments in AI and robotics, along with the expansion of its grocery and entertainment divisions, are expected to fuel continued growth.

title: Edible Garden’s Award-Winning Kick. Sports Nutrition Now Available on Walmart.com
summary: Edible Garden (Nasdaq: EDBL) announced that its award-winning Kick. Sports Nutrition line is now available on Walmart.com, expanding its national e-commerce distribution. This move supports Edible Garden’s omnichannel growth strategy, providing increased brand exposure and accessibility for consumers seeking performance-focused nutrition products like whey and plant proteins, pre/post-workout formulas, and hydration-energy blends. The products are formulated without artificial colors or unnecessary fillers, aligning with the brand's focus on clarity and functionality.

title: Allegiant to buy rival budget airline Sun Country in $1.5 billion cash and stock deal
summary: Allegiant is acquiring fellow budget airline Sun Country in a $1.5 billion cash and stock deal, including debt. This merger comes as budget airlines face increasing costs and capacity challenges, with Allegiant's CEO Greg Anderson emphasizing the minimal network overlap and the importance of Sun Country's Amazon flying agreement to the deal. The combination aims to create a stronger, leisure-focused airline despite potential regulatory scrutiny over airline mergers.

title: James Bond, Rocky and more head to premium 4K collector editions
summary: Alliance Entertainment (AENT) has secured an exclusive physical media distribution deal with Amazon MGM Studios for North America, effective January 12, 2026. This agreement positions Alliance to distribute Amazon MGM’s extensive library, including new releases like Fallout Season 2 and Mercy, alongside classic franchises such as James Bond and Rocky, in premium 4K UHD and Blu-ray formats. The partnership leverages Alliance's significant scale, inventory, and retail reach to cater to collectors and enhance the availability of physical media.

title: A Look At Alibaba Group Holding (BABA) Valuation After Recent Share Price Pressure
summary: Alibaba Group Holding (BABA) has experienced recent share price pressure despite a strong 1-year return of 90.6%. Simply Wall St's analysis suggests BABA is 22.6% undervalued, with a narrative fair value of US$195.12 compared to its last closing price of US$150.96. This valuation hinges on the success of Alibaba's significant investments in AI and cloud infrastructure, which are expected to drive future growth despite potential challenges from quick commerce margins.

title: Jim Cramer on CVS CEO: "Joyner's Money"
summary: Jim Cramer praised CVS Health Corporation's performance under CEO David Joyner, highlighting its nearly 77% stock increase in 2025, making it the best performer in the healthcare sector. Cramer attributed this success to Joyner's leadership and the struggles of competitor Walgreens. He anticipates another strong year for CVS.

title: Walmart to expand drone delivery to hundreds of stores
summary: Walmart plans to significantly expand its drone delivery service, partnering with Wing to add drone delivery options to an additional 150 stores by 2026, aiming for a total of 270 U.S. locations by 2027. This expansion is projected to make drone delivery available to over 40 million Americans, enhancing convenience for customers to receive groceries and other items quickly. The service, which currently exists in parts of Texas and Atlanta, will extend to major cities like Los Angeles, St. Louis, Cincinnati, and Miami.

title: Data center investments to hit $3 trillion over next five years, says Moody’s By Investing.com
summary: Moody's Ratings projects that approximately $3 trillion will be invested in data-center-related infrastructure over the next five years. This substantial capital influx is driven by the booming demand from artificial intelligence and cloud computing, with major tech companies leading the investment surge. The report also highlights the growing participation of institutional investors beyond banks and the increasing use of varied financing structures like asset-backed securities for data center projects.

title: Amazon.Com's Quarterly Earnings Preview: What You Need to Know
summary: Amazon.com Inc. (AMZN) is preparing to announce its fiscal Q4 2025 earnings, with analysts expecting a profit of $1.97 per share, a 5.9% increase year-over-year. Despite exceeding earnings estimates in previous quarters, AMZN's stock has underperformed the S&P 500 largely due to rising capital expenditure on AI and increasing competition. Wall Street analysts maintain a "Strong Buy" rating with an 18.8% potential upside.

title: 3 Funds for 2026 and Beyond
summary: This article recommends three funds—Vanguard Dividend Growth (VDIGX), Artisan International Value (ARTKX), and Parnassus Core Equity (PRBLX)—as sensible long-term investments for 2026 and beyond. Author Russel Kinnel suggests these funds, despite subpar 2025 returns, offer defensive characteristics and quality holdings, making them suitable for navigating market uncertainties and potential economic shifts. He emphasizes a long-term investment horizon of a decade or more for these selections.

title: Why RBC Sees Opportunity in F5 Inc. (FFIV) After the Breach-Driven Pullback
summary: RBC Capital Markets upgraded F5 Inc. (FFIV) to Outperform, raising its price target to $325, after a security breach caused a substantial stock pullback. RBC believes the financial impact of the breach will be less than initially estimated and sees the stock's correction as a favorable entry point. The firm also identified several medium-term growth drivers for F5, including cloud repatriation, AI-driven workload monetization, and increased private data center investment.

title: Microsoft Corporation $MSFT Position Reduced by HM Payson & Co.
summary: HM Payson & Co. slightly reduced its stake in Microsoft Corporation by 0.6% in the third quarter, selling 5,587 shares but still maintaining it as its largest holding. Despite this, Microsoft shows strong momentum with accelerating Office 365 growth, new AI initiatives, and positive analyst sentiment, with an average target price around $630.76. The company recently surpassed quarterly estimates with significant revenue and EPS growth, though it faces some negative sentiment regarding AI-capable PC sales and job cut rumors.

title: Hardman Johnston Global Advisors LLC Sells 31,900 Shares of Marvell Technology, Inc. $MRVL
summary: Hardman Johnston Global Advisors LLC has reduced its stake in Marvell Technology, Inc. by 34.0%, selling 31,900 shares and now owning 61,860 shares valued at $5.20 million. Despite some insider selling and short-term profit-taking pressure, Marvell Technology reported strong quarterly results, beating EPS estimates and achieving a 36.8% year-over-year revenue increase. The company has also authorized a $5.0 billion share buyback program and is expanding its AI/data-center capabilities through the XConn acquisition, attracting a "Moderate Buy" consensus rating from analysts with an average target price of $116.03.

title: Microsoft Corporation $MSFT is Lawson Kroeker Investment Management Inc. NE's 5th Largest Position
summary: Lawson Kroeker Investment Management Inc. NE recently decreased its stake in Microsoft (MSFT) by 3.8% but it remains their 5th largest holding, valued at $21.57 million. Despite recent insider selling, Wall Street analysts maintain a "Moderate Buy" consensus with an average target price of $630.76. Microsoft reported strong Q3 earnings, beating EPS estimates and showing an 18.4% year-over-year revenue increase.

title: Microsoft Corporation $MSFT is Fort Washington Investment Advisors Inc. OH's Largest Position
summary: Fort Washington Investment Advisors Inc. OH has increased its stake in Microsoft (NASDAQ:MSFT) by 0.4%, making it their largest holding with 2,131,519 shares valued at $1.104 billion. Microsoft reported strong quarterly earnings, beating expectations with an EPS of $4.13 and revenue of $77.67 billion, an 18.4% year-over-year increase. Despite some insider selling and mixed sentiment regarding AI PC sales and job cut rumors, analysts maintain a "Moderate Buy" rating with an average price target of $630.76 for the software giant.

title: Microsoft Corporation $MSFT Shares Bought by Analyst IMS Investment Management Services Ltd.
summary: IMS Investment Management Services Ltd. increased its holdings in Microsoft (NASDAQ:MSFT) by 6.3% in Q3 2025, bringing its total to 54,502 shares valued at $28.23 million. The article highlights strong business momentum for Microsoft, with the company exceeding quarterly expectations and experiencing growth in Office 365 subscriptions and AI-driven products. Despite positive analyst sentiment and strong performance, several insider transactions saw key executives selling a significant number of shares, while reports also indicated a potential slowdown in AI-capable PC sales and initial negative sentiment regarding planned job cuts and a controversial data center proposal.

title: News | Walmart moves to expand drone service nationally
summary: Walmart is significantly expanding its drone delivery service, partnering with Wing to make it available at 150 additional stores over the next year. This expansion aims to reach over 40 million Americans in major metropolitan areas, with plans for a network of over 270 drone delivery locations by 2027. The move is intended to enhance Walmart's competitiveness in quick delivery against e-commerce giants like Amazon, following successful trials in Dallas-Fort Worth and Atlanta.

title: Roundhill AMZN WeeklyPay ETF To Go Ex-Dividend On January 12th, 2026 With 0.21185 USD Dividend Per Share
summary: The Roundhill AMZN WeeklyPay ETF (NYSEARCA:AMZW) is scheduled to go ex-dividend on January 12th, 2026. Shareholders will receive a dividend of 0.21185 USD per share. This indicates a regular payout for investors holding the ETF.

title: GPIQ ETF: 9.8% Yield At $52.89 – Nasdaq-100 Income Play For The 2026 Tech Rally
summary: The GPIQ ETF, currently trading at $52.89 with a 9.8% yield, is positioned as a high-income Nasdaq-100 play for the anticipated 2026 tech rally. It utilizes an actively managed buy-write strategy on Nasdaq-100 derivatives, offering a more tax-efficient yield and higher upside participation than JEPQ, making it attractive for investors seeking cash flow from tech investments. The fund's risk/reward profile is considered constructive, assuming continued strength in large-cap tech and supportive macroeconomic conditions.

title: Alphabet (GOOG) stock week ahead: Washington pressure hits Google Play as earnings loom
summary: Alphabet (GOOG) stock faces pressure as Democratic Senators demand Google and Apple remove X and Grok from their app stores due to policy violations, just as the company prepares for its upcoming earnings report on February 4th. Investors are also watching the EU antitrust regulators' decision by February 10th regarding Alphabet's $32 billion acquisition of Wiz, which is crucial for Google Cloud. The week ahead will also see the release of the U.S. Consumer Price Index for December 2025, which could impact interest rate expectations and high-multiple tech stocks like GOOG.

title: The Truth About Alphabet Inc. (Class C): Is This Tech Giant Still Worth Your Money?
summary: This article examines whether Alphabet Inc. (Class C) remains a worthwhile investment despite market volatility and increasing competition, particularly in the AI space. It delves into the company's business fundamentals, its significant bets on AI with Gemini, the enduring power of its advertising platform, and its valuation relative to its potential. The piece concludes with a "cop or drop" verdict, suggesting it's a solid long-term anchor for those who believe in tech dominance but not for short-term traders.

title: Deltec Asset Management LLC Sells 51,170 Shares of Marvell Technology, Inc. $MRVL
summary: Deltec Asset Management LLC reduced its stake in Marvell Technology (NASDAQ:MRVL) by 56.7% in Q3, selling 51,170 shares and now holding 39,015 shares valued at $3.28 million. Marvell reported strong Q3 results, beating EPS and revenue estimates, and announced a $5.0 billion share repurchase program and a quarterly dividend. The company also acquired XConn to boost its AI data center interconnect capabilities, leading to positive analyst sentiment despite some insider selling and valuation debates.

title: TJX Companies Inc.: How an Off-Price Retail Engine Became a Data-Driven Product Powerhouse
summary: TJX Companies Inc. has evolved its off-price retail model into a sophisticated, data-driven "product" that competes effectively with Amazon and traditional department stores. The company leverages a flexible supply chain, sophisticated data insights, and a "treasure-hunt" customer experience across multiple banners to offer branded goods at significant discounts. This strategy has made TJX a resilient and structurally growing force in the retail sector, outperforming many competitors and providing a strong investment case.

title: Oregon Public Employees Retirement Fund Acquires 28,146 Shares of Exelon Corporation $EXC
summary: The Oregon Public Employees Retirement Fund increased its stake in Exelon Corporation by 32.2%, acquiring an additional 28,146 shares, bringing their total holdings to 115,447 shares valued at $5.20 million. This move is part of a broader trend of institutional investors significantly increasing their positions in Exelon, with institutional ownership now standing at approximately 80.92%. The article also discusses recent analyst ratings, earnings estimates, and stock performance data for Exelon.

title: Oregon Public Employees Retirement Fund Increases Stock Position in Electronic Arts Inc. $EA
summary: The Oregon Public Employees Retirement Fund has increased its stake in Electronic Arts Inc. (NASDAQ:EA) by 30.7%, acquiring an additional 6,033 shares to hold a total of 25,692 shares valued at approximately $5.18 million. Despite this increase in institutional holdings, EA recently missed quarterly earnings expectations and saw its revenue decline year-over-year. The company's stock trades near its 52-week high, while analysts maintain a consensus "Hold" rating with an average price target of $181.21.

title: 12 Best Software Infrastructure Stocks to Buy According to Hedge Funds
summary: This article identifies Synopsys Inc. (NASDAQ:SNPS) as one of the best software infrastructure stocks favored by hedge funds. Analyst Gary Mobley reiterated a Buy rating and increased the price target to $600, citing potential benefits from a broad-based rally in 2026, growth in automotive and industrial semiconductors, and a strategic partnership with Nvidia. The company is expected to gain from an "AI-enhanced" Electronic Design Automation (EDA) market.

title: Amazon stock: Walmart-style mega-store plan near Chicago puts AMZN back in retail focus
summary: Amazon's stock saw a slight increase after reports emerged of its plan to open a large-format, Walmart-style store near Chicago, signaling its continued interest in physical retail to cut delivery costs and attract grocery shoppers. This move is significant as Amazon has had mixed success with smaller store formats, and a "one-stop" shop would place it in direct competition with Walmart. The article also touches upon Amazon Web Services' (AWS) leadership in sovereign cloud infrastructure and its plans to expand its AI-driven work assistant, alongside analyst opinions on Amazon's potential for AI-driven revenue growth and upcoming economic data influencing its stock.

title: Microsoft Corporation $MSFT Shares Acquired by 1900 Wealth Management LLC
summary: 1900 Wealth Management LLC significantly increased its stake in Microsoft (MSFT) by 26.8%, bringing its total holdings to 12,965 shares valued at $6.715 million, reflecting strong institutional confidence as over 71% of the company is now institutionally owned. Despite significant insider selling, Microsoft continues to attract investor interest, especially after beating earnings estimates with $4.13 EPS and $77.67 billion in revenue, and analysts maintaining a consensus "Moderate Buy" rating with a target price of approximately $630.11. The company also announced a quarterly dividend of $0.91 per share, further indicating its robust performance.

title: FengHe Fund Management Pte. Ltd. Lowers Position in Marvell Technology, Inc. $MRVL
summary: FengHe Fund Management Pte. Ltd. has reduced its stake in Marvell Technology, Inc. by 25.8% in Q3, now holding 500,600 shares valued at $42.1 million. Despite this, Marvell Technology makes up 3.8% of FengHe's portfolio and is its 8th largest holding. The company recently announced strong Q3 results, a $5 billion share buyback program, and a $0.06 quarterly dividend, leading analysts to maintain a "Moderate Buy" rating with an average target price of $116.03.

title: Verisign Inc.: The Quiet Giant Powering the Internet’s Front Door
summary: Verisign Inc. plays a critical, behind-the-scenes role in the internet by operating the core naming infrastructure, including the .com and .net top-level domains and essential DNS services. The company distinguishes itself through its focus on reliability, security, and stability rather than rapid feature development, catering to enterprises that prioritize guaranteed uptime. Its unique position as the exclusive .com registry, coupled with its engineering conservatism and cloud-neutral stance, creates a highly defensible business model with predictable recurring revenues, making its stock a proxy for the internet's naming system's stability.

title: Applied Optoelectronics' David Kuo Sells 12,500 Shares for $501,875
summary: David Kuo, Chief Legal Officer of Applied Optoelectronics, sold 12,500 shares for $501,875 on December 23, 2025, reducing his direct holdings by 8.71%. This sale occurred as the company reached a 52-week high after a strong Q3 revenue increase. Despite robust demand and promising forecasts, the company faces a net loss, prompting caution among investors regarding its elevated price-to-sales ratio.

title: Citizens Downgrades Life360 (LIF) to Market Perform Citing Skepticism Over 2026 Growth Catalysts
summary: Citizens downgraded Life360 (LIF) to Market Perform from Outperform due to skepticism over its 2026 growth catalysts, following a deceleration in its core expansion and difficult year-over-year comparisons. Despite the downgrade, Life360 recently completed its $120 million acquisition of Nativo and surpassed 50 million Monthly Active Users in the US. Earlier, DA Davidson initiated coverage with a Buy rating, anticipating international growth and higher-margin revenue streams from new features like pet GPS subscriptions.

title: Is Fidelity’s Sleepy ETF Actually Easy Money In 2026?
summary: The Fidelity MSCI Consumer Discretionary Index ETF (FDIS) is a concentrated fund with 39% of its assets in Amazon and Tesla, currently underperforming the broader market. Its 2026 performance relies heavily on sustained consumer spending growth (forecasted at 2%) and Tesla's ability to halt its significant earnings decline. Investors seeking similar exposure with less single-stock risk might consider the Vanguard Consumer Discretionary ETF (VCR).

title: Whirlpool Corp.: How a 113-Year-Old Appliance Giant Is Rebooting the Smart Home
summary: Whirlpool Corp. is transforming its appliance business into a connected ecosystem, integrating AI-driven and energy-efficient technologies into its stoves, fridges, and washers. The company is focusing on connectivity, sustainability, and user experience to compete in the smart home market against rivals like Samsung, LG, and Haier. By leveraging its established brands and focusing on reliability and software-extendable hardware, Whirlpool aims to be a leading player in the evolving smart home landscape.

title: HP Inc shares fall as company says it will cut up to 6,000 employees

summary: Vistra Corp has acquired two more natural gas power plants in Pennsylvania, and Facebook/Meta secured a 20-year power purchase agreement for supply from nuclear plants, including Beaver Valley. These deals are part of a trend where existing Pennsylvania power plants are being dedicated to supplying energy for AI data centers, raising concerns among consumer advocates about potential electricity price increases for regular ratepayers and grid reliability issues. Currently, power from 18 Pennsylvania power plants is allocated to AI data centers, impacting a mix of natural gas, nuclear, hydroelectric, and coal waste-fired facilities.

The development on a 35-acre site at 159th Street and LaGrange Road was approved by the Orland Park Plan Commission and awaits a final vote from the village board on January 19. If approved, the store is expected to generate sales tax revenue for the area, supporting municipal services and improvements.

Autonomous on-road testing has already begun in the San Francisco Bay Area, with plans for a service launch later this year, leveraging Lucid’s vehicle architecture, Nuro’s Level 4 autonomy, and Uber’s extensive network.

This decision comes despite lobbying from European telecom operators and aims to boost investment in broadband infrastructure.

title: Wegovy em pílula chega à Amazon — e em breve às vending machines

The medication will also be available in One Medical's automated kiosks in the coming weeks, further increasing its accessibility.

title: Alibaba logistics unit Cainiao opens US-Mexico cross-border service

This service aims to reduce costs for parcel delivery in one of the region's highest-traffic corridors, with Cainiao controlling key logistical nodes including sorting, line-haul transfer, and last-mile delivery using its own local networks. The company expects to cover 99% of the Mexican market and offer prices approximately 60% lower than the current market average.

title: Netflix’s competition isn’t sleep anymore. Its battle against YouTube is like fighting an ‘infinite number of monkeys,’ top strategist says
summary: A top strategist specializing in media, Doug Shapiro, suggests that Netflix's potential acquisition of Warner Bros. indicates a strategic shift away from competing with "sleep" to combating the immense volume of user-generated content on platforms like YouTube, which he describes as fighting an "infinite number of monkeys." Shapiro argues that traditional media companies can no longer win the "time game" against social platforms that "hack our biology" with dopamine loops and that Netflix's deal for Warner's IP is a defensive move to create a "fortress" in an age of infinite content. He outlines three reasons IP is crucial: as a filter against overwhelming choice, as a moat because new IP is difficult to create, and as a platform to monetize fandom in a service-oriented media landscape.

authors: Allie Grace Garnett, The Editors of Encyclopaedia Britannica

title: How to still get up to $51 from the Amazon Prime settlement in 2025

The FTC warns against scammers impersonating the agency or Amazon to obtain personal information or money.
