title: If You'd Invested $1,000 in the Invesco QQQ ETF 27 Years Ago, Here's How Much You'd Have Today
summary: The Invesco QQQ Trust ETF, launched in early 1999, has been a significant performer despite experiencing an over 80% drawdown during the early 2000s tech bubble. A $1,000 investment at its inception would now be worth approximately $14,190, representing a 1,340% total return. If invested at the market bottom in October 2002, the same amount would have grown by over 3,613%.

title: Doradla, Grid Dynamics CFO, sells $20k in shares By Investing.com
summary: Anil Doradla, the CFO of Grid Dynamics (NASDAQ:GDYN), sold 2,000 shares of the company's common stock for $20,000 on January 7, 2026, pursuant to a Rule 10b5-1 trading plan. After this transaction, Doradla still directly owns 376,475 shares. This news follows recent company developments including Q3 2025 financial results, a strategic collaboration with AWS for generative AI, and shareholder approval of an amendment to the company's Equity Incentive Plan.

title: 3 Reasons EBC is Risky and 1 Stock to Buy Instead
summary: This article evaluates Eastern Bankshares (EBC), highlighting three reasons for caution despite its recent outperformance against the S&P 500. The analysis points to a low net interest margin, projected shrinkage in tangible book value per share, and unimpressive historical return on equity as key concerns. The article concludes that while EBC's valuation is reasonable, its shaky fundamentals present too much downside risk, recommending investors look at other high-growth opportunities instead.

title: 1 Small-Cap Stock I'd Buy Before GLBE in 2026
summary: This article suggests AXT (AXTI) as a preferable small-cap stock over Global-E Online (GLBE) for 2026, primarily due to AXT's critical role in the AI infrastructure supply chain. AXT specializes in indium phosphide, a semiconductor material experiencing surging demand with over 250% sequential revenue growth in that segment. While GLBE faces intense competition and a high P/E ratio, AXT holds a significant market share in a crucial AI bottleneck, positioning it for substantial growth despite being a smaller and more volatile company.

title: GOOG stock rises after hours as Alphabet sets Feb. 4 earnings date; Wiz deal deadline in focus
summary: Alphabet's Class C shares (GOOG) rose 1.1% in after-hours trading as the company announced its Q4 and full-year 2025 earnings call for February 4th. Investors are closely watching Google's advertising growth, AI investments, and the EU's antitrust decision on Alphabet's proposed $32 billion acquisition of cybersecurity firm Wiz by February 10th. This period is expected to be volatile for the stock due to regulatory decisions and upcoming earnings.

title: Ford named No. 1 most iconic American company in nationwide survey: 'Making people's lives better'
summary: Ford Motor Company has been ranked as the No. 1 most iconic American company in a new nationwide survey by Time magazine and Statista, surpassing tech giants like Apple and Amazon. The recognition highlights Ford's historical impact on American culture and society through innovations like the assembly line and its current focus on American workers and making transportation more accessible. Executive Chair Bill Ford emphasized the company's commitment to "making people's lives better" through innovation.

title: Infosys partners with AWS to fast-track enterprise generative AI adoption
summary: Infosys has announced a partnership with AWS to accelerate the adoption of generative AI across various enterprises. This collaboration will integrate Infosys Topaz, an AI-first suite of services, with Amazon Q Developer to enhance Infosys' internal operations and drive innovation for customers in sectors like manufacturing, telecom, financial services, and consumer goods. The initiative aims to streamline core enterprise functions and develop advanced cross-industry solutions through AI-powered transformations.

title: Eizen, AN2 Therapeutics COO, sells $25k in ANTX stock
summary: Joshua M. Eizen, COO and Chief Legal Officer at AN2 Therapeutics (NASDAQ:ANTX), sold approximately $24,962 worth of ANTX stock on January 5 and 6, 2026. These sales, totaling 24,854 shares, were primarily conducted to cover tax withholding obligations from vested Restricted Stock Units. Despite a recent loss per share, the micro-cap biotech company, valued at $29.32 million, exhibits strong liquidity and is collaborating with GSK on tuberculosis therapies, supported by the Gates Foundation.

title: IBM Finalizes $11 Billion Confluent Acquisition, Cementing Dominance in the "Data-in-Motion" Era
summary: IBM has completed its $11 billion all-cash acquisition of Confluent, Inc., a pioneer in data streaming, integrating it into its hybrid cloud and AI portfolio. This deal strengthens IBM's position in real-time data processing, crucial for AI agents, and creates a "Trifecta" of hybrid cloud infrastructure when combined with previous acquisitions of Red Hat and HashiCorp. The acquisition is a strategic move to dominate the "data-in-motion" era, with IBM expecting significant software revenue growth and the deal also signals a shift in regulatory priorities towards fostering AI innovation.

title: AWS clears OCC security review as BMO raises Amazon (AMZN) PT to $304
summary: Amazon's cloud computing division, AWS, has successfully completed a security review by the Options Clearing Corporation (OCC), enabling financial institutions to use its cloud services more broadly. This development follows similar approvals from FINRA, signaling growing adoption of AWS in the financial sector. Concurrently, BMO Capital Markets has increased its price target for Amazon shares to $304, citing the company's strong AWS growth and other positive business trends.

title: Legendary grocery chain starts to close 60 stores after abandoning $24.6b merger
summary: Kroger, a major grocery chain, is set to close approximately 60 underperforming stores over 18 months, with closures potentially continuing into December 2026. This decision follows the abandonment of a $24.6 billion merger deal with Albertsons in late 2024, which was blocked by a judge due to concerns about consumer benefits and competition. Kroger plans to reallocate resources to stronger-performing stores and will offer affected employees other roles within the company.

title: Holiday season e-commerce sales hit $258 billion: Adobe
summary: Online shoppers spent a record $257.8 billion during the holiday season (November 1 - December 31), marking a 6.8% increase year-over-year according to Adobe Analytics. Black Friday's online spending growth surpassed Cyber Monday's, though Cyber Monday remained the largest single e-commerce day. Electronics, apparel, furniture, and cosmetics saw significant increases, with smartphone transactions accounting for over 56% of online spend.

title: Perella Weinberg, WEX, and Donnelley Financial Solutions Stocks Trade Up, What You Need To Know
summary: Perella Weinberg (PWP), WEX (WEX), and Donnelley Financial Solutions (DFIN) saw their stocks rise as investors reallocated capital from high-growth tech firms to sectors with more stable valuations. This shift was supported by a Goldman Sachs forecast predicting 2.6% U.S. economic growth in 2026 due to anticipated tax cuts and easier financial conditions. Donnelley Financial Solutions, in particular, gained 3.3%, reflecting a significant market response despite its typically low volatility.

title: AWS Clears OCC Security Review as BMO Raises Amazon (AMZN) PT to $304
summary: Amazon Web Services (AWS) successfully completed a comprehensive security assessment by the Options Clearing Corporation (OCC), affirming its cloud security controls align with regulatory requirements. Concurrently, BMO Capital raised its price target for Amazon (AMZN) to $304 from $300, maintaining an "Outperform" rating, following positive insights into AWS's growth trajectory which led to an increased Q1 2026 growth forecast for AWS to 24%. Amazon is highlighted as a key player in e-commerce and cloud computing, offering significant AI capabilities through AWS.

title: Angi (ANGI) and the AI Pivot: Can 12% Workforce Cuts Unlock Long-Term Value?
summary: Angi Inc. (ANGI) is undergoing a significant strategic shift, cutting 12% of its workforce due to AI-driven efficiency gains. This move aims to pivot Angi towards an AI-first operating model, prioritizing profitability and a leaner structure after its full spin-off from IAC Inc. Investors are watching to see if these cost-cutting measures, coupled with new AI innovations like AI Helper and Smart Matching, will lead to long-term value and a return to top-line growth.

title: Should You Hold Oracle Stock Despite Debt-Fueled AI Data Center Bet?
summary: Oracle is significantly expanding its cloud infrastructure to capitalize on the AI revolution, with second-quarter fiscal 2026 revenues growing 14% year over year and cloud infrastructure revenues climbing 68%. This aggressive expansion, however, necessitates substantial capital investments, increasing fiscal 2026 guidance to $50 billion and resulting in negative free cash flow in the short term. Despite the financial pressure, the company has secured major commitments and is pursuing a multicloud strategy, positioning itself as a key player in next-generation AI applications, though investors are advised to exercise patience given the high investment phase.

title: Graniteshares YieldBOOST AMZN ETF 宣佈每股 $0.1914 分紅，投資者注意！

title: Adobe’s new AI tools aim to speed up ads on TikTok, Amazon and more
summary: Adobe has announced significant expansions to its GenStudio and Firefly enterprise capabilities, introducing new AI tools like Firefly Design Intelligence, Firefly Creative Production for Enterprise, and Firefly Foundry. These innovations aim to streamline and scale the creation of on-brand, personalized content and advertising. Additionally, Adobe has integrated with major advertising platforms such as Amazon Ads, Innovid, Google Marketing Platform, LinkedIn, and TikTok to enable direct activation and optimization of display and video ad campaigns, empowering businesses to enhance their content supply chains with AI.

title: Vanguard Total Stock Market ETF (VTI) Daily Snapshot—1/8/25
summary: This article provides a daily snapshot of the Vanguard Total Stock Market ETF (VTI) as of January 8, 2025. The report also highlights VTI's top holdings, its "Moderate Buy" analyst consensus, average price target, and stocks within its portfolio with the highest upside and downside potential.

title: Is Instacart’s New Data Hub Reshaping The Investment Case For Maplebear (CART)?
summary: Instacart's parent company, Maplebear (CART), unveiled Data Hub at CES 2026, a clean room solution allowing CPG brands to securely combine their data with Instacart's grocery purchase signals for marketing and performance measurement. This move strengthens Maplebear's position as a retail media and data partner, enhancing its investment narrative by focusing on higher-value analytics and non-transactional revenues. While Data Hub broadens the company's story, investors should still consider the impact of CPG ad budgets and evolving privacy rules on its high-margin advertising business.

title: $2.5B Amazon settlement — here’s which customers qualify
summary: Amazon has agreed to a $2.5 billion settlement following allegations by the Federal Trade Commission (FTC) that it used deceptive methods to enroll customers in Prime subscriptions without consent. Eligible consumers in the Automatic Payment Group, who used three or fewer Prime benefits, will receive payments automatically, while those in the Claim Process Payment Group, who used more benefits, can file claims starting January 5, 2026. The settlement includes $1.5 billion in refunds and a $1 billion civil penalty, with individual payouts up to $51.

title: Amazon AI tool blindsides merchants by offering products without their knowledge
summary: Amazon's experimental AI tool has been automatically creating product listings for independent retailers without their consent, leading to customer confusion and fulfillment issues. Merchants reported incorrect product displays, copyright concerns, and a lack of notification, despite Amazon claiming the programs receive positive feedback and sellers can opt out. This aggressive approach by Amazon has caused frustration among small business owners who deliberately avoided selling on the platform.

title: Western Europe Colocation Data Center Portfolio Analysis Report 2025: AWS, Microsoft, Google Scale AI Campuses as Digital Realty, Equinix, NTT, Data4, and Vantage Lead by Capacity - Forecast to 2029 - ResearchAndMarkets.com
summary: This report from ResearchAndMarkets.com analyzes the colocation data center market in Western Europe, highlighting its current status with over 1,025 existing facilities and projections up to 2029. Key players like Digital Realty, Equinix, and Vantage Data Centers lead in capacity, while hyperscalers such as AWS, Microsoft, and Google are expanding to support AI workloads. The report provides detailed insights into existing and upcoming data centers, covering capacity, pricing, and infrastructure investments across various Western European countries.

title: Exploring Analyst Estimates for JPMorgan Chase & Co. (JPM) Q4 Earnings, Beyond Revenue and EPS
summary: Analysts expect JPMorgan Chase & Co. (JPM) to report Q4 earnings of $5.01 per share on $45.71 billion in revenue, representing year-over-year increases. The stock has seen a 5.4% increase in the past month and holds a Zacks Rank #3 (Hold).

title: Wix.com Mandates 5-Day Office Week for Israel, Poland, Lithuania Staff
summary: Wix.com has announced a mandatory five-day office workweek for employees in Israel, Poland, and Lithuania, aiming to boost collaboration, while its U.S. staff will retain hybrid flexibility. This decision, which starts in March 2026 for the affected regions, highlights the tech industry's ongoing debate between fostering in-person interaction and accommodating employee preferences for work-life balance. The company's nuanced approach reflects regional differences in labor markets and cultural expectations, with potential implications for talent retention and future office policies.

title: Is Alibaba Group Holding (NYSE:BABA) Still Attractive After A 78.3% One-Year Share Price Rally?
summary: Alibaba Group Holding (NYSE:BABA) has seen a significant 78.3% share price rally over the past year. The article also explores contrasting "Bull Case" and "Bear Case" narratives for Alibaba, reflecting different perspectives on its future growth, profitability, and market risks.

summary: During CNBC's Halftime Report Final Trades, investment experts highlighted their top stock selections. title: Amazon in the Open
summary: Amazon has confirmed its identity as the purchaser of an 85-acre parcel near the Eugene Airport for a controversial parcel-delivery warehouse, after previously concealing its involvement. The article also provides an update on Arcimoto, an electric-vehicle maker based in Eugene, detailing its financial struggles including nearly $600,000 in unpaid taxes and penalties, and its cessation of vehicle manufacturing. Public opposition to the Amazon facility continues due to concerns about traffic, pollution, wetlands, and the company's labor practices.

title: ALT5 Sigma Corp. Reports Company Record Annual Transaction Volume of $3.4 Billion in 2025
summary: ALT5 Sigma Corporation announced a record transaction volume of $3.4 billion in 2025, marking a 55% increase over the previous year and nearly $8 billion in cumulative volume since 2021. authors: ALT5 Sigma Corporation via Business Wire

title: The Truth About Amazon.com Inc.: Is This Stock Still Worth the Hype or Is Peak Amazon Over?
summary: This article analyzes whether Amazon.com Inc. (AMZN) stock is still a worthwhile investment, given its current valuation and market presence. It delves into Amazon's various business segments, including e-commerce, Amazon Web Services (AWS), and emerging revenue streams like advertising and AI, comparing them against competitors. The article concludes that while the stock trades at a premium, its diverse ecosystem and long-term growth engines make it a "cop" for long-term investors, rather than a quick "moonshot" trade.

title: Where Is ServiceNow (NOW) Headed According to the Street?
summary: ServiceNow (NYSE: NOW) is considered a strong buy, with Canaccord Genuity reaffirming a Buy rating and a $224 price target. Recent acquisitions of Armis for cyber exposure management and Moveworks for AI-powered intuitiveness and workflow automation are expected to strengthen ServiceNow's security and AI offerings. While NOW shows growth potential, the article suggests other AI stocks might offer greater returns with limited downside risk.

title: Defiance’s XMAG ETF, the First ETF Offering Exposure to the
summary: Defiance ETFs announced that its Defiance Large Cap Ex-Magnificent Seven ETF (XMAG) has surpassed $100 million in assets under management since its launch in October 2024. XMAG provides exposure to the S&P 500 while excluding the "Magnificent Seven" tech companies, addressing concerns about concentration risk in traditional market-capitalization-weighted benchmarks. The fund aims to offer investors a diversified large-cap U.S. equity solution without overexposure to a few mega-cap stocks.

title: Perella Weinberg, WEX, and Donnelley Financial Solutions Shares Rise, Key Information to Be Aware Of
summary: Shares of Perella Weinberg (PWP), WEX (WEX), and Donnelley Financial Solutions (DFIN) saw notable gains as investors shifted funds from technology stocks to sectors with more appealing valuations. Donnelley Financial Solutions, in particular, has shown low volatility and significant year-to-date gains, with predictions for enterprise software integrating generative AI to become the next industry giants.

title: Copper in the Age of AI: Challenges of Electrification
summary: This S&P Global report analyzes the increasing global demand for copper, driven by electrification, AI, data centers, electric vehicles, and defense modernization, projecting a 50% surge to 42 million metric tons by 2040. It highlights a potential 10 million metric ton supply shortfall unless significant investments are made in mining, processing, and recycling. The study also addresses the challenges of meeting this demand, including declining ore grades, long development timelines, rising costs, and geopolitical complexities in the supply chain.
authors: Daniel Yergin, Ph.D., Carlos Pascual, Eleonor Kramarz, Aurian De La Noue, Miguel Acosta, Gray Bender, Mohsen Bonakdarpour, Tabitha Bailey, Keerti Rajan

title: Analysts Identify Multiple Catalysts for Amazon.com (AMZN) in 2026
summary: Evercore ISI has named Amazon.com (AMZN) as its top large-cap Internet pick for 2026, citing strong momentum in Amazon Web Services (AWS) which saw 20% year-over-year growth in Q3. Analyst Mark Mahaney highlighted the positive artificial intelligence narrative surrounding AWS and identified other potential catalysts for Amazon in 2026, including Trainium chips, Alexa+ engagement, grocery business, Amazon Pharmacy, Amazon Leo, Zoox’s robotaxi service, and a renewed focus on Amazon for Business. The company, however, paused its commercial drone delivery plans in Italy due to regulatory challenges.

title: Etsy Inc.: The Handmade Marketplace Turning Algorithms Into Artisans’ Income
summary: Etsy Inc. has evolved from a simple craft site into a sophisticated, data-driven global marketplace for unique and vintage goods, strategically positioned between large e-commerce sites like Amazon and social discovery platforms like Instagram. The article details Etsy's core product features, including its discovery engine, customization capabilities, seller tools, and trust infrastructure, highlighting how these elements cater specifically to handmade and vintage items. It also compares Etsy to rivals like Amazon Handmade, eBay, and Shopify, emphasizing Etsy's unique competitive advantages in brand identity, algorithm design, global reach for micro-brands, and its focus on non-commoditized products, which underpins its stock valuation.

title: HP's All-in-One Plan Leases You a Printer and Unlimited Ink for a Low Monthly Price
summary: HP's All-in-One Plan offers a convenient way to get a printer and unlimited ink for a low monthly fee, eliminating upfront costs and the hassle of buying cartridges. The plan includes continuous warranty coverage and various tiers depending on print volume and printer model, with the "High-Volume" plan for the HP Smart Tank 7602 being highlighted as the best value. While it provides convenience and avoids instant high costs, the article suggests that buying a printer outright might be more cost-effective for those who can afford the initial investment and plan to keep the printer for an extended period.

title: The Truth About Cisco Systems Inc: Why Everyone Is Suddenly Paying Attention
summary: This article analyzes Cisco Systems Inc. (CSCO), questioning if the networking giant is a "quiet must-have" or a "boomer tech trap." It explores Cisco's market position, product power in infrastructure and cybersecurity, financial health including dividends, and its competition against broader tech trends like AI, concluding that it's a stable, dividend-paying tech backbone for long-term investors rather than a high-volatility, quick-gain stock.

title: History of Costco: Company timeline and facts
summary: Costco, a pioneer in the members-only warehouse club model, originated from the 1993 merger of Price Club and Costco. With strategic leadership transitions and global expansion, Costco has grown significantly, aiming for continued growth with new store openings and increased employee pay.

title: MOES: The Top Rated Tuya Smart Switch Designer Driving Innovation in the Smart Home Industry
summary: MOES, founded in 2008 and based in Wenzhou, China, is highlighted as a top-rated Tuya Smart Switch Designer, specializing in both solar energy products and smart home solutions. The company is recognized for its technical excellence, particularly with the Zigbee 3.0 protocol in its Star Ring Series of smart switches, offering advanced features and global compatibility. MOES emphasizes sustainable integration, aligning with global standards and contributing to energy efficient smart living environments.

title: Who Are the Long-Term Winners of AI?
summary: This article discusses the long-term winners of AI, moving beyond the initial productivity gains to focus on companies that can truly capture lasting value. It argues that market power, the ability to capitalize on unmet demand, and careful selection of sectors will be crucial for sustained profitability from AI. The article highlights that while AI lowers costs, competitive dynamics can erode profits unless companies have strong market positions or can unlock new markets through reduced prices.

title: WisdomTree’s ho-hum ETF Has Been A Huge Winner For Retirees

The company's strategic pivot into cloud infrastructure for AI and its established database stronghold position it as a powerful, albeit understated, player in the tech landscape, attracting serious investors with its predictable earnings and consistent growth. While not a "viral rocket," Oracle is seen as a solid long-term investment, especially for those seeking steady cash generation rather than meme-stock volatility.

title: Roundhill’s AI ETF Rips 45% Higher As The AI Buildout Continues In 2026
summary: The Roundhill Generative AI & Technology ETF (CHAT) saw a significant 45% gain in 2025, outperforming major market indices. Its 2026 performance is tied to massive capital expenditures by hyperscalers on AI infrastructure, with consensus estimates for 2026 capex now at $527 billion. The fund's concentrated holdings in hyperscalers and semiconductor companies indicate a strong link between AI infrastructure spending and its future trajectory, though it also carries concentration risk.

title: Bourgeon Capital Management LLC Raises Holdings in Marvell Technology, Inc. $MRVL
summary: Bourgeon Capital Management LLC has increased its stake in Marvell Technology, Inc. (NASDAQ:MRVL) by 8.1%, now owning 181,661 shares valued at over $15 million, making it their 7th largest holding. Other institutional investors have also adjusted their positions in the semiconductor company.

title: Top Research Reports for Amazon.com, Palantir & TotalEnergies
summary: This article summarizes Zacks Research Daily reports on 16 major stocks, focusing on Amazon.com, Palantir, and TotalEnergies, along with micro-cap MIND Technology. It details their recent performance, analyst insights, and key factors influencing their outlook. The reports cover growth drivers, financial health, competitive landscapes, and future prospects for each company.

title: 3 Consumer Stocks Set for a Comeback in 2026
summary: This article identifies three consumer stocks – Target (TGT), Sea Limited (SE), and The Trade Desk (TTD) – that are poised for a comeback in 2026 after facing challenges in previous years. It highlights their current valuations, growth prospects, and specific reasons why they present buying opportunities for investors.

title: Why data is the single most important asset for companies of the future
summary: Data is becoming the most crucial asset for future companies, requiring a shift in mindset from viewing it as a commodity to a prioritized business asset. Companies need to integrate internal and external data to gain comprehensive "outsights," moving away from siloed approaches to a unified data analytics ecosystem. This transformation, ideally leveraging modern cloud platforms like Teradata Vantage, will drive growth, agility, and competitive advantage by enabling informed decisions across the organization.

title: Alphabet Stock Balances AI Euphoria With Valuation Jitters as Wall Street Stays Overwhelmingly Bullish
summary: Alphabet Inc Class A (GOOGL) is experiencing investor jitters surrounding its valuation despite strong performance driven by AI advancements, leading to a recent consolidation phase. Wall Street analysts remain largely bullish, reiterating "Buy" ratings and emphasizing Alphabet's long-term potential in AI, cloud services, and search monetization. The stock's future performance hinges on its ability to translate AI investments into visible revenue and profit uplift, manage operating expenses, and navigate regulatory challenges effectively.

title: Navitas Semiconductor (NVTS) Jumps 17% After One-Month Low
summary: Navitas Semiconductor (NVTS) saw its stock jump 17.37% after reaching a one-month low, closing at $8.38 per share due to investor bargain-hunting and general optimism regarding the AI industry. The company, which develops gallium nitride semiconductors, had a challenging quarter, widening its net loss to $19.2 million and seeing revenues drop, as it strategically shifts focus to higher power revenues. This rally comes despite previous financial setbacks and a strategic pivot in its business model.

title: Netflix stock slides to start 2026 as Warner deal drama and earnings loom
summary: Netflix shares fell 2.97% amidst investor uncertainty regarding its planned acquisition of Warner Bros. Discovery's studio and streaming assets. The deal, valued at $82.7 billion and expected to close in 12 to 18 months, is being scrutinized for potential regulatory and execution risks, despite Netflix's commitment to traditional theatrical releases for Warner films. The company also looks forward to its Q4 earnings report on January 20, with live events like NFL games showing strong viewer engagement.

title: Amazon Unveiled
summary: Amazon has finally confirmed its identity as the purchaser of an 85-acre parcel near the Eugene Airport for a controversial 320,000-square-foot parcel-delivery warehouse. The company, which had meticulously hidden its involvement for over a year, bought the land for $2 million on December 26. Despite public opposition concerning traffic, pollution, and wetland filling, local officials state they are powerless to stop the project given its industrial zone classification.

title: Discovering Newegg Inc.: The Ultimate Destination For Tech Enthusiasts-
summary: Newegg Inc. is a leading online retailer founded in 2001, specializing in computer hardware, consumer electronics, and other tech products. It stands out due to its wide product range, competitive pricing, strong community engagement, and customer-centric approach, making it a go-to platform for tech enthusiasts. The company plans to expand product lines, enhance customer experience, and pursue global expansion.

title: Walmart stock rises 1.2% to start 2026 — what investors are watching next for WMT
summary: Walmart shares closed up 1.21% on the first trading day of 2026, with investors now focused on upcoming U.S. jobs data and Walmart's late-February earnings report. The stock's performance is seen as a gauge of value-focused U.S. consumer demand, particularly concerning staple essentials and lower prices amidst shifting economic expectations. Analysts anticipate Walmart to report earnings of 72 cents a share on approximately $190.16 billion in revenue for the quarter.

title: Palmetto Grain Brokerage - This Under-the-Radar AI Company Could Be the Best Stock You Buy in 2026.
summary: Quanta Services (PWR) is presented as an "under-the-radar" infrastructure services provider poised to benefit from the AI boom. The company shows steady financial growth, strategic partnerships with energy providers like AEP for data center expansion, and a robust skilled labor force. Analysts currently rate PWR stock as a "Moderate Buy" with significant upside potential.

title: Oracle stock ticks higher after hours as 2026 trading begins; ORCL dividend date and jobs data in focus
summary: Oracle (ORCL) shares rose 0.4% in after-hours trading as 2026 market activity commenced, following a mixed start to the year for the broader market. Investors are focusing on Oracle's January 9th dividend record date and upcoming mid-March earnings, with the company's AI-driven cloud business remaining a key driver. Macro data, including January 9th U.S. jobs data, will also be critical in shaping market expectations for rate cuts and their impact on growth stocks.

title: Target, Walmart, Whole Foods Targeted in Botulism Suits
summary: Target, Walmart, and Whole Foods are being added as defendants in lawsuits against baby formula maker ByHeart due to a product potentially contaminated with botulism spores. Prominent foodborne-illness attorney Bill Marler is suing ByHeart on behalf of families whose babies were hospitalized and plans to include the grocery chains, stating they need to "step up—morally and legally—to help these families" as ByHeart may face insolvency. The FDA previously issued warnings to Target and Walmart for failing to remove recalled ByHeart formula from shelves.

title: eBay Inc. in 2026: Can the Original Online Marketplace Still Rewrite E?Commerce?
summary: eBay Inc. is focusing on high-intent buyers, collectibles, and AI-driven experiences to differentiate itself in the crowded e-commerce market of 2026. The company emphasizes its unique position as a marketplace for long-tail, rare, and high-value items, leveraging AI and trust infrastructure instead of an Amazon-style logistics model. This strategy aims to drive monetization through increased take rates and retention in specialized enthusiast categories, which directly impacts its stock performance.

title: Microsoft Corporation (MSFT) Stock: Slides as Brazil Opens Antitrust Probe Into Cloud Services
summary: Brazil's antitrust authority has launched a formal investigation into Microsoft's cloud computing services, causing MSFT stock to slide. The probe, which focuses on potential abuse of dominant market position and illegal competition, adds to existing regulatory scrutiny globally. Despite this near-term uncertainty, Microsoft maintains strong financial fundamentals, including a robust balance sheet and profitable cloud and software revenues, but faces increasing regulatory pressure as cloud computing becomes essential infrastructure.

title: Marvell Technology (NASDAQ:MRVL) Trading 5.2% Higher - Here's What Happened
summary: Marvell Technology (NASDAQ:MRVL) shares rose 5.2% to $89.39 after the company beat quarterly earnings estimates, provided optimistic Q4 2026 EPS guidance, and announced a $5 billion share buyback program. Several analysts, including Roth, Wells Fargo, and Jefferies, raised their price targets for MRVL, contributing to a "Moderate Buy" consensus rating with an average price target of $111.25. The company also declared a quarterly dividend of $0.06 per share.

title: Where Did Edward Lampert Go Wrong with Sears?
summary: An article explores why Edward Lampert's bid to revive Sears failed, questioning whether it was due to his missteps or unfortunate timing. Lampert merged Kmart and Sears in 2005, aiming to capitalize on real estate and compete with Walmart, but sales declined, leading to asset sales and neglected stores, according to critics. Many commentators hold Lampert responsible for Sears' decline, citing financial engineering and a lack of retail investment, while others suggest Sears was already struggling before his involvement.

title: Form 424B2 BARCLAYS BANK PLC
summary: Barclays Bank PLC has filed an S-1 pricing supplement for $2,240,000 Phoenix AutoCallable Notes due January 5, 2029, linked to the least performing of two equity securities: Apple Inc. (AAPL) and Amazon.com, Inc. (AMZN). The notes offer contingent coupon payments and an automatic call feature but expose investors to potential principal loss if either underlying asset falls below its barrier value. Investors must consider the credit risk of Barclays Bank PLC and the potential exercise of U.K. Bail-in Power.

title: Cloud Spending and AI Workloads Push Western Digital (WDC) Higher
summary: Morgan Stanley analyst Erik Woodring has raised Western Digital's price target to $228 from $188, citing strong exposure to cloud capital spending, healthy end markets, and solid pricing power. The company's hard disk drive market is showing consistent demand, contributing to a 280% surge in its stock in 2025. Western Digital's focus on selling higher-capacity storage for data centers, especially for AI workloads, is driving revenue growth, which is projected to rise 23% in fiscal 2026.

title: This Amazon Competitor Is Starting To Flare Up Following A Muted 2025: Momentum Score Surges
summary: Etsy Inc. (NASDAQ: ETSY), a rival to Amazon.com Inc. (NASDAQ: AMZN), is showing renewed momentum after a subdued 2025, with its Momentum score increasing significantly. The stock, which had largely lagged peers, is seeing an upward trend, supported by a recently announced $750 million share repurchase program. This indicates a potential period of consolidation or indecision in the market following modest returns.

title: How Should Investors Approach FDX Stock in the New Year?
summary: Despite declining package volumes, FedEx (FDX) shares outperformed the Zacks Transportation—Air Freight and Cargo industry in 2025, driven by cost-cutting initiatives. While the company's Q2 fiscal 2026 results exceeded expectations and guidance was raised, FedEx is not considered an opportune buy due to ongoing challenges like tariffs and the upcoming spin-off of its freight unit with limited immediate impact or financial visibility. Investors are advised to track developments for a better entry point or remain invested if they already hold the stock.

title: News | Here are CoStar's top office stories of 2025
summary: The year 2025 saw a significant rebound in the office sector as companies across tech, legal, and finance sectors implemented stricter in-person office mandates, leading to a spike in leasing activity. This shift, combined with some office owners converting empty buildings for other uses, boosted demand and marked 2025 as a pivotal year for the office real estate market. Key stories include increased office space removal, major tower teardown considerations, federal lease cuts, and significant corporate relocations.

title: Regulatory Delays and Weakening Margins Weigh on Morgan Stanley’s ADM Outlook
summary: Morgan Stanley downgraded Archer-Daniels-Midland Company (NYSE: ADM) to Underweight, citing regulatory delays concerning the EPA’s renewable volume obligation extending into 2026 and weakening margins in ADM’s Carb Solutions unit. Despite a 15% rally in early 2025, the company's earnings momentum has faltered, leading to a lowered 2025 profit outlook amidst uncertainty in US biofuel policy and global trade disruptions. This has resulted in a significant 21% drop in its largest agricultural services and oilseed segment profit, with crushing profits falling 93%.

title: 3 Big Rebound Stocks for 2026
summary: After a challenging 2025 where many high-growth companies underperformed the S&P 500, select stocks are poised for a significant rebound in 2026. This article highlights Amazon (AMZN), The Trade Desk (TTD), and Salesforce (CRM) as prime candidates due to resetting valuations, identifiable catalysts, and strong underlying business fundamentals despite recent headwinds. Investors are encouraged to look for valuation-driven opportunities with asymmetric upside as the market sentiment shifts.

title: Amazon (AMZN) AWS AI momentum supports higher price target at BMO Capital
summary: BMO Capital has raised its price target for Amazon (AMZN) to $220, reflecting increased confidence in the company's AWS artificial intelligence division. The analyst notes significant momentum within AWS AI, citing strong demand for its services and strategic partnerships as key drivers for this revised outlook. This positive adjustment suggests a belief in Amazon's continued growth, particularly within its cloud computing and AI offerings.

title: Amazon stock today: AMZN slips as 2026 kicks off, with AI spending and Fed bets in focus
summary: Amazon shares (AMZN) fell 0.7% in early trading as investors consider the sustainability of the AI-led rally and reset expectations for Federal Reserve policy in 2026. The debate around the returns on AI infrastructure spending is intensifying, especially after reports of new cloud business models challenging established providers like Amazon. The next key catalyst for Amazon is its earnings update, expected in early February, where investors will scrutinize AWS growth and management's capital expenditure plans.

title: Taylor of Velocity Financial sells $61k in stock
summary: Jeffrey T. Taylor, Executive VP, Capital Markets at Velocity Financial, Inc. (NYSE:VEL), sold 3,049 shares of common stock for a total of $61,387 on December 31, 2025. title: A Shift in Focus: The iShares MSCI World ETF’s Growing Reliance on US Tech
summary: The iShares MSCI World ETF (URTH) is increasingly dominated by US technology stocks, with US equities now making up nearly 70% of its holdings and NVIDIA becoming its largest position. Despite its "World" designation, the fund primarily reflects the US market and developed countries, excluding emerging economies. This high concentration in US tech exposes URTH to specific sector risks and makes its performance significantly dependent on that market segment.

title: The Storage Supercycle: How Seagate Technology is Powering the AI Data Revolution
summary: Seagate Technology (STX) is a critical player in the AI data revolution, transitioning from a legacy hardware manufacturer to a gatekeeper of the AI era due to the massive storage needs generated by AI. The company, through its focus on "Mass Capacity" storage and HAMR technology, has seen its stock surge and is positioned for continued growth as AI infrastructure demands grow. Seagate's strategic shift to high-density drives for cloud providers and its technological lead are key factors in its current success and future prospects.

title: Bank of America unveils top 10 stock picks for Q1 2026 with diverse catalysts
summary: Bank of America has released its top 10 stock recommendations for Q1 2026, comprising nine Buy ratings and one Underperform across various industries. While AI remains a significant theme, the firm highlights other diverse catalysts for these picks, including healthcare legislation, commercial production rates, and tax refunds. InvestingPro data also shows strong performance for Dollar General, one of the recommended Buy stocks, with an impressive 80% return over the past year.

title: Amazon Downgraded to Hold Amid Valuation Concerns
summary: Amazon.com Inc. (AMZN) has been downgraded to Hold by Invictus Origin's Oliver Rodzianko, citing valuation concerns and macroeconomic risks despite the company's fundamental strength. Rodzianko believes that Amazon's future multiple is too high, especially considering the high costs associated with AI-related investments. He set a 12-month price target of $255 per share, below the current average, and suggested a shift to lower-beta assets.

title: Tech Titans Stumble: Amazon and Tesla Drags Market Lower to Open 2026
summary: Amazon and Tesla have caused a turbulent start to 2026 for investors, with their stock declines impacting the S&P 500 and Nasdaq Composite. Tesla's poor delivery numbers and market share erosion, alongside Amazon's AI investments and regulatory challenges, have prompted a shift in investor focus away from broad tech enthusiasm towards more fundamental evaluations. This divergence highlights increased market concentration risks and a potential "broadening out" of market leadership into other sectors like semiconductors and traditional retail.

title: Amazon Cuts 2,400 Washington Jobs for $100B AI Investment
summary: Amazon is cutting 2,400 jobs in Washington state as part of a strategic reallocation of resources towards a $100 billion investment in artificial intelligence over the next decade. This move aims to bolster Amazon's AI capabilities, particularly in AWS, to compete with rivals like Microsoft and Google, but raises concerns about job displacement and the humanitarian impact of technological advancement. The layoffs highlight a broader industry trend where tech giants are streamlining operations to fund ambitious AI initiatives.

title: Google stock’s best year since 2009 sets up a tougher 2026 test for Alphabet’s AI spending
summary: Alphabet (GOOGL) experienced its best annual stock performance since 2009 in 2025, driven by investor enthusiasm for its AI initiatives. However, Wall Street anticipates a sharp slowdown in 2026 earnings growth as increased capital spending on AI infrastructure puts pressure on Google Cloud to perform and the core search business to adapt. Despite rising investment costs, some investors remain bullish on Alphabet's long-term prospects.

title: Amazon (NASDAQ: AMZN) Stock Price Prediction in 2030: Bull, Bear, & Baseline Forecasts (Jan 2)
summary: This article provides bullish, bearish, and baseline forecasts for Amazon's (NASDAQ: AMZN) stock price in 2030, examining key drivers such as e-commerce success, Amazon Web Services (AWS), and advertising. The bull case predicts $431 per share based on strong growth in AWS, e-commerce profitability, and advertising revenue, while the bear case sees a decline to $77 due to cloud competition and unprofitable segments. The baseline forecast, drawing from Wall Street analyst projections, estimates Amazon's stock reaching $250 by 2030.

title: Ex-Google CEO Eric Schmidt jumps into the AI data center business with a failed Texas railroad
summary: Former Google CEO Eric Schmidt has launched Bolt Data & Energy, a startup focused on building AI data centers in West Texas. Partnering with Texas Pacific Land, Bolt aims to address the energy constraints of AI by leveraging TPL's extensive land, water resources, and access to natural gas, with future plans for renewable and nuclear energy. The venture seeks to provide a vertically integrated solution for hyperscalers' land, power, and water needs, aspiring to reach 10 gigawatts of power capacity.

title: Amazon (AMZN) AWS AI Momentum Supports Higher Price Target at BMO Capital
summary: BMO Capital raised its price target for Amazon (AMZN) to $304 from $300, maintaining an Outperform rating, due to accelerated cloud commitments and the growing enterprise AI market demonstrated by discussions with former AWS workers. Amazon also announced a significant $35 billion investment in India by 2030, focusing on AI-driven digitization and operational expansion. The analyst notes highlight AWS's strong position in the AI space, particularly with Claude as a development model.

title: FuelCell Energy (FCEL) Falls After Amending Open Market Sales Agreement
summary: FuelCell Energy (FCEL) experienced a 9.67% drop in share price between December 23 and December 30, 2025, following strong Q4 2025 results that beat estimates. The decline was attributed to an insider stock sale and, more significantly, an amendment to its open market sales agreement revealing plans to issue and sell an additional $200 million in common stock, leading to investor dilution.

title: Netflix stock falls nearly 2% as NFL streaming win meets fresh-year caution
summary: Netflix shares dropped about 1.9% on the first trading day of 2026 despite record viewership for its Christmas Day NFL broadcasts. Investors are cautious amid broader market uncertainties and await Netflix's Q4 2025 earnings report on January 20th to assess the profitability and impact of its ad-supported plan and live sports strategy. The stock's performance reflects a split focus between macro data and company-specific outlook as the year begins.

title: Cipher Mining (CIFR) stock edges up in premarket as bitcoin climbs near $89,000
summary: Cipher Mining (CIFR) stock rose 1.1% in premarket trading as Bitcoin climbed near $89,000, recovering from a volatile end to 2025. While the company's core business is Bitcoin mining, Cipher is also expanding into high-performance computing (HPC) with significant lease agreements for AI workloads to reduce reliance on Bitcoin's price fluctuations. Traders are closely watching Bitcoin's ability to hold the $90,000 level and Cipher's HPC project timelines and funding, which could quickly reprice the stock.

title: Permanent Capital Management LP Acquires Shares of 6,397 Alphabet Inc. $GOOG
summary: Permanent Capital Management LP initiated a new position in Alphabet Inc. (NASDAQ:GOOG) by purchasing 6,397 shares valued at approximately $1.56 million in the third quarter. title: 2 Top Stocks to Double Up on Right Now
summary: This article recommends Amazon (AMZN) and Philip Morris International (PM) as two growth stocks investors should consider adding to their portfolios. Philip Morris International is presented as a strong growth stock in a defensive industry, with robust performance from its smokeless products like Zyn and Iqos, and also noted for its attractive valuation.

title: IBM Gains 33% in a Year: Is it Worth Investing in the Stock Now?

Despite trading below the industry average in price/sales, it's above its mean, with analysts recommending a "Buy" based on its strong fundamentals and growth prospects.

title: Hepsiburada: Facing Competitors, Inflation And Currency Devaluation (NASDAQ:HEPS)
summary: Hepsiburada (HEPS) is struggling with intense competition from rivals like Trendyol and Amazon, along with severe macroeconomic challenges in Turkey, including high inflation and currency depreciation. The company's real revenue growth is minimal in USD terms, with declining active customers and average order values, and worsening gross margin and net income. Given these factors and significant operating losses, the article recommends a HOLD rating for HEPS.

title: Advanced Micro Devices (AMD) is Gaining on Several Fronts
summary: Alpha Wealth Funds' "Insiders Fund" highlighted Advanced Micro Devices (NASDAQ:AMD) in its Q3 2025 investor letter, noting AMD's transformation into a strong competitor in the AI and data center markets under CEO Lisa Su. The fund reported an impressive 21.37% YTD return, outperforming the S&P 500, with AMD shares gaining 77.53% over the last 52 weeks, closing at $214.16 on December 31, 2025. Despite significant insider sales following a stock surge, EVP Phillip Guido has held onto his May purchase of 8800 shares.

title: Strong Results Lifted BK Technologies Corp. (BKTI) in Q3
summary: Liberty Park Capital Management's Q3 2025 investor letter highlighted BK Technologies Corporation (BKTI) for exceeding expectations with its quarterly results and strong demand for its BKR9000 radio. Despite the positive outlook, Liberty Park Fund believes other AI stocks offer greater promise for higher returns in a shorter timeframe. BK Technologies Corporation's stock has seen significant gains, with a 13.10% one-month return and a 120.35% increase over the last 52 weeks.

title: Knowles Corp stock: quiet charts, cautious optimism and a market waiting for proof
summary: Knowles Corp stock is currently in a low-volume holding pattern, with its price drifting in a tight band despite broader market swings. While Wall Street maintains a cautiously constructive view with moderate price targets, the lack of immediate catalysts leaves the market waiting for proof of its strategic shift's success.

title: Grail Inc (GRAL) Climbs 380% on Strong Optimism for Cancer Detection Kit
summary: Grail Inc. (NASDAQ:GRAL) saw its stock price climb by 379.5% in 2025, driven by positive analyst ratings and strong confidence in its Galleri early cancer detection test kit. Grail Inc. plans to seek FDA pre-market approval for Galleri in Q1 2026.

The unionization effort contributes to a broader trend of logistics workers nationwide pushing for collective bargaining power and improved contracts.

title: InMode (NASDAQ:INMD) Shares Pass Above 200 Day Moving Average - Should You Sell?
summary: InMode (NASDAQ:INMD) saw its shares trade above its 200-day moving average, reaching $14.85 before settling at $14.69. title: Oracle (ORCL) stock ends 2025 lower as New Year holiday shuts U.S. markets — what’s next

The company's remaining performance obligations rose to $523 billion, while cloud revenue and cloud infrastructure revenue increased significantly.

title: Netflix stock in focus as record NFL Christmas streams land ahead of key earnings

The success of these broadcasts, which attracted tens of millions of viewers, highlights Netflix's push into live programming and advertising, crucial for subscriber engagement and revenue growth. Investors are keen to see if these new revenue drivers, especially advertising, are scaling effectively without eroding margins.

title: Arista Networks Deserves a Closer Look

Despite moderating revenue growth and a premium valuation, its entrenched position with Cloud Titans and strong balance sheet make it a compelling investment. The company benefits from a structural lag in AI infrastructure buildouts, reflected in its ballooning deferred revenue and significant backlog, and is well-positioned to capitalize on the industry's pivot from proprietary InfiniBand to open-standard Ethernet for AI clusters.

title: Ulta Beauty (ULTA): The 2026 Research Feature – A New Era of Global Expansion

Despite risks like the Target partnership exit and retail shrink, Ulta's strong loyalty program, focus on innovation, and robust financial performance position it as a compelling growth story for investors.

The company's Energy & Transportation segment, fueled by demand from hyperscale data center operators, became its primary growth engine, setting it apart from industrial peers facing agricultural recessions and construction slowdowns.

title: Goldman Sachs Downgrades Arm Holdings (ARM) Amid Limited AI Cycle Exposure and Non-Traditional Market Challenges

title: Alphabet Inc. $GOOGL is Marshall & Sullivan Inc. WA's 3rd Largest Position
summary: Marshall & Sullivan Inc. WA has reduced its stake in Alphabet Inc. (GOOGL) by 7.3%, making it the firm's third-largest holding despite the reduction. However, concerns about heavy AI capital expenditures and regulatory risks are also noted.

title: The Truth About JOYY Inc: Is This ‘Sleeper’ Stock About To Go Viral or Vanish?
summary: This article discusses JOYY Inc, a live-streaming social entertainment company, as a potential "sleeper" stock that could either go viral or vanish. The author concludes that JOYY is a high-risk, speculative play best suited for traders comfortable with volatility.

title: The "Harvest Year" Begins: Why Institutional Giants Are Betting Big on Texas Instruments for 2026

title: Sunrun director Fenster sells $655k in shares

The company emphasizes its new direction towards comprehensive, multi-layered security ecosystems for critical infrastructure, subject to shareholder and regulatory approvals.

title: Market Surge: POET Technologies Sees Promising Price Target

title: Nucor Corp Stock Live Price, Chart, Analysis, News & Forecast – Buy, Sell & Trade US Equities Today

title: Elizabeth Warren Warns Amazon And Meta Could Be Passing AI Data Center Costs Onto Consumers: 'You Could Be Bankrolling The Electricity Costs'
summary: Senator Elizabeth Warren has raised concerns that tech giants like Amazon and Meta might be shifting the electricity costs of their AI data centers to consumers. Her office, along with other senators, has sent letters to several tech companies, including Amazon, Meta, Alphabet (Google), and Microsoft, requesting details on their energy consumption and utility contracts, with responses due by January 12. This inquiry stems from worries that the surging energy demands of AI data centers are leading to higher electricity rates for ordinary households, as utilities pass on grid upgrade costs.

summary: Ocugen's CEO recently presented at a rare disease summit, focusing on the company's gene and cell therapy pipeline, which could influence its investment narrative and risk profile. The article also touches on Ocugen's revenue and earnings forecasts, limited cash runway, and a wide range of fair value estimates from the Simply Wall St Community.

title: Gartner debuts 4PL Magic Quadrant as tariffs and disruption reshape logistics
summary: Gartner has released its inaugural Magic Quadrant for Fourth-Party Logistics (4PL), highlighting how orchestration, accountability, and integration are transforming supply chain management amidst persistent disruption from tariffs and geopolitics. Robinson, RXO, GEODIS, Arvato, Kuehne+Nagel, 4flow, and DHL Supply Chain as leaders, while also identifying Challengers like Unilog and Visionaries such as Redwood Logistics. This leadership change aims to strengthen operational execution in Humana's Medicare Advantage segment amidst rising medical costs and efforts to improve star ratings.

This move highlights BlackRock's continued confidence in Bitcoin through market cycles and its expanding crypto-linked ETF offerings, including successful Ethereum ETFs and plans for a Bitcoin Premium Income ETF.

The company has not applied for a driverless permit in California, unlike rivals Waymo and Zoox.

title: One Liberty Properties, Inc. Expands Industrial Portfolio with $53.5 Million Acquisition in Sewickley, Pennsylvania

The purchase aligns with One Liberty's industrial-focused transformation strategy, significantly expanding its presence in a high-performing Pittsburgh submarket.

title: Bank of America’s Moynihan says AI’s economic benefit is ‘kicking in more’
summary: Bank of America CEO Brian Moynihan stated that artificial intelligence's economic benefits are increasingly impacting the US economy and will be a bigger contributor in coming years. He predicts a strong US economy for next year with 2.4% growth, despite some warnings from other executives about an "industrial bubble" in AI spending. Moynihan also mentioned that Bank of America uses AI, notably its bot "Erica," to enhance effectiveness.

title: TikTok puts department stores in your phone. Macy’s and Nordstrom say not so fast
summary: Department stores like Macy's and Nordstrom are struggling to compete with online retailers and social media trends for beauty sales, as consumers increasingly turn to platforms like TikTok for product recommendations and purchases. In response, these stores are investing in significant renovations and technological upgrades, such as robot-applied eyelash extensions and virtual reality scent sampling, to create immersive and unique in-store experiences. Despite these efforts, online platforms like Amazon and TikTok Shop continue to dominate the beauty market, posing a significant challenge to traditional brick-and-mortar retailers.

title: What the iRobot bankruptcy means for Roomba owners
summary: iRobot, the maker of Roomba robot vacuums, has filed for Chapter 11 bankruptcy after a challenging period, including a failed acquisition by Amazon. Despite the bankruptcy, iRobot CEO Gary Cohen assures consumers that "it's business as usual," with apps, warranties, and firmware updates continuing. The company is transitioning ownership to its primary contract manufacturer, Picea, and actively working on new products, indicating no immediate disruption for Roomba owners.

While Array and others like Nextracker and Shoals Technologies Group are thriving, residential solar installers face challenges due to the termination of tax credits.

Analysts are confident in Adobe's long-term outlook, projecting double-digit growth for fiscal year 2026.

(NASDAQ: SPAI) has deployed upgraded AI algorithms for its patented Safe Pro Object Threat Detection (SPOTD) technology, enabling drone operations in GPS-denied environments. This enhanced SPOTD capability, designed to identify and map explosive threats like landmines, will be showcased at the upcoming U.S. Army 2026 Concept Focused Warfighter Experiment at Fort Hood, Texas. The improvements offer significant operational advantages for customers, providing actionable intelligence in challenging electronic warfare environments, and include features like processing any drone video data, enhanced operational robustness, terrain modeling, and accelerated processing.

In contrast, UPS saw its revenue decline by 3.7% due to Amazon's reduced shipments and responded by cutting 48,000 jobs to protect its operating margin and provide a higher dividend yield, signaling a shift towards margin defense and cost discipline.

The abandoned Amazon acquisition, intended to save iRobot, ultimately led to its sale to a Chinese contract manufacturer, illustrating the complex environment for tech innovation and consolidation. Despite competition from online retailers offering lower prices, AutoZone's focus on service and its extensive brick-and-mortar presence have proven successful, as evidenced by consistent comparable-store sales growth.

title: Humana taps Amazon's Aaron Martin to lead insurance unit as company veteran steps down
summary: Humana announced that longtime executive George Renaudin, president of its insurance segment, will retire next summer. Aaron Martin, formerly of Amazon, will succeed Renaudin, initially leading Humana's Medicare Advantage business before taking over the entire insurance segment. John Barger will be promoted to president of Medicare Advantage, highlighting Humana’s focus on leveraging technology and a consumer-centric approach to healthcare.

title: News | DC-area developer receives approval for 640-unit residential project in Northern Virginia
summary: JBG Smith has received approval from the city of Alexandria, Virginia, for a 640-unit residential project in the Potomac Yard neighborhood. This development will include apartments and townhouses, adding much-needed rental, affordable, and for-sale housing to the area near Amazon's HQ2 campus. The project also features open space and retail, with construction planned to begin permits in early 2026.

title: Subscribe to intelligence: R&D’s move towards MaaS
summary: Revvity has launched Signals Xynthetica, a new Model-as-a-Service (MaaS) platform designed to democratize predictive modeling in R&D. This allows labs to access pre-trained, high-fidelity models, integrate AI tools into experimental workflows, and enhance security by keeping data in-house. The MaaS market, including offerings from AWS and Google, reached $17 billion in 2024 and is projected to grow significantly to $491.5 billion by 2035.

title: Alibaba in 2025: Three Shifts That Investors Should Know Before Entering 2026
summary: In 2025, Alibaba Group redefined its trajectory by prioritizing cloud and AI, stabilizing its core e-commerce business, and repositioning itself as a broader technology and AI platform. The company's cloud segment, driven by AI demand, emerged as its primary growth engine, while its e-commerce operations became a stable foundation. This strategic shift, moving beyond a commerce-only identity, expands Alibaba's long-term opportunities while still navigating competitive pressures and investor sentiment toward Chinese tech.

title: Amazon Restructures Workforce, Slashes Luxembourg Jobs, Doubles Down On AI - Amazon.com (NASDAQ:AMZN)
summary: Amazon, (NASDAQ: AMZN), is continuing its global workforce restructuring, focusing on cost controls and significant investment in AI and cloud infrastructure. The company plans to lay off 370 employees in Luxembourg, marking the largest job cuts there in two decades, while also streamlining operations amidst reports of broader corporate job reductions. Despite investor concerns about heavy AI spending, Wall Street analysts are growing more optimistic about Amazon's AI strategy, particularly with advancements in autonomous AI agents and custom chips.

The company faces challenges such as policy headwinds and cash burn but could see its market cap surge if it meets projected revenue growth in the expanding green hydrogen market.

title: Best Buy integrates marketplace with Rithum network
summary: Best Buy is expanding its third-party marketplace by partnering with the Rithum network, which will allow U.S. retailers and sellers to list and manage products directly on Best Buy's platform. This collaboration aims to simplify product onboarding, optimize content and pricing, and enhance fulfillment for Best Buy's marketplace, while also providing a fast lane for sellers to reach qualified customers. Best Buy's marketplace, built on the Mirakl platform, broadens its product assortment into numerous new categories and allows customers to return marketplace purchases in-store.

title: Safe Pro Group (NASDAQ: SPAI) Files Patent Application for AI Computer Vision Tech
summary: Safe Pro Group (NASDAQ: SPAI) has filed a new patent application for its AI-powered computer vision technology. This technology is designed for the rapid and autonomous detection of small explosive threats in drone-based video and imagery, expanding the company's intellectual property. The application details novel methods to improve object-detection precision for small targets, building on their existing SPOTD technology used in humanitarian demining and national defense.

title: Humana Names Former Amazon Executive Next Insurance President. The Stock Drops.

Despite the layoffs, which were negotiated down from 470 under EU labor laws, Amazon will remain Luxembourg’s fifth-largest employer.

title: What's Going On With STMicroelectronics Stock Monday? - STMicroelectronics (NYSE:STM)
summary: STMicroelectronics N.V. (NYSE: STM) is celebrating a decade-long partnership with SpaceX, providing custom components essential for Starlink's user terminals and satellites as the network surpasses 8 million global users. The collaboration involves co-designing chips in France and Italy, with manufacturing across several locations, demonstrating STMicroelectronics' critical role in the commercial satellite connectivity sector. Despite broader market uncertainties, STMicroelectronics expects growth in the commercial space market, leveraging its specialized chips for high-data-rate applications in harsh environments.

title: Utility watchdogs accuse PGE of skirting new law meant to make data centers pay for rising demand
summary: Oregon's largest electrical utility, Portland General Electric (PGE), is accused by utility watchdogs of attempting to circumvent a new law, the POWER Act, which mandates that data centers bear the costs of their growing energy demands. PGE's proposed "Peak Growth Modifier" plan would only directly charge data centers for the first three years of infrastructure investment costs, leaving residential and other customers to fund the remaining 47 years of typical infrastructure investments, despite data centers being the primary driver of demand growth. Critics from the Citizens' Utility Board label this approach as "twisted logic" and advocate for direct assignment of costs to data centers for the entire lifespan of assets primarily serving them.

title: Poverty wages: TJX and BJ’s are heavily reliant on part-time workers, making their median employee pay qualified for government food assistance

title: Microsoft Worm Attack Warning — Act Rapidly And Change Passwords Now
summary: Microsoft is warning organizations to rapidly change passwords following widespread "Shai-Hulud 2.0 Dune Worm" attacks, which compromise cloud-native ecosystems. This self-replicating worm impacts API keys for major cloud services including AWS, Google Cloud, and Microsoft Azure, and has already created over 27,000 new GitHub repositories to exfiltrate stolen credentials. Microsoft advises immediate credential rotation, review of Key Vault assets, isolation of affected CI/CD agents, and reduced permissions for pipeline identities to mitigate further compromise.

title: Fear of Missing Out on data center boom leads Arkansas officials to ignore hard questions
summary: Arkansas officials are enthusiastically pursuing data center projects, offering tax breaks and utility concessions due to "Fear of Missing Out" (FOMO) on the AI boom. However, this article questions whether the modest job gains justify the significant infrastructure costs, potential environmental impact, and secretive negotiation tactics that shift financial burdens to consumers and lack public scrutiny. The author points to Virginia's experience with data centers, where initial enthusiasm has given way to regret over high utility rates and environmental concerns, suggesting Arkansas might be making similar mistakes.

title: Microsoft Corporation (MSFT): Navigating the AI Frontier with Cloud Dominance
summary: Microsoft Corporation (MSFT) continues to demonstrate robust financial performance and technological leadership, primarily driven by its dominant position in cloud computing and aggressive investments in Artificial Intelligence (AI). Under CEO Satya Nadella, Microsoft has strategically shifted to a "cloud-first, mobile-first" approach, rapidly expanding its Azure cloud platform and deeply integrating AI across its products, leading to significant revenue growth and a strong market position. The company faces increased regulatory scrutiny and high AI-related capital expenditures, but its strategic pivots and strong financial health suggest continued long-term growth.

title: Amazon.com Inc. (AMZN): A Deep Dive into the E-commerce and Cloud Giant’s Future
summary: Amazon.com Inc. remains a global technology powerhouse in 2025, driven by its robust performance in e-commerce, cloud computing (AWS), and significant investments in AI. The company reported strong Q3 2025 results with substantial revenue growth across segments, particularly AWS and advertising. Despite regulatory scrutiny and high capital expenditures, Amazon's strategic focus on AI and operational efficiency positions it for continued growth and market dominance in the coming years.

title: Industry-leading roadmap
summary: IonQ is leading the quantum computing industry with a roadmap to deliver powerful quantum computers featuring 2 million physical qubits and 80,000 logical qubits by 2030, aiming for fault tolerance and commercial quantum advantage. Their approach leverages naturally perfect atomic qubits, high fidelity operations, modular scaling, and advancements in quantum memory, with practical applications already demonstrated in drug development, AI, and materials science.

title: MercadoLibre (MELI) Fell in Q3 Due to Competition Concerns
summary: MercadoLibre, Inc. (NASDAQ:MELI) experienced a decline in Q3 2025 primarily due to increasing competition from other online retailers like Amazon and Shopee, raising concerns among investors about its margins and profitability. Despite this, Janus Henderson Forty Fund maintained its position, believing MercadoLibre remains a dominant operator in the underpenetrated Latin American e-commerce and financial technology markets. The company reported 39% year-on-year growth in Q3 2025 and is held by 109 hedge funds, though it is not considered among the 30 most popular hedge fund stocks.

title: Janus Henderson Forty Fund Sold Marvell Technology (MRVL) Due to Lack of Earnings Visibility
summary: Janus Henderson Forty Fund divested its position in Marvell Technology (NASDAQ: MRVL) during the third quarter of 2025, citing a lack of earnings visibility. Despite the company's overall revenue and earnings meeting expectations, data center revenues were weaker and there was a near-term slowing in custom application-specific integrated circuits sales. The fund manager stated this decision was made because Marvell Technology's data center revenues were weaker than anticipated and the company indicated a near-term slowing in sales for custom application-specific integrated circuits.

title: Goldman Sachs Initiates Sell Rating On Bruker Corporation (BRKR)
summary: Goldman Sachs has initiated a "Sell" rating on Bruker Corporation (NASDAQ:BRKR) with a $40 price target, citing potential recovery delays in the drug discovery sector and U.S. academic/government spending. This contrasts with Rothschild & Co. Redburn's earlier "Buy" rating and $60 price target, based on anticipated above-market earnings growth starting in 2026 due to the company's proteomics prominence and cost-cutting measures. Bruker produces diagnostic tests and scientific instruments for the biotechnology, pharmaceutical, applied markets, and life sciences sectors.

title: Quantum Computing Stocks IonQ, Rigetti Computing, and D-Wave Quantum Have a Date With History in 2026
summary: Quantum computing stocks like IonQ, Rigetti Computing, and D-Wave Quantum have seen significant gains, driven by the perceived large addressable market for quantum technology. However, historical precedents for "next-big-thing" technologies suggest a potential bubble-bursting event in 2026 due to overhyped adoption rates, early-stage utility, and high valuations. Despite expected sales growth, analysts believe practical problem-solving applications are still years away, raising concerns about the sustainability of current valuations and first-mover advantages.

title: Cheniere Energy (LNG) Falls as LNG Stocks Come Under Pressure
summary: Cheniere Energy (LNG) experienced a 7.46% share price drop between December 3 and December 10, 2025, amidst broader pressure on LNG stocks. This decline is attributed to eroding profit margins caused by rising US Henry Hub natural gas prices and falling LNG prices in Asian and European markets, leading to a narrowed price spread. The article suggests this trend of squeezed margins may continue as natural gas prices are forecasted to rise and more LNG facilities come online.

title: Marvell Technology (MRVL) Stock: AI Infrastructure Star Faces Fresh Amazon and Microsoft Risks After November Rally
summary: Marvell Technology (MRVL) has experienced significant volatility since November 21, 2025, with an initial rally driven by record earnings and a multi-billion-dollar AI acquisition, pushing the stock up about 17%. However, fresh concerns regarding its business with Amazon and Microsoft, particularly the potential loss of AI chip designs to competitors and Microsoft diversifying suppliers, have introduced uncertainty. Despite a broadly bullish analyst consensus, the stock faces challenges related to earnings quality, valuation debates, and customer concentration risks as it navigates the high-growth AI semiconductor market.

title: Criteo (CRTO): Reassessing Valuation After Strong Q3 Beat and Confident Analyst Outlook
summary: Criteo (CRTO) significantly beat Q3 2025 expectations, leading to a bounce in its share price, although it remains down significantly year-to-date. Despite past struggles and a steep discount to analyst targets, the market views Criteo as 41.5% undervalued with a fair value of $35.92, driven by anticipated boosts from AI-powered ad targeting and Agentic AI solutions leveraging its commerce data. Investors are now evaluating if Criteo is undervalued after its reset or if the market is already factoring in future growth.

title: Amazon Deal, World Cup Demand And Cleaner Inventory Put Nike's Rebound In Play
summary: Nike's stock rose as investors became more optimistic about its product pipeline and strengthening demand, partly driven by a new Amazon storefront targeting value shoppers. Bank of America Securities analyst Lorraine Hutchinson reiterated a Buy rating, expecting sales to improve in Q3 thanks to reduced inventory, product innovation, and World Cup demand. Despite challenges like weaker direct-to-consumer traffic and slow Greater China recovery, a healthy recovery is anticipated with modest margin expansion.

title: Where is Bitfarms Ltd. (BITF) Headed According to Analysts?
summary: Bitfarms Ltd. (NASDAQ:BITF) has received updated ratings from several analysts, with varying price targets and market outlooks. Alliance Global Partners raised its target to $6, citing the company's planned conversion to AI sites, while Cantor Fitzgerald also lifted its target to $5. H.C. Wainwright maintained a Buy rating but lowered the price target to $4 due to "lackluster" Q3 results, though it views the stock as an attractive buying opportunity following a rotation out of AI-related stocks.

title: AWS Cloud WAN software-defined networking
summary: This article from DXC discusses AWS Cloud WAN, a new software-defined networking service announced at AWS re:Invent 2021. It highlights the business value through increased agility, reduced costs by leveraging DevOps, and new capabilities for enterprise networking compared to traditional methods like MPLS or managing multiple Transit Gateways. The piece details how Cloud WAN simplifies configuration, offers automated routing, and keeps traffic on the AWS backbone for improved performance and scalability.

title: Amazon.com Inc: Disclose Climate Strategy for Data Centers
summary: Shareholders are requesting Amazon to disclose its climate strategy given the massive energy demands from its expanding data centers and artificial intelligence operations. Concerns exist regarding Amazon's ability to meet its net-zero carbon emissions by 2040 and 100% renewable energy by 2030 commitments, as increased data center demand is leading utilities to expand fossil fuel power. The resolution asks for a report explaining how the company plans to tackle these rising energy demands while upholding its climate pledges.

title: Xometry, Inc. $XMTR Shares Acquired by Next Century Growth Investors LLC
summary: Next Century Growth Investors LLC increased its stake in Xometry, Inc. ($XMTR) by 16.3%, now owning 772,593 shares worth $26.1 million, making institutional investors hold about 97.31% of the company. Despite multiple analysts raising price targets, the consensus remains "Hold" with a $57.89 target, while Xometry's revenue grew 27.5% year-over-year, its net margin is still negative at -9.8%, and insider selling has occurred.

title: SPY ETF at $688: AI Earnings And S&P 500 8,100 Target
summary: The SPDR S&P 500 ETF Trust (NYSEARCA:SPY) trades at $688.39, driven by AI-fueled profit margins, softer Fed policy, and strong earnings expectations for 2025 and 2026. Despite being at record highs, the article suggests the SPY ETF could reach price targets between $730 and $812 by 2026, implying an 11-18% upside, if macro conditions remain supportive and earnings continue to grow as projected. While acknowledging valuation and volatility risks, the overall verdict is a "Buy" due to sustained earnings growth, favorable macro conditions, and strong investor flows.

title: Amazon expands same-day grocery delivery to 2,300 cities
summary: Amazon has significantly expanded its same-day grocery delivery service for Prime members, now reaching over 2,300 cities, up from 1,000 cities in August. The retailer has also increased its grocery selection by 30% and plans further expansion in 2026. Prime members receive free same-day delivery on orders over $25.

title: How Good Has Etsy Stock Actually Been?
summary: Etsy, once a high-flying stock, has seen its shares decline significantly after a period of rapid growth supercharged by the COVID-19 pandemic. While the company's fundamentals have weakened, with declining gross merchandise sales and compressing margins, its stock is currently considered reasonably valued. However, the market's pessimistic view may be warranted given the struggles in recent years.

title: Guggenheim initiates coverage of Amazon.com (AMZN) with "Buy" rating and $300 price target
summary: Guggenheim has initiated coverage of Amazon.com (AMZN) with a "Buy" rating, reflecting a positive outlook on the company's future performance. The firm set a price target of $300 for AMZN, suggesting significant potential upside for the stock. This new analyst coverage could influence investor sentiment and trading activity for Amazon shares.

title: Guggenheim Initiates Coverage of Amazon.com (AMZN) with "Buy" Rating and $300 Price Target
summary: Guggenheim has initiated coverage of Amazon.com (AMZN) with a "Buy" rating and a $300 price target, acknowledging the retail sector's resilience despite perceived weaknesses and strong gross margins. Rosenblatt Securities also reiterated a "Buy" rating with a $305 target, citing strong enterprise adoption, Amazon's growing role in AI and cloud markets, and undervalued cash flow potential. The company's recent launch of faster and more energy-efficient Graviton5-based EC2 M9g instances further highlights its technological advancements.

title: What does the Netflix-Warner deal mean for talent?
summary: Netflix's $82.7 billion acquisition of Warner Bros. is raising significant concerns within the entertainment industry, particularly regarding fair pay for actors and writers. The deal, which further consolidates streaming platforms, has prompted SAG-AFTRA and the Directors Guild of America (DGA) to express worries about its impact on creative talent and the competitive landscape. This acquisition reignites long-standing issues surrounding residuals and upfront pay in the streaming era.

title: Comcast (NASDAQ: CMCSA) adds Amazon Luna cloud gaming to millions of Xfinity TVs
summary: Comcast and Amazon have jointly launched Amazon Luna, a cloud gaming service, on millions of Xfinity TV and streaming devices across the U.S. This integration allows Xfinity customers with eligible devices to access a wide array of high-quality video games directly through their TV, leveraging Comcast's robust Xfinity WiFi for low latency gaming.
