The service includes over 50 games accessible to Prime members at no extra cost, requiring no console or downloads, and aims to make gaming more accessible to a broader audience.

title: Stock of the Week – Jabil Inc (11.12.2025)
summary: Jabil Inc. is highlighted as a key, understated player in the technology sector, specializing in contract electronics manufacturing for AI servers, iPhones, and Tesla electronics. Despite its significant role and impressive stock performance in 2025 (up 59%), its valuation suggests it remains underestimated by Wall Street. The company leverages megatrends like AI, EVs, and 5G, boasting strong financials and a positive outlook for continued growth.

title: Why Synergy (NASDAQ: SNYR) Could Hit $7 Sooner Than Expected – Beverage Rollout Ignites 2026 Growth Acceleration
summary: Roth Capital Partners reaffirmed a Buy rating and a $7 price target for Synergy CHC Corp. (NASDAQ: SNYR), citing strong fundamentals, a growing product portfolio, and expected revenue acceleration in 2026. The company's recent $4 million equity raise and expansion of its functional beverage business, including FOCUSfactor® Focus + Energy into 1,600+ EG America locations, are expected to drive significant sales growth through existing retail partners like Costco, Walmart, and Amazon. Analysts project revenues could rise from $35.4 million in 2025 to approximately $55 million in 2026, with the $7 target based on a 6.2x EV/EBITDA multiple of projected 2027 results.

title: Alphabet Inc. (GOOGL): Navigating the AI Frontier Amidst Regulatory Headwinds
summary: Alphabet Inc. (GOOGL) remains a dominant force in the tech industry, driven by its aggressive leadership in AI, robust growth in Google Cloud, and the enduring strength of its core advertising businesses. The company faces significant regulatory challenges, particularly antitrust lawsuits in the U.S. and EU, but its strategic investments in AI infrastructure and diverse portfolio position it for continued long-term growth. Investors are largely bullish, though they remain cautious about ongoing capital expenditures and intense competition in the AI space.

title: Oracle’s Larry Ellison Thinks He’s Identified the Next Big AI Business
summary: Oracle CEO Larry Ellison believes the next major AI business will focus on enabling AI models to perform multi-step reasoning on private enterprise data without compromising security. This approach, he argues, will be even more valuable than training AI models on public data, as Oracle databases hold a significant portion of the world's high-value private data. The company is aggressively investing in data centers and hardware, with capital expenditures projected to reach $50 billion, to secure large AI deals in this emerging market.

title: From TikTok to Tariffs: Impinj Supply Chain Integrity Outlook 2026 Reveals Growing Strain Between Consumer Expectations and Supply Chain Reality
summary: Impinj's Supply Chain Integrity Outlook 2026 report highlights a growing disconnect between escalating consumer expectations and the reality of global supply chains. Key findings indicate increased demand for faster delivery, the impact of viral shopping trends, and challenges in food supply chains regarding safety and waste. The report also addresses the strain from tariff tensions, digital product passport compliance, rising counterfeits, and fraudulent shipping, while emphasizing how AI and real-time visibility, particularly through RAIN RFID, are crucial for businesses to navigate these complexities.

title: FedEx (FDX/NYSE): Navigating a Transformative Era in Global Logistics
summary: FedEx (FDX/NYSE) is undergoing a significant transformation with its "DRIVE" program and "Network 2.0" initiatives focused on cost reduction and operational efficiencies. The company, a global leader in logistics, is also planning to spin off FedEx Freight into a separate publicly traded entity by June 2026 to unlock shareholder value. Despite a mixed stock performance in the short term, FedEx shows long-term growth potential and is adapting to industry trends through technology investments and sustainability goals, while facing fierce competition and macroeconomic uncertainties.

title: Should You Buy, Sell or Hold FedEx Stock Before Q2 Earnings?
summary: FedEx Corporation (FDX) is poised to release its fiscal Q2 2026 earnings, with analysts anticipating increased earnings per share and revenues fueled by strong holiday shipping demand and cost-reduction initiatives under the DRIVE program. The company has a Zacks Rank #2 and a positive Earnings ESP of +1.38%, suggesting a high probability of beating estimates. FDX stock has outperformed both its industry and rival UPS in the fiscal second quarter and appears undervalued based on its forward 12-month Price/Sales.

title: Granite REIT to voluntarily delist from NYSE
summary: Granite REIT (GRT-UN-T) announced its plan to voluntarily delist its trust units from the New York Stock Exchange (NYSE) due to consistent low trading volumes and a desire for financial and administrative efficiencies. Less than one percent of its global average daily trading volume occurs on the NYSE. The company will maintain its listing on the Toronto Stock Exchange (TSX) and has applied for quotation on the OTCQX for over-the-counter trading, expecting it to begin around December 23rd.

title: Mairs & Power Balanced Fund Added Amazon (AMZN) Amid Market Share Capture
summary: Mairs & Power Balanced Fund initiated a new position in Amazon.com, Inc. (NASDAQ: AMZN) during Q3 2025, taking advantage of a stock weakness for an attractive valuation. The fund sees Amazon as well-positioned to continue capturing market share in retail distribution and grow its market-leading cloud business. Despite the fund's overall underperformance compared to its benchmarks and peer group, the Consumer Discretionary sector, including Amazon, positively contributed to its relative performance.

title: Microsoft fights $2.8 billion UK lawsuit over cloud computing licences
summary: Microsoft is facing a $2.8 billion UK lawsuit alleging that it overcharges British businesses for using Windows Server software on rival cloud computing platforms like Amazon, Google, and Alibaba. The lawsuit, brought by competition lawyer Maria Luisa Stasi on behalf of nearly 60,000 businesses, claims Microsoft makes it more expensive to use Windows Server on non-Azure platforms as part of an "abusive strategy" to leverage its dominant position. Microsoft denies the allegations, stating its integrated business model encourages competition, while a British competition inquiry previously suggested Microsoft's licensing practices disadvantage competitors.

title: Algorhythm Holdings (NASDAQ: RIME) lands $6M SemiCab deal, lifting ARR beyond $13M
summary: Algorhythm Holdings' SemiCab has secured a $6 million contract expansion with a major Indian paint manufacturer, significantly increasing committed lanes seven-fold to 183 and projecting an additional $5.5 million in annual service revenue. This deal, SemiCab's largest to date, is expected to boost its annualized revenue run rate (ARR) to over $13 million. The expansion validates SemiCab's AI-enabled Collaborative Transportation Platform in reducing logistics costs and empty miles.

title: EXL (Nasdaq: EXLS) completes AWS migration for LifePRO Digital Suite, enhancing insurer cloud and AI
summary: EXL has successfully completed the migration of its LifePRO Digital Suite platforms to Amazon Web Services (AWS), strengthening its collaboration with AWS and modernizing the life and annuity industry. This migration provides a secure, scalable, and resilient cloud infrastructure, leveraging Amazon Bedrock and Kendra to deliver AI/ML services and advanced analytics. The move is expected to accelerate innovation, reduce operational costs, improve performance, and enhance business continuity for insurers using LifePRO.

title: EPAM Wins Global AWS Innovation Award as Cloud Competition Intensifies
summary: EPAM Systems, Inc. (NYSE: EPAM) received the Innovation Partner of the Year – Global award at the 2025 Geography and Global AWS Partner Awards, recognizing its consulting, managed services, and cloud solutions on Amazon Web Services (AWS). This global acknowledgment highlights EPAM's expertise in full-lifecycle cloud services, delivering consistent customer outcomes through integrated consulting and engineering, and developing AI-enabled tools for cloud modernization. The award reinforces EPAM's role in helping clients modernize systems and adopt AI in their cloud-native operations amidst intensifying cloud competition.

title: Morgan Stanley sets LA area record for 2025 with $211M purchase
summary: Morgan Stanley Real Estate Investing has set a new record for the largest industrial deal in Greater Los Angeles for 2025 with the acquisition of a 143,060-square-foot Amazon-occupied facility for $211 million. The previous owner, Overton Moore Properties, had purchased the property for $115 million and developed it into a custom-built distribution center for Amazon. This acquisition underscores Morgan Stanley's continued confidence in Southern California's logistics market, which is experiencing increased sales volume and institutional investor activity.

title: Guggenheim Initiates Coverage of Amazon.com (AMZN) with “Buy” Rating and $300 Price Target
summary: Guggenheim has initiated coverage of Amazon.com (AMZN) with a "Buy" rating and a $300 price target, acknowledging the retail sector's perceived struggles despite strong holiday sales and tariffs. This firm also highlights that many retail stocks it covers are operating at high gross margins. Rosenblatt Securities also reiterated a "Buy" rating with a $305 price target for Amazon, citing strong enterprise adoption and Amazon's growing role in AI and cloud markets.

title: AI chip and tech stocks are falling again after gloomy Oracle earnings reignite bubble fears. Here's the latest
summary: AI chip and tech stocks are falling after Oracle reported disappointing Q2 2026 earnings, renewing fears of an AI bubble fueled by "circular spending." Despite Oracle's non-GAAP EPS beating expectations, its total revenue fell short, causing investors to question the sustainability of current AI investments. This slump is impacting major tech companies and chip makers, with Oracle's stock alone down over 12%.

title: VTI ETF Daily Update—12/11/25
summary: The Vanguard Total Stock Market ETF (VTI) provides investors with broad access to the entire U.S. stock market. In today’s VTI ETF snapshot, we highlight the fund’s recent performance, key technical indicators, and top holdings to help investors track trends in the broader market. VTI is down by 0.12% in pre-market trading on Thursday, while gaining 0.74% in the previous session due to a Federal Reserve interest rate cut.

title: Robotic Floor Scrubber Market (11.69% CAGR) Surges as Tennant Leads With 24.5% Share and New Entrants Like Fimap & Pudu Drive Next-Gen Automation to 2032
summary: The global robotic floor scrubber market is projected to reach US$2,643.92 million by 2032, growing at an 11.69% CAGR from 2025. This growth is driven by increasing demand for automation in cleaning, integration of advanced technologies like AI and IoT, and post-pandemic hygiene awareness. Tennant Company currently leads the market with a 24.5% share, while emerging players like Fimap and Pudu are also significantly contributing to next-gen automation.

title: RTX (RTX): Valuation Check After Raytheon’s New Cloud and AI Partnership With AWS
summary: RTX (RTX) has partnered with Amazon Web Services to integrate cloud-native and AI-driven models into satellite data processing and mission control, bolstering its defense technology portfolio. While the stock has seen significant gains, trading near record highs, Simply Wall St's narrative suggests it is 9.8% undervalued with a fair value of $193.79, driven by strategic portfolio optimization and expected margin improvements. However, a traditional earnings multiple view shows less upside.

title: Applied Optoelectronics (AAOI) Soars 15% on Hyperscaler Huge Volume Order
summary: Applied Optoelectronics, Inc. (NASDAQ:AAOI) saw its stock jump 15.14% after securing its first volume order for 800G data center transceivers from a major hyperscale customer. This order positions the company to meet its year-end 800G shipment expectations, contributing $4 million to $8 million in Q4 revenues. Additionally, the company is ramping up 400G transceiver shipments, with $22 million in orders year-to-date and $13 million delivered in Q4 from the same customer.

title: Amazon's (AMZN) AI Assistant Rufus Sparks Jump in Purchases, Analysts Reaffirm Bullish View
summary: Amazon's AI assistant, Rufus, has led to a significant increase in successful purchases, with sessions including Rufus showing a 75% day-over-day increase compared to 35% without it. Analysts like Citizens have reiterated a "Market Outperform" rating on AMZN, highlighting Rufus's impact and Amazon's fee cuts for European fashion sellers to boost listings and compete with rivals. The company continues to expand its offerings in e-commerce, cloud computing, and AI solutions.

title: Tesla Bulls See $500 Ahead—But Bears Warn of a Painful Reversal
summary: Tesla (NASDAQ: TSLA) stock has seen a significant rally, climbing 15% in the past month and over 100% since April, leading some analysts to predict a potential rise to $500. While bullish analysts from firms like Piper Sandler, Mizuho, and Stifel Nicolaus emphasize Tesla's vertical integration, expanding product lineup, and FSD advancements, bears, including Morgan Stanley, Barclays, and UBS Group, warn of an overstretched valuation with a P/E ratio of nearly 300 and increasing competition in the cyclical automotive business. Technically, the stock shows bullish momentum with a strong uptrend and positive indicators, but faces resistance at the $460-$470 level.

title: Marvell (MRVL) Stock Downgraded as Concerns Grow Over Amazon Trainium Transitions
summary: Marvell Technology, Inc. (NASDAQ: MRVL) has been downgraded from Buy to Hold by Benchmark due to concerns over losing Amazon's Trainium3 and 4 chip designs to a Taiwanese competitor, Alchip. This downgrade, despite Marvell's assurances of continued Amazon revenue, suggests a projected slowdown in XPU growth. Investors are advised to consider taking short-term profits.

title: American Airlines In Talks With Starlink Rival Amazon Leo To Provide Onboard WiFi: Report
summary: American Airlines Group is reportedly in discussions with Amazon.com Inc. to implement its Leo satellite internet WiFi on flights, despite Starlink's current dominance in the sector. American Airlines CEO Robert Isom mentioned that the airline seeks to provide services catering to customer needs, anticipating "better deals" as technology advances. While Leo's constellation is smaller than Starlink's, it boasts impressive 1 GBPS download speeds and is currently in a preview program ahead of a wider rollout next year.

title: TD Cowen Reaffirms Amazon as Its Top Mega-Cap Pick for 2026
summary: TD Cowen has reaffirmed Amazon (AMZN) as its top mega-cap internet stock pick for 2026, maintaining a Buy rating and a $300 price target. This confidence stems from anticipated reacceleration in AWS growth driven by AI workloads, improving e-commerce trends, and continued expansion of Amazon's advertising business. The firm projects Amazon's 2026 operating income to reach approximately $104 billion, expecting the company to exceed both revenue and earnings expectations.

title: What's Going On With Marvell Technology Stock Wednesday? - Marvell Tech (NASDAQ:MRVL)
summary: Marvell Technology Inc. launched its Golden Cable initiative to accelerate active electrical cable development for AI infrastructure, with industry analysts forecasting significant market growth. Despite a recent stock downgrade due to competitive pressures, particularly regarding Amazon's chip designs, Marvell's long-term AI strategy, including major engagements with Amazon and Microsoft, remains on track for future growth. The company anticipates substantial revenue from new AI chip wins by 2028.

title: Marvell Stock Falls Again. ‘Block Out the Noise,’ Analysts Say.
summary: Marvell Technology's stock fell 7% after reports surfaced that the company risks losing projects with two major customers, Microsoft and Amazon. Despite the decline and ongoing investor debate about the custom chip business, analysts are advising investors to "block out the noise." The article suggests that volatility may persist as the market assesses Marvell's future prospects.

title: Amazon to invest $35B in India by 2030 with focus on AI, logistics
summary: Amazon.com Inc. plans to invest $35 billion in India by 2030, targeting growth across all its businesses, including expanding AI capabilities and enhancing its e-commerce infrastructure. The investment aims to quadruple its platform's export facilitation to $80 billion and create approximately 3.8 million jobs by 2030. This move follows similar large-scale investments by rivals like Microsoft in the rapidly growing Indian market.

title: Morgan Stanley Raises CSX Price Target Amid Positive Freight Outlook
summary: Morgan Stanley increased its price target for CSX Corporation (NASDAQ:CSX) to $30 from $27, maintaining an Equal Weight rating, due to a positive outlook for the freight transportation industry in 2026. The firm upgraded its industry view to "Attractive" and highlighted CSX's improved operational metrics despite mixed third-quarter earnings, noting increased volumes and faster train velocity. CSX, a leading transportation company, is positioned for growth with completed infrastructure projects enhancing capacity.

title: Grid Dynamics Signs Strategic Collaboration Agreement with AWS to Advance Data Foundations for Generative AI
summary: Grid Dynamics has signed a multi-year Strategic Collaboration Agreement with Amazon Web Services (AWS) to accelerate AI-related services for enterprise customers, focusing on generative AI journeys. This agreement extends their 15-year collaboration and grants Grid Dynamics access to the AWS Data Foundations for Generative AI Program. Through this, Grid Dynamics aims to empower clients at every stage of their AI journey, providing modern, scalable, and secure data foundations from AWS to help enterprises move from AI experimentation to full-scale production.

title: JPMorgan Chase & Co. Reduces Stake in Host Hotels & Resorts Inc.
summary: JPMorgan Chase & Co. has significantly reduced its stake in Host Hotels & Resorts Inc. by 60.15%, selling over 44 million shares at $17.63 each. Despite this large reduction, the impact on JPMorgan's overall portfolio was minimal, decreasing its position by only 0.02%. Host Hotels & Resorts remains a leading REIT, considered modestly undervalued with strong growth potential, attracting other notable investors.

title: News | US office rebound raises questions for nationwide property transformation
summary: The US real estate industry's rapid shift to converting obsolete office buildings into new uses, driven by post-pandemic vacancies, is now being re-evaluated due to a recent rebound in office leasing. Developers like Vornado Realty Trust are scrapping conversion plans in favor of modernizing office spaces, especially for high-demand, top-tier properties. This change in strategy highlights a fluctuating market where, despite high vacancy rates, increased leasing activity and corporate return-to-office mandates are reshaping investment decisions, though conversion projects still continue in other areas.

title: Addressing technical debt with DXC Assure Platform
summary: DXC Assure Platform helps insurers tackle technical debt by modernizing operations and future-proofing infrastructure. It provides a cloud foundation built on AWS, enabling cost reduction, improved flexibility, and seamless integration with new technologies. The platform leverages AI tools, automation, and specific components like Assure Cloud, Assure 360, Assure Security, Enterprise Link, and Enterprise Data Hub to facilitate the migration from legacy systems to modern cloud-based solutions, ensuring insurers remain competitive and can launch products quickly.

title: Comerica (CMA): Buy, Sell, or Hold Post Q3 Earnings?
summary: This article discusses whether investors should buy, sell, or hold Comerica (CMA) stock after its recent Q3 earnings report and significant price increase. The author advises against purchasing CMA, citing concerns about its net interest income growth, unimpressive EPS growth, and current valuation. Instead, the article suggests other stock opportunities for investors.

title: Backblaze to Present Strategy for Future-Proofing AI Initiatives at Gartner® IT Infrastructure, Operations, & Cloud Strategies Conference 2025
summary: Backblaze, Inc. will present at the Gartner IT Infrastructure, Operations, & Cloud Strategies Conference 2025, with Patrick Thomas, Head of GTM, outlining how an independent data layer can solve data sprawl and foster AI agility. The presentation will offer a strategic playbook for I&O leaders to overcome data fragmentation and vendor lock-in by adopting a vendor-neutral, S3-compatible data layer. Backblaze aims to equip organizations with a flexible foundation optimized for AI and multi-cloud initiatives, showcasing real-world examples of substantial cost reductions and improved performance.

title: Ulta Beauty Counters Rivals With Advantages in Product Selection, Stores, and Loyalty
summary: Ulta Beauty maintains a narrow economic moat through its strong brand, extensive product selection, and a successful loyalty program with over 45 million members. The company has significantly increased its revenue and store count over the past decade, effectively competing against both mall-based retailers and e-commerce giants like Amazon. Ulta's strategy leverages in-store experiences, salons, and promotions to encourage frequent customer visits and drive market share.

title: OGE Energy (OGE) Announces Dividend of $0.425 per Share
summary: OGE Energy Corp. (NYSE: OGE) announced a dividend of $0.425 per share, payable on January 30, 2026, to shareholders of record as of January 5, 2026. The company has a 19-year history of growing payouts and offers an annual dividend yield of 3.96%. OGE is also investing in expansion, including a $345 million public stock offering to fund capital expenditures and debt repayment, and recently received a "Buy" rating and $51 price target from Barclays.

title: Datadog’s Le-Quoc Alexis sells $8.3m in shares By Investing.com
summary: Datadog's Chief Technology Officer, Le-Quoc Alexis, sold 53,912 shares of Class A Common Stock for approximately $8.3 million on December 8, 2025. This sale followed a conversion of 123,000 Class B shares to Class A shares on December 5. The article also notes recent company developments, including a strategic collaboration with AWS, the launch of new AI and storage management products, and a raised price target from Truist Securities.

title: Amazon.com Inc: Sustainable Packaging Policies for Flexible Plastics
summary: Shareholders are requesting that Amazon.com Inc's Board issue a report detailing how the company can address flexible plastic packaging in line with the Pew Report's findings to reduce its contribution to plastic pollution. The resolution highlights the growing financial and reputational risks associated with non-recyclable plastic packaging and the increasing global regulations. It also points out Amazon's absence from major pre-competitive initiatives and its lagging position compared to competitors in adopting sustainable packaging goals.

title: Kroger cancels plans for additional automated fulfillment center
summary: Kroger has canceled plans for an automated e-commerce fulfillment center in Charlotte, North Carolina, and will pay Ocado $350 million. This decision is part of a broader strategy to refine its e-commerce network, which includes closing other facilities and relying more on individual stores for order fulfillment. The company aims for its online operations to become profitable next year.

title: Honeywell International Inc. (HON) Appoints Indra Nooyi as Indep
summary: Honeywell International Inc. (HON) has appointed former PepsiCo CEO Indra Nooyi as an Independent Director to its Board, effective January 1, 2026. Ms. Nooyi brings extensive leadership and governance experience from her roles at PepsiCo, Amazon, and Philips. This appointment aims to strengthen Honeywell's strategic direction and innovation initiatives.

title: JPMorganChase names Todd Combs to head Strategic Investment Group of Security and Resiliency Initiative; Company also announces external advisory council to inform SRI’s strategy and investment priorities
summary: JPMorganChase announced that Todd Combs, Investment Manager of Berkshire Hathaway and CEO of GEICO, will lead the $10 billion Strategic Investment Group within its new Security and Resiliency Initiative (SRI). Combs will also advise Jamie Dimon and the firm's Operating Committee on strategic issues. Additionally, JPMorganChase formed an external advisory council, including notable leaders like Jeff Bezos and Michael Dell, to guide the SRI's long-term strategy in critical industries.

title: Kroger ramps up Marketplace store fleet in Texas as it faces down H-E-B
summary: Kroger plans to expand its Marketplace store fleet in North Texas, breaking ground on three new large-scale locations in 2026. This move aims to keep pace with the region's population growth and compete with strong regional players like H-E-B, which is also expanding its presence in the Dallas-Fort Worth area. The Marketplace format offers full-service grocery, pharmacy, and expanded general merchandise across 99,000 to 130,000 square feet.

title: Honeywell International Inc. (HON) Appoints Indra Nooyi as Independent Director
summary: Honeywell International Inc. (HON) has announced the appointment of Indra Nooyi, former CEO of PepsiCo, Inc., as an Independent Director to its Board of Directors, effective January 1, 2026. Nooyi, who also serves on the board of Amazon and Philips, brings extensive leadership and governance experience to Honeywell. This strategic addition aims to strengthen the company's leadership and support its growth and innovation strategies.

title: Immutep Limited (IMMP): Firm Reports Positive Data from Trials
summary: Immutep Limited (NASDAQ:IMMP) recently announced positive data from two clinical trials for its drug candidate, eftilagimod alpha. A Phase 2 study showed significant efficacy in treating soft tissue sarcoma, while a Phase 1 study achieved an 81% overall survival rate for metastatic non-small cell lung cancer. The company has also reached a key enrollment milestone for a Phase III trial, moving closer to potentially changing the non-small cell lung cancer treatment landscape.

title: WINTON GROUP Ltd Takes Position in Modine Manufacturing Company $MOD
summary: WINTON GROUP Ltd has acquired a new position in Modine Manufacturing (NYSE:MOD), purchasing 15,625 shares valued at approximately $1.539 million. This comes as CEO Neil David Brinker recently sold 31,871 shares, reducing his stake by 11.8%. Modine Manufacturing, an auto parts company, reported an EPS beat and 12.3% revenue growth last quarter, with a "Moderate Buy" consensus rating from analysts and an average target price of $182.

title: Netflix (NFLX) Stock Today, December 10, 2025: Warner Bros. Discovery Bid, Lawsuit Risks, and 2026 Price Targets
summary: Netflix (NFLX) stock is currently experiencing volatility due to its proposed acquisition of Warner Bros. Discovery (WBD), facing a competing bid from Paramount Skydance and a new consumer class-action lawsuit. Despite these challenges and concerns about increased debt, Netflix's core business remains strong with growing subscribers, revenue, and free cash flow, along with promising growth from its ad-supported tier and expansion into live sports. Wall Street analysts largely maintain a positive outlook, although some express caution regarding the deal's risks and its potential impact on Netflix's balance sheet.

title: ANET vs. IBM: Which Hybrid Cloud Stock is the Better Buy for 2026?
summary: This article compares Arista Networks (ANET) and International Business Machines (IBM) as leading hybrid cloud and AI infrastructure providers. While both companies are strategically positioned, Arista shows stronger growth and estimate revisions, but IBM appears more attractive from a valuation perspective. The analysis suggests that IBM may hold a slight edge as a better investment for 2026 due to its valuation and broad tech play, despite Arista's steady growth and AI/cloud focus.

title: This Amazon Analyst Begins Coverage On A Bullish Note; Here Are Top 5 Initiations For Wednesday
summary: Guggenheim analyst Simeon Siegel initiated coverage on Amazon.com, Inc. (NASDAQ: AMZN) with a Buy rating and a $300 price target. This article highlights five top analyst initiations for Wednesday, also including Samsara Inc. (NYSE: IOT), NIKE, Inc. (NYSE: NKE), Apogee Therapeutics, Inc. (NASDAQ: APGE), and ABM Industries Incorporated (NYSE: ABM), all receiving Buy or Overweight ratings with new price targets.

title: Navitas Bets Big On AI And EV Power, Risk Remains
summary: Navitas Semiconductor, a fabless chipmaker specializing in GaN and SiC technologies, is focusing on high-power segments like AI data centers and EVs, leading to significant stock volatility despite a substantial year-over-year return. The company faces challenges including uneven revenue, high losses, and intense competition, but its NVIDIA partnership and patent portfolio offer potential for long-term growth. Its high valuation reflects future expectations, making it a high-risk, high-reward investment.

title: Amazon’s Same-Day perishable grocery delivery expands to 2,300+ cities and towns as fresh foods become bestsellers
summary: Amazon has expanded its Same-Day perishable grocery delivery service to over 2,300 U.S. cities and towns, with further growth planned for 2026. This expansion has led to fresh groceries becoming nine of the top ten bestselling items on the platform, driven by customer demand for quality, low prices, and convenience. Prime members benefit from free same-day delivery on orders over $25, and Amazon has increased its perishable selection by over 30% since August, including Whole Foods Market items and its own Amazon Grocery brand.

title: HONEYWELL APPOINTS INDRA NOOYI TO BOARD OF DIRECTORS
summary: Honeywell (NASDAQ: HON) announced the appointment of Indra Nooyi, former Chair and CEO of PepsiCo, to its Board of Directors as an Independent Director, effective January 1, 2026. Nooyi, 70, served as CEO of PepsiCo from 2006 to 2018 and is recognized for her "Performance with Purpose" strategy. Her extensive experience in leading diverse global businesses and her financial expertise are expected to contribute significantly to Honeywell's growth and shareholder value.

title: William Blair Touts AAON, Inc. (AAON) Growth Prospects, Asserts Buy Rating
summary: William Blair has maintained a Buy rating on AAON, Inc. (AAON), highlighting the company's unique market approach, strong relationships with major hyperscaler customers like Amazon, and focus on advanced thermal management solutions. Analysts have given AAON a Strong Buy rating with an average target price of $119, implying a significant upside. The company recently announced the promotion of Doug Wichman to EVP and General Manager, effective January 1, 2026, to lead strategic planning and product development for its semi-custom HVAC solutions.

title: Resideo Technologies Inc. (REZI) Unveils Honeywell Home X8S Smart Thermostat with Live Video Streaming Capability
summary: Resideo Technologies Inc. has launched the new Honeywell Home X8S Smart Thermostat, featuring live video streaming from compatible doorbell cameras like Ring, at a price point of $219.99. This Matter-certified thermostat also offers indoor air quality monitoring and is compatible with Amazon Alexa and Apple Home. Despite short-term pressures from an ERP system transition and a decline in HVAC-related air product sales, Resideo remains optimistic about future growth, supported by new product launches and the planned separation of its Products and Solutions unit from the ADI distribution business.

title: Ziff Davis to Attend Barclays Tech Conference
summary: Ziff Davis (ZD) will participate in the Barclays Global Technology Conference on December 10, 2025, though public access will be limited as there will be no webcast. Analysts currently rate ZD stock as a Hold with a $37.00 price target. TipRanks' AI Analyst, Spark, also considers ZD a Neutral, citing strong revenue growth and improved profitability alongside mixed technical momentum and reasonable valuation.

title: The Upside Story Behind Concentra Group Holdings Parent, Inc. (CON)
summary: Concentra Group Holdings Parent, Inc. (NYSE: CON) is highlighted as a cheap healthcare stock with significant upside potential, based on analyst ratings and recent financial performance. The company reported strong third-quarter results with increased revenue, net income, and adjusted EBITDA, driven by visit and rate growth. Analysts have reaffirmed "Buy" ratings with a median price target of $29, suggesting a nearly 49% upside.

title: Should You Buy the Invesco QQQ ETF With the Nasdaq Near an All-Time High? History Offers a Clear Answer.
summary: The Invesco QQQ Trust, which tracks the Nasdaq-100 index, is heavily weighted by major tech companies involved in AI and other advanced technologies. Despite the Nasdaq nearing an all-time high, history suggests that long-term investment in the QQQ ETF has consistently yielded positive returns, making it a viable option for investors. The fund's focus on innovative sectors like AI, autonomous vehicles, and robotics indicates continued growth potential, even as market conditions shift.

title: Amazon Pledges $35 Billion To Supercharge India's AI, Cloud Market And Create 1 Million Jobs By 2030
summary: Amazon has announced a significant investment of over $35 billion in India's artificial intelligence and cloud computing sector by 2030, in addition to its existing $40 billion investment. This initiative aims to drive AI-powered digitization, boost exports, and create 1 million jobs in India. The move comes as other tech giants like Microsoft, Intel, and Google also increase their investments in India's rapidly growing AI market.

title: Bank of Nova Scotia Has $28.51 Million Position in iShares MSCI Eurozone ETF $EZU
summary: Bank of Nova Scotia significantly increased its stake in the iShares MSCI Eurozone ETF (EZU) by 5,491.5% during the second quarter, now holding 479,531 shares valued at $28.51 million. This makes Bank of Nova Scotia one of several institutional investors to have recently modified their positions in EZU. The ETF itself has seen a 32.8% increase in stock value, with a current market cap of $8.64 billion.

title: Infrastructure, App & Data Protection
summary: DXC Technology offers comprehensive cybersecurity solutions for infrastructure, applications, and data, helping organizations navigate the complexities of hybrid environments. They design, install, and integrate perimeter, network, and endpoint solutions with advanced threat protection, ensuring compliance and risk reduction. DXC's services encompass endpoint protection, 24x7 network security monitoring, managed cloud access security broker services, cloud security compliance, and robust zero-trust solutions.

title: Amazon to invest $35 billion in India through 2030, create 1 million more jobs | Business News
summary: Amazon.com Inc. plans to invest $35 billion in India through 2030, creating one million more jobs and quadrupling e-commerce exports from India to $80 billion by then. This investment will focus on artificial intelligence and logistics infrastructure, building on an earlier commitment of $15 billion, which included $12.7 billion by Amazon Web Services. The move comes as other Big Tech firms also increase their presence in India's high-growth market, despite regulatory challenges and stiff local competition.

title: Amazon announces $35 billion investment in India by 2030 to advance AI innovation, create jobs
summary: Amazon has announced plans to invest over $35 billion in India by 2030, totaling nearly $75 billion in cumulative investments. This new investment will focus on AI-driven digitization, export growth, and job creation, building on previous efforts that digitized 12 million small businesses and enabled $20 billion in exports. The company aims to empower 15 million small businesses and 4 million students with AI literacy, expanding its physical and digital infrastructure and supporting 3.8 million direct, indirect, induced, and seasonal jobs by 2030.

title: Amazon Raises India Investment Pledge to $35 Billion by 2030
summary: Amazon has increased its investment commitment in India to $35 billion by 2030. This updated pledge comes as the company continues to expand its operations and presence in the burgeoning Indian market. The move highlights Amazon's strategic focus on India as a key growth region for its global business.

title: Zimmer Biomet Stock: Is ZBH Underperforming the Health Care Sector?
summary: Zimmer Biomet Holdings, Inc. (ZBH) is a large-cap medical technology company specializing in orthopedic implants. The company's stock has underperformed the Health Care Select Sector SPDR Fund (XLV) over various periods, including a 12.7% decline year-to-date compared to XLV's 9% gain. ZBH also lags behind competitor Penumbra, Inc. (PEN) and analysts currently rate ZBH as a "Hold" with an 11.3% upside to the mean price target.

title: InterDigital (IDCC): Assessing Valuation After Legal Wins Boost Streaming Patent Revenue Prospects
summary: InterDigital (IDCC) has seen its valuation propelled by recent legal victories in Germany and Brazil regarding streaming patents, leading to significant share price growth. Despite a narrative fair value of $412 based on strong licensing agreements and recurring revenue, Simply Wall St's DCF model suggests a fair value of $70.67, indicating a potential overvaluation. Investors are weighing the impact of patent litigation wins, a reaffirmed dividend, and analyst targets against underlying cash flow strength and future growth prospects.

title: Analog Devices (ADI): Buy, Sell, or Hold Post Q3 Earnings?
summary: Analog Devices (ADI) has closely tracked the S&P 500, but StockStory analysts advise against buying due to declining revenue and mediocre return on invested capital. While the current valuation is fair, the upside potential is minimal compared to the risks. They suggest exploring better investment opportunities in other high-quality stocks.

title: Microsoft to spend $17.5B on AI infrastructure to support India’s AI ambitions
summary: Microsoft Corp. is investing $17.5 billion to build AI infrastructure in India, its largest investment in Asia, focusing on scaling its presence and supporting India's AI ambitions. This initiative includes a new data center region in Hyderabad and expansion of existing facilities, alongside collaborations with the Indian government to integrate AI into public services. The move highlights India's growing importance as a global tech battleground, attracting major AI industry players like Google, Anthropic, and Nvidia.

title: How Investors Are Reacting To Alibaba Group Holding (BABA) Launching Qwen-Powered Quark AI Glasses In China
summary: Alibaba has launched its Qwen-powered Quark AI Glasses in China, integrating them deeply with its AI model and core platforms like Alipay and Taobao. This move aims to extend Qwen's reach beyond cloud services into consumer hardware, potentially increasing user engagement across Alibaba's digital ecosystem. Investors are currently weighing this development against Alibaba's significant AI and cloud investments and the pressure this places on profit margins.

title: Kroger Cuts Prices on 1,000 Items While Closing Stores and Eliminating Jobs — What It Means for ‘Frustrated’ Consumers
summary: Kroger is implementing aggressive cost-cutting measures, including lowering prices on over 1,000 items, laying off corporate staff, and closing underperforming stores and fulfillment centers, to address consumer frustration with high grocery costs. Many shoppers are changing their habits, opting for generic brands and strict lists, to manage their budgets. Consumers can stretch their grocery budget by utilizing loyalty programs, comparing unit prices, timing purchases with sales, embracing store brands, and sticking to shopping lists.

title: Datadog’s Le-Quoc Alexis sells $8.3m in shares
summary: Datadog's Chief Technology Officer, Le-Quoc Alexis, sold 53,912 shares of Class A Common Stock for approximately $8.3 million on December 8, 2025. This follows his conversion of 123,000 shares of Class B to Class A Common Stock on December 5. The article also highlights Datadog's strategic collaboration with AWS, new AI and storage management products, and a raised price target from Truist Securities.

title: Kroger delivery rejects robots, embraces AI. How will your shopping experience change?
summary: Kroger is shifting its grocery delivery strategy, moving away from robot-powered warehouses to embrace artificial intelligence and partnerships with Instacart, DoorDash, and Uber Eats. This change aims to save $400 million annually and speed up delivery, but raises concerns among some customers and privacy experts about data usage and the potential for "surveillance pricing." Critics question whether AI tools will truly prioritize customer interests over commercial ones, and whether Kroger's reliance on third-party platforms for a core competency is a wise move for customer interaction and data privacy.

title: IQVIA Holdings amends credit agreement to refinance loans and reduce interest rates
summary: IQVIA Holdings Inc. announced amendments to its Fifth Amended and Restated Credit Agreement, refinancing existing term loans into new classes and consolidating revolving credit commitments. The restructuring also reduces the interest rate for U.S. dollar-denominated term A loans and revolving credit loans by removing the term SOFR credit spread adjustment. Furthermore, the Swiss and Japanese subsidiary borrowers are released from their obligations under the credit agreement.

title: Staffing Challenges and Post-Covid Hiring Slowdown Hit Robert Half (RHI), According to BNP Paribas
summary: BNP Paribas Exane downgraded Robert Half Inc. (RHI) to Underperform with a $22 price target, citing negative impacts from AI, automation, and a return to normal hiring post-COVID. The firm noted that temporary roles are particularly vulnerable to AI, affecting staffing companies like Robert Half, which recently reported a 7.54% YoY decline in services revenue. Despite mixed earnings and client caution, RHI showed confidence in sequential growth in weekly trends and contract talent revenues, maintaining a solid cash position.

title: Instacart (CART) Stock Trades Up, Here Is Why
summary: Instacart's stock (NASDAQ:CART) rose 6% after launching an embedded shopping and checkout app within ChatGPT, making it the first grocery partner to offer such a feature. This integration allows users to discover recipes, create grocery lists, and complete the checkout process directly within the chat, strengthening Instacart's market position. The move is seen as a strategic advantage over competitors like Walmart and Amazon, aligning with Instacart's growth strategy through partnerships despite recent volatility due to increased competition.

title: Code and Theory Named Adweek's Inaugural Innovation Agency of the Year
summary: Code and Theory, a creative and technology network within Stagwell, has been named Adweek's first-ever Innovation Agency of the Year. This recognition highlights the company's success in redefining customer experiences through creativity, technology, and AI-driven innovation, reflecting a shift in what businesses need from agency partners. Their unique 50/50 split between engineers and creatives has led to significant growth and transformative results for major brands.

title: Heidi Klum joins SharkNinja as ambassador - Bizwomen
summary: Heidi Klum has been named an ambassador for SharkNinja, joining other celebrities like Tom Brady, Kevin Hart, and David Beckham. Klum will promote the Massachusetts-based company's kitchen and home appliances, particularly in Europe and her native Germany. This partnership follows SharkNinja's recent focus on international expansion and its robust sales performance in 2024.

title: ETFs Poised to Gain From Black Friday's $11.8B Online E-Commerce Sales
summary: Black Friday's record $11.8 billion in online e-commerce sales, a 9.1% year-over-year increase, highlights a significant shift towards digital shopping, propelled by aggressive discounting and AI adoption. This surge is expected to boost e-commerce giants like Amazon, Shopify, and eBay. Investors can capitalize on this trend through diversified Exchange-Traded Funds (ETFs) such as Global X E-commerce ETF (EBIZ), ProShares Online Retail ETF (ONLN), and VanEck Retail ETF (RTH), which offer exposure to a basket of e-commerce and related technology stocks.

title: Marvell Technology Debunks Speculations Of Losing Business From Amazon, Microsoft
summary: Marvell Technology (NASDAQ: MRVL) has confirmed that its XPU programs with major customers Amazon.com Inc (NASDAQ: AMZN) and Microsoft Corp (NASDAQ: MSFT) are on track to ramp up in 2026. JPMorgan analyst Harlan Sur reiterated an Overweight rating on Marvell's stock, noting confirmed purchase orders for AWS's Trainium 3 XPU ASIC program through 2026 and Microsoft's Maia AI XPU ASIC program ramping in late 2026 and 2027. Marvell expects AI XPU attach revenues to reach $2 billion by CY28, alongside significant growth in their electro-optical business.

title: IQVIA Holdings altera acordo de crédito para refinanciar empréstimos e reduzir taxas de juros
summary: IQVIA Holdings Inc. (IQV) announced an amendment to its Fifth Amended Credit Agreement, refinancing existing Term A-1 and Term A-2 Dollar Loans and Term A Euro Loans into new classes. The amendment also consolidates all US, Japan, and Swiss/Multicurrency Revolving Credit Commitments into a new class and reduces interest rates for dollar-denominated Term A and revolving credit loans by eliminating the SOFR credit spread adjustment. This debt restructuring occurs as InvestingPro data indicates IQVIA's short-term obligations exceed its liquid assets, with a liquidity ratio of 0.7.
source: Investing.com Brasil - Finanças, Câmbio e Investimentos

title: Walmart makes a major change for Christmas Eve
summary: Walmart is extending its Express Delivery deadline on Christmas Eve by an hour this year, allowing customers to place orders until 5 p.m. local time for delivery in as fast as one hour. This change aims to provide a lifeline for last-minute shoppers, with stores open from 6 a.m. to 6 p.m. on Christmas Eve and closed on Christmas Day. The retailer emphasizes its commitment to speed and delivery, now reaching 95% of U.S. households within three hours.

title: 10 Consumer Discretionary Stocks With Whale Alerts In Today's Session
summary: This article details significant options activity, dubbed "whale alerts," in ten consumer discretionary stocks. These alerts identify large-sum transactions that can signal future price movements, with comprehensive data provided for call and put options including sentiment, expiration dates, strike prices, total trade prices, open interest, and volume. The stocks highlighted include major companies like Tesla, Amazon, and Nike, among others.

title: Pony AI Expands Sunlight Mobility Partnership to Accelerate Scalable, Capital-Efficient Fleet Growth
summary: Pony AI Inc. has expanded its partnership with Sunlight Mobility to implement an asset-light model for fleet growth, building on their initial collaboration from June 2024. Sunlight Mobility will fund Gen-7 Robotaxi vehicles, with initial deployment planned for Guangzhou by the end of 2025, and further expansion across China. This agreement highlights the growing market recognition of Pony AI's Robotaxi business model, as third parties are increasingly willing to finance fleet deployment and lease Pony AI's Virtual Driver for commercial operations, sharing economic benefits.

title: Amazon's (AMZN) AWS Momentum Strengthens as Evercore Keeps $335 Price Target
summary: Evercore ISI reiterated its "Outperform" rating on Amazon (AMZN) with a $335 price target following the AWS re:Invent conference, indicating increased confidence in AWS's sustained growth and inflection. The firm's channel checks suggest AWS is likely to grow 20% or more in 2026, with prior supply constraints largely addressed and demand for cloud services accelerating. Amazon (AMZN) is a major technology company, but the article suggests other AI stocks may offer greater upside.

title: Why KeyBanc Remains Bullish on Amazon (AMZN) After AWS re:Invent
summary: KeyBanc analysts reiterated an "Overweight" rating on Amazon (AMZN) with a $303.00 price target after AWS re:Invent, citing confidence in AWS momentum and long-term AI growth. The firm is encouraged by Amazon's flexible AI offerings and expects 21% year-over-year growth for AWS into 2026E. While optimistic about AMZN, KeyBanc suggests other AI stocks might offer greater upside and less downside risk.

title: Spotify expands music videos access to premium users in US, Canada to take on YouTube
summary: Spotify is expanding music video access to its premium subscribers in the U.S. and Canada, aiming to compete with YouTube in the streaming market. This move follows a beta launch last year and is intended to enhance user engagement and attract more subscribers and advertisers. Spotify's shares saw a nearly 4% increase following the announcement.

title: AI Arms Race: How Tech’s Capital Surge Will Reshape the Investment Landscape in 2026
summary: The article discusses the massive capital expenditure by tech giants ("hyperscalers") to build AI infrastructure, highlighting the significant investment despite potential challenges like energy demands, cooling needs, and uncertain monetization. It warns that AI-linked sectors are experiencing elevated valuations reminiscent of previous tech bubbles and advises investors to maintain balanced portfolios, as many are already heavily exposed to AI through broad market indexes.

title: Why F5 (FFIV) Stock Is Up Today
summary: Shares of F5 (NASDAQ: FFIV) jumped 4.2% after the company announced an expanded collaboration with NetApp to enhance AI application performance and prepare for post-quantum cryptography. This partnership combines F5's application delivery and security platform with NetApp's intelligent data infrastructure to support demanding AI workloads and strengthen defenses against emerging cybersecurity threats. The stock also saw a boost 18 days prior due to positive sentiment surrounding potential interest rate cuts from the Federal Reserve.

title: How Trump’s U-Turn on Nvidia Chips Changes the Game for China’s AI
summary: President Trump has allowed Nvidia to sell its H200 artificial-intelligence chips to China, a move that critics fear will help Beijing's AI industry catch up to the U.S. This decision gives Nvidia access to a massive market while providing China with crucial high-end semiconductors it couldn't develop domestically. The deal significantly reshapes the technological competition between the two countries.

title: Grid Dynamics signs strategic collaboration agreement with AWS to advance data foundations for Generative AI
summary: Grid Dynamics Holdings, Inc. has announced a strategic collaboration agreement with Amazon Web Services (AWS) to enhance data foundations for Generative AI. This partnership aims to help enterprises leverage AWS services to build robust data platforms essential for advanced AI applications. The collaboration focuses on improving data management and infrastructure to support generative AI initiatives.

title: Improving Economic Signals Drives Participation In Direxion's Daily Retail Bull 3X Shares RETL ETF
summary: Despite a challenging economic environment for consumers and the S&P Retail Select Industry Index underperforming for most of the year, recent economic data and consumer sentiment point towards a potential comeback in the retail sector. This positive shift is influencing the performance of leveraged ETFs like the Direxion Daily Retail Bull 3X Shares (RETL), which tracks 300% of the S&P Retail Select Industry Index. Investors are showing increased interest in RETL, driven by improving economic signals and adapting retail strategies, though the inherent volatility and short-term design of such leveraged funds necessitate caution.
authors: Direxion Donald Trump ETF The SP 500 Economy

title: Nvidia, SoftBank Target 'Robot Brain' Maker In Potential $14 Billion Deal - NVIDIA (NASDAQ:NVDA)
summary: SoftBank Group Corp. and NVIDIA Corp are reportedly in talks to lead a significant funding round for Skild AI, a robotics artificial intelligence company. This investment could value Skild AI at approximately $14 billion, nearly tripling its earlier valuation. Skild AI aims to develop universal software that acts as a central "brain" for robots, addressing a key barrier to widespread robot deployment.

title: NVIDIA Corporation $NVDA Stock Holdings Lifted by Wealthspire Advisors LLC
summary: Wealthspire Advisors LLC significantly increased its stake in NVIDIA Corporation (NASDAQ:NVDA) by 20.9% in Q2, adding over 40,000 shares. Despite this institutional bullishness and broad "Buy" ratings from analysts, company insiders have been net sellers, disposing of a large volume of shares in recent months. NVIDIA reported strong Q3 earnings, beating analyst estimates for both revenue and EPS, and the company also declared a quarterly dividend.

title: Netflix Stock Falls as Warner Bros. Deal Faces Hostile Challenge – What NFLX Investors Need to Know Now
summary: Netflix (NFLX) stock is under pressure due to a complex acquisition bid for Warner Bros. Discovery’s studios and streaming assets, valued at $72-83 billion, which now faces a hostile $108.4 billion counterbid from Paramount. Despite this uncertainty and recent analyst downgrades, Netflix's core streaming business remains strong, supported by high engagement and a rapidly growing ad-supported tier boasting over 190 million monthly active viewers. The market is currently weighing whether the Warner Bros. deal will be a transformative win or an expensive distraction, with Wall Street's consensus leaning cautiously bullish on NFLX.

title: Kroger slashes prices on 3,500 items after return to ‘retro’ coupons
summary: Kroger is reintroducing paper coupons and cutting prices on 3,500 items, including chuck roasts and eggs, in an effort to combat a reported $1.3 billion loss and mounting industry pressures. This strategy comes after the grocery giant ended its partnership with Ocado and lowered its full-year sales forecast. CEO Ron Sargent aims to shift savings closer to consumers and improve profitability by focusing on third-party delivery services and expanding private-label brands.

title: Lombard Odier Asset Management USA Corp Buys New Stake in The Kroger Co. $KR
summary: Lombard Odier Asset Management USA Corp has acquired a new stake in The Kroger Co. (NYSE:KR) during the second quarter, purchasing 48,328 shares valued at approximately $3.47 million. Several other institutional investors have also adjusted their holdings in Kroger, contributing to 80.93% institutional ownership. Analyst ratings for Kroger are generally positive, with a consensus of "Moderate Buy" and an average target price of $73.39.

title: Here is What to Know Beyond Why Amazon.com, Inc. (AMZN) is a Trending Stock
summary: This article analyzes Amazon.com, Inc. (AMZN)'s stock performance and future prospects beyond its trending status. It delves into earnings estimate revisions, revenue growth forecasts, and valuation, concluding that Amazon's Zacks Rank #2 (Buy) suggests potential outperformance in the near term. The analysis utilizes Zacks' proprietary tools to assess the company's financial health.

title: How AWS No‑Code AI Launch And ShareFile Synergies At Progress Software (PRGS) Have Changed Its Investment Story
summary: Progress Software (PRGS) has significantly evolved its investment profile by launching its no-code Agentic RAG platform on AWS Marketplace and integrating ShareFile, boosting recurring revenue and expense savings. These strategic moves pivot the company towards higher-margin, SaaS-based income, marking AI as central to its future growth. The article explores how these developments impact Progress Software's valuation and the associated risks.

title: EPAM (NYSE: EPAM) debuts 7 industry AI agents on Google Cloud Marketplace platform
summary: EPAM Systems announced the availability of seven production-ready AI agents on Google Cloud Marketplace, built with support for Gemini Enterprise and Agent-to-Agent (A2A) protocol. These agents cater to various industry use cases, including finance, healthcare, and retail, offering solutions like KYC automation, clinical document authoring, and SQL query optimization. This initiative expands EPAM's AI footprint and continues its strategy of cloud- and AI-centric collaborations, following strong Q3 results.

title: Analysts Boost Centessa Pharmaceuticals plc (CNTA) Price Targets as Sleep Disorder Drug Shows Breakthrough Results
summary: Centessa Pharmaceuticals plc (CNTA) has seen its price targets boosted by analysts following impressive Phase 2 data for its sleep disorder drug, ORX750. The drug demonstrated strong wake-promoting effects and benefits in narcolepsy type 2 and idiopathic hypersomnia, leading analysts to highlight Centessa's potential lead in the growing market for orexin-based therapies. While acknowledging CNTA's growth potential, the article also promotes a separate AI stock with significant upside.

title: Microsoft to invest more than $5.4 billion in Canada to boost AI infrastructure
summary: Microsoft announced investments of over C$7.5 billion ($5.42 billion) in Canada over the next two years to enhance its artificial intelligence infrastructure, contributing to a total estimated investment of C$19 billion in the country between 2023 and 2027. This move is part of the company's global strategy to expand cloud computing capacity for AI workloads. Microsoft will also expand its Azure Local cloud offering in Canada, partner with Canadian AI startup Cohere, and establish a "Threat Intelligence Hub" for cybersecurity and AI security research.

title: Jefferies Reaffirms Buy on VAALCO (EGY) Despite Q3 Revenue Miss
summary: Jefferies has reaffirmed its Buy rating on VAALCO Energy, Inc. (NYSE:EGY) and maintained its price target, even as the company missed Q3 2025 revenue and adjusted EPS estimates. The revenue miss was attributed to lower realized pricing and sales volume due to a planned maintenance shutdown. Despite the setbacks, VAALCO declared a quarterly cash dividend and increased its credit facility commitments, signaling confidence in future growth.

title: Evercore ISI Adjusts Price Target on FedEx to $275 From $239, Maintains In Line Rating
summary: Evercore ISI has raised its price target for FedEx (FDX) to $275 from $239, while maintaining an "In Line" rating for the company. This adjustment reflects an updated outlook on the shipping giant's valuation by the Evercore ISI analyst team. The new price target is slightly below the current average target price of $275.14 among analysts.

title: Republican Senator Asks DOJ and Homeland Security to Investigate PDD Holdings Inc.’s (PDD) TEMU
summary: Senator Tom Cotton has requested the Department of Justice and Homeland Security to investigate PDD Holdings Inc.'s Temu and Shein for intellectual property theft and counterfeiting. Temu has faced similar accusations from the European Commission and is working to comply with EU rules. Despite these challenges, Benchmark has maintained a "Buy" rating on PDD Holdings (PDD).

title: Microsoft vows to protect ‘digital sovereignty’ in $7.5-billion Canadian data-centre expansion
summary: Microsoft plans to invest over $7.5 billion in Canada for data-centre expansion, emphasizing a commitment to "digital sovereignty." This initiative includes keeping data within Canadian borders and resisting demands to discontinue services to government clients. The investment aims to address geopolitical vulnerabilities and enhance Canada's AI and cloud computing infrastructure.

title: Is Norwegian Cruise Line Holdings Ltd. (NCLH) the Lowest P/E Ratio Stock of the S&P 500 in 2025?
summary: Norwegian Cruise Line Holdings Ltd. (NCLH) is highlighted as one of the S&P 500 stocks with the lowest P/E ratios in 2025, despite recent price target reductions by Truist Securities and Wells Fargo due to concerns about supply exceeding demand in the cruise industry. Analysts maintain a generally positive outlook with a 47% upside potential, but the article suggests that certain AI stocks offer greater promise for higher and quicker returns, promoting a paid report on such opportunities.

title: QDVO ETF Price Targets $35 as Nasdaq Rally Boosts 9.8% Yield
summary: The Amplify CWP Growth & Income ETF (QDVO) is trading at $29.30, demonstrating strong performance with a 9.82% yield and a 17.95% annual return, outperforming peers like JEPQ. Its tactical covered call strategy and concentration in mega-cap tech stocks like Apple, NVIDIA, and Microsoft position it favorably for continued growth, with analysts setting near-term price targets of $32.50 and a medium-term target of $35.00. The fund is seen as a "Strong Buy" due to its hybrid growth-income design, robust yield, and strategic alignment with projected AI-driven earnings growth and anticipated Fed rate cuts in 2026.

title: Marvell Technology CEO addresses reports the company lost business from Amazon and Microsoft
summary: Marvell Technology CEO Matt Murphy addressed recent speculation that the company lost business from major customers like Amazon and Microsoft, stating that "nothing changed" and they "didn't lose any business." He emphasized the strength of Marvell's data center business and its deep relationships with hyperscalers, calling the stock undervalued. This comes after Marvell beat estimates and announced plans to acquire Celestial AI, causing shares to climb before falling again due to the reports.

title: Is AWS Security Hub Integration Reshaping The Investment Case For Varonis Systems (VRNS)?
summary: Varonis Systems announced an integration with AWS Security Hub to unify risk visibility and automate remediation, particularly enhancing their cloud and unstructured data security offerings. This move aligns with their strategy to offer platform-based solutions that can address both finding and fixing data risks, reinforcing their long-term growth prospects despite ongoing financial losses and potential competition from larger vendors. The company projects significant revenue and earnings growth by 2028, with fair value estimates suggesting a considerable upside to its current stock price.

title: 1-800-FLOWERS.COM (FLWS) Stock Jumps 30% on AI-Focused CIO Hire: Latest News, Debt Risk and 2026 Forecast
summary: 1-800-FLOWERS.COM (FLWS) saw its stock jump 30% following the appointment of Alexander Zelikovsky as CIO, specifically tasked with accelerating AI and digital commerce initiatives. This surge comes despite the company facing significant financial challenges, including declining revenue, consistent losses, and a substantial debt load. While analysts see potential upside, the stock remains a high-risk turnaround play dependent on the new leadership's ability to execute a rapid transformation.

title: BlackRock bets on ‘pick and shovel’ trade, singling out clear winners in AI spending spree
summary: BlackRock's chief investment strategist for APAC, Ben Powell, argues that the "picks and shovels" suppliers to the AI industry, such as chipmakers, energy producers, and copper-wire manufacturers, are the clearest winners in the ongoing AI spending spree. He notes that the capital expenditure in AI infrastructure is far from peaking as tech giants continue to invest heavily. Powell believes that durable gains from the AI boom will likely come from hardware, energy, and infrastructure, rather than just model developers.
authors: Anniek Bao, Dan Murphy, Steve Sedgwick

title: eBay Encourages Buyers & Sellers To Use AI For The Holidays While Quietly Updating AI Agent Policy
summary: eBay is promoting the use of AI tools for both buyers and sellers during the holiday season, claiming they enhance the shopping experience and seller efficiency. Concurrently, eBay has quietly updated its website's backend with new policies restricting how AI agents interact with the platform, specifically prohibiting automated scraping and order placement without human review. This move reflects a dual strategy of leveraging AI for user engagement while implementing guardrails against unauthorized automation.

title: Astera Labs’ Stock Secrets: Skyrocketing or Sinking?
summary: Astera Labs Inc. (ALAB) stock has risen by 8.37%, influenced by potential collaborations with Intel and positive mentions from Amazon AWS. Despite a recent 13% stock drop and concerns about valuation, analysts from Jefferies and Stifel remain optimistic about Astera Labs' intrinsic value and growth potential. The company shows strong financial health with high gross margins and ROE but faces investor concerns regarding its high PE ratio and price-to-free-cash-flow ratio.
authors: Tim Bohen, Ben Sturgill, Ellis Hobbs

title: Morgan Stanley Explains Why Instacart Has an AI-Edge over Its Competitors
summary: Morgan Stanley suggests that Instacart (CART) is gaining an early lead in online grocery shopping due to its integration with ChatGPT, ahead of competitors like Walmart and Amazon. Analyst Brian Nowak anticipates the rise of "agentic commerce" by 2026, benefiting grocery and CPG sectors, where Instacart's real-time inventory and delivery network give it an advantage. Despite this AI edge, Nowak maintains a Hold rating on CART stock with a $48 price target.

title: Press releases
summary: This page provides a collection of press releases from Flutter Entertainment PLC, highlighting key business developments and partnerships. Recent announcements include FanDuel's prediction market platform launch, strategic collaborations with Amazon and FanDuel Sports Network, and initiatives in responsible gaming and community engagement. The releases cover a range of dates from September to December 2025 across various Flutter brands.

title: Astera Labs Stock: A Turning Tide?
summary: Astera Labs Inc. (NASDAQ: ALAB) recently experienced an 8.96% stock price increase following significant market news, including Dr. Craig H. Barratt's appointment to Intel's board and positive implications from Amazon's AWS re:Invent event. Despite a recent dip, Jefferies maintains a "Buy" rating, viewing the decline as an overreaction, while Stifel expresses confidence in Astera's NVLink prospects. The company reported strong financials with $396.29M in revenue and a 27.5% profit margin, coupled with strategic partnerships and technological advancements that analysts believe will bolster its competitive edge.
authors: Tim Bohen, Ben Sturgill, Ellis Hobbs

title: NetApp Advances EMEA & LATAM Presence with Appointment of Willem Hendrickx as Customer Demand for AI Accelerates
summary: NetApp has appointed Willem Hendrickx as Senior Vice President and General Manager, EMEA & LATAM, effective January 5, 2026. Hendrickx will lead NetApp’s business strategy and partner engagement in these regions, responding to increasing customer demand for AI-driven data infrastructure. With nearly three decades of experience, his leadership aims to strengthen NetApp's global footprint and deepen customer relationships.

title: Netflix’s A3 rating affirmed by Moody’s, outlook changed to stable
summary: Moody's Ratings has affirmed Netflix's A3 senior unsecured notes ratings and Prime-2 short-term commercial paper program rating, but changed the outlook from positive to stable. This follows Netflix's agreement to acquire Warner Bros. from Warner Bros. Discovery, a deal valued at $72 billion in equity and $82.7 billion in enterprise value, which involves a substantial increase in Netflix's debt. Moody's expects Netflix to reduce its leverage to around 2.5x within two years of the acquisition's closing, which is anticipated in 2027.

title: Blue Current Inc Closes More Than $80M Series D Extension Funding Round, Anchored by Amazon, to Deliver Industry-Leading Solid-State Batteries for Stationary Storage and Mobility Applications
summary: Blue Current Inc. has closed an $80 million Series D extension funding round, led by Amazon, with participation from Koch Disruptive Technologies, Piedmont Capital, Rusheen Capital Partners, and Allen & Company. This funding will accelerate the commercialization of Blue Current's silicon composite battery platform, designed for best-in-class safety and performance in mobility and stationary storage applications. James Hamilton, Amazon Senior Vice President, will join Blue Current's Board of Directors.

title: Where Kroger feels the heat from regional competitors
summary: Despite being the nation’s largest grocer, Kroger is encountering significant competitive pressure from regional chains like H-E-B and Publix in key markets. A Dunnhumby analysis using geolocation and customer preference data identified 74 rivals, highlighting

title: Should You Buy, Sell or Hold Oracle Stock Before Q2 Earnings?
summary: Oracle is set to report its second-quarter fiscal 2026 results on December 10, with expected revenue growth between 12-16% and EPS growth of 8-12%. Despite significant AI infrastructure expansion, including a $300 billion cloud computing agreement with OpenAI and new AI offerings, the company faces concerns regarding execution, high capital expenditures, and increased debt levels. Investors are advised to consider holding the stock or waiting for a better entry point due to premium valuations and intense competition in the cloud market.

title: JPMorgan taps Geico CEO to lead new initiative
summary: JPMorgan Chase has appointed Todd Combs, former Geico CEO and Berkshire Hathaway executive, to lead its new security and resiliency initiative. This initiative will focus on direct equity investments in critical sectors like health care, aerospace, and defense. Combs, who served on JPMorgan's board for nine years, will also be a special adviser to CEO Jamie Dimon and a member of the initiative's external advisory council which includes notable figures such as Jeff Bezos and Condoleezza Rice.

title: Perion Network enhances advertising reach with Amazon DSP integration
summary: Perion Network has integrated its Sortable content monetization platform with Amazon DSP, allowing advertisers to access Perion's premium publisher inventory programmatically through Amazon DSP. This collaboration provides advertisers with enhanced reach and access to high-quality, brand-safe inventory, while publishers can better monetize their content. The integration offers robust analytics and measurement tools for optimized campaign performance.

title: Spotify to Hike US Premium Prices to $12.99+ in Q1 2026
summary: Spotify is preparing for its third US premium price hike in as many years, expected in Q1 2026, which could push individual plans to $12.99 or higher. This move is driven by pressures from record labels, inflation, and investments in new features like audiobooks, aiming to boost profitability. The company faces mixed user reactions and competitive challenges as it seeks to balance increased revenue with user retention.

title: Here's How We'll Adjust Our ServiceNow Price Target for Stock Split
summary: ServiceNow stockholders approved a 5-for-1 stock split, effective December 18, which will cause the share price and price target to adjust. The company also announced the acquisition of identity security provider Veza to enhance its security services. These moves are expected to benefit ServiceNow through increased cloud adoption, enterprise AI usage, and cross-selling opportunities in the growing security sector.

title: Broadcom Stock Rides Market Momentum As Marvell Faces Microsoft, Amazon Setbacks
summary: Broadcom Inc. (NASDAQ: AVGO) is gaining significant momentum in the custom-chip market, driven by reports that Microsoft (NASDAQ: MSFT) may collaborate with them for future AI chip designs. This comes as Marvell Technology Inc. (NASDAQ: MRVL) faces setbacks, including concerns over losing key cloud contracts with giants like Microsoft and Amazon (NASDAQ: AMZN), leading to a sharp drop in its stock value and an analyst downgrade. Broadcom's strategic discussions with Microsoft highlight a potential shift in the competitive landscape for custom AI chips.

title: RTX’s Raytheon’s strategic collaboration with AWS
summary: Raytheon, an RTX business, has partnered with Amazon Web Services (AWS) to modernize satellite data processing and mission control architectures using cloud-native integration. This collaboration aims to equip national security and commercial space customers with the ability to overcome legacy processing bottlenecks by embedding AWS AI and ML services into the mission chain. Key enhancements include advanced constellation C2, serverless architectures, and generative AI integration, with active programs already underway for government and commercial sectors.

title: Kroger to pay $350 million to automation partner as it scales back robotic warehouses
summary: Kroger is paying its automation partner, Ocado Group, $350 million as it significantly scales back its reliance on automated customer fulfillment centers (CFCs). This decision follows a review that identified opportunities to optimize its fulfillment network, leading to the closure of several CFC facilities and the cancellation of others. Despite the reduction, Kroger plans to continue utilizing Ocado's technology in some existing CFCs and will expand its partnerships with online delivery providers like Instacart, DoorDash, and Uber Eats.

title: JPMorgan Names Todd Combs to Head US$10bn Security Drive
summary: JPMorgan Chase has appointed Todd Combs, a long-time Berkshire Hathaway executive, to lead its new Strategic Investment Group. This US$10bn initiative will focus on investments in sectors crucial to US economic and national security, including defense, aerospace, healthcare, and energy. Combs will report directly to JPMorgan CEO Jamie Dimon and will also serve as a Special Adviser to the bank's Chief and operating committee.

title: Blue Current Inc closes more than $80 million Series D extension funding round, anchored by Amazon
summary: Blue Current Inc has successfully closed a Series D extension funding round, raising over $80 million. The investment was notably anchored by Amazon, highlighting a significant strategic partnership. This funding will likely support the company's continued growth and development initiatives.

title: Blue Current Inc. Closes More Than $80M Series D Extension Funding Round, Anchored by Amazon, to Deliver Industry-Leading Solid-State Batteries for Stationary Storage and Mobility Applications
summary: Blue Current Inc. has successfully closed an over $80 million Series D extension funding round, with Amazon.com, Inc. as the anchor investor. This funding will accelerate the commercialization of Blue Current's silicon composite solid-state battery platform, designed to offer superior safety and performance for both mobility and stationary storage applications. James Hamilton, Amazon Senior Vice President and Distinguished Engineer, will join Blue Current's Board of Directors as part of this investment.

title: Recapping 2025’s flurry of major CEO moves
summary: The grocery industry saw a significant number of CEO changes in 2025, affecting major players like Kroger, Albertsons, Walmart, and Aldi. This article highlights key leadership transitions, including Rodney McMullen's resignation from Kroger and Vivek Sankaran's retirement from Albertsons, underscoring a busy year for top executive roles in the sector.

title: More evidence Zepp Pay might finally be landing in the US
summary: The latest update to the Zepp Health smartphone app, version 9.15.1, provides further indications that Zepp Pay is nearing a US rollout. Internal references confirm US support and list The Bancorp Bank as the associated financial institution, suggesting a new partnership for contactless payments. While still limited, this marks the clearest sign yet that Zepp Pay is preparing to enter the US market, potentially starting with virtual or prepaid card solutions.

title: Kroger Paying Ocado $350M Upon Robotic Warehouse Closures
summary: Kroger is paying its technology provider Ocado $350 million as it closes three e-commerce fulfillment centers in January and scraps plans for an additional facility. The grocer had previously announced plans to update its e-commerce strategy to improve customer experience and drive profitable sales growth. Despite these closures, Kroger still plans to open a new automated site in Phoenix next year.

title: NICE downgraded by Wedbush on mounting AI competition, margin pressures
summary: Wedbush downgraded Nice Ltd (NASDAQ:NICE) to "Neutral" from "Outperform," lowering its price target due to increased AI competition from both startups and major cloud providers, which makes it harder for NICE to capitalize on the growing customer experience AI market. The brokerage expressed concerns that NICE's aggressive multi-year growth targets, which involve heavy investment in agentic AI and international expansion, are coming at the expense of near-term margins and pose significant execution and profitability risks. Wedbush highlighted NICE's "one step forward, two steps back-style execution" in recent quarters and its reliance on a conversational AI partner for cloud revenue growth as reasons for moving to the sidelines.

title: Fed set for rate cut as views split over inflation, jobs as priority
summary: The Federal Reserve is expected to implement its third interest rate cut this week, facing a divided Federal Open Market Committee on whether to prioritize cooling inflation or bolstering the labor market. While some officials are concerned about persistently high inflation above the 2% target, others advocate for cuts due to signs of weakness in the labor market. The decision will likely be a 25-basis-point cut, followed by a potential pause, requiring Chair Jerome Powell to carefully manage expectations for 2026.

title: Alphabet (GOOGL) Stock: Record Highs Driven by Gemini AI and Cloud Growth
summary: Alphabet's stock has reached record highs, driven by significant growth in its Gemini AI suite and Google Cloud. The company's full-stack AI strategy, combined with strong cloud revenue and a new dividend payout, signals robust financial health despite ongoing regulatory challenges and increasing competition in both AI and cloud sectors.

title: Kroger Closes Three Robotic Centers, Ends Ocado Deal in $350M Pivot
