summary: Warner Bros. Discovery has set a November 20th deadline for nonbinding offers from Paramount Global, Comcast Corporation, and Netflix Incorporated as it formally launches a sale process. Paramount aims to acquire the entire company, while Comcast and Netflix are interested only in the film and TV studios and HBO Max. The company is also exploring a plan to split into two distinct entities to maximize value for potential buyers, highlighting the intensifying consolidation in the media industry.

title: Virgin Galactic (SPCE) Narrows Q3 Loss, Reaffirms 2026 Space Tourism Launch as Stock Trades Near Lows
summary: Virgin Galactic (SPCE) reported a narrowed Q3 2025 loss of $64 million, down from $75 million in Q3 2024, despite minimal revenue of $0.4 million. The company reaffirmed its target for flight testing of Delta-class spacecraft in Q3 2026 and commercial spaceflight in Q4 2026, with private astronaut flights following 6-8 weeks later. SPCE stock, trading around $3.31, is down over 40% year-to-date, reflecting market caution as the company continues to burn significant cash ($108 million in Q3).

title: Kroger Precision Marketing Brings New Capabilities to CPG Partners
summary: Kroger Precision Marketing (KPM) is introducing new capabilities for CPG partners, leveraging automation and AI to provide faster insights and greater precision. These innovations include AI-powered weekly performance summaries, consolidated dashboards, and self-service data orders, all designed to help CPG brands identify growth opportunities from Kroger's first-party retail data. The new features aim to enhance speed, clarity, and the ability for marketers to act on key performance trends.

title: Examining Vipshop’s True Worth After 46% Stock Surge and New Partnership News
summary: Vipshop Holdings has seen a 46% stock surge and 50.8% year-to-date increase, fueled by new partnerships and tech investments. A Discounted Cash Flow (DCF) analysis suggests an intrinsic value of $45.12 per share, indicating a 56.3% undervaluation. Additionally, its current PE ratio of 10x is well below the calculated "Fair Ratio" of 16.1x, further suggesting the stock is undervalued compared to its industry and growth prospects.

title: Apple Pay US online volumes to surpass PayPal in 2025 and beyond: analysts
summary: UBS analysts project that Apple Pay's US online transaction volumes will exceed PayPal's Branded Checkout in 2025 and beyond. This growth is anticipated due to increasing desktop adoption and expansion into third-party browsers on non-iOS devices. Apple Pay's 2024 volumes were estimated at $205 billion, representing about 6% of the total US eCommerce market.

title: Google stock split: What next for GOOGL shares?
summary: This article examines Alphabet's 20-for-1 stock split in July 2022, detailing its impact on share structure, pricing, and accessibility for traders. It discusses the reasons behind stock splits, Alphabet's previous split in 2014, and the company's latest earnings, concluding with an outlook on future stock split possibilities.

title: Applied Digital CEO says it is trying to land two more big deals
summary: Applied Digital, a data center provider, is actively pursuing two additional hyperscale customers after securing deals with CoreWeave and one unnamed hyperscaler. CEO Wes Cummins reports that these potential new deals, if landed, would significantly expand the company's capacity pipeline to potentially 4 gigawatts, generating an estimated $100 billion in lifetime value. Cummins emphasizes that Applied Digital's contracts are structured to protect the company from an "AI bubble" by ensuring customers are liable for full lease payments even if they cancel.

title: Amazon (NASDAQ: AMZN) Stock Price Prediction in 2030: Bull, Bear, & Baseline Forecasts (Nov 14)
summary: This article provides bullish, bearish, and baseline forecasts for Amazon's (NASDAQ: AMZN) stock price in 2030, analyzed by 24/7 Wall St. The predictions are based on an examination of macroeconomic factors, industry trends, Amazon’s growth metrics, and P/E ratios, focusing on e-commerce, Amazon Web Services (AWS), and advertising segments. Forecasts range from $431 (bull case) to $77 (bear case), with a baseline of $250.

title: Earnings call transcript: Ranpak Holdings misses Q3 2025 earnings expectations
summary: Ranpak Holdings (PACK) reported a wider-than-expected loss for Q3 2025, with EPS at -$0.12 against a -$0.04 forecast, despite a 4.4% year-over-year revenue increase to $99.6 million. The company's stock declined in premarket trading due to the earnings miss, though it highlighted strong North American performance and significant automation revenue growth, including strategic partnerships with Walmart and Medline. Ranpak maintains a positive long-term outlook, aiming for $800 million in revenue within five years, with automation contributing 15%.

title: Google Stock Today, Nov 13, 2025: EU Opens New Probe Into Search Practices; Waymo’s Freeway Expansion Adds Upside Narrative
summary: Google's stock is slightly down due to a new EU probe into its search practices under the Digital Markets Act, which presents a regulatory headline risk. This is contrasted by the upside narrative from Waymo's expansion of freeway robotaxi routes, which reinforces Alphabet's position in autonomous mobility and AI. The market is also impacted by thin macro visibility following the end of the U.S. government shutdown.

title: NIQ Unwraps Real-Time Insights Throughout the Holiday Season
summary: NIQ is providing real-time consumer intelligence for the 2025 holiday season, focusing on evolving shopping behaviors including early shopping, self-gifting, and a balance between online and in-store purchases. The insights highlight consumer priorities like value and connection, with Thanksgiving trends indicating a shift towards cost-saving measures such as private labels and reduced alcohol consumption. NIQ aims to equip retailers with actionable data to navigate a competitive holiday market.

title: Aterian Reports 2025 Third Quarter Financial Results and Reiterates Guidance
summary: Aterian, Inc. reported its Q3 2025 financial results, showing improved margins, reduced operating expenses, and significantly narrowed losses compared to Q2 2025. The company reiterated its guidance for the six months ending December 31, 2025, expecting net revenue between $36 million and $38 million and Adjusted EBITDA of $0 to a loss of $(1.0) million. Aterian attributed these improvements to strategic execution, including expense control, sales channel expansion, and new product introductions, despite revenue challenges from tariffs.

title: Verizon To Slash 15,000 Jobs And Shift Hundreds Of Stores To Franchises
summary: Verizon Communications plans its largest-ever workforce reduction of 15,000 jobs and will convert 200 stores to franchises to cut costs amidst intense competition. The company's new CEO, Daniel Schulman, aims to streamline operations after recent subscriber losses and mixed third-quarter results, despite reaffirming 2025 guidance.

title: KeyCorp turns Northwest as regional banks seek growth across U.S.
summary: Cleveland-based KeyCorp is focusing its growth strategy on the Northwest, a departure from many regional banks targeting the U.S. South. CEO Chris Gorman sees the Pacific Northwest as a rational market with significant wealth creation, and the company plans to increase its retail deposit share there, particularly in technology-heavy states like Washington. This strategic move includes potential acquisitions of boutique investment banks to expand capital-raising capabilities and comes as KeyCorp seeks to improve its stock performance and consumer banking footprint.
authors: Yizhu Wang and Cedric Sam, Bloomberg

title: LiveOne, Inc. (NASDAQ:LVO) Q2 2026 Earnings Call Transcript
summary: LiveOne, Inc. held its Q2 fiscal 2026 earnings call, with CEO Rob Ellin highlighting a transformative 12 months for the company. Despite losing $50 million in revenue from Tesla, LiveOne leveraged AI to cut staff and costs, expanded partnerships with Amazon and a Fortune 250 company, and reported record growth in its PodcastOne subsidiary. The company is actively converting free Tesla users to paid subscribers using AI, with plans for more B2B deals and a long-term goal of $1 billion in revenue within five years.

title: GigaCloud's Outsized Rally Negates Brilliant Execution And Cheap Acquisition (Rating Downgrade)
summary: GigaCloud Technology's stock rally has outweighed its strong Q3'25 performance and valuable acquisition, leading to a downgrade due to minimal margin of safety. Despite robust demand and efficient cash flow utilization, the current valuation is considered speculative with most upside potential already priced in. Technical indicators and inflated short interest ratio also suggest a mixed investment thesis.

title: Amazon.com, Inc. (AMZN): Our Calculation of Intrinsic Value
summary: This article presents a Discounted Cash Flow (DCF) analysis for Amazon.com, Inc. (AMZN) to determine its intrinsic value. Despite Amazon's dominant position in e-commerce, cloud computing (AWS), and AI, the analysis concludes that AMZN is currently overvalued with a negative margin of safety. The report indicates that the market has already priced in significant future growth, suggesting limited near-term margin of safety for long-term investors.

title: About Us - Great American Insurance Group - Specialty Property & Casualty Insurance
summary: Karbon-X Corp. (OTCQX: KARX) is rapidly expanding its global presence in the carbon markets by restoring mangroves in Senegal and extending its blue-carbon model to Guinea's Konkouré Delta. This expansion is enhancing biodiversity, fostering community resilience, and increasing the company's verified carbon credit assets, positioning Karbon-X for significant growth and investor appeal in the escalating voluntary carbon market.

title: IZEA Extends Profitability Momentum in Q3 2025 with $8.1 Million in Revenue
summary: IZEA Worldwide, Inc. reported its Q3 2025 financial results, showing improved profitability with a net income of $0.1 million, a significant improvement from a net loss of $8.8 million in Q3 2024. The company achieved this despite a decline in total revenue to $8.1 million, attributing the shift to a strategic focus on larger, recurring accounts and shedding unprofitable projects. Managed Services revenue increased by 5%, and Adjusted EBITDA reached $0.4 million, reflecting a strong operational turnaround.

title: “McDonald’s (MCD) Had A Very Good Quarter,” Says Jim Cramer
summary: Jim Cramer praised McDonald's Corporation (MCD) for a "very good quarter," despite reporting revenue and EPS misses. He highlighted the company's ability to lower prices due to its scale, helping it navigate a challenging restaurant sector and price-conscious consumers. Cramer contrasted McDonald's success with other chains struggling to maintain customer affordability.

title: Rivian Stock Soars To 16-Month High — Citigroup Boosts Stake, Retail Traders See ‘Next-Gen’ Opportunity In R2 SUV
summary: Rivian stock reached a 16-month high after Citigroup significantly increased its stake in the company during the third quarter. This surge also comes ahead of Rivian's Autonomy & AI Day, with retail traders expressing bullish sentiment on the Stocktwits platform, particularly regarding the potential of the upcoming R2 SUV. Analysts expect the AI Day to focus on practical driver-assist features rather than full self-driving, and strong institutional support for Rivian continues with major holdings by Amazon and Volkswagen.

title: Kirkland’s Home decor store to close in Jess Ranch Marketplace in Apple Valley
summary: Kirkland's Home decor store in Apple Valley's Jess Ranch Marketplace is slated for closure by year-end, specifically by December 27th, unless inventory sells out sooner. This closure aligns with Bed Bath & Beyond's strategy to convert some Kirkland's Home locations into Bed Bath & Beyond stores and expand Kirkland's Home into the wholesale market. Despite this, Bed Bath & Beyond will not open brick-and-mortar locations in California, serving the state solely through delivery.

title: GrowGeneration beats Q3 2025 forecasts, stock falls
summary: GrowGeneration (GRWG) reported stronger-than-expected Q3 2025 results, with a narrower loss per share and higher revenue, yet its stock declined over 6% in after-hours trading due to investor concerns over future guidance. The company demonstrated sequential net sales growth and improved gross margins, driven by a strategic shift towards proprietary brands and diversification beyond the cannabis market. Management emphasized financial stability with $48.3 million in cash and no debt, and anticipates positive revenue growth and Adjusted EBITDA in 2026.

title: LiveOne (Nasdaq: LVO) Reports $38M Six-Month Revenue and
summary: LiveOne (Nasdaq: LVO) reported $38 million in six-month revenue and $36.6 million in Audio Division revenue, achieving over $1.1 million in Adjusted EBITDA. The company leveraged AI efficiencies to significantly reduce quarterly operating expenses from $22 million to $6 million and staff from 350 to 95. These financial highlights were accompanied by strategic growth, including numerous B2B deals, an expanded Amazon partnership, and plans for new B2B initiatives and an upcoming live event.

title: Hour Loop Reports Third Quarter of 2025 Results
summary: Hour Loop, Inc. announced its financial and operational results for the third quarter ended September 30, 2025, showing increased net revenues and net income despite economic challenges and tariffs. The company reported a 7.6% increase in net revenues to $33.4 million and net income of $0.53 million, attributing the success to strategic investments, operational efficiency improvements, and inventory management. Hour Loop, an online retailer, plans to continue expanding its business by increasing managers, vendors, and SKUs, though it is not providing full-year 2025 guidance due to economic uncertainty.

title: ChipMOS bullish on AI memory drive
summary: Chip packaging services provider ChipMOS Technologies Inc expects 2026 to be a promising year for the global memory industry, driven by strong demand for chips used in artificial intelligence (AI) data centers. The company plans to moderately expand DRAM and flash memory packaging capacity to meet customer demand, while also considering raising prices due to increasing costs of raw materials. ChipMOS recorded a net profit of NT$352.2 million last quarter, an increase from a net loss in the second quarter.

title: Earnings call transcript: FTC Solar Q3 2025 sees stock surge 33%
summary: FTC Solar (FTCI) reported a strong Q3 2025 with revenue up 157% year-over-year to $26 million, achieving its first positive gross margin since late 2023. The company's stock surged over 33% in pre-market trading, reflecting investor confidence. Strategic moves include a $37 million term loan and acquiring full ownership of Alpha Steel, and the company expects to be adjusted EBITDA positive for the full year in 2026.

title: Palantir Q3 2025 Results: Record Growth, AI Platform Drives Adoption - News and Statistics
summary: Palantir Technologies (PLTR) reported "eye-popping growth" in its Q3 2025 earnings, exceeding Wall Street estimates, primarily driven by its Artificial Intelligence Platform (AIP). Despite this strong performance and a record-high Rule of 40 score of 114%, the company's stock price declined, reflecting broader market nervousness and concerns about an AI bubble. Wedbush analyst Dan Ives, however, remains highly positive, predicting a 120% increase to a $1 trillion valuation within three years, comparing Palantir's U.S. commercial growth to early Salesforce and Amazon Web Services.

title: Oracle Rises 44.5% YTD on Cloud Strength: Buy the Stock Now or Hold?
summary: Oracle's shares have surged 44.5% year-to-date in 2025, driven by significant growth in its cloud infrastructure business, with first-quarter fiscal 2026 results showing remarkable potential. The company projects aggressive cloud infrastructure revenue growth through fiscal 2030, supported by new contracts and AI strategies, despite operating in a highly competitive cloud market. While existing investors might hold, the article suggests new investors should await a better entry point due to Oracle's premium valuation and execution risks.

title: Amazon Fights Prime Video User Bid To Revive Privacy Suit 11/12/2025
summary: Amazon is asking an appellate court to uphold the dismissal of a lawsuit claiming the company violated a federal video privacy law by sharing Prime Video user data with corporate affiliates. The lawsuit, filed by Virginia and Louisiana residents, alleges that Amazon Services disclosed personally identifiable information to its parent company, Amazon Inc., without user consent. Amazon argues that the allegations do not prove actual disclosure and that storing data is not equivalent to disclosing it.

title: Nvidia is seeing the largest losses among the 'Magnificent Seven' stocks
summary: Nvidia experienced the largest losses among the 'Magnificent Seven' stocks on Tuesday, with a decline of around 3.1%. This downturn follows bearish sentiment from notable investors such as Michael Burry, who bought put options, and Softbank, which exited its $5.8 billion position in Nvidia. While six of the "Magnificent Seven" stocks were down, Apple Inc. was the only one trading higher.

title: Apple shares hit new all-time closing high
summary: Apple Inc. (AAPL) shares reached a new all-time closing high of $275.25 on Tuesday, November 11, 2025, representing a 2.16% increase. The company's market value stands at $4.067 trillion, making it the world's second-most valuable publicly-traded company. This article details Apple's stock performance and lists market valuations of other major tech companies.

title: Infios Recognized as Customers’ Choice in 2025 Gartner® Peer Insights™ Voice of the Customer for Warehouse Management Systems
summary: Infios has been recognized as a Customers’ Choice in the 2025 Gartner Peer Insights™ Voice of the Customer for Warehouse Management Systems (WMS), marking them as the only vendor to receive this distinction. This recognition follows Infios being named a Leader in the 2025 Gartner® Magic Quadrant™ for WMS for the seventh consecutive year, underscoring their commitment to customer satisfaction and the value of their intelligent supply chain solutions. Customers rated Infios an average of 4.5 out of 5 based on 32 reviews as of August 31, 2025, placing them in the coveted Customers’ Choice quadrant.

title: Goldman CEO David Solomon warns ‘there will be a reckoning’ around the $38 trillion national debt
summary: Goldman Sachs CEO David Solomon has issued a strong warning about the U.S. national debt, which has reached $38 trillion, stating that a "reckoning" is inevitable if the current fiscal trajectory continues without substantial economic growth. Solomon suggests that focusing on economic expansion, driven by technology and infrastructure investments, is a more viable solution than increasing taxes to manage the debt. He acknowledges a positive short-term economic outlook but emphasizes the long-term danger of unsustainable debt.

title: Ken Washington Joins TE Connectivity Board of Directors
summary: Dr. Ken Washington has been appointed to TE Connectivity's board of directors, effective November 17, 2025, bringing decades of technological leadership and innovation experience. He previously held senior roles at Medtronic plc, Amazon Lab126, Ford Motor Company, Lockheed Martin Corporation, and Sandia National Laboratories. His extensive background in various industries, including automotive, defense, healthcare, and consumer technology, is expected to strengthen TE Connectivity's strategic initiatives.

title: Earnings call transcript: iHeartMedia Q3 2025 revenue beats forecast, stock dips
summary: iHeartMedia (IHRT) reported Q3 2025 revenue of $997.01 million, exceeding forecasts, but its stock declined 1.51% due to investor concerns over annual performance and high debt levels. Despite a 1.1% YoY revenue decrease, the Digital Audio Group saw a 13.5% growth, signaling a successful shift to digital platforms. The company aims to return its multi-platform group to revenue growth through digital monetization and cost-cutting measures, expecting strong podcasting growth and a robust political advertising cycle in 2026.

title: Ken Washington appointed to TE Connectivity board of directors By Investing.com
summary: TE Connectivity plc announced Ken Washington will join its board of directors effective November 17, 2025. Washington brings extensive technology leadership experience from Medtronic, Amazon Lab126, Ford Motor Company, Lockheed Martin, and Sandia National Laboratories. The company, valued at $73.23 billion, has shown strong financial performance with a 71.62% year-to-date return and 19 consecutive years of dividend payments.

title: U.S. Equities Lag International in 2025: 5 Top ETF Performers
summary: In 2025, international equities, particularly those tracked by the iShares MSCI ACWI ex US ETF (ACWX), have significantly outperformed U.S. equities, represented by the SPDR S&P 500 ETF Trust (SPY). This shift is attributed to investor skepticism regarding American assets due to uncertain U.S. policy sentiment following events like "Liberation Day," and concerns about tech concentration and overvaluation in the U.S. market. The article highlights the cheaper valuation of international equities and lists five top-performing international equity ETFs of 2025.

title: PepsiCo Ramps Up AI and Digitization Efforts: Real Gains or Hype?
summary: PepsiCo is significantly increasing its investment in AI and digitization across its entire value chain to enhance efficiency, agility, and competitive advantage. The company is partnering with tech giants like Amazon Web Services and Salesforce to implement AI in areas such as product innovation, supply-chain management, marketing, and sales. Other beverage companies like Coca-Cola and Anheuser-Busch InBev are also adopting similar digital transformation strategies to strengthen consumer connections and improve operational efficiency.

title: Earnings call transcript: Fold Holdings reports Q3 2025 revenue growth, stock dips
summary: Fold Holdings Inc. (FOLD) reported a 41% year-over-year revenue increase to $7.4 million for Q3 2025 and a GAAP net income of $0.6 million, a significant turnaround from a $62.3 million net loss in Q3 2024. Despite this growth and the expansion of its Bitcoin-related financial services, including the upcoming Bitcoin Rewards Credit Card and gift cards, the stock dipped 4.85% in aftermarket trading. The company emphasized its strong focus on Bitcoin-centric products and strategic partnerships for future growth, aiming for general access to its credit card in Q1 2026.

title: Idexx Laboratories Insider Sold Shares Worth $6,629,014, According to a Recent SEC Filing
summary: An insider at Idexx Laboratories sold shares valued at $6,629,014, as reported in a recent SEC filing. The company also saw several analyst price target adjustments in early November, with most firms maintaining buy or overweight ratings. This transaction and the analyst activity provide insight into recent movements concerning Idexx Laboratories stock.

title: InterDigital sues Amazon over video-compression patents
summary: InterDigital has filed a lawsuit against Amazon in Delaware federal court, alleging that Amazon violated its patent rights related to digital video technology. This lawsuit follows Amazon's earlier legal actions against InterDigital in the UK and Brazil amidst licensing negotiations. InterDigital is also pursuing related lawsuits in Brazil and Germany, seeking monetary damages and a court order to prevent further infringement by Amazon's streaming services.

title: Microsoft bets on influencers like Alix Earle to close the gap with ChatGPT
summary: Microsoft is leveraging popular social media influencers like Alix Earle, Brigette and Danielle Pheloung, and Brandon Edelman to promote its Copilot chatbot to a younger, consumer audience. The strategy aims to boost Copilot's user base, which currently lags behind competitors like ChatGPT and Gemini, by having influencers portray the AI assistant as a versatile lifestyle tool. Despite skepticism from some analysts, Microsoft's CMO believes the campaign is effectively driving engagement and usage among target demographics.

title: Amazon's $150 Billion AI Capex Surge Could Force Its First Big Bond Deal In Years
summary: Amazon, despite its strong cash position, may need to issue its first major bond deal since 2021 to fund an estimated $150 billion in AI and data center spending by FY26. JPMorgan projects this surge in capital expenditure across the tech sector, with hyperscalers potentially issuing $1.5 trillion in new investment-grade bonds over the next five years, signaling a significant shift in corporate finance for AI development.

title: Alphabet Inc. $GOOG is Panview Capital Ltd's 5th Largest Position
summary: Panview Capital Ltd reduced its stake in Alphabet Inc. ($GOOG) by 22.4% during Q2, yet Alphabet remains its 5th largest holding, constituting 9.8% of its investment portfolio. This article details institutional and insider trading activity, Alphabet's price performance, recent earnings, dividend announcement, and analyst ratings for the company.

title: Verizon: 21 Years Connecting the Dow Jones
summary: This article examines Verizon's 21-year tenure as a Dow Jones Industrial Average component, detailing its stock performance before and after inclusion, recent financial results, and strategic initiatives. It highlights Verizon's consistent dividend payouts and its role as a steady, if low-growth, telecom pillar within the index. The piece concludes that despite competitive pressures, Verizon offers stability, solid cash flows, and a rising income stream for long-term investors.

title: Amazon.com Inc. (AMZN) Stock: Rises as Low-Cost 'Bazaar' Service Expands to 14 Global Markets
summary: Amazon's stock rose 0.3% after the company announced the global expansion of its low-cost retail platform, Amazon Bazaar, to 14 new markets. This expansion, aimed at competing with Shein and Temu, offers ultra-cheap products and is seen by analysts as a strategic move to penetrate emerging e-commerce markets. Despite typically taking years to achieve profitability in new regions, the success of low-cost items could allow Bazaar to expand globally beyond its current core markets.

title: Atour Lifestyle Holdings Limited Announces Board Changes with Resignation of Cong Lin and Appointment of Yingchun Song
summary: Atour Lifestyle Holdings Limited announced that Mr. Cong Lin resigned from his positions as a director and committee member due to personal reasons, effective November 10, 2025. Following his resignation, the Board appointed Mr. Yingchun Song as a new director and member of both the Audit Committee and the Nominating and Corporate Governance Committee. Mr. Song brings extensive experience in retail chain management and brand operations, including his roles as chairman of Wuhan Today Dream Trading and director at the Alibaba Foundation.

title: Costco Wholesale Corporation $COST Shares Bought by Connor Clark & Lunn Investment Management Ltd.
summary: Connor Clark & Lunn Investment Management Ltd. significantly increased its stake in Costco Wholesale Corporation (NASDAQ:COST) by 141.8% in the Q2, owning shares worth $38.899 million. The article details various other institutional investors who adjusted their positions in COST, alongside the company's stock performance, recent earnings, dividend announcements, and analyst ratings. It also includes information on recent insider transactions by Costco executives.

title: Adobe (ADBE) Reports Surge in October E-commerce Spending
summary: Adobe (ADBE) reported a significant 8.2% year-over-year increase in online consumer spending for October, reaching $88.7 billion, with mobile platforms accounting for over half of this growth. The "Buy Now Pay Later" option also saw a notable rise, contributing $7.1 billion. Despite potential undervaluation indicated by its P/E, P/S, and P/B ratios near historical lows, Adobe maintains robust financial health and a positive analyst sentiment for a "Buy" rating.

title: Earnings call transcript: Viant Technology beats Q3 2025 earnings expectations
summary: Viant Technology Inc. (DSP) surpassed Q3 2025 earnings expectations with an EPS of $0.06 and revenue of $85.58 million, significantly exceeding forecasts. The company's stock rose 1.63% in after-hours trading, reflecting strong investor confidence. Key drivers included 7% YoY revenue growth, a 9% YoY increase in Adjusted EBITDA, and successful launches of its AI product suite, positioning Viant for continued growth in the digital advertising market.

title: SenesTech’s Rat Control Sales Grew, But Revenue Fell Short
summary: SenesTech's Evolve rodent birth control sales increased significantly, leading to a 43% revenue jump year-over-year in Q3, despite falling short of Wall Street estimates. The company is focusing on profitable growth through strong e-commerce and municipal contracts, with analysts maintaining a positive outlook. This growth highlights increasing demand for sustainable pest control solutions, particularly in urban areas.

title: What's Going On With Plug Power Stock Today?
summary: Plug Power (NASDAQ: PLUG) shares traded lower after the company reported third-quarter results showing improved operational discipline and narrowing losses, beating EPS expectations. The company is pushing for profitability by scaling its hydrogen network, tightening spending, and expects to achieve gross-margin breakeven by late 2025 and positive EBITDA by the second half of 2026. Plug Power also signed a long-term hydrogen supply arrangement and is focusing on higher-return projects.

title: ETF Investors Bet On Retail Revival As Holiday Spending Set To Hit Record High
summary: As the holiday season approaches, ETF investors are showing increased interest in retail-focused funds, anticipating record U.S. holiday sales ranging from $1.01 trillion to $1.02 trillion. This optimism is fueled by resilient consumer demand, early promotions, and cooling inflation. Notable ETFs like VanEck Retail ETF (RTH) and Global X E-commerce ETF (EBIZ) are gaining traction, offering diversified exposure to both traditional and digital retail segments.

title: Cathie Wood Bets Big On Jack Dorsey's Bitcoin-Heavy Block, Adds Amazon And Alibaba — Sells Shopify, Surging Palantir
summary: Cathie Wood's Ark Invest made significant trades, purchasing shares in Amazon, Block Inc., and Alibaba Group Holding Ltd., while selling shares of Shopify and Palantir Inc. These moves reflect strategic bets on companies like Block with substantial Bitcoin holdings and Alibaba's AI advancements, alongside reductions in positions like Palantir which has seen recent surges.

title: This Congresswoman’s Bet on Amazon.com (AMZN) Was Profitable
summary: Congresswoman Marjorie Taylor Greene made a profitable investment in Amazon.com (AMZN) shares in October, coinciding with a post-earnings spike driven by strong AWS growth. Mairs & Power Balanced Fund also initiated a position in Amazon in Q2 2025, recognizing its market leadership in retail and cloud business. While acknowledging AMZN's potential, the article suggests focusing on other AI stocks with higher return promise and lower downside risk.

title: Cypress Funds Llc Reduces Stake in Amazon
summary: Cypress Funds Llc, managed by Steven Baum, significantly reduced its stake in Amazon.Com, Inc. by selling 69,809 shares. TipRanks' AI Analyst, Spark, rates AMZN as an "Outperform" due to strong financial performance and positive earnings sentiment, though technical analysis warns of potential overbought conditions. The high valuation of Amazon reflects growth expectations but might deter value investors.

title: Panview Capital Ltd Sells 51,000 Shares of Deckers Outdoor Corporation $DECK
summary: Panview Capital Ltd reduced its stake in Deckers Outdoor Corporation by 19.7% in Q2 2025, selling 51,000 shares and now holding 207,900 shares valued at $21.43 million. Deckers Outdoor reported strong Q3 earnings, beating analyst estimates with $1.82 EPS and $1.43 billion revenue, and provided optimistic FY2026 guidance. The stock faces mixed analyst ratings, with an average target price of $118.11 despite recent price target cuts from some firms.

title: Global Business Travel Group, Inc. (NYSE:GBTG) Q3 2025 Earnings Call Transcript
summary: Global Business Travel Group, Inc. (NYSE: GBTG) reported outstanding Q3 2025 results, with Total Transaction Value (TTV) growing 23% and revenue increasing by 13%. The company also announced the acquisition of CWT, which significantly boosts its top line and SME business, and a strategic alliance with SAP Concur for a new travel and expense solution. GBTG raised its full-year 2025 guidance and provided preliminary expectations for 2026, underlining confidence in continued growth through strategic initiatives and AI integration.

title: Soltis Investment Advisors LLC Lowers Stock Position in The Kroger Co. $KR
summary: Soltis Investment Advisors LLC significantly reduced its stake in The Kroger Co. by 96.2% in Q2, selling 119,807 shares and retaining 4,683 shares valued at approximately $336,000. Despite this, analyst sentiment for Kroger remains a "Moderate Buy" with an average price target of $74.50. The company recently reported strong quarterly EPS, set positive FY2025 guidance, and announced a $0.35 quarterly dividend.

title: Cincinnati Financial Corp Buys 38,000 Shares of NextEra Energy, Inc. $NEE
summary: Cincinnati Financial Corp increased its stake in NextEra Energy, Inc. by 79.2%, purchasing 38,000 additional shares, bringing its total holdings to 86,000 shares valued at approximately $5.97 million. The article details other institutional investments, analyst ratings indicating a "Moderate Buy" with an average price target of $90.22, and recent financial performance including an EPS beat and dividend announcement. It also covers insider trading activities involving the sale of shares by company executives.

title: Aviva PLC Has $87.71 Million Position in Prologis, Inc. $PLD
summary: Aviva PLC significantly increased its holdings in Prologis, Inc. ($PLD) by 6.2% during Q2, bringing its total position to $87.71 million. Other institutional investors like Vanguard Group and Goldman Sachs also adjusted their stakes, with institutional investors owning 93.50% of the stock. The article also details recent insider selling, analyst ratings, and Prologis's financial performance and dividend announcement.

title: Costco Wholesale Corporation $COST Shares Sold by 1ST Source Bank
summary: 1ST Source Bank reduced its stake in Costco Wholesale Corporation by 2.8% during the second quarter, selling 332 shares. Other institutional investors adjusted their positions, while company insiders Russell D. Miller and Tiffany Marie Barbre also sold significant amounts of shares. The article also details Costco's stock performance, recent earnings, dividend announcement, and current analyst ratings.

title: Criteo abandons France to enable potential U.S. acquisition
summary: Criteo S.A. is moving its legal headquarters from France to Luxembourg by Q3 2026 to bypass French corporate law restrictions on direct mergers with U.S. corporations, which currently hinder potential acquisition by American buyers. This strategic move aims to provide greater strategic flexibility and potential U.S. stock index eligibility, with a potential redomiciliation to the U.S. as early as Q1 2027. The announcement coincided with strong Q3 2025 financial results, including $470 million in revenue and 552% growth in net income.

title: Xylem and Amazon to save 1.3 billion liters annually with smart water upgrades in Mexico
summary: Xylem and Amazon are partnering with Mexico City and Monterrey to implement smart water upgrades using Xylem Vue technology. These upgrades are projected to save over 1.3 billion liters of water annually by detecting leaks, managing pressure, and improving water supply reliability in water-stressed urban areas. This initiative highlights the role of public-private collaboration and advanced technology in enhancing urban water management and resilience.

title: Pinterest CEO touts open source AI: ‘tremendous performance’ with reduced costs
summary: Pinterest's CEO, Bill Ready, stated the company is achieving "tremendous performance" from open-source AI models for visual AI, which significantly reduces costs compared to proprietary models. This strategy helps the company manage expenses as it expands AI use cases for personalized recommendations, search, and the new Pinterest Assistant. Despite near-term revenue concerns expressed during their Q3 earnings call, Ready believes open-source AI will be key to managing costs while advancing agentic commerce and shopping experiences.

title: Taiwan’s supply chain role unwavering: Nvidia CEO
summary: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang emphasized Taiwan's unwavering role in the global semiconductor supply chain, particularly praising TSMC. He highlighted AI's transformative impact and Taiwan's pivotal position in its development, noting strong demand for Nvidia's advanced chips and ongoing collaboration with TSMC and memory makers.

title: TNL Mediagene (NASDAQ: TNMG) Leverages AWS AI Technologies to Drive Cross-Border Media Innovation
summary: TNL Mediagene is adopting Amazon Web Services (AWS) AI services to enhance cross-border content creation and publishing efficiency, setting a new standard for media collaboration across regions. The company's AI applications include real-time sports coverage and multilingual recipe translations, demonstrating significant efficiency gains and multi-scenario adoption, helping to reshape how content is created, distributed, and governed across Asia. In FY2024, TNL Mediagene's AI-driven Technology business unit contributed $14.2 million to consolidated revenue, representing 29% of total revenue and growing 34% annually.

title: Liberty All-Star® Equity Fund September 2025 Monthly Update
summary: This article provides the September 2025 monthly update for the Liberty All-Star Equity Fund (NYSE: USA). It details the fund's investment approach, lists its top 20 holdings, presents monthly performance figures including NAV and market price, and outlines the sector breakdown of its equity portfolio. The update also includes information on new holdings and a description of closed-end fund terminology.

title: iHeartMedia, Inc. Reports Results for 2025 Third Quarter
summary: iHeartMedia, Inc. reported its financial results for the Q3 2025, with consolidated revenue of $997 million, a 1.1% decrease, but up 2.8% excluding political revenue. The company achieved a consolidated Adjusted EBITDA of $205 million, while the Digital Audio Group saw significant growth with revenue up 14% and Adjusted EBITDA up 30%. iHeartMedia also announced new partnerships with Amazon Ads and TikTok to expand its reach and leverage its audio portfolio.

title: Docebo Inc. (NASDAQ:DCBO) Q3 2025 Earnings Call Transcript
summary: Docebo Inc. (NASDAQ:DCBO) Q3 2025 earnings call transcript details the company's strong performance, exceeding earnings expectations with EPS of $0.3436 against forecasts of $0.34. The company highlighted 14% year-over-year ARR growth excluding the Dayforce business, significant wins with federal customers after FedRAMP listing, and continued success in the mid-market and enterprise segments. Discussions also covered the planned wind-down of the Dayforce OEM contract, with projections for its diminishing contribution to revenue, and Docebo's strategy for AI monetization, emphasizing a credit-based system for new modules like AI Virtual Coach.

title: Is the Options Market Predicting a Spike in BayCom Stock?
summary: Investors in BayCom Corp (BCML) should pay attention to options market activity, particularly the Dec. 19, 2025 $22.5 Put, which recently showed high implied volatility. While this suggests expectations of a significant price movement, analysts currently rate BayCom as a Zacks Rank #4 (Sell), with declining earnings estimates. This discrepancy between high implied volatility and analyst sentiment could indicate a potential trading opportunity for options traders who sell premium.

title: Progressive Investment Management Corp Reduces Amazon Holdings
summary: Progressive Investment Management Corp, managed by Carsten Henningsen, has reduced its holdings in Amazon.Com, Inc. by 1,397 shares. TipRanks' AI Analyst, Spark, rates AMZN as an Outperform due to strong financial performance, positive earnings call sentiment, and a bullish technical outlook, though it notes potential overbought conditions and high valuation.

title: SentinelOne’s chief legal officer sells $97k in stock
summary: SentinelOne's Chief Legal Officer, Conder Keenan Michael, sold 5,871 shares of Class A Common Stock for $97,224 on November 6, 2025, to cover tax withholding obligations. Following this transaction, Michael still holds 573,536 shares. The company has also been actively expanding, securing integrations with AWS, receiving a $2 million CISA award, appointing a new president of product and technology, and acquiring Prompt Security and Observo, Inc., leading one analyst to reiterate a Market Outperform rating.

title: QDVO ETF (NYSEARCA:QDVO) Targets $35 in 2025 and $42 in 2026 — 9.3% Yield, 28.6% Total Return
summary: The Amplify CWP Growth & Income ETF (NYSEARCA:QDVO) is positioned for significant growth in 2025 and 2026, targeting $35 and $42 respectively, driven by its exposure to AI-centric megacaps and a high 9.3% yield. Its active management allows for tactical covered-call execution, outperforming peers in total return while benefiting from falling interest rates and strong AI capital expenditures. The ETF offers a compelling blend of income and growth, making it a "BUY" recommendation for investors seeking yield without sacrificing growth.

title: UiPath Shares Fall Amid Legal Scrutiny and Insider Trades
summary: UiPath Inc. shares have fallen by 8.69% due to concerns over Amazon's competition and a legal investigation into potential breaches of fiduciary duties by company officers. CEO Daniel Dines has sold over 135,000 shares worth more than $2.25 million, though he still retains significant control. These events, coupled with the company's slim profit margin despite high revenue, are causing investor anxiety and raising questions about UiPath's future trajectory.
authors: Tim Bohen, Ben Sturgill, Ellis Hobbs

title: BATS:SPYI — Double-Digit Yield, Option Discipline, and Capital Rotation Tailwinds
summary: The NEOS S&P 500 High Income ETF (BATS:SPYI) offers an 11.67% yield with monthly payouts, making it attractive to investors seeking income as the Fed prepares for rate cuts. SPYI uses a unique 'credit-spread' option strategy to generate high yield while retaining some upside potential, setting it apart from traditional covered-call ETFs. With a favorable tax structure and growing institutional confidence, SPYI is positioned as a strong income-generating option, especially for retirees and yield-focused investors.

title: Short Interest in Incannex Healthcare Inc. (NASDAQ:IXHL) Grows By 89.2%
summary: Incannex Healthcare Inc. (NASDAQ:IXHL) experienced a substantial 89.2% increase in short interest, reaching 10,160,000 shares as of October 15th. The stock's short-interest ratio is 0.1 days with 3.7% of its shares short sold. Analysts generally rate IXHL as a "Sell," with its shares opening at $0.38 and a market capitalization of $131.09 million.

title: EverQuote (EVER) Q3 Earnings Beat: Stock Surges on Revenue Growth - News and Statistics
summary: EverQuote (NASDAQ:EVER) saw its stock surge by 11.4% after reporting strong third-quarter earnings that surpassed analyst expectations. The online insurance marketplace reported revenue of $173.9 million, a 20.3% year-over-year increase, and earnings per share of $0.50, significantly higher than the $0.38 forecast. The company also provided an optimistic revenue outlook for the fourth quarter, further boosting investor confidence.

title: Texas Wealth Firm Exits Goldman’s High-Yield Nasdaq ETF After Strong Run
summary: B&D White Capital Company, a Texas-based wealth advisory, fully exited its stake in the Goldman Sachs Nasdaq-100 Premium Income ETF (GPIQ), selling 351,699 shares for an estimated $17.5 million. This move represents a shift away from high-yield, options-based equity strategies and aligns with the firm's philosophy of long-term diversification over yield chasing. The firm also liquidated its holding in Goldman's S&P 500 Premium Income ETF (GPIX), indicating a broader strategy change rather than a bearish view on GPIQ itself.

title: Gaxos (GXAI) adds Photoshoots to Art-Gen: studio-grade AI images, instant animation
summary: Gaxos Labs launched "Photoshoots" for its Art-Gen AI platform, enabling the creation of cinematic, studio-quality images and instant animations from photos or concepts. This update introduces a new workflow for continuity, subject-likeness preservation, and creative direction, positioning GXAI for revenue expansion within the rapidly growing creator economy. The company projects the creator economy to reach $480 billion by 2027, with Photoshoots aimed at capturing a share of this market through enhanced content creation tools.

title: Elon Musk’s SpaceX explores acquisition of Globalstar - report
summary: SpaceX, led by Elon Musk, is reportedly considering acquiring Globalstar, an Apple-backed satellite operator, leading to a significant increase in Globalstar's share price. The potential acquisition would integrate Globalstar's extensive satellite network with SpaceX's ambitions in the commercial 5G and satellite phone markets, intensifying competition in the direct-to-device segment. However, the leak of these discussions and the subsequent market impact could complicate the negotiation process.

title: Amazon Investigation Initiated By Former Louisiana Attorney General: Kahn Swick & Foti, LLC Investigates the Officers and Directors of Amazon.com, Inc. - AMZN
summary: Kahn Swick & Foti, LLC (KSF), led by former Louisiana Attorney General Charles C. Foti, Jr., has launched an investigation into the officers and directors of Amazon.com, Inc. (NasdaqGS: AMZN). This investigation follows a settlement between Amazon and the Federal Trade Commission (FTC) regarding allegations of enrolling consumers in Prime without consent and making cancellations difficult, resulting in a $1 billion civil penalty and $1.5 billion in refunds. KSF is examining whether Amazon's leadership breached fiduciary duties or violated state or federal laws.

title: The Best ETF for AI Infrastructure Investors
summary: This article highlights the Global X Data Center & Digital Infrastructure ETF (NASDAQ: DTCR) as a top choice for investors seeking pure exposure to the physical infrastructure behind artificial intelligence. Unlike many AI-themed ETFs that are diluted with software and chip companies, this fund focuses on data center operators and digital infrastructure REITs, which are directly benefiting from the massive capital expenditures by hyperscalers like Amazon and Microsoft. The ETF provides a way to invest in the essential power-dense real estate and long-term leasing contracts crucial for AI’s expansion, offering diversification and reduced single-name risk within the AI infrastructure space.

title: Bill Ackman's Amazon Trade Reverses Course – Now Up $119 Million And Counting In Third Quarter
summary: Bill Ackman's new stake in Amazon.com Inc, revealed in the second quarter, has turned into a profitable bet, showing a $119.4 million gain for Pershing Square since the end of the second quarter. Amazon's strong third-quarter performance, including a double beat on revenue and EPS and accelerated AWS growth, bolstered the stock. Investors await Ackman's mid-November 13F filing to see his updated positions in Amazon and Alphabet.

title: Ampco-Pittsburgh names David Anderson as new CFO effective January
summary: Ampco-Pittsburgh Corporation announced the appointment of David G. Anderson as its new Vice President, Chief Financial Officer, Treasurer, and Assistant Secretary, effective January 1, 2026. Anderson will succeed Michael G. McAuley, who will transition to a Strategic Advisor role before retiring on June 30, 2026, while retaining his current position as President of Air & Liquid Systems Corporation. The company, valued at $38.3 million, is preparing to release quarterly earnings soon and recently reported increased net sales but a net loss due to a UK market exit.

title: Amazon extends Haul’s ultra low-price shopping experience to 14 new destinations with new Amazon Bazaar app
summary: Amazon is launching the new Amazon Bazaar app, extending its ultra low-price shopping experience, previously offered by Amazon Haul, to 14 new international destinations. This app will offer hundreds of thousands of affordable products, primarily under $10, across fashion, home, and lifestyle categories, with features like free delivery on qualifying orders and free returns. It aims to provide the trusted Amazon shopping experience with value-focused options and interactive entertainment features to a broader global customer base.

title: SentinelOne CAO Tomasello sells $57k in stock
summary: SentinelOne's Chief Accounting Officer, Robin Tomasello, sold 3,476 shares of Class A Common Stock worth $57,563 to cover tax obligations related to vesting Restricted Stock Units. The company, with a $5.63 billion market cap, is predicted to become profitable this year, and analysts suggest the stock is undervalued.

title: Amazon Threatens The Trade Desk's Advertiser Retention
summary: The Trade Desk, a demand-side platform, faces a significant competitive threat from Amazon, despite posting a solid financial quarter. Amazon's integration with Netflix's ad platform is intensifying this threat, leading to a decreased fair value for The Trade Desk. The article highlights The Trade Desk's business model of exclusively serving advertisers, which helps avoid conflicts of interest, unlike "walled gardens" such as Google, Amazon, and Meta.

Cramer noted that Amazon has now emphasized its possession of both NVIDIA and in-house chips, indicating a strong position in the AI infrastructure space.

title: Will Netflix’s 10-For-1 Split Rally The Stock?
summary: Netflix (NASDAQ: NFLX) has announced a 10-for-1 stock split, effective November 17, aimed at making shares more accessible for retail investors and employees. This move follows a period of strong performance for Netflix, driven by successful strategies like stricter password sharing policies and an ad-supported plan. The split could also pave the way for Netflix's inclusion in the Dow Jones Industrial Average, potentially boosting demand from index funds and solidifying its market position.

title: Vistra Corp projects 2026 adjusted core profit surge to $6.8-$7.6 bn amid growing power demand
summary: Vistra Corp projects its 2026 adjusted core profit to surge to $6.8-$7.6 billion, driven by an expanding power generation portfolio and anticipated record U.S. power demand fueled by AI, crypto, and electrification. The company also announced an additional $1 billion in share buybacks and is expanding its gas-fired and clean energy capacity to meet this growing demand. Despite strong projections, Vistra's Q3 net income more than halved due to a decline in unrealized gains from derivative positions and higher operating expenses.

title: Vistra Corp Bets Big On America’s Electric Future
summary: Vistra Corp is significantly expanding its power generation network to meet anticipated record-breaking electricity demand in the US, driven by digital growth, data centers, and AI. Despite a recent dip in net income due to higher operating costs, the company is making substantial investments in natural gas, nuclear, solar, and storage facilities, and securing long-term contracts with major tech clients like Amazon and Microsoft. Vistra's strategy, which includes a $1 billion share buyback, signals confidence in the long-term potential of the energy sector as it adapts to America's evolving electrification journey.

title: Jim Cramer on Tyler Technologies: “Let’s Hold Off”
summary: Jim Cramer advised caution on Tyler Technologies (NYSE: TYL), suggesting investors "hold off" due to its high 40 PE ratio despite its strong market position and recent earnings beat. He acknowledged its past impressive performance but noted some recent softness in bookings. Cramer also alluded to better AI stock opportunities with higher return potential.

title: JPMorgan Chase & Co. Reduces Stake in Mohawk Industries Inc.
summary: JPMorgan Chase & Co. significantly reduced its stake in Mohawk Industries Inc. by over 30% on September 30, 2025, selling 1,084,001 shares. This strategic move, impacting less than 1% of JPMorgan's portfolio, leaves the firm with 2,427,971 shares and reflects a recalibration of its investment strategy in the flooring products manufacturer. Mohawk Industries, with a market capitalization of $6.61 billion, is considered fairly valued and has a strong financial and profitability rank despite recent declines in some growth indicators.

title: JPMorgan Chase & Co. Increases Stake in Lowe's Companies Inc.
summary: JPMorgan Chase & Co. has significantly increased its stake in Lowe's Companies Inc. by adding over 5.2 million shares, bringing its total holdings to more than 36.7 million shares. This transaction, valued at $251.31 per share, reflects JPMorgan's confidence in Lowe's long-term growth potential and market position within the home improvement sector. Lowe's, despite a year-to-date price decline, maintains a strong market position, profitability, and growth metrics, appealing to various institutional investors.

title: BigCommerce Named as a Challenger in 2025 Gartner® Magic Quadrant™ for Digital Commerce Platforms
summary: BigCommerce, an ecommerce platform under Commerce.com, Inc. (Nasdaq: CMRC), has been recognized as a Challenger in the 2025 Gartner Magic Quadrant for Digital Commerce Platforms for the sixth consecutive year. This recognition highlights BigCommerce's innovative approach and robust capabilities in serving sophisticated merchants with flexible, best-of-breed solutions. The company's roadmap includes investments in agentic commerce, B2B and B2C capabilities, and enhanced integrations to further empower digital operations globally.

title: Earnings Flash (EXPE) Expedia Group, Inc. Reports Q3 Revenue $4.41B, vs. FactSet Est of $4.28B
summary: Expedia Group, Inc. (EXPE) reported its Q3 revenue of $4.41 billion, surpassing the FactSet estimate of $4.28 billion. This announcement was made on November 6, 2025, at 04:05 PM EST. The company also posted a Q3 Adjusted EPS of $7.57 per share and raised its 2025 revenue forecast due to strong business demand.

title: Nasdaq Halts Trading of Legal Tech Newcomer Robot Consulting Co. Ltd. Amid Regulatory Scrutiny
summary: Nasdaq halted trading of Robot Consulting Co. Ltd. (LAWR) on November 6, 2025, following a prior SEC suspension due to alleged market manipulation and a "price pump scheme." The action raises significant concerns about due diligence in new public offerings, especially in the high-growth legal tech and AI sectors. This serves as a warning for investors and a call for increased scrutiny on AI companies regarding financial transparency and governance.

title: The Estée Lauder Companies Partners with Shopify to Reimagine Digital Beauty Commerce and Elevate Consumer Experiences
summary: The Estée Lauder Companies (EL) has announced a strategic partnership with Shopify to modernize its digital technology infrastructure and enhance omnichannel consumer experiences. This collaboration, part of EL's Beauty Reimagined strategy, aims to leverage data and emerging technologies to accelerate direct-to-consumer strategies and improve speed-to-market. The first phase of the partnership is expected to launch in Q1 2026, providing EL with real-time data and AI-driven capabilities for personalization.

title: Jim Cramer on Altria: “I Won’t Recommend It Personally, But I Can’t Fight It”
summary: Jim Cramer discussed Altria Group, Inc. (NYSE: MO), acknowledging its strong long-term returns despite his personal reservations about tobacco stocks. He stated that while he wouldn't personally recommend or own Altria due to ethical concerns, the stock's historical performance—even surprising him—is undeniable. Cramer presented a two-sided view, recognizing its financial strength but also his moral conflict, advising callers to make their own decision.

title: Vistra prevé mayores beneficios en 2026 por el aumento de la demanda eléctrica en EE.UU
summary: Vistra (VST) projects a significant increase in adjusted EBITDA for 2026, ranging from $6.8 billion to $7.6 billion, driven by robust U.S. electricity demand fueled by AI and cryptocurrency data centers, and electrification efforts. To meet this demand, Vistra has secured a 20-year nuclear plant agreement and acquired several natural gas facilities, alongside developing solar and storage projects supported by deals with Amazon and Microsoft. Despite a strong outlook, the company reported a decrease in net income for the third quarter due to reduced non-realized gains from derivative positions and increased operating expenses.

title: IBM Just Announced A Layoff: Here Are Other US Companies That Recently Slashed Their Workforce
summary: IBM announced a workforce reduction impacting a "single-digit percentage" of its global employees in Q4 2024. The job cuts across these companies are aimed at workforce rebalancing and cost savings.

title: Coca-Cola makes electrifying change to its deliveries: 'We need millions'
summary: Coca-Cola's bottling partners in India are integrating over 5,000 e-rickshaws into their delivery fleet to reduce pollution, support entrepreneurs, and decarbonize last-mile delivery. While this is a positive environmental step, the company still faces criticism for being a major producer of plastic waste globally. This initiative aims to improve air quality and reduce reliance on dirty fuels, with aspirations for an even larger electric fleet in the future.

title: Earnings call transcript: ScanSource Q1 2026 beats EPS forecast, stock tumbles
summary: ScanSource (SCSC) reported Q1 fiscal year 2026 earnings, beating EPS forecasts but missing revenue expectations. The company's EPS was $1.06 against a forecast of $0.90, while revenue was $739.65 million, falling short of the $788.77 million forecast. Despite the EPS beat, the stock tumbled 15.98% in pre-market trading, reflecting investor concerns over the revenue shortfall, although the company reaffirmed its full fiscal year 2026 outlook for net sales and adjusted EBITDA.
